0.title: Dissemination of sexually oriented materials to minors; revise penalties.
0.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Dissemination Of Sexually Oriented Material To A Minor; And For Related Purposes.

1.title: Chancery Court; provide additional chancellor for Fourth Chancery Court District.
1.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Additional Chancellor For The Fourth Chancery Court District; And For Related Purposes.

2.title: MS Charter School Authorizer Board; provide protection from civil liability under the MS Tort Claims Act.
2.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-46-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Employees Of And Members Of The Mississippi Charter School Authorizer Board Within The Scope Of Protection From Claims Under The Tort Claims Act; And For Related Purposes.

3.title: Memorial intersection; designate in Clarke County for Chief Randy Boykin.
3.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Intersection In The Town Of Enterprise In Clarke County, Mississippi, As The "chief Randy Boykin Memorial Intersection"; And For Related Purposes.

4.title: Dental insurance; require State Designated Dental Insurance Plan as option for state employees.
4.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Utilize A Competitive Request For Proposals Process To Select A State Designated Dental Insurance Plan; To Require Each State Agency Or Commission, School District, Community/junior College District And Public Library To Make Available To All Of Its Employees The State Designated Dental Insurance Plan On And After October 1, 2014, In Addition To Any Other Dental Insurance Plan The Employer May Choose To Make Available To Its Employees; And For Related Purposes.

5.title: Motor vehicles; require check with Department of Revenue before scrapping.
5.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-21-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It A Felony For A First Offense Of Knowingly Falsifying Any Information On The Affidavit Form Used To Cancel A Certificate Of Title For Scrap Motor Vehicles; To Require The Department Of Revenue To Develop And Implement An Internet-based System For Electronically Submitting Certain Title Information Not Later Than July 1, 2014; To Provide That A Licensed Used Motor Vehicle Dealer Shall Not Dismantle Or Destroy A Motor Vehicle Until It Receives Notification From The Department That There Are No Liens On The Motor Vehicle; To Provide That The Used Motor Vehicle Parts Dealer Or Scrap Metal Processor Shall Secure The Motor Vehicle For Three Full Business Days If The Department's Records Indicate That There Is No Active Lien Before Destroying Or Dismantling The Motor Vehicle; To Provide That If There Is An Active Lien, The Used Motor Vehicle Parts Dealer Or Scrap Metal Processor Shall Secure The Motor Vehicle For Fifteen Days And The Department Shall Notify The Lienholder; To Provide That The Department May Remove The Lien From Its Records If A Written Statement Protesting Removal Of The Lien Is Not Received By The Department From The Lienholder Within The Fifteen-day Period; To Provide For The Actions To Be Taken If A Written Protest From The Lienholder Is Received; To Make It A Misdemeanor To Knowingly Destroy Or Dismantle A Motor Vehicle That Has An Active Lien; And For Related Purposes.; And For Related Purposes.

6.title: Controlled substances; revise hallucinogenic substances and synthetic cannabinoids.
6.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Additional Substances To The List Of Hallucinogenic Substances And Synthetic Cannabinoids Under Schedule I Of Controlled Substances; And For Related Purposes.

7.title: Ad valorem tax; provide partial exemption for certain business personal property.
7.description: An Act To Provide A Partial Ad Valorem Tax Exemption For Certain Personal Property That Is Owned By A Business Enterprise And Used By The Business Enterprise Solely In The Operation Of The Enterprise; And For Related Purposes.

8.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt certain business personal property.
8.description: An Act To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Certain Personal Property That Is Owned By A Business Enterprise And Used By The Business Enterprise Solely On The Premises Of The Business Enterprise In The Operation Of The Enterprise; And For Related Purposes.

9.title: Required weapons training course for enhanced carry permit; exempt servicemen.
9.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorized Military Personnel To Be Exempt From Training Requirements For An Enhanced Carry Permit; And For Related Purposes.

10.title: Voting machines; require all to be stored in one location that is chosen by election commissioners.
10.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-445, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Voting Machines To Be Stored In One Location That Is Chosen By A Majority Of Election Commissioners; To Require That The Location Where Voting Machines Are Stored Is Secure At All Times; To Amend Section 23-15-415, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That 25 Days Before An Election, The Custodian Shall Visit The Location Where All Voting Machines Are Located And Count The Machines To Determine Whether All Machines That Are Needed For The Election Are Actually Located In The One Location Chosen By The Election Commissioners; And For Related Purposes.

11.title: Student transfer; prohibit school boards in districts graded "D" or "F" from denying to better performing district.
11.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Local School Board In Districts With An Accountability Rating Grade Of "d" Or "f" From Denying Student Requests To Transfer To A Better Performing Adjacent District Upon Receipt Of A Written Petition By The Parent, Legal Guardian Or Individual In Loco Parentis Of The Student Requesting The Transfer; To Prescribe The Components To Be Included In The Release Petition; To Require The Receiving School District To Verify The Accountability Rating Grade Of The Transferring School District Before Accepting Any Student, And Upon A Determination That The Transferring District Has A Poor Accountability Rating, Shall Receive The Student And Make A Request Of The Transferring District For Per Pupil Expenditures Allotted The Student; And For Related Purposes.

12.title: Highways; require MDOT install rumble strips along shoulders of newly constructed or resurfaced roadways.
12.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Install Rumble Strips Along The Shoulders Of Roadways When They Are Constructed Or Resurfaced; And For Related Purposes.

13.title: Municipal council and board of aldermen meeting; authorize majority of quorum to transact business.
13.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-3-19, 21-5-13 And 21-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Affirmative Vote By The Quorum Of Municipal Council Members Shall Be Necessary To Conduct Business; To Bring Forward Sections 21-7-9 And 21-8-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

14.title: State advertising; prohibit elected and appointed officers from publicly participating in.
14.description: An Act To Prohibit Elected And Appointed State Officers From Visually Or Audibly Participating In Public Advertising That Has Been Funded, In Whole Or In Part, With Legislative Appropriations; And For Related Purposes.

15.title: Irrigation wells; require meters to be placed on.
15.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Environmental Quality To Develop A Program For Placing Meters On Irrigation Wells; To Require Fees To Defray The Costs Thereof; To Amend Sections 51-3-11 And 51-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

16.title: Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan; new legislators not members and current members don't earn additional credit.
16.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Persons Who Become Members Of The State Legislature For The First Time On Or After July 1, 2014, And The Persons Who Become The President Of The Senate For The First Time On Or After July 1, 2014, Shall Not Become Members Of The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan; To Provide That From And After July 1, 2014, The Members Of The State Legislature And The President Of The Senate Shall Not Earn Any Additional Creditable Service As A Member Of The State Legislature Or As The President Of The Senate For The Purposes Of The Plan; To Amend Section 25-11-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From And After July 1, 2014, The Members Of The Plan Will Not Pay The Employee's Contribution And The State Legislature Will Not Pay The Employer's Contribution For Members Of The Plan; And For Related Purposes.

17.title: Sales tax; exempt retail sales of school supplies during the last weekend in July.
17.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Retail Sales Of Certain School Supplies During A Period Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The Last Friday In July And Ending At 12:00 Midnight The Following Saturday; And For Related Purposes.

18.title: Death Benefits Trust Fund; include emergency management personnel, volunteer firefighters and fire chiefs.
18.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Firefighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel, Volunteer Firefighters Who Are Not Employees Of An Employer And Fire Chiefs Of Volunteer Fire Departments; To Change The Name Of The Trust Fund To The Safety Officials Death Benefits Trust Fund; To Amend Section 99-17-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

19.title: Seat belt laws; revise penalties for violations of.
19.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-2-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Second And Subsequent Convictions Of Violations Of The Mandatory Safety Belt Law Shall Be Punishable By A Fine Of Not Less Than One Hundred Dollars Nor More Than Five Hundred Dollars; And For Related Purposes.

20.title: Utility worker; killing of shall be capital murder.
20.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Killing Of A Utility Worker In The Definition Of Capital Murder; And For Related Purposes.

21.title: Utility Worker Protection Act; create.
21.description: An Act To Create The "utility Worker Protection Act"; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Provide The Elements Of Criminal Tampering; To Provide The Penalties For Any Violation Of The Act; And For Related Purposes.

22.title: Capital murder; include killing of public utility workers and emergency responders.
22.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Killing Of Public Utility Workers And Emergency Responders In The Definition Of Capital Murder; And For Related Purposes.

23.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tags; authorize for various purposes.
23.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Friends Of Jackson County Animal Shelter Pets; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; O Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Lawrence County School District; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Pass Christian School District; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Mississippi Vision Foundation; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Mississippi Band Of Choctaw Indians; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The State Board Of Cosmetology; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Meridian High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Pontotoc City School District; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Moss Point High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Forest High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Mississippi Motosteps Motorcycle Safety Training; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Choctaw County Chargers; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive License Tag Honoring Fallen Law Enforcement Officers And Designating The Motor Vehicle Owner As A Supporter Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund; To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Distinctive License Tag From The Requirement That In Order For The Tag To Be Produced, Proof That A Certain Number Of The Tags Will Be Purchased And An Amount Necessary To Pay For The Tags Must Be Submitted To The Department Of Revenue Within Three Years Of The Tag's Authorization; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Mississippi Wildlife Enforcement Officers' Association, Inc.; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of West Lauderdale High School; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Amend Section 27-19-56.7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of A Public Junior College Or Community College In This State; To Amend Section 27-19-56.15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags That Display The Emblems Of Universities Located In Other States; To Provide That A Portion Of The Fees Collected From The Issuance Of Distinctive License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of Clemson University Shall Be Distributed To The University; To Amend Section 27-19-56.133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Boys And Girls Clubs; To Amend Section 27-19-56.14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Persons To Whom The Grand Lodge Of Mississippi, Free And Accepted Masons, Distinctive License Tag May Be Issued; To Amend Section 27-19-56.27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Supporting The Department Of Marine Resources Shall Be Issued To Supporters Of Mississippi Marine Life Rather Than The Mississippi Seafood Industry And To Require Fees Collected From The Issuance Of The License Tags To Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Marine Life Program Account Within The Seafood Fund Rather Than The Mississippi Seafood Marketing Program Account; To Amend Section 49-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 27-19-56.22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Optional Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Design For Members Of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity; To Bring Forward Section 27-19-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For License Tags For Motorcycles, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-19-47.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Special License Tags For Antique Motorcycles, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-19-48, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Personalized License Tags, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-19-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Special Motorcycle License Tags For Members Of Shrine Motorcycle Clubs, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-19-56, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Special License Tags To Persons With Disabilities, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-19-56.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Special License Tags To Pearl Harbor Survivors And Purple Heart Recipients, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-19-56.9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Special License Tags To Persons Who Are Deaf, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-19-56.125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Distinctive Motorcycle License Tags To Veterans Of The Armed Forces, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

24.title: Department of Corrections; revise contract amount that must be approved by Public Procurement Review Board.
24.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Contract Amount That The Department Of Corrections Must Receive Approval From The Public Procurement Review Board Before A Contract May Be Awarded By The Department; And For Related Purposes.

25.title: Campaign contributions; restrict use by candidate for purposes unrelated to election campaign.
25.description: An Act To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 23-15-802, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Restrict The Purposes For Which A Candidate For Public Office May Use Campaign Contributions For A Reason Unrelated To The Candidate's Campaign To Seek Election Or Reelection To An Office; To Prescribe The Persons, Organizations And Legal Entities To Which A Candidate Who Is Finally Elected, Defeated Or Withdraws From An Election Campaign May Disburse Surplus Contributions; To Prescribe Penalties For A Violation Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

26.title: Adoption; revise home study and residency requirements.
26.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-17-3 And 93-17-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Judge To Determine If A Home Study Is Necessary In An Adoption; To Clarify Residency Requirements; To Amend Section 93-17-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Persons Who Disclose Information Received During Closed Adoption Hearings Or From Records Pertaining To Adoption Proceedings Are Guilty Of A Misdemeanor, Subject To Being Fined Or Imprisoned, And May Be Held In Contempt Of Court; And For Related Purposes.

27.title: MS Qualified Health Center Grant Program; extend date for authority to make grants under.
27.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-99-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Period Of Time That The State Department Of Health May Make Grants Under The Mississippi Qualified Health Center Grant Program; And For Related Purposes.

28.title: Emergency contraception; require prescription to dispense to persons under 18 years old.
28.description: An Act To Provide That Emergency Contraception Shall Be Dispensed Or Sold To Persons Under Eighteen Years Old Only Upon The Prescription Of An Authorized Health Care Professional, Except When Dispensed Directly To The Person By The Health Care Professional; To Direct The State Board Of Pharmacy To Adopt And Enforce Regulations Regarding The Dispensing And Sale Of Emergency Contraception In Pharmacies To Ensure That Emergency Contraception Is Not Dispensed Or Sold To Persons Under Eighteen Years Old Without A Prescription; And For Related Purposes.

29.title: Lobbying; prohibit legislator from engaging in for four years after leaving office.
29.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A Member Of The Legislature For A Period Of Four Years From And After Expiration Of His Or Her Term Of Office From Engaging In Any Activity Or Performing Any Function That Requires Registration As A Lobbyist; And For Related Purposes.

30.title: Student transfer; reduce distance from 30 to 20 miles to permit enrollment in adjacent district.
30.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Distance Of Transporting Students To And From Schools From Thirty Miles To Twenty Miles In Order To Permit Parents To Transfer And Enroll Such Students To An Adjacent School District Closer To The Student's Residence; And For Related Purposes.

31.title: Partition of property; revise method of appointing freeholders.
31.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-21-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Appointment Of Freeholders In Partition Proceedings; And For Related Purposes.

32.title: Ad valorem taxes; allow local contribution to follow students who transfer to another school district.
32.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Boards Of Trustees Of Certain Transferring School Districts And Certain Receiving School Districts To Certify To The State Board Of Education The Number Of Students Transferred To Another School District From The District Of Residence For Purposes Of Calculating The Per Pupil Pro Rata Share Of Local Ad Valorem School District Maintenance Funds To Be Remitted To The Receiving School District; To Amend Section 37-57-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

33.title: Appropriation; Department of Public Safety to provide funding for drug task forces.
33.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Public Safety For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For The Drug

34.title: Sales tax; reduce rate on retail sales of motorcycles.
34.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Sales Tax Rate On Retail Sales Of Motorcycles From Seven Percent To Five Percent; And For Related Purposes.

35.title: Homestead exemption; increase.
35.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes For Homesteads; And For Related Purposes.

36.title: Reappraisal; local taxing units must publish certain information regarding to receive homestead exemption reimbursement.
36.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That During The Fiscal Year In Which A County Has Completed A Countywide Reappraisal Of The Valuation Of The Property In The County That Results In An Increase In The Assessed Valuation Of The Property, Each Taxing Unit In The County Shall Publish In The Notice Required To Be Published By This Section The Lower Millage Rate That Would Produce The Same Amount Of Revenue From Ad Valorem Taxation On Property Of The Taxing Unit That Was Produced In The Fiscal Year Before The Property Of The Taxing Unit Was Reappraised; To Amend Section 27-33-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Department Of Revenue From Paying Any Reimbursement To A Taxing Unit For Annual Tax Losses From Homestead Exemption Until After The Taxing Unit Has Complied With The Notice Requirement Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

37.title: Bail; provide restrictions.
37.description: An Act To Provide For Crimes With Bail Restrictions; To Define Certain Terms; To Create A Presumption In Favor Of Full Cash Bonds For Certain Offenses; To Require An Affidavit Regarding Property Bonds; To Bring Forward Sections 99-5-5, 99-5-7, 99-5-9, 99-5-13, 99-5-23 And 99-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

38.title: MDOT; provide that Governor shall appoint executive director.
38.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Shall Be Appointed By The Governor; And For Related Purposes.

39.title: Counties and municipalities; revise how rates for electronic payments are assessed.
39.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-25-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise How A County Or Municipality May Set The Processing Rate For Electronic Payments; And For Related Purposes.

40.title: Medicaid; expand eligibility under federal health care reform law.
40.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Medicaid Coverage For Individuals Who Are Under 65 Years Of Age, Are Not Pregnant, Are Not Entitled To Or Enrolled For Medicare Benefits And Whose Income Is Not More Than 133% Of The Federal Poverty Level, As Authorized Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act; And For Related Purposes.

41.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements at state parks.
41.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For Repairs, Renovations And Capital Improvements At State Parks; And For Related Purposes.

42.title: Human cloning; prohibit.
42.description: An Act To Prohibit Human Cloning; To Prohibit Shipping Or Receiving Embryos Produced By Human Cloning; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Criminal And Civil Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Create The Stem Cell Research Advisory Committee And Provide For Its Duties; And For Related Purposes.

43.title: Courts; prohibit from applying foreign law under certain circumstances.
43.description: An Act To Address The Application Of Foreign Laws In Judicial Proceedings In This State; To Provide Legislative Findings; To Define Certain Terms; To Prohibit The Use And Enforcement Of Foreign Laws Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For Applicability In Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

44.title: Bad check law; include electronic fund transfers.
44.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97-19-55, 97-19-57, 97-19-61, 97-19-62, 97-19-63, 97-19-65, 97-19-67 And 97-19-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Electronic Fund Transfers In The Bad Check Law; And For Related Purposes.

45.title: Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant; allow transfer to a Mississippi College or University to receive.
45.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Eligibility Requirements For The Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant To Allow Persons Who Transfer From An Out-of-state College Or University To Receive The Grant; And For Related Purposes.

46.title: Ad valorem tax; authorize partial exemption for agricultural land that is converted to a residential use.
46.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of A County And/or The Governing Authorities Of A Municipality To Grant A Partial Ad Valorem Tax Exemption For Agricultural Property That Is Being Converted To A Residential Use In An Amount Equal To The Difference Between The Assessed Value Of The Property For Agricultural Use And The Assessed Value Of The Property For Residential Use; To Provide That The Exemption Shall End When The Property Is Occupied By A Homeowner; To Provide The Manner In Which A Request For Such Exemption Must Be Made; And For Related Purposes.

47.title: Youth Concussion Law; create.
47.description: An Act To Require Public And Private Schools That Provide Youth Activities To Adopt And Implement A Concussion Management And Return To Play Policy That Includes Certain Components And To Provide Parents With The Concussion Policy Before The Start Of The Regular School Athletic Season; To Provide That The State Department Of Health Shall Endorse A Concussion Recognition Education Course To Provide Information To Mississippians Of The Nature And Risk Of Concussions In Youth Athletics, Which Shall Be Available Online; To Provide That This Act Does Not Create Any Liability For Any Person Or Entity Who Has Complied With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

48.title: TANF recipients; require drug testing for certain who have been screened.
48.description: An Act To Provide That Adult Applicants For Tanf Benefits In The Assistance Unit Who Otherwise Qualify For Cash Assistance Under The Tanf Program Shall Be Required To Complete A Written Screening Questionnaire Designed To Determine The Likelihood Of The Person Having A Substance Use Disorder; To Provide That If The Results Of The Written Screening Questionnaire Indicate A Reasonable Likelihood That An Adult Recipient May Have A Substance Use Disorder Involving The Misuse Of A Drug, The Department Shall Require The Person To Submit To A Drug Test At The Department's Expense In Order To Continue To Receive Cash Assistance; To Provide That If An Adult Recipient Refuses To Take The Required Drug Test, The Department Shall Terminate Cash Assistance And The Person May Not Reapply For Cash Assistance For A Certain Period Of Time; To Provide That If An Adult Recipient Tests Positive For The Unlawful Use Of A Drug After Taking A Drug Test, The Person Shall Be Given A List Of Approved Substance Use Disorder Treatment Providers That Are Available In The Area In Which The Person Resides, And May Continue To Receive Benefits If The Person Enters Into And Follows The Requirements Of A Substance Use Disorder Treatment Plan; To Provide That If An Adult Recipient Declines To Enter Into A Substance Use Disorder Treatment Plan, Or If The Recipient Enters Into, But Fails To Meet, A Requirement Of A Substance Use Disorder Treatment Plan, The Department Shall Terminate Cash Assistance And The Person May Not Reapply For Cash Assistance For A Certain Period Of Time; To Amend Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

49.title: Controlled substances; additions to Schedule I.
49.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Additional Substances To The List Of Hallucinogenic Substances And Synthetic Cannabinoids Under Schedule I Of Controlled Substances; And For Related Purposes.

50.title: School districts; revise provisions regarding the hiring of certain persons.
50.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Authority Of The Local School Board To Designate A Person Other Than The Superintendent Of The School District To Recommend To The Board Individuals For Employment As New Assistant Superintendents And Principals; To Amend Section 37-9-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Authority Of The Local School Board To Designate A Personnel Supervisor Or Principal Employed By The District For The Purpose Of Recommending To The Superintendent Licensed Or Noninstructional Employees For Employment; To Delete The Provisions That Such Licensed Or Noninstructional Employees Must Have Been Employed By The District At The Time The Superintendent Was Elected Or Appointed To Office; To Delete The Provision Limiting The Compensation Of Noninstructional Employees To The Statewide Average Paid To Individuals With Comparable Experience As Established By The State Department Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

51.title: Prison lands; transfer authority to manage agricultural leases from DFA to Secretary of State.
51.description: An Act To Transfer The Duty To Assist The Mississippi Department Of Corrections In The Management Of Prison Lands Leased For Agricultural Purposes From The Department Of Finance And Administration To The Secretary Of State; To Require The Department Of Corrections To Make An Annual Report To The Legislature And File A Copy Of That Report With The Secretary Of State; To Prescribe The Provisions For Determining The Validity Of Agricultural Leases Of Prison Lands; To Authorize The Leaseholder To Maintain Insurance On His Interests In The Leased Lands And Any Improvements Located Thereon At His Own Expense; To Prescribe The Procedures To Be Used For Leasing And Re-leasing Prison Lands Through The Competitive Bid Process; To Reserve To The State Title To All Timber, Minerals, Oil And Gas On Prison Lands Leased For Agricultural Purposes; To Authorize The Occasional Sale Of Timber On Prison Lands By The Department Of Corrections; To Prescribe The Process To Be Followed By A Leaseholder To Have The Lease Confirmed Or Quieted In Chancery Court; To Require The Court To Issue A Decree Of Confirmation Of The Lease Under Certain Conditions; To Authorize The Court To Determine The Legal Status Of A Lease And Provide For The Proper Equitable Relief For Satisfaction Of All Liens And Rents Accrued From The Prison Lands Subject To The Illegal Lease; To Amend Sections 47-5-64 And 47-5-66, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; To Bring Forward Section 47-5-357, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Department Of Finance And Administration And The Department Of Corrections To Establish A Purchasing Policy That Exempts Certain Items From Bid Requirements, For Purposes Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

52.title: Capital murder; include killing of utility worker in definition.
52.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Killing Of A Utility Worker In The Definition Of Capital Murder; And For Related Purposes.

53.title: Ad valorem taxes; delete school board's authority to increase more than 2% without referendum approval.
53.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-57-104, 37-57-105 And 37-57-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority Of School Boards To Increase Ad Valorem Taxes Levied For School District Purposes By More Than Two Percent Over The Amount Levied In The Preceding Year Absent Approval By A Majority Vote In A Referendum On The Proposed Tax Increase; To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

54.title: Open primaries elections; authorize for state, county and municipal offices.
54.description: An Act To Abolish Partisan Primaries; To Provide The Time For Holding General And Preferential Elections; To Provide That When Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For An Office, Such Person's Name Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That A Preferential Election Shall Be Held Three Weeks Before The General Election And The Candidate Who Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast For Such Office Shall Have His Name And His Name Only Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That When No Candidate Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast In The Preferential Election For An Office, That The Two Candidates Who Receive The Highest Number Of Votes In The Preferential Election Shall Have Their Names Placed On The General Election Ballot As Candidates For Such Office; To Provide The Procedure To Follow In Case Of Ties; To Provide The Manner For Qualifying As A Candidate For Public Office; To Provide For The Printing Of Necessary Ballots; To Amend Sections 21-7-7, 21-8-7, 21-15-1, 23-15-21, 23-15-31, 23-15-129, 23-15-153, 23-15-173, 23-15-197, 23-15-313, 23-15-367, 23-15-375, 23-15-403, 23-15-411, 23-15-463, 23-15-465, 23-15-507, 23-15-511, 23-15-559, 23-15-561, 23-15-573, 23-15-593, 23-15-595, 23-15-601, 23-15-605, 23-15-673, 23-15-713, 23-15-755, 23-15-771, 23-15-801, 23-15-807, 23-15-811, 23-15-833, 23-15-859, 23-15-873, 23-15-881, 23-15-885, 23-15-891, 23-15-899, 23-15-911, 23-15-973, 23-15-1065, 23-15-1085 And 23-15-1087, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 23-15-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Preparation, Use And Revision Of Primary Election Pollbooks; To Repeal Section 23-15-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Dates Of Municipal Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of State, District And County Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-263, 23-15-265, 23-15-267, 23-15-291 Through 23-15-311, 23-15-317, 23-15-319, 23-15-331, 23-15-333 And 23-15-335, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Duties Of The State Executive Committee And County Executive Committees In Primary Elections, Provide For The Qualification Of Candidates For Party Primary Elections, And Provide For The Conduct Of Party Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-359, 23-15-361 And 23-15-363, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Contents Of General Election Ballots; To Repeal Sections 23-15-597 And 23-15-599, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Canvass Of Returns And Announcement Of Vote By The County Executive Committees In Primary Elections And Require The State Executive Committee To Transmit To The Secretary Of State A Tabulated Statement Of The Party Vote For Certain Offices; To Repeal Section 23-15-841, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Primary Elections For Nomination Of Candidates To Fill Vacancies In County And County District Offices; To Repeal Sections 23-15-921 Through 23-15-941, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Procedures For Contests Of Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1031, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of Primary Elections For Congressmen And United States Senators; To Repeal Section 23-15-1063, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Unregistered Political Parties From Conducting Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1083, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That Certain Congressional Primaries Be Held On The Same Day As The Presidential Preference Primary; And For Related Purposes.

55.title: Beneficiaries in will; include in allowable payment without administration for small amounts.
55.description: An Act To Amend Sections 81-5-63 And 91-7-322, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Beneficiaries Named In A Will As Allowable Parties For Payment Without Administration; And For Related Purposes.

56.title: Alcohol beverages; create exception for cultural and educational centers from distance restrictions on sale or storage of.
56.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create An Exception For Certain Cultural And Educational Centers From The Distance Restriction Imposed On The Sale Or Storage Of Alcoholic Beverages Within A Prescribed Distance Of Certain Entities; And For Related Purposes.

57.title: Mississippi False Claims Act; create.
57.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi False Claims Act"; To Prohibit Any Person From Knowingly Presenting, Or Causing To Be Presented, A False Or Fraudulent Claim For Payment Or Approval To A State Agency Or Any Employee Or Agent Of A State Agency; To Require State Agencies To Diligently Investigate Suspected Violations Of The Act; To Authorize Civil Action By A Qui Tam Plaintiff; To Provide For A Monetary Award To The Qui Tam Plaintiff Out Of The Proceeds Of The Action Or Settlement, If Any; To Bar Certain Civil Actions; To Provide A Statute Of Limitations For Bringing A Civil Action Under The Act; To Prohibit Employer Interference With Employee Disclosure; To Provide That The Remedies Provided In The Act Are Not Exclusive And Shall Be In Addition To Any Other Remedies Provided By Law; And For Related Purposes.

58.title: Appropriation; from WC-SRF to Medical Care Fund to compensate hospitals for reduction in federal DSH payments.
58.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund To The Medical Care Fund For The Purpose Of Compensating Mississippi Hospitals For The Amount Of The Reduction In Disproportionate Share Hospital (dsh) Payments From The Federal Government To Mississippi During Fiscal Year 2014.

59.title: Homestead exemption; increase for persons 70 years of age or older.
59.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Homestead Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes For Persons Who Are Seventy Years Of Age Or Older; And For Related Purposes.

60.title: Crimes; clarify that burglary is a violent crime.
60.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97-1-5, 97-17-23 And 97-17-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Burglary Shall Be A Violent Crime; And For Related Purposes.

61.title: Parole; require offender serve at least 1/3 of sentence and that commissioner recommend parole before offender is eligible for.
61.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Inmate To Serve At Least One-third Of His Sentence Instead Of One-fourth Of His Sentence Before The Inmate May Become Eligible For Parole; To Provide That The Commissioner Of The Department Of Corrections Must Recommend To The State Parole Board That An Inmate Be Placed On Parole Before Such Inmate May Be Paroled; To Amend Sections 47-7-5 And 47-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

62.title: Earned time allowances; prohibit certain inmates from obtaining.
62.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If An Inmate Has Been Convicted Of A Violent Felony After The Inmate Had Been Convicted Previously Of Another Violent Felony And Served Time For Such Previous Felony Then The Inmate Is Ineligible For Earned Time Allowance; To Amend Section 47-5-138.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Inmate In Trusty Status Is Ineligible For The Accumulation Of Trusty Time Allowance If Such Trusty Has Been Convicted Of A Violent Felony After The Trusty Had Been Convicted Previously Of Another Violent Felony And Served Time For Such Previous Felony; To Define The Term "violent Felony" Under Such Sections; And For Related Purposes.

63.title: School property; authorize district superintendents to select certain employees to carry concealed weapons on campus.
63.description: An Act To Authorize School Superintendents To Appoint Employees To Carry Concealed Weapons For Security Purposes At The School Where They Are Employed Provided Certain Licensing, Training And Conditions Are Met; To Amend Sections 45-9-101 And 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

64.title: Ad Valorem taxes; delete school board's authority to increase without referendum approval.
64.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-57-104, 37-57-105 And 37-57-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority Of School Boards To Increase Ad Valorem Taxes Levied For School District Purposes, Regardless Of The Millage Rate, Absent Approval In A Referendum On The Proposed Tax Increase; To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

65.title: Medical record copies; revise how fees are charged for electronic and imaging media.
65.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-1-52, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise How Any Medical Provider Or Hospital Or Nursing Home Or Other Medical Facility May Charge For Copies Of Patient Records; And For Related Purposes.

66.title: Special judges; revise compensation cap.
66.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-1-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Maximum Compensation Allowed For Special Judges; And For Related Purposes.

67.title: Violent crimes; require DNA testing for arrests.
67.description: An Act To Provide For Dna Collection From Persons Arrested For Violent Crimes; To Amend Section 99-49-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

68.title: Restitution; revise for crime victims.
68.description: An Act To Amend Sections 99-37-1, 99-37-3, 99-37-5, 99-37-7, 99-37-9 And 99-37-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Restitution To Crime Victims; To Amend Sections 97-19-67 And 99-15-26, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

69.title: Personal and professional services contracts; Personnel Board shall finally approve or disapprove certain.
69.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Personal And Professional Services Contracts Involving The Expenditures Of Funds In Excess Of One Hundred Thousand Dollars Shall Be Finally Approved Or Disapproved By The State Personnel Board After Review By The Personal Service Contract Review Board; And For Related Purposes.

70.title: Payment of teacher salaries; standard contract shall fix monthly installment.
70.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Standard Teacher Contract Prescribed By The State Board Of Education Shall Provide That Licensed Employees Shall Earn A Salary Payable In Equal Installments Beginning In The First Month Of Employment; And For Related Purposes.

71.title: School buses; require school districts to have identifying signage placed upon all buses.
71.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-41-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Any Contract Entered Into By A School District For The Operation, Rental Or Leasing Of School Buses With Private Or Public Entities, Or The Purchase Of School Buses To Be Used By A School District To Stipulate In The Contract That The Entity From Whom The School Bus Is Rented, Leased Or Purchased, Or Which Is Providing The Transportation Service, Shall Cause The Required District-identifying Signage To Be Placed On The Bus Before Delivery Of The School Bus Into Possession Of The School District; To Amend Sections 37-41-29 And 37-41-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

72.title: Textbooks; authorize flexibility in use of alternative electronic forms of.
72.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-43-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide School Districts With The Flexible Authority To Use Electronic Textbooks In Addition To Or As An Alternative To Traditional Bound Textbooks For The Purpose Of Student Instruction; To Prohibit Students From Carrying Electronic Devices That Are Property Of The School District Home; To Require Teachers To Provide Students And Their Parents Or Legal Guardian The Access Code To Allow The Student To Access The Instructional Material At Home Upon A Personal Electronic Device; To Define The Term "electronic Textbook"; And For Related Purposes.

73.title: School board members; revise qualifications of to be eligible for selection as.
73.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications Of Local School Board Trustees To Include The Minimum Requirement Of A High School Diploma; And For Related Purposes.

74.title: School term; reduces number of days in scholastic year to 175.
74.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Length Of The Public Schools' Scholastic Year From 180 To 175 Days; To Amend Sections 37-13-91, 37-151-5 And 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 37-9-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Minimum Term Allowed In School Districts' Contracts With Licensed Personnel From 187 To 177 Days, And To Require School Districts To Shorten The Terms Of Contracts Previously Executed For The 2014-2015 School Year, Without Any Reduction To The Annual Salary Set Forth In Each Contract, Accordingly; To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Teacher Salary Scale Is Applicable For All Teachers Whose Contracts Are For A Term Of No Less Than The Statutorily Prescribed Number Of Days; And For Related Purposes.

75.title: MAEP; clarify to remove strict interpretation of MDE to request full funding of at budget hearing.
75.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Discretionary Determination Of The Annual Allocation Of Adequate Education Programs Funds In Order To Remove The Ambiguous Interpretation That The State Department Of Education Is Required To Request Full Funding Of Maep In Its Annual Legislative Budget Request; To Repeal Section 37-151-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Legislature To Fully Fund The Mississippi Adequate Education Program Each Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

76.title: Student grades; enhance penalty imposed on school districts for individuals who influence falsification of.
76.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-64, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enhance The Penalty Imposed Upon School Districts For School Administrators And Certain Other Faculty, Staff And Employees Who Influence The Falsifying Of Grades Received By A Student From A Teacher; To Provide That Upon Presentation Of Sufficient Evidence Of A Violation The State Department Of Education Immediately Shall Suspend The Accreditation Of The Violating School Or District; To Provide For Administrative Procedures And Due Process For Those Accused Of Violations; And For Related Purposes.

77.title: Student transfer; prohibit school boards in failing school districts from denying requests to better performing district.
77.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Local School Board In Districts With An Accountability Rating Grade Of "d" Or "f" From Denying Student Requests To Transfer To A Better Performing Adjacent District Upon Receipt Of A Written Petition By The Parent, Legal Guardian Or Individual In Loco Parentis Of The Student Requesting The Transfer; To Prescribe The Components To Be Included In The Release Petition; To Require The Receiving School District To Verify The Accountability Rating Grade Of The Transferring School District Before Accepting Any Student, And Upon A Determination That The Transferring District Has A Poor Accountability Rating, Shall Receive The Student And Make A Request Of The Transferring District For Per Pupil Expenditures Allotted The Student; And For Related Purposes.

78.title: School revenue; provide levying authority with veto power relating to request for increase in tax measure for.
78.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-57-104, 37-57-105 And 37-57-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Local Levying Authority For A School District With The Authority To Exercise Veto Power Over A School Board's Request To Increase Ad Valorem Taxes Levied For School District Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

80.title: Teacher Classroom and Disciplinary Control Act; create.
80.description: An Act To Create The Teacher Classroom And Disciplinary Control Act; To Give Each Teacher Employed By A Public Local School District Total Autonomy Over Classroom Management With Regard To Instruction And Discipline, Provide That Such Management Does Not Violate The Rules Adopted By The State Board Of Education And Local School Boards; To Provide That The Teacher Shall Be The Singular Authoritative Disciplinarian In The Classroom With The Power To Reprimand And Discipline Any Student Disrupting The Learning Environment Or Refer Such Student To The Appropriate School Administrator For Further Disciplinary Action If The Student Is To Be Removed From The Classroom; To Require The Appropriate School Administrator To Take The Referring Teacher's Recommendation For The Disciplinary Action Taken Against The Student Or The Student's Temporary Or Permanent Alternative Removal From The Classroom; To Require School Administrators Who Disapprove Of The Referring Teacher's Recommendation To Provide The Teacher With Written Justification For The Disapproval; To Amend Section 37-11-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provision Of This Act; To Bring Forward Sections 37-9-71 And 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

81.title: Income tax; authorize deduction for private school tuition, expenses for home schooled students and certain public school expenses.
81.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Tuition Payments Made By A Taxpayer For Tuition Required For A Dependent Child To Attend A Nonpublic School, Certain Expenses Paid By A Taxpayer For The Home Schooling Of A Dependent Child And Certain Costs Paid By A Taxpayer Which Are Associated With The Enrollment Of A Dependent Child In A Public School, Are Deductible As An Adjustment To Gross Income For State Income Tax Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

82.title: MAEP; bring forward sections relating to for purpose of possible revisions.
82.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 37-151-1, 37-151-5, 37-151-6, 37-151-7, 37-151-9, 37-151-10, 37-151-25, 37-151-79, 37-151-81, 37-151-83, 37-151-85, 37-151-87, 37-151-89, 37-151-91, 37-151-93, 37-151-95, 37-151-97, 37-151-99, 37-151-101, 37-151-103, 37-152-1 And 37-152-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Adequate Education Program, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

83.title: Burglary; enhanced penalties for repeat offenders.
83.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Enhanced Penalties For A Second And Third Or Subsequent Offense Of Burglary; And For Related Purposes.

84.title: Adequate education program funds; withhold from districts failing to properly display flags or recite pledge of allegiance.
84.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-13-5 And 37-13-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Withhold Adequate Education Program Funds From School Districts Failing To Properly Display The National And State Flags Or Lead Students In The Pledge Of Allegiance To The United States Flag; To Amend Section 37-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Provisions Relating To The Recitation Of The Pledge Of Allegiance Which Are Contradictory To Subsequently Enacted Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

86.title: DUI; revise penalty for second or subsequent offense of driving with suspended license.
86.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Enhanced Penalties For Second Or Subsequent Offenses Of Driving With A Driver's License That Has Been Cancelled, Suspended Or Revoked For Implied Consent Violations; And For Related Purposes.

87.title: Expunction; revise.
87.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-23-7, 41-29-150, 63-11-30, 99-15-57, 99-15-59 And 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Convictions May Be Expunged Only Upon A Showing Of Innocence Based On Reliable Evidence; And For Related Purposes.

88.title: Medicaid; recipients shall be subject to random drug tests for eligibility to continue receiving benefits.
88.description: An Act To Provide That Recipients Of Medicaid Benefits Who Are 13 Years Of Age Or Older Shall Be Subject To Taking A Drug Test On A Random Basis To Determine Their Eligibility To Continue Receiving The Benefits; To Provide That If A Recipient Of Medicaid Benefits Is Given A Drug Test And He Or She Tests Positive For Any Prohibited Drug, The Recipient Shall Not Be Eligible To Receive The Benefits For A Period Of Not Less Than 90 Days; To Provide That After That Period, A Person May Reapply To Receive Medicaid Benefits, And Will Be Eligible To Receive The Benefits Again If The Person Passes Another Drug Test; To Provide That The State Department Of Health Shall Perform The Drug Tests Authorized By This Act, And The Cost Of The Drug Tests Shall Be Paid By The Division Of Medicaid; To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

89.title: Crimes; revise penalties for fraudulent use of identity of another.
89.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-19-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties For The Fraudulent Use Of The Identity Of Another; And For Related Purposes.

90.title: Tax levy to support school districts; authorize levying authority to veto school board request for increase up to seven percent.
90.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-57-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Levying Authority For A School District To Veto The School Board's Request For An Increase In The Ad Valorem Tax Dollars Up To Seven Percent; To Amend Section 37-57-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

91.title: Rape; death penalty for conviction if victim is age 13 or under.
91.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Death Penalty In Statutory Rape Cases Where The Victim Is 13 Years Of Age Or Under And The Defendant Is 18 Years Of Age Or Older; And For Related Purposes.

92.title: Capital murder; apply to multiple murders.
92.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Multiple Murders Shall Be Capital Murder; And For Related Purposes.

93.title: County school board members; require to declare party affiliation.
93.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-5-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Candidates For The County Board Of Education To Declare The Political Party With Which They Are Affiliated Upon Petition Of Candidacy For Such Office; And For Related Purposes.

94.title: Name reservation and registration for corporations; revise.
94.description: An Act To Amend Sections 79-4-4.02, 79-11-159 And 79-14-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Renewable Name Reservation; To Amend Section 79-29-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Name Reservation Period; To Repeal Sections 79-4-4.03 And 79-11-161, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Registration Of Corporate Names; And For Related Purposes.

95.title: UCC; revise waiver of implied warranties for sales between merchants and "as is" sales.
95.description: An Act To Create Section 75-2-316, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Exclusion Or Modification To Warranties; To Amend Sections 75-2-314, 75-2-315, 75-2-719 And 11-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Repeal Section 75-2-315.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides To Limitation Of Exclusion Or Modification Or Warranties To Consumers; And For Related Purposes.

96.title: Protective covenants; allow revival and modification after expiration.
96.description: An Act To Provide A Method To Revive, Reform, Modify Or Correct Protective Covenants In Subdivisions; To Provide For Proceedings In Chancery Court Regarding Such Protective Covenants; To Require Notice To All Parties; To Provide For A Hearing; To Provide Authority For The Chancery Court To Rule On Such Petitions And Certain Other Matters Relating To Such Subdivisions; To Amend Section 17-1-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

97.title: Drug forfeiture laws; remove repealer on administrative forfeiture.
97.description: An Act To Reenact Section 41-29-176, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Administrative Forfeiture Under The Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 2 Of Chapter 484, Laws Of 2013, To Remove The Repealer; And For Related Purposes.

98.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund.
98.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

99.title: Sales tax; revise provisions regarding erroneous diversions to certain municipalities.
99.description: An Act To Provide That Any Payment Made Erroneously By The Department Of Revenue, As A Diversion From Sales Tax Monies Collected, To Certain Municipalities Shall Not Be Charged Back To Such Municipalities By The Department Of Revenue; To Amend Sections 27-65-75, 27-65-53 And 27-65-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

100.title: Department of Corrections; revise administrative review appeals procedure.
100.description: An Act To Amend Sections 47-5-803 And 47-5-807, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Administrative Appeals Involving The Department Of Corrections Shall Be Conducted By A Three Judge Panel; To Provide That Appeals From The Panel Shall Be To The Supreme Court; And For Related Purposes.

101.title: Domestic violence; clarify determination of third or subsequent offenses.
101.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify How A Third Or Subsequent Simple Domestic Violence Offense Shall Be Determined; And For Related Purposes.

102.title: Bonds; mandate election on issuing county or municipal bonds.
102.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-9-11, 19-9-13 And 21-33-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Mandate The Holding Of An Election On The Question Of Issuing County Or Municipal Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

103.title: Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; repeal.
103.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 63-13-1 Through 63-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Annual Safety Inspections Of Motor Vehicles And For The Issuance Of Certificates Of Inspection; To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

104.title: Annexed territory; prohibit municipality from levying ad valorem taxes until services are provided.
104.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-1-27, 21-1-29, 21-1-61, 21-33-1 And 21-33-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Municipality Is Prohibited From Levying And Collecting Ad Valorem Taxes In Newly Annexed Areas Until The Municipality Has Provided The Services To The Annexed Area Which Are Listed In The Ordinance That The Municipality Is Required To Pass; And For Related Purposes.

105.title: Constables; authorize to be paid after diligent search and inquiry upon unsuccessful service of process.
105.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Marshals And Constables To Be Paid For Civil Service Of Process After Diligent Search And Inquiry, Regardless Of Whether Service Of Process Is Successful; And For Related Purposes.

106.title: Homestead exemption; increase for persons 65 years of age or older or totally disabled.
106.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Homestead Exemption For Persons Who Are Sixty-five Years Of Age Or Older Or Who Are Totally Disabled; And For Related Purposes.

107.title: Victims assistance coordinator; additional for 14th Circuit Court District.
107.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-36-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Additional Victim Assistance Coordinator For The Fourteenth Circuit Court District; And For Related Purposes.

108.title: Appropriation; Mississippi Rural Dentists Scholarship Program.
108.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Rural Dentists Scholarship Commission For The Purpose Of Funding The Mississippi Rural Dentists Scholarship Program For The Fiscal Year 2015.

109.title: Appropriations; Medical Care Fund to compensate hospitals for reduction in federal DSH payments.
109.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Medical Care Fund For The Purpose Of Compensating Mississippi Hospitals For The Amount Of The Reduction In Disproportionate Share Hospital (dsh) Payments From The Federal Government To Mississippi During Fiscal Year 2014.

110.title: Corrections; require inmate fund to be a special fund and require RFPs for administration of canteen services.
110.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-158, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Inmate Welfare Fund Be A Special Fund In The State Treasury; To Provide For The Management Of The Fund; To Require That The Inmate Welfare Fund Committee Adopt Rules And Regulations And Conduct Needs Assessments For Future Purchases From The Fund; To Establish A Process For The Selection Of A Third Party To Administer Inmate Canteen Services For The Department Of Corrections; To Require The Department To Submit A Request For Proposals For Such Administration; To Provide Evaluation Of Such Services By The Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review (peer) Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

111.title: Districts of Innovation; authorize State Board of Education to approve creation of in local school districts.
111.description: An Act To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Approve The Creation Of Districts Of Innovation; To Define Certain Terms Related To "districts Of Innovation"; To Provide That The Number Of Districts Of Innovation Approved Shall Not Exceed Five Districts Per Year; To Limit The Initial Approval And Subsequent Renewals Of Districts Of Innovation To Five-year Periods; To Direct The Board To Promulgate Administrative Rules And Regulations To Prescribe The Conditions And Procedures To Be Used By Local School Boards To Be Approved As A District Of Innovation; To Specify The Criteria To Be Addressed By The Administrative Regulations; To Prescribe The Requirements For A District To Be A District Of Innovation Applicant; To Prescribe The Statutory Requirements With Which Schools Of Innovation Within Districts Of Innovation Must Comply; To Identify Areas In Which Districts Of Innovation May Request Approval Of Practices That Are Different Than Current Statutory Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

112.title: Higher Education Legislative Plan Grant Program; revise and clarify requirements related to income, residency and documentation.
112.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-157-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Higher Education Legislative Plan Grant Program; To Require Students To Submit An Application By The Deadline Set For The Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Program; To Clarify The Method For Determining Residency Status; To Require That A Student's Successful Completion Of The Required High School Course Work Be Certified By The High School Counselor; To Raise The Annual Adjusted Gross Income Used For Purposes Of Determining A Student's Eligibility For The Program; To Require The Completion Of The Free Application For Federal Student Aid To Verify Annual Adjusted Gross Income; And For Related Purposes.

113.title: Law enforcement officers and firefighters scholarship; change requirements related to GPA and proof of disability.
113.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-107-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Recipients Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Firefighters Scholarship To Maintain A Grade Point Average Of 2.5 As A Condition For Renewal; To Amend Section 37-107-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Documentation That Must Be Submitted To Prove Permanent And Total Disability; And For Related Purposes.

114.title: MS Eminent Scholars Grant; revise eligibility requirements and limit awards to cost of attendance.
114.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Eligibility Requirements For First-time And Renewal Applicants; To Allow Students To Choose To Limit Financial Aid Awards To The Cost Of Attendance; And For Related Purposes.

115.title: Mississippi Public Records Act of 1983; exempt certain academic records from.
115.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Exemption From The Mississippi Public Records Act For Certain Records Created Or Collected In The Course Of Academic Research; And For Related Purposes.

116.title: County regional correctional facilities, certain; require certain auditing of.
116.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A County Regional Correction Facility Is Constructed With A County Jail At Such Facility Then The County Jail Shall Be Included In Any Audit Conducted By The American Correctional Association; And For Related Purposes.

117.title: Crimes; prohibit impersonating a fire fighter.
117.description: An Act To Prohibit Impersonating A Firefighter And Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

118.title: Corrections; require Inmate Fund to be special fund, require RFP's for canteen services and revise contract amount to be reviewed by Procurement Review Board.
118.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-158, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Inmate Welfare Fund Be A Special Fund In The State Treasury; To Provide For The Management Of The Fund; To Require That The Inmate Welfare Fund Committee Adopt Rules And Regulations And Conduct Needs Assessments For Future Purchases From The Fund; To Establish A Process For The Selection Of A Third Party To Administer Inmate Canteen Services For The Department Of Corrections; To Require The Department To Submit A Request For Proposals For Such Administration; To Provide Evaluation Of Such Services By The Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review (peer) Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 47-5-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Contract Amount That The Department Of Corrections Must Receive Approval From The Public Procurement Review Board Before A Contract May Be Awarded By The Department; And For Related Purposes.

119.title: State-assisted Local Road Construction and Maintenance Program; create for counties and municipalities under certain populations.
119.description: An Act To Establish A State-assisted Local Road Construction And Maintenance Program For The Purpose Of Providing Financial Assistance To Certain Counties And Municipalities In The Construction, Reconstruction And Maintenance Of Highways, Roads And Streets That Are Not Included In The State Highway System Or The State Aid Road System; To Provide That The Program Shall Be Administered By The Office Of State Aid Road Construction; To Amend Section 65-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

120.title: Retirement; PERS members convicted of job-related felonies shall be terminated from system.
120.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Member Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Shall Be Terminated From Membership In The System If The Member Is Convicted Of A Felony That Is Related To Or In Connection With The Member's Employment In The State Service; To Amend Section 25-11-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Refund Of The Accumulated Contributions Of Any Member Who Is Convicted Of Any Such Crime; To Amend Sections 25-15-3 And 25-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Active Member Of The Retirement System Who Is Participating In The State And School Employees Life And Health Insurance Plan, And Who Otherwise Would Be Eligible To Receive A Retirement Allowance But Is Terminated From Membership In The System Because Of Conviction Of Any Such Crime, Shall Be Eligible To Continue To Participate In The Plan Under The Same Conditions And Coverages For Retired Employees; And For Related Purposes.

121.title: Bail reform; enact.
121.description: An Act To Reform Bail Procedures; To Provide When Release On Bail Shall Be Authorized; To Provide Conditions For Release; To Authorize Temporary Detention For Revocation Of Release; To Provide For Detention And Detention Hearings; To Provide Factors For Consideration; To Provide For The Contents Of Release And Detention Orders; To Provide For Release Or Detention Pending Sentence And Appeal; To Provide For The Arrest Of Persons; To Provide For The Review Of Release Orders And Appeals Therefrom; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Provide For Sanctions And Revocation Of Release; To Provide For Surrender Of An Offender By A Surety; To Amend Sections 99-5-11, 99-5-13, 99-5-15, 99-5-25, 99-5-27, 99-5-31, 99-5-33, 99-5-35, 99-5-37, 99-5-38, 99-5-39, 99-35-1, 99-35-3, 99-35-5, 99-35-7, 99-35-9, 99-35-11, 99-35-13, 99-35-101, 99-35-103, 99-35-109, 99-35-111, 99-35-113, 99-35-115, 99-35-117, 99-35-119 And 99-35-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

122.title: Grandparents' visitation rights; include great-grandparents.
122.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-16-1, 93-16-3, 93-16-5 And 93-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Great-grandparents In The Grandparents' Visitation Rights Law; And For Related Purposes.

123.title: District Attorneys; provide additional legal assistants.
123.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Full-time Legal Assistants For District Attorneys; And For Related Purposes.

124.title: Attorney General; require approval by Outside Counsel Oversight Commission to bring certain suits.
124.description: An Act To Amend Sections 7-5-1 And 7-5-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Approval Of The Outside Counsel Oversight Commission In Certain Actions Brought By The Attorney General; And For Related Purposes.

125.title: Protection from domestic abuse; clarify record.
125.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-21-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Meaning Of Record In The Protection From Domestic Abuse Law; And For Related Purposes.

126.title: Mississippi Main Street Investment Act; create.
126.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Main Street Investment Act; To Provide Definitions For This Act; To Create The Mississippi Main Street Investment Loan Fund; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Establish A Program To Make Loans To Municipalities To Assist With Maintaining And Improving The Viability Of Revitalization Zones; To Require A Municipality Desiring A Loan Under This Act To Submit An Application To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Review The Application Of A Municipality In Order To Confirm That The Revitalization Zone Meets The Requirements Of This Act; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Establish A Deadline For The Submission Of Applications During A State Fiscal Year; To Provide That If A Municipality In Which A Revitalization Zone Is Located Receives A Loan Under This Section, Then The Sales Tax Revenue Collected Within A Revitalization Zone Shall Be Allocated For Distribution To The Municipality In Which The Revitalization Zone Is Located And Paid To The Municipality; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority With All Powers Necessary To Implement And Administer The Program Authorized By This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 And Provide That The Proceeds Of Such Bonds Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Main Street Investment Loan Fund; And For Related Purposes.

127.title: Habitual offender law; revise.
127.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Provisions Of The Habitual Offender Law; And For Related Purposes.

128.title: Domestic violence; prohibit eligibility for parole when death results from.
128.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Person Shall Be Eligible For Parole Who Is Charged, Tried And Convicted Of Capital Murder In The Commission Of The Crime Of Domestic Violence; To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include "domestic Violence That Causes Death" In The Definition Of Capital Murder; And For Related Purposes.

129.title: Courts; create circuit court district for Madison County.
129.description: An Act To Create Sections 9-7-59 And 9-7-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Twenty-third Circuit Court District; To Provide Judgeships For The Twenty-third Circuit Court District; To Amend Section 9-7-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 25-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Legal Assistants To The District Attorney Of The Twenty-third Circuit Court District; To Amend Section 25-31-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Criminal Investigator For The Twentieth And Twenty-third Circuit Court Districts; And For Related Purposes.

130.title: Distinctive license tag; reauthorize issuance for public junior colleges and community colleges.
130.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of A Public Junior College Or Community College In This State; And For Related Purposes.

131.title: Persons with disabilities; require state agencies to enhance employment opportunities for.
131.description: An Act To Require State Agencies That Provide Services And Support To Persons With Disabilities To Consider, As Their First Option, Competitive Employment In An Integrated Setting For Persons With Disabilities; To Require All State Agencies To Follow This Policy For Employment By Coordinating All Collaborating Efforts Among Agencies; To Authorize State Agencies To Adopt Rules And Regulations To Implement The Provisions Of This Act; To Require The Disability Resource Commission To Review Measurable Goals And Objectives As Submitted To It By Each Relevant State Agency To Ensure Implementation Of This Act; To Provide Reporting Requirements For State Agencies; To Amend Section 43-30-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

132.title: Distinctive license tag; revise persons eligible to receive Grand Lodge of Mississippi, Free and Accepted Masons tag.
132.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Persons To Whom The Grand Lodge Of Mississippi, Free And Accepted Masons, Distinctive License Tag May Be Issued; And For Related Purposes.

133.title: Appropriation; Rural Fire Truck Fund for additional round of trucks under Acquisition Assistance Program.
133.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Rural Fire Truck Fund For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For An Additional Round Of Fire Trucks For Counties And Municipalities Under The Rural Fire Truck Acquisition Assistance Program For The Fiscal Year 2015.

134.title: Appropriation; Bridge Replacement and Rehabilitation Fund for funding bridge program.
134.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Fund For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program For The Fiscal Year 2015.

135.title: Rural Fire Truck Acquisition Assistance Program; authorize an additional round for counties and municipalities.
135.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-23-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Additional Round Of Fire Trucks For Counties And Municipalities Under The Rural Fire Truck Acquisition Assistance Program; And For Related Purposes.

136.title: Appropriation; IHL for funding Mississippi Dyslexia Education Scholarship Program.
136.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Purpose Of Funding The Mississippi Dyslexia Education Scholarship Program For The Fiscal Year 2015.

137.title: School board members; revise manner of compensation of for work done in furtherance of regular board meetings.
137.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Compensatory Benefits Provided To School Board Members In Further Performance Of Their Duties And Obligations Including Attendance At Any Mandatory School Board Training Session Or At Regional And National Education Meetings By Granting A Per Diem In The Amount Of Forty Dollars For Those Duties Performed In Addition To The Regular Attendance Of Board Meetings; To Bring Forward Section 37-3-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

138.title: Gun buy-back programs; prohibit.
