1279.title: CON; exempt relocation of certain nursing facilities within some long-term care planning district from.
1279.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Relocation Of Certain Existing Nursing Home Facilities To A New Facility Located Within The Same Long-term Care Planning District Without The Requirement Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need; And For Related Purposes.

1280.title: Rights of individual's with a terminal condition; require payment of health insurance and Medicaid benefits.
1280.description: An Act To Provide That No Health Coverage Plan Shall Restrict Coverage For Prescribed Treatment Based Upon The Insured's Diagnosis With A Terminal Condition; To Provide That No Health Benefit Paid With State Funds Specifically Medicaid And The State Insurance Plan Shall Restrict Coverage For Physician Prescribed Treatment Based Upon The Individual's Diagnosis With A Terminal Condition; To Amend Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1281.title: Mississippi Physician Shield Act; create.
1281.description: An Act To Be Known As The Mississippi Physician Shield Act; To Provide For Certain Findings Of The Legislature; To Provide That A Physician's Failure To Comply With Or A Physician's Breach Of Any Federal Statute, Regulation, Program, Guideline Or Other Provision Shall Not Be Admissible, Be Used To Determine The Standard Of Care, Or Be The Legal Basis For A Presumption Of Negligence, In Any Medical Malpractice Or Liability Action; And For Related Purposes.

1282.title: CON; issue for nursing facility in Jones County.
1282.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Of A Nursing Facility In Jones County, Not To Exceed Sixty Beds; And For Related Purposes.

1283.title: State Board of Medical Licensure; add nurse practitioner member of MS Board of Nursing to.
1283.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Membership Of The State Board Of Medical Licensure Shall Include A Registered Nurse Practitioner Of The Mississippi Board Of Nursing, Who Shall Serve In A Nonvoting Capacity; And For Related Purposes.

1284.title: Medicaid; provide civil immunity to physician Medicaid providers for services provided to Medicaid recipients.
1284.description: An Act To Provide Immunity From Civil Liability To Physicians Who Participate In The Medicaid Program For Acts Or Omissions In The Provision Of Medical Or Health Services To Medicaid Recipients, Except In Cases Of Gross Negligence Or Willful Or Wanton Misconduct; To Extend The Immunity Provided Under This Act To The Health Care Facility In Which The Physician Provided The Medical Or Health Services To The Medicaid Recipient; And For Related Purposes.

1285.title: Pregnancy; provide crime of child abuse for women using illegal drugs during.
1285.description: An Act To Require Drug Testing Of Pregnant Women Arrested For Violations Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Law; To Provide That A Positive Test Shall Constitute Child Abuse; To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1286.title: Epinephrine auto-injectors; allow schools and certain authorized entities to stock and administer.
1286.description: An Act To Create New Section 41-79-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Health Care Providers To Prescribe Epinephrine Auto-injectors In The Name Of A School For Use In Accordance With This Act; To Authorize Schools To Maintain A Stock Supply Of Epinephrine Auto-injectors For Use In Accordance With This Act; To Authorize School Nurses And Designated School Personnel To Use Epinephrine Auto-injectors Prescribed Under This Act To Provide Them To Students For Self-administration In Accordance With A Prescription Specific To The Student On File With The School, Toadminister An Epinephrine Auto-injector To A Student In Accordance With A Prescription Specific To The Student On File With The School, And To Administer An Epinephrine Auto-injector To Any Student Or Other Individual Who The School Nurse Or Designated School Personnel Believes In Good Faith Is Experiencing Anaphylaxis In Accordance With A Standing Protocol From An Authorized Health Care Provider; To Authorize Schools To Enter Into Arrangements With Manufacturers Of Epinephrine Auto-injectors Or Third-party Suppliers Of Epinephrine Auto-injectors To Obtain Epinephrine Auto-injectors At Fair-market, Free, Or Reduced Prices; To Require Designated School Personnel To Complete An Anaphylaxis Training Program Before Providing Or Administering An Epinephrine Auto-injector Made Available By A School; To Direct The State Department Of Education, In Consultation With The State Department Of Health, To Develop And Make Available To All Schools Guidelines For The Management Of Students With Life-threatening Food Allergies; To Require The Governing Authorities Of Schools To Implement A Plan Based On The Guidelines Developed By The Department Of Education For The Management Of Students With Life-threatening Allergies Enrolled In The Schools Under Its Jurisdiction, And To Make The Plan Available On The Governing Authority's Website Or The Website Of Each School Under The Governing Authority's Jurisdiction; To Authorize Health Care Providers To Prescribe Epinephrine Auto-injectors In The Name Of Certain Authorized Entities For Use In Accordance With This Act; To Provide That Authorized Entities May Acquire And Maintain A Stock Supply Of Epinephrine Auto-injectors Under A Prescription Issued In Accordance With This Act; To Require That Those Epinephrine Auto-injectors Be Stored In A Location Readily Accessible In An Emergency And In Accordance With The Epinephrine Auto-injector's Instructions For Use And Any Additional Requirements That May Be Established By The State Department Of Health; To Require Authorized Entities To Designate Employees Or Agents Who Have Completed The Training Required By This Section To Be Responsible For The Storage, Maintenance, And General Oversight Of Epinephrine Auto-injectors Acquired By The Authorized Entity; To Authorize Employees And Agents Of Authorized Entities And Other Individuals Who Have Completed The Training Required By This Act To Use Epinephrine Auto-injectors Prescribed Under This Act To Provide Them To Any Individual Who The Employee, Agent Or Other Individual Believes In Good Faith Is Experiencing Anaphylaxis For Immediate Self-administration, And Administer An Epinephrine Auto-injector To Any Individual Who The Employee, Agent Or Other Individual Believes In Good Faith Is Experiencing Anaphylaxis; To Require Employees, Agents And Other Individuals To Complete An Anaphylaxis Training Program Before Providing Or Administering An Epinephrine Auto-injector Made Available By An Authorized Entity; To Provide That Authorized Entities That Acquire And Maintain A Stock Supply Of Epinephrine Auto-injectors Under A Prescription Issued In Accordance With This Act May Make Those Epinephrine Auto-injectors Available To Individuals Other Than Those Trained Individuals Described In This Act If The Epinephrine Auto-injectors Are Stored In A Locked, Secure Container And Are Made Available Only Upon Remote Authorization By An Authorized Health Care Provider After Consultation With The Authorized Health Care Provider By Audio, Televideo, Or Other Similar Means Of Electronic Communication; To Provide Immunity From Liability For Damages For Any Injuries That Result From The Administration Of, Self-administration Of, Or Failure To Administer An Epinephrine Auto-injector That May Constitute Ordinary Negligence For Schools That Possess And Make Available Epinephrine Auto-injectors And School Nurses, Employees, Agents, And Volunteers, And For Authorized Entities That Possess And Makes Available Epinephrine Auto-injectors And Their Employees, Agents, And Other Trained Individuals; And For Related Purposes.

1287.title: Acupuncturist; exempt certain from requirement of physician referral of patients.
1287.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-71-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Acupuncturists Who Have Been Licensed And In Good Standing For Five Consecutive Years With No Disciplinary Actions Taken Against Them Are Exempt From The Requirement That Their Patients Must Have A Referral Or Prescription From A Physician; And For Related Purposes.

1288.title: Commission on the Future of Medicaid and Health Care in Mississippi; create.
1288.description: An Act To Create The Commission On The Future Of Medicaid And Health Care In Mississippi; To Provide For The Membership Of The Commission; To Specify The Medicaid And Other Health Topics And Matters For The Commission To Study And Make Recommendations On, With The Goal Of Ensuring Access, Increasing Quality And Controlling Costs Of The Medicaid And Other Health Programs; To Provide For Monthly Meetings Of The Commission; To Provide That The Commission Shall Prepare And Submit Its Initial Report With A Detailed Statement Of Findings, Conclusions And Recommendations To The Legislature And The Governor Not Later Than September 1, 2015; To Provide That The Commission Shall Continue In Existence And Shall Prepare And Submit A Follow-up Report Annually Not Later Than September 1 Of The Year; To Repeal Sections 41-95-1 Through 41-95-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Health Policy Act Of 1994; And For Related Purposes.

1289.title: Newborns; require hospitals to perform pulse oximetry screening on after birth.
1289.description: An Act To Create New Section 41-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Hospital That Provides Birthing And Newborn Care Services To Perform A Pulse Oximetry Screening On Every Newborn In Its Care Not Less Than 24 Hours After Birth; And For Related Purposes.

1290.title: CON; certain health care services shall be subject to CON review.
1290.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Health Care Services Shall Be Subject To Certificate Of Need Review; And For Related Purposes.

1291.title: SNAP recipients; require drug testing for certain who have been screened.
1291.description: An Act To Provide That Adults Who Are Approved By The Department Of Human Services To Receive Snap Benefits Shall Be Required To Complete A Written Screening Questionnaire Designed To Determine The Likelihood Of The Person Having A Substance Use Disorder; To Provide That If The Results Of The Written Screening Questionnaire Indicate A Reasonable Likelihood That An Adult Recipient May Have A Substance Use Disorder Involving The Misuse Of A Drug, The Department Shall Require The Person To Submit To A Drug Test At The Department's Expense In Order To Continue To Receive Benefits; To Provide That If An Adult Recipient Refuses To Take The Required Drug Test, The Department Shall Terminate Snap Benefits And The Person May Not Reapply For Benefits For A Certain Period Of Time; To Provide That If An Adult Recipient Tests Positive For The Unlawful Use Of A Drug After Taking A Drug Test, The Person Shall Be Given A List Of Approved Substance Use Disorder Treatment Providers That Are Available In The Area In Which The Person Resides, And May Continue To Receive Benefits If The Person Enters Into And Follows The Requirements Of A Substance Use Disorder Treatment Plan; To Provide That If An Adult Recipient Declines To Enter Into A Substance Use Disorder Treatment Plan, Or If The Recipient Enters Into, But Fails To Meet, A Requirement Of A Substance Use Disorder Treatment Plan, The Department Shall Terminate Snap Benefits And The Person May Not Reapply For Benefits For A Certain Period Of Time; To Direct The Department Of Human Services To Seek Federal Waivers Necessary To Allow The Department To Implement The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1292.title: Medicaid; authorize coverage for home/therapeutic leave days for supervised living program.
1292.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Medicaid Coverage For Home/therapeutic Leave Days For The Supervised Living Waiver Program; And For Related Purposes.

1293.title: Mississippi Telephone Solicitation Act; provide that online pharmacies are not exempt from.
1293.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define And Add The Term "online Pharmacy" To The Mississippi Telephone Solicitation Act; To Amend Section 77-3-709, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Service Commission Shall Not Exempt A Telephone Solicitor Who Is An Online Pharmacy From Purchasing Or Using The No-calls Data Base; To Amend Section 77-3-711, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Online Pharmacy Shall Not Be Exempt From The Telephone Solicitation Act Even If Such Pharmacy Has An Established Business Relationship With A Consumer; And For Related Purposes.

1294.title: Domestic violence shelters; revise certain provisions relating to state grants to.
1294.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-21-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms For The Purposes Of The Grant Program For Domestic Violence Shelters; To Amend Section 93-21-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any State-source Grant To A Domestic Violence Shelter Shall Be Matched With A Certain Amount Of Local Funds; To Provide That Grants Made To Domestic Violence Shelters With State Funds Shall Be Inflated By A General Cpi Inflator To Maintain The Buying Power Of The Grants; To Amend Section 93-21-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Employee Or Agent Of A Domestic Violence Shelter Who Discloses Any Confidential Information Or Makes Any Comment About The Identity Or Condition Of Any Person Admitted To The Shelter Is Civilly Liable To The Person Whose Personal Information Was Disclosed; To Bring Forward Sections 93-21-103, 93-21-105, 93-21-111, 93-21-113, 93-21-115 And 93-21-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1295.title: Pharmacy benefit mangers; extend date that definition in Prompt Pay Act excludes certain insurance companies.
1295.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Period Of Time That The Term "pharmacy Benefit Manager" In The Pharmacy Benefit Prompt Pay Act Excludes An Insurance Company That Provides An Integrated Health Benefit Plan And That Does Not Separately Contract For Pharmacy Benefit Management Services; And For Related Purposes.

1296.title: Administrative procedures act; revise to allow small business to have streamlined adjudicatory proceeding.
1296.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-43-2.104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Administrative Procedures Act; To Provide That An Agency May Adopt Rules Providing For The Use Of Streamlined Proceedings For A Small Business That Is Involved In An Adjudicatory Proceeding Before The Agency; To Amend Sections 25-43-1.102, 25-43-1.106, 25-43-2.103 And 25-43-3.105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Bring Forward Section 25-43-4.104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1297.title: Finance charges; charges & premiums for credit insurance & auto club memberships by small loan licenses not considered as.
1297.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-17-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charges, Fees And Premiums For Voluntarily Purchased Credit Insurance And Auto Club Memberships Charged By A Small Loan Licensee Shall Not Be Considered To Be Finance Charges; And For Related Purposes.

1298.title: Mississippi Prison Industries; prohibit the sale of goods and services to private entities or other states.
1298.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-549, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Mississippi Prison Industries Corporation From Selling Any Of Its Goods Or Services To Any Other State Or Any Private Entity; To Require The Corporation To Contribute A Certain Percentage Of Its Gross Sales To The Crime Victims' Compensation Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1299.title: Mississippi Prison Industries Corporation; require inmate to meet certain criteria to become eligible to perform work for.
1299.description: An Act To Provide That Before An Inmate May Become Eligible To Perform Work For Mississippi Prison Industries Corporation, He Or She Must Meet Certain Criteria; And For Related Purposes.

1300.title: Public records; access not diminished because stored in certain manner.
1300.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Public Records Act To Clarify That Public Access To Certain Information That Is Not Exempt Under The Act, Even Though Contained In Proprietary, Sensitive Or Other Software, Will Not Be Diminished Because Components Of Data Are Stored In A Certain Manner; To Amend Section 25-61-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When A Person Denies Access To A Public Record That Is Not Exempt Under The Act, The Civil Penalty May Be Imposed On That Person In His Personal Capacity; And For Related Purposes.

1301.title: Public records; revise requirements for production of records related to negotiations of purchases, contracts and leases.
1301.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Public Records That Are Part Of A Quotation, Bid, Request For Qualifications Or Request For Proposal Shall Be Produced By The Public Body Within A Certain Time After The Execution Of The Pertinent Purchase, Contract And/or Lease; And For Related Purposes.

1302.title: Mississippi Public Records Act of 1983; revise enforcement.
1302.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Ethics Commission Shall Have The Authority To Enforce The Law Regarding The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983; To Provide Procedures For Complaints; To Provide For Appeals Of Commission Orders; And For Related Purposes.

1303.title: Open meetings law; create civil penalty for disclosing information from executive session of public body.
1303.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-41-7 And 25-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Civil Penalty For Disclosing Information Derived From An Executive Session; And For Related Purposes.

1304.title: Open meetings law; revise judicial review.
1304.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Judicial Review Of Cases Under The Open Meetings Law; And For Related Purposes.

1305.title: Public contracts; give preference to resident bidders and prescribe specific penalties for violations.
1305.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-13-111, 31-7-15 And 31-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Letting Of Public Contracts, Preference Shall Be Given To Resident Bidders Whenever All Things Are Equal With Regard To Quality And Service But Differ Only With Regard To Price, If The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Resident Bidders Is Not More Than Two Percent Greater Than The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Nonresident Bidders; To Provide That A Nonresident Bidder Domiciled In A State Having Laws Granting Preference To Resident Bidders Shall Be Awarded Mississippi Contracts Only On The Same Basis As The Nonresident Bidder's State Awards Contracts To Mississippi Residents Bidding Under Similar Circumstances; To Amend Section 31-7-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe A Penalty For Persons Who Intentionally, Willfully And Knowingly Violate The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1306.title: Unmarked vehicles; authorize use by DFA & Commissioner of Insurance when identifying marks will hinder official investigations.
1306.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Use Of Unmarked Vehicles By The Department Of Finance And Administration And The Commissioner Of Insurance In Instances Where Identifying Marks Will Hinder Official Investigations; And For Related Purposes.

1307.title: Personal services contracts; require those over $10,000.00 to be submitted to Personal Service Contract Review and posted on website.
1307.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Personal Service Contract Review Board Shall Require That All Personal And Professional Services Contracts Involving The Expenditures Of Funds In Excess Of $10,000.00 Be Submitted To The Personal Service Contract Review Board, Which Shall Post Those Contracts On The Website Of The State Personnel Board; And For Related Purposes.

1308.title: Public purchasing laws; remove prohibition on using reverse auctions for certain public contracts.
1308.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Prohibition In The Public Purchasing Laws On Using Reverse Auctions For Public Contracts For The Design Or Construction Of Public Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1309.title: Mississippi Employment Fairness Act; create.
1309.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Employment Fairness Act; To Provide Definitions For Such Act; To Provide That No Law, Ordinance, Or Regulation Shall Impose Any Contractual, Zoning, Permitting, Licensing, Or Other Condition That Requires Any Employer Or Employee To Waive Their Rights Under The National Labor Relations Act; To Provide That Any Agreement, Contract, Understanding, Or Practice, Written Or Oral, Implied Or Expressed, Between Any Employer And Any Labor Organization Required In Violation Of This Section Is Declared To Be Unlawful, Null And Void, And Of No Legal Effect; To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; To Bring Forward Section 71-1-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Declares The Right To Work Policy Of The State, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1310.title: Dept. of ITS; revise authority of executive director regarding the purchase of computer equipment and services.
1310.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of The Executive Director Of The Department Of Information Technology Services With Regard To The Acquisition Of Computer Equipment Or Services; To Amend Sections 25-53-5, 25-53-25 And 25-53-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Bring Forward Sections 25-53-117, 25-53-123 And 25-53-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1311.title: Information Technology Services; revise composition of board and delete surety bond requirement.
1311.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Board Of The Department Of Information Technology Services; To Delete The Requirement That A Board Member Must Furnish A Surety Bond Before Entering Upon His Duties; And For Related Purposes.

1312.title: Personal Service Contract Review Board; abolish and transfer its powers and duties to State Personnel Board.
1312.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Abolish The Personal Service Contract Review Board And Transfer Its Powers And Duties To The State Personnel Board; To Amend Sections 7-7-3, 7-7-211, 25-9-107, 25-53-21 And 43-13-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1313.title: Personal Service Contract Review Board; delete exemption from review by for certain professional services contracts.
1313.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Exemption From Review By The Personal Service Contract Review Board For Certain Professional Services Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

1314.title: Personal Service Contract Review Board; shall only review contracts & Personnel Board approves & performs other functions of.
1314.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Personal And Professional Services Contracts Involving The Expenditures Of Funds In Excess Of One Hundred Thousand Dollars Shall Be Finally Approved Or Disapproved By The State Personnel Board After Review By The Personal Service Contract Review Board; To Transfer The Remaining Powers Of The Personal Service Contract Review Board To The State Personnel Board; To Amend Sections 7-7-3, 7-7-211, 25-9-107, 25-53-21, 43-13-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1315.title: State agency purchasing; require procurement portal to provide information to vendors and include on Transparency MS website.
1315.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Electronic Government Oversight Committee To Require The Development Of A State Procurement Portal To Provide Potential Vendors Of Goods And Services Information Necessary To Assist Them In Procuring Contracts With The State Of Mississippi; To Codify New Section 27-104-165, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Procurement Portal Be Incorporated Into The Current Transparency Mississippi Website; And For Related Purposes.

1317.title: State Auditor; authorize to conduct audits of state-funded economic development projects.
1317.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Auditor To Conduct Performance And Compliance Audits Of State-funded Economic Development Projects; To Amend Section 57-61-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Authorize Audits Of Projects Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act And To Authorize The State Auditor To Bill For The Cost Of Such Audits; To Amend Section 57-62-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Authorize Audits Of Projects Under The Mississippi Advantage Jobs Act And To Authorize The State Auditor To Bill For The Cost Of Such Audits; To Bring Forward Section 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Grants Certain Powers To The State Bond Commission Under The Major Economic Impact Act, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 57-85-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Use Of Monies In The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund To Pay For The Costs Of Audits On Projects Conducted By The State Auditor; To Amend Section 57-89-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Authorize The State Auditor To Conduct Audits On Motion Picture Production Companies Receiving Rebates Under The Mississippi Motion Picture Incentive Act; To Amend Section 57-93-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Authorize The State Auditor To Conduct Audits On Existing Industries Receiving A Loan Under The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Program And To Bill For The Costs Of Such Audits; To Amend Section 57-95-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Authorize The State Auditor To Conduct Audits On At-risk Industries Receiving A Loan Under The Mississippi Job Protection Act And To Bill For The Costs Of Such Audits; To Amend Section 69-2-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Auditor To Bill The Mississippi Development Authority For Expenses Relating To Audits Of Businesses Receiving A Loan From The Emerging Crops Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1319.title: UN Agenda 21; prohibit MS and any political subdivisions of from adopting or implementing and prohibit any association with certain.
1319.description: An Act To Prohibit The State Of Mississippi And All Political Subdivisions Of The State From Adopting Or Implementing The Creed, Doctrine, Principle Or Any Tenet Of The United States Rio Declaration On Environment And The Statement Of Principles For Sustainable Development Known As "agenda 21" Or Any Other International Law Contravening The Constitution Of The United States Or The Constitution Of The State Of Mississippi; To Prohibit The State Of Mississippi And All Political Subdivisions Of The State From Implementing Programs Of, Expending Any Sum Of Money For, Being A Member Of, Receiving Funding From, Contracting Services From, Or Giving Financial Or Other Forms Of Aid To The International Council For Local Environmental Initiatives Or Any Of Its Related Or Affiliated Organizations To Include, But Not Be Limited To, Countdown 2010, Local Action For Biodiversity, European Center For Nature Conservation, The International Union For Conservation Of Nature And The President's Council On Sustainable Development; And For Related Purposes.

1320.title: Flu vaccinations; require hospitals to offer to certain patients before discharge.
1320.description: An Act To Create Section 41-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Flu Vaccinations To Be Offered By Hospitals To Certain Patients Before Discharge; To Amend Section 41-9-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

1321.title: Employment Protection Act; revise.
1321.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Employment Protection Act To Conform With Federal Law And Regulations Regarding The Hiring Of Unauthorized Aliens; And For Related Purposes.

1322.title: Purchase requisition; provide that any person who makes a purchase without such shall be personally liable.
1322.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Any Person Who Makes A Purchase Without A Purchase Requisition Or Binding Contract Shall Be Responsible For Ensuring The Purchase Is Made According To State Law; To Bring Forward Section 31-7-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1323.title: Public purchasing laws; exempt from bid requirements certain fuel purchases for county-owned machinery & vehicles.
1323.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Bid Requirements Under The Public Purchasing Laws Purchases Of Fuel In Amounts Of 2,000 Gallons Or Less That Are Needed To Power County-owned Machinery And Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

1324.title: Corrections; require Inmate Fund to be a special fund and require RFPs for administration of canteen services.
1324.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-158, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Inmate Welfare Fund Be A Special Fund In The State Treasury; To Provide For The Management Of The Fund; To Require That The Inmate Welfare Fund Committee Adopt Rules And Regulations And Conduct Needs Assessments For Future Purchases From The Fund; To Establish A Process For The Selection Of A Third Party To Administer Inmate Canteen Services For The Department Of Corrections; To Require The Department To Submit A Request For Proposals For Such Administration; To Provide Evaluation Of Such Services By The Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review (peer) Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

1325.title: Sports officials; create offense of assaulting.
1325.description: An Act To Create The Offense Of Assault Of A Sports Official And Provide Penalties For Violations; To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1326.title: Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan; new members of Legislature after January 1, 2012, shall not be members of.
1326.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Person Who Becomes A Member Of The State Legislature For The First Time On Or After July 1, 2014, And Any Person Who Becomes The President Of The Senate For The First Time On Or After July 1, 2014, Shall Not Become A Member Of The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan; To Provide That Any Person Who Became A Member Of The State Legislature For The First Time On Or After January 1, 2012, And Before July 1, 2014, And The Person Who Became The President Of The Senate For The First Time On Or After January 1, 2012, And Before July 1, 2014, Shall Not Be A Member Of The Plan From And After July 1, 2014; To Provide That Those Persons Shall Not Receive Any Service Credit For The Time That They Were Members Of The Plan, But They May Receive A Refund Of The Amount Of Their Accumulated Contributions, Or Have An Eligible Rollover Distribution Of Their Accumulated Contributions Paid Directly To An Eligible Retirement Plan Or An Individual Retirement Account; To Amend Section 25-11-311, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1327.title: Small Business & Grocer Investment Act; create to encourage consumption of affordable healthy foods in underserved communities.
1327.description: An Act To Create The Small Business And Grocer Investment Act; To Provide That, To The Extent Funds Are Available, The Mississippi Development Authority, In Cooperation With Public And Private Sector Partners, Shall Establish A Program That Provides Grants And Loans And/or Promotes Access To Healthy Food Retailers That Increase Access To Fresh Fruits And Vegetables And Other Affordable Healthy Food In Underserved Communities; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority May Contract With One Or More Qualified Nonprofit Organizations Or Community Development Financial Institutions To Administer The Program Described In This Act Through A Public-private Partnership, To Raise Matching Funds, Market The Program Statewide, Evaluate Applicants, Make Award Decisions, Underwrite Loans, And Monitor Compliance And Impact; To Provide That The Program Shall Provide Funding On A Competitive, One-time Basis As Appropriate For The Eligible Project; To Provide The Types Of Programs And Projects For Which Funding May Be Provided; To Provide The Criteria That Must Be Met For Funding Under The Program; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Establish Program Benchmarks And Reporting Processes To Make Certain That The Program Benefits Both Rural And Urban Communities In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1328.title: Emergency communications districts; require regular audits.
1328.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Auditor To Ensure That When Conducting County Audits, That The Funds And Transactions Of Emergency Communications Districts Be Included In Such Audit; To Require That Emergency Communications Districts, Which Maintain Their Funds In A Fund Or Funds Separate From The County General Fund, Employ The Services Of A Certified Public Accountant To Conduct An Audit Of The Emergency Communications District; To Amend Section 19-5-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Purposes For Which Emergency Communications Districts May Purchase And Procure Equipment, Commodities And Services, And Empower The Commercial Mobile Radio Services Board To Establish Regulations Governing Such Purposes; To Amend Section 19-5-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Empower The Commercial Mobile Radio Services Board To Carry Out Certain Additional Functions; And For Related Purposes.

1329.title: Mayor-council municipal government; authorize appointed staff for certain.
1329.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-8-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Certain Municipalities To Appoint Their Own Staff; To Amend Section 21-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Council's Authority Over Its Staff; And For Related Purposes.

1330.title: Certain personal service contracts for DOC; place under the purview of Personal Service Contract Review Board.
1330.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Exception From Personal Service Contract Review Board Rules And Regulations For Solicitation And Selection Of Contractual Services For Physician Services That Are Provided State Correctional Facilities, Privately Operated Correctional Facilities And Regional Correctional Facilities; To Provide That Personal Service Contract Services For Pharmaceutical And Offender Service Programs Shall Be Under Such Rules Of The Personal Service Contract Review Board; And For Related Purposes.

1331.title: Computer services & other professional services; allow public contracts over $100,000.00 for without competitive bidding.
1331.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase To $100,000.00 The Minimum Amount Of Expenditure Of Funds For Acquisitions Of Computer Equipment And Services For Which Advertising For Competitive Bids Is Required; To Provide That State Agencies And Local Governing Authorities Shall Not Require The Advertising For Or Otherwise Requesting Competitive Bids To Enter Into Contracts For Any Professional Services Where The Amount Of The Contract Involves The Expenditure Of Public Funds Exceeding $100,000.00, And Those Contracts May Be Negotiated Directly Between The Agency Or Governing Authority And The Providers Of The Professional Services; And For Related Purposes.

1332.title: Transparency website; require information on state actions related to public purchases and contracts to be included on.
1332.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Detailed Information On State Agency Actions Related To Public Purchases And Public Contracts That Are Made Through Competitive Bids Or Negotiations Or Through A Request For Proposals Process Be Included On The Website Maintained Under The Mississippi Accountability And Transparency Act; And For Related Purposes.

1333.title: Mississippi Accountability & Transparency Act; clarify and enhance.
1333.description: An Act To Clarify And Enhance The Mississippi Accountability And Transparency Act; To Amend Section 27-104-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Describe The Manner Of Presenting Information On The Searchable Website That Includes Information On Expenditures Of State Funds Operated By The Department Of Finance And Administration; To Provide Immunity From Civil Liability For An Officer Or Employee Of The Department Who Posts Information On The Website In Reliance On A Determination Made By A State Agency About The Confidentiality Of Information; To Provide That The Department May Not Charge A Fee To The Public To Access The Website; To Bring Forward Section 27-104-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1334.title: Package retailer's permits; increase maximum number a person may hold from 1 to 6.
1334.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Number Of Package Retailer's Permits That May Be Owned By A Person Or In Which A Person May Have A Controlling Interest From One To Six; To Amend Section 67-1-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1335.title: Income tax; authorize a deduction for certain retrofitting or upgrades to homes in Coastal Area of Mississippi.
1335.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Deduction For Certain Retrofitting Or Upgrades To Homes Located In The Coastal Area Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1336.title: Windstorm insurance; require cumulative deductible for named storms occurring in same calendar year.
1336.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-2-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That A Deductible Providing Coverage For Windstorm From A Named Storm Event Shall Be A Cumulative Deductible For Named Storms Occurring In The Same Calendar Year; And For Related Purposes.

1337.title: State Department of Education; impose moratorium on increase of salaries to certain employees of for a three-year period.
1337.description: An Act To Require The State Board Of Education And The State Department Of Education To Place A Moratorium On The Issuance Of Salary Increases To Certain Employees Of The Department For A Period Of Three Years; To Require The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review To Conduct A Study Of The Impact The Lifting Of The Moratorium Would Have On The Department; To Provide For The Repeal Of This Act On July 1, 2017; And For Related Purposes.

1338.title: Wildlife enclosures; prohibit establishment of contain native and nonnative cervids.
1338.description: An Act To Place A Moratorium On The Establishment And Operation Of Wildlife Enclosures For Cervids Or Exotic Animals Within The State After July 1, 2014; To Require The Board Of Animal Health To Revoke The Application For Permit Of Any Person Or Entity Desiring To Establish And Operate A Wildlife Enclosure; To Prescribe Penalties For Violations Of The Moratorium On Wildlife Enclosures; To Amend Section 49-7-58, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; To Amend Section 69-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of The Board Of Animal Health And State Veterinarian Relating To The Control Of Disease In Wild And Domesticated Animals; To Amend Sections 49-1-29, 49-4-41, 49-7-58.1 And 49-7-58.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Removing Certain Authority From The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks And The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks As It Relates To Those Entities' Control Of Disease In Animals And Transferring Such Authority To The Board Of Animal Health; To Bring Forward Section 49-8-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendments; To Repeal Section 49-7-58.3 And 49-7-58.4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Regulation Of The Hunting Of Nonnative Cervids In Commercial And Noncommercial Wildlife Enclosures That Prevent The Free Egress Of White-tail Deer; And For Related Purposes.

1339.title: Returning Veterans of Foreign Conflict Task Force; create.
1339.description: An Act To Create The Returning Veterans Of Foreign Conflict Task Force; To Provide For The Membership Of The Task Force; To Provide The Duties Of The Task Force; To Provide Staff To Assist The Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

1340.title: Adverse possession cases; require losing party to pay court costs and attorney's fees.
1340.description: An Act To Amend Section 15-1-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Party That Does Not Prevail In An Adverse Possession Action To Pay Court Costs And Attorney's Fees; And For Related Purposes.

1341.title: Nonnative plant species control; exempt forestry and silviculture activities from permit requirement for areas exceeding one acre.
1341.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-25-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Individuals Engaged In Forestry And Silviculture Activities From The Special Permit Requirement For Plantings In Excess Of One Acre For The Purpose Of Controlling The Cultivation Of Nonnative Plant Species For Fuel Production; And For Related Purposes.

1342.title: Motor vehicles; prohibit texting by operator of and make secondary offense until January 1, 2016.
1342.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Wireless Telephones Or Electronic Communication Devices To Engage In Wireless Interactive Communication By A Person Operating A Motor Vehicle; To Provide Exemptions From Compliance With The Requirements Of This Act; To Provide That From July 1, 2014, Through December 31, 2015, A Conviction Under This Act Must Occur As A Secondary Offense And Shall Not Be Entered On The Driving Record Of The Convicted Person; To Provide That From And After January 1, 2016, A Conviction Under This Act May Occur As A Primary Offense And Shall Be Entered On The Driving Record Of The Convicted Person; To Provide That A Law Enforcement Officer May Not Seize Or Examine The Wireless Telephone Or Electronic Communication Device Of A Person For The Purpose Of Determining A Violation Of Section 63-1-73; To Amend Section 63-1-216, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Shall Be Disqualified From Driving A Commercial Motor Vehicle For Certain Amounts Of Time For Violations Under Section 63-1-73; And For Related Purposes.

1343.title: Counties and municipalities; prohibit from hindering employers' need to perform background.
1343.description: An Act To Provide That No Local Government Shall Adopt Or Maintain In Effect Any Law, Ordinance, Or Rule That Creates Requirements, Regulations, Processes Or Prohibitions That In Any Way Interfere With An Employers' Ability To Become Fully Informed About The Background Of An Employee Or Potential Employee For The Purpose Of Creating Or Maintaining A Fair, Secure, Safe And Productive Workplace; And For Related Purposes.

1344.title: Milk Producers Transportation Cost Assistance Loan Forgiveness Act of 2014; enact.
1344.description: An Act To Create The "milk Producers Transportation Cost Assistance Loan Forgiveness Act Of 2014"; To Provide For The Forgiveness Of Certain Loans Issued Under The Program For Individuals Having Repaid Less Than The 50% Of The Original Loan Amount Received Under The Milk Producers Transportation Cost Assistance Loan Program, Which Repealed Under Operation Of Law On December 31, 2012; To Provide For A Refund To Certain Individuals Who Having Repaid 50% Or More Of The Original Loan Amount Received Under The Milk Producers Transportation Cost Assistance Loan Program; And For Related Purposes.

1345.title: Sales tax; revise type of information used by Commissioner of Revenue when assessing tax liability in certain cases.
1345.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Type Of Information That The Commissioner Of Revenue May Consider When Assessing A Taxpayer's Sales Tax Liability Where The Taxpayer Has Failed To Maintain Adequate Records Of Gross Income Or Gross Proceeds Of Sales Or Fails To Pay Or Underpays The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1346.title: Board of Tax Appeals; revise certain provisions regarding chancery court review on appeals from.
1346.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-77-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Standard Of Review Exercised By The Chancery Court Regarding Certain Matters When Considering Appeals From The Board Of Tax Appeals; And For Related Purposes.

1347.title: Sales tax; phase out on retail sales of certain truck-tractors/semitrailers.
1347.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-65-17 And 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The Sales Tax On Retail Sales Of Truck-tractors And Semitrailers Used In Interstate Commerce And Registered Under The International Registration Plan Or Any Similar Reciprocity Agreement Or Compact Relating To The Proportional Registration Of Commercial Vehicles; To Reduce The Sales Tax Rate On Retail Sales Of Equipment, And Parts And Labor Used To Maintain And/or Repair Such Equipment, To Contractors For Use Solely In The Construction, Reconstruction, Repair, Rehabilitation And/or Resurfacing Of Highways, Roads Or Bridges In This State; And For Related Purposes.

1348.title: Income tax; public and private hospitals may collect certain debts by a setoff against the debtor's refund.
1348.description: An Act To Authorize A Procedure To Allow Public And Private Hospitals To Collect Certain Debts Through A Setoff Against Income Tax Refunds Owed The Debtor; To Provide For Hearing And Appeals In Contested Cases; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Transfer The Income Tax Refunds Of A Debtor To Claimant Hospital For The Purpose Of Satisfying Such Debts; To Amend Section 27-7-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1349.title: Board of Tax Appeals; provide discretion in determining whether to assess interest/penalty in actions appealed to.
1349.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-77-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Appeals To The Board Of Tax Appeals The Board Shall Have Discretion In Determining Whether And To What Extent The Assessment Of Interest And Penalties Is Warranted Under The Facts Of A Case; And For Related Purposes.

1350.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of the Choctaw County Chargers.
1350.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Choctaw County Chargers; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1351.title: Income tax; repeal the provision that requires withholding of a portion of the gain realized on property sold by nonresidents.
1351.description: An Act To Repeal Section 27-7-308, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Buyer Of Real Property Owned By A Nonresident To Withhold A Portion Of The Amount Realized By The Seller On The Sale When The Sale Is Not Considered An Exchange Or Trade Of Property And Results In Gross Proceeds Greater Than $100,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

1352.title: Board of Tax Appeals; revise certain provisions regarding appeal of orders by.
1352.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-77-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Taxpayer Appealing An Order Of The Board Of Tax Appeals To Chancery Court Shall Not Be Required To Provide A Bond Unless Deemed Absolutely Necessary By The Chancery Court; To Provide That Any Bond Required By The Chancery Court Shall Be An Appearance Bond Or Performance Bond And That The Court Shall Not Require Any Surety Bond; To Provide That The Burden Of Proof In The Chancery Court Is Always On The Department Of Revenue; To Provide That If An Aggrieved Taxpayer Prevails On Such An Appeal, The Taxpayer Is Entitled To Attorney's Fees, Interest, And Any Other Remedy Deemed Proper By The Chancery Court And That Such Fees Shall Be Collected Against The Agency Or The Commissioner In His Individual And Personal Capacity; And For Related Purposes.

1353.title: Taxation; revise rate of interest assessed on underpayment or nonpayment of income, withholding, franchise and sales taxes.
1353.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-7-51, 27-7-53 And 27-7-327, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce Certain Interest Assessments That May Be Made By The Commissioner Of Revenue For Underpayment And Nonpayment Of Tax Under The Income Tax Law From 1% To 1-1/2% Per Month; To Amend Section 27-13-23 And 27-13-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce Certain Interest Assessments That May Be Made By The Commissioner Of Revenue For Underpayment And Nonpayment Of Tax Under The Franchise Tax Law From 1% To 1-1/2% Per Month; To Amend Section 27-65-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce Certain Interest Assessments That May Be Made By The Commissioner Of Revenue For Underpayment And Nonpayment Of Tax Under The Sales Tax Law From 1% To 1-1/2% Per Month; And For Related Purposes.

1354.title: Commercial motor vehicle registration; remove repeal and reverter on provisions relating to enforcement of unlawful operation of.
1354.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-60, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2014 Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Department Of Revenue To Deny Registration And Licensing Or Revoke Or Suspend Licensing Of Commercial Motor Vehicles Operated By Certain Persons, And That Authorizes The Removal Of License Plates From Commercial Motor Vehicles Of Persons Who Have Been Prohibited From Operating By A Federal Or State Agency Responsible For Motor Carrier Safety; To Amend Section 27-19-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2014, Reverter On The Provision Of Law That Makes It Unlawful To Willfully And Knowingly Make Any False Statement Or Representation On The Registration Application For A Commercial Motor Vehicle In Order To Circumvent The Federal Prohibition From Operating In Interstate Commerce Or The Laws Of The State Of Mississippi, Or To Attempt To Register A Commercial Motor Vehicle On Behalf Of Another Person In Order To Circumvent The Federal Prohibition From Operating In Interstate Commerce Or The Laws Of The State Of Mississippi; To Amend Section 27-19-90, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2014, Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Provides Criminal Penalties For Any Person Who Willfully And Knowingly Alters, Forges Or Counterfeits Any License Plate, Decal, Permit Or Other Document Required For A Commercial Motor Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

1355.title: Fuel tax; provide that interest charged for late payment or nonpayment shall be as provided in the International Fuel Tax Agreement.
1355.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-61-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Rate Of Interest That May Be Imposed For Late Payment Or Nonpayment Of The Fuel Tax Shall Be The Rate Of Interest Provided For In The International Fuel Tax Agreement; And For Related Purposes.

1356.title: Parole supervision fees; increase.
1356.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $55.00 To $60.00 The Monthly Fee That Must Be Paid By Offenders Who Are On Probation, Parole, Earned-release Supervision, Post-release Supervision, Earned Probation Or Any Other Offenders Who Are Under Field Supervision; And For Related Purposes.

1357.title: Tourism project sales tax incentive program; revise definition of term project and extend; create new hotel incentive.
1357.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-26-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Not Issue Certificates Designating Entities As Approved Participants In The Tourism Project Sales Tax Incentive Program After July 1, 2014, For Tourism Projects That Are Cultural Retail Attractions, Or July 1, 2016, For Other Tourism Projects; And For Related Purposes.

1358.title: Hotel and restaurant renovation projects sales tax incentives; authorize for certain projects.
1358.description: An Act To Create An Incentive For Persons, Corporations Or Other Entities To Repair And Renovate Hotels And Restaurants In This State; To Create The Hotel Renovation Projects Sales Tax Incentive Fund; To Create The Restaurant Renovation Projects Sales Tax Incentive Fund; To Authorize Certain Incentive Payments From Such Funds To Approved Participants That Incur Costs To Repair And Renovate Hotels And Restaurants In This State; To Provide That Incentive Payments Shall Cease On The Occurrence Of The Earlier Of The Date That An Aggregate Amount Of 20% Of The Approved Project Costs Incurred By An Approved Participant For A Project Has Been Paid To The Approved Participant Or 10 Years After The Date Of Commencement Of Incentive Payments To An Approved Participant For A Project; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Administer The Program; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That 25% Of The Sales Tax Revenue Collected From The Operation Of A Project Shall Be Deposited, After Certain Diversions, Into The Hotel Renovation Projects Sales Tax Incentive Fund Or The Restaurant Renovation Projects Sales Tax Incentive Fund, As The Case May Be; And For Related Purposes.

1359.title: County tax collectors and deputies; provide additional compensation for those holding certificates of educational recognition.
1359.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That County Tax Collectors And Deputy Tax Collectors Who Hold Valid Certificates Of Educational Recognition From The Education And Certification Board By Attaining Certification As A Collector Of Revenue I, Collector Of Revenue Ii Or Mississippi Collector Of Revenue Shall Receive Addition Annual Compensation; To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

1360.title: County tax assessors and collectors; bring forward section providing for salaries of.
1360.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Salaries Of County Tax Assessors And Tax Collectors, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1361.title: Pat Harrison Waterway District; use Department of Revenue tax rolls to determine counties' share of ad valorem funding.
1361.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-15-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Pat Harrison Waterway District To Use State Approved Tax Rolls Available On November 1 Of Each Year As A Basis For Determining The Proper Share That Each Member County Will Pay To The District In Ad Valorem Funding; To Require Each Member County To Remit Its Share Of Ad Valorem Taxes To The District By March 1 Of Each Year; And For Related Purposes.

1362.title: Beer and light wines; prohibit retailers from acting as wholesalers, distributors or manufacturers of.
1362.description: An Act To Codify New Section 67-3-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Retailers Of Beer And Light Wines Are Prohibited From Acting As Or Making Loans To Wholesalers, Distributors Or Manufacturers Of Light Wines And Beer; And For Related Purposes.

1364.title: Economic development tax incentives and programs; University Research Center to analyze incentives, MDA to report on programs.
1364.description: An Act To Create The Economic Development Programs Tax Incentives Evaluation Act Of 2014; To Require An Analysis Of Economic Development Programs And Tax Incentives To Be Prepared By The University Research Center In Consultation With The Director Of The Mississippi Development Authority And The Executive Director Of The Legislative Budget Office; To Provide A Schedule For The Analysis Of Economic Development Programs And Tax Incentives; To Provide For The Contents Of Such Analyses; To Require All Departments, Offices, Boards, And Agencies Of The State To Cooperate With The University Research Center And Provide To The University Research Center Any Records, Information, Data, And Data Analysis As May Be Necessary To Complete The Analyses Required By This Act; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To File An Annual Report Regarding Tax Credits, Loans And Grants Made, Approved Or Awarded To Its Clients As A Result Of Negotiations Involving An Economic Development Project; To Provide That Certain Information Shall Be Included In Such Report; To Amend Sections 57-13-47, 27-3-73, 27-7-83, 27-13-57, 27-65-81 And 27-103-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1365.title: License tags; Department of Revenue to establish system for marketing and sale of certain.
1365.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Revenue To Develop A System, Including The Use Of An Auction Or Similar Procedure, For The Marketing And Sale Of Certain Personalized And Distinctive License Tags; To Authorize The Department To Enter Into A Contract With A Vendor Or Other Entity For The Purpose Of Assisting In Developing And Operating Such A System; To Provide That The System Shall Be Used For The Marketing And Sale Of License Tags For The License Plate Or Tag Series Beginning On October 1, 2017; And For Related Purpose.

1366.title: Unfair Cigarette Sales Law; repeal.
1366.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 75-23-1 Through 75-23-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The "unfair Cigarette Sales Law," Establish Definitions, And Provide For The Enforcement Of The Article By The Department Of Revenue; To Amend Section 27-69-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1367.title: State Treasurer; allow to collect fees for management of transaction books.
1367.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Treasurer Shall Provide Continuing Support Of The Management Of Certain Books Related To State Funds; To Authorize The State Treasurer To Collect A Management And Transactional Fee; And For Related Purposes.

1368.title: Taxation; require the Department of Revenue to establish a tax amnesty program.
1368.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To To Require The Department Of Revenue To Develop A Tax Amnesty Program; To Provide That The Program Will Begin On September 30, 2014, And End On December 31, 2014, And Will Apply To All Taxes Required To Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Which Were Due And Payable For The Year 2009 And After; To Provide That Tax Amnesty Will Not Be Available To Taxpayers Subject To Tax-related Criminal Investigations Or Prosecutions, Or Where Taxes Have Been Previously Assessed By The Department Of Revenue Or To Estimated Income Tax Payments; To Bring Forward Sections 27-7-7, 27-7-51, 27-7-53, 27-7-327, 27-7-345, 27-9-27, 27-9-43, 27-13-23, 27-13-25, 27-65-33, 27-65-39, 27-69-41 And 27-71-331, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorize The Assessment Of Interest And Penalties For Unpaid Income Taxes, Corporation Franchise Taxes, Sales Taxes, Tobacco Taxes And Light Wine And Beer Taxes, For The Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1369.title: Board of Tax Appeals; expand actions that maybe appealed to.
1369.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-77-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Actions That May Be Appealed To The Board Of Tax Appeals; And For Related Purposes.

1370.title: Mississippi Motion Picture Incentive Act; include employee benefits not subject to state income tax in rebate calculation.
1370.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-89-3 And 57-89-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Costs Paid By A Motion Picture Production Company For Employee Benefits That Are Not Subject To State Income Tax In The Calculation Of Rebates Under The Mississippi Motion Picture Incentive Act; And For Related Purposes.

1371.title: Income tax; revise definition of term "economic development project" for purposes of certain tax credit.
1371.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-10-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Within The Definition Of The Term "economic Development Project" Under The Law Which Provides For The Issuance Of Bonds By The Mississippi Business Finance Corporation To Finance Economic Development Projects In Order To Induce The Location Or Expansion Of Certain Businesses Within This State, The Economic Development Project Of A Related Approved Company That Is Merged Into Or Consolidated With Another Approved Company Where The Approved Companies Are Engaged In A Vertically Integrated Manufacturing Or Warehouse Operation; And For Related Purposes.

1372.title: Income tax, job credit; authorize for entities that conduct certain warehousing activities.
1372.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Entities That Perform Certain Warehousing Activities Within The Business Enterprises That Are Eligible For The Job Tax Credit; To Provide That Credits Generated For Such Entities Shall Offset The Income Of The Entity Based On An Apportioned Ratio Of Payroll For Warehouse Employees Of The Entity To Total Mississippi Payroll Of The Entity That Includes The Payroll Of Retail Employees Of The Entity; And For Related Purposes.

1374.title: Open preferential primaries; establish.
1374.description: An Act To Abolish Partisan Primaries; To Provide The Time For Holding General And Preferential Elections; To Provide That When Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For An Office, Such Person's Name Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That A Preferential Election Shall Be Held Three Weeks Before The General Election And The Candidate Who Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast For Such Office Shall Have His Name And His Name Only Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That When No Candidate Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast In The Preferential Election For An Office, That The Two Candidates Who Receive The Highest Number Of Votes In The Preferential Election Shall Have Their Names Placed On The General Election Ballot As Candidates For Such Office; To Provide The Procedure To Follow In Case Of Ties; To Provide The Manner For Qualifying As A Candidate For Public Office; To Provide For The Printing Of Necessary Ballots; To Amend Sections 21-7-7, 21-8-7, 21-15-1, 23-15-21, 23-15-31, 23-15-129, 23-15-153, 23-15-173, 23-15-197, 23-15-313, 23-15-367, 23-15-375, 23-15-403, 23-15-411, 23-15-463, 23-15-465, 23-15-507, 23-15-511, 23-15-559, 23-15-561, 23-15-573, 23-15-593, 23-15-595, 23-15-601, 23-15-605, 23-15-673, 23-15-713, 23-15-755, 23-15-771, 23-15-801, 23-15-807, 23-15-811, 23-15-833, 23-15-859, 23-15-873, 23-15-881, 23-15-885, 23-15-891, 23-15-899, 23-15-911, 23-15-973, 23-15-1065, 23-15-1085 And 23-15-1087, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 23-15-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Preparation, Use And Revision Of Primary Election Pollbooks; To Repeal Section 23-15-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Dates Of Municipal Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of State, District And County Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-263, 23-15-265, 23-15-267, 23-15-291 Through 23-15-311, 23-15-317, 23-15-319, 23-15-331, 23-15-333 And 23-15-335, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Duties Of The State Executive Committee And County Executive Committees In Primary Elections, Provide For The Qualification Of Candidates For Party Primary Elections, And Provide For The Conduct Of Party Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-359, 23-15-361 And 23-15-363, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Contents Of General Election Ballots; To Repeal Sections 23-15-597 And 23-15-599, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Canvass Of Returns And Announcement Of Vote By The County Executive Committees In Primary Elections And Require The State Executive Committee To Transmit To The Secretary Of State A Tabulated Statement Of The Party Vote For Certain Offices; To Repeal Section 23-15-841, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Primary Elections For Nomination Of Candidates To Fill Vacancies In County And County District Offices; To Repeal Sections 23-15-921 Through 23-15-941, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Procedures For Contests Of Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1031, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of Primary Elections For Congressmen And United States Senators; To Repeal Section 23-15-1063, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Unregistered Political Parties From Conducting Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1083, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That Certain Congressional Primaries Be Held On The Same Day As The Presidential Preference Primary; And For Related Purposes.

1376.title: Mineral interests; revert to surface owner after certain period of time.
1376.description: An Act To Provide That Mineral Estates Separated From The Surface Estate Shall Revert To The Owner Of The Surface Estate After Twenty Years Of Nonproduction; To Define Nonproduction; And For Related Purposes.

1377.title: Income and franchise tax; allow credit for costs of purchasing and installing solar energy system or energy efficiency services.
1377.description: An Act To Authorize An Income And/or Franchise Tax Credit Equal To A Certain Amount Of The Cost Of Purchasing And Installing Solar Energy Systems And Energy Efficiency Services; To Provide The Manner In Which The Credit May Be Claimed; To Provide That If The Amount Of Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income And/or Franchise Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; And For Related Purposes.

1378.title: Real estate appraisers; revise certain provisions.
1378.description: An Act To Create Section 73-34-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Background Investigations Of Prospective Real Estate Appraiser Licensees; To Amend Section 73-34-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Classes Of Real Estate Appraiser Licenses; To Amend Section 73-34-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Prerequisites To Taking Examinations For Licensing; To Amend Section 73-34-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise License Renewal Requirements; To Amend Section 73-34-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Fees For Licensing; To Amend Section 73-34-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Requirements For Nonresident Applicants Or Licensure; And For Related Purposes.

1379.title: Labor unions; prohibit from mass picketing a residence or place of business.
1379.description: An Act To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful For Any Union, Labor Union Or Agency Thereof To Singly Or In Concert With Others, To Engage In Mass Picketing Or Mass Demonstrations In Such A Manner As To Obstruct Or Unreasonably Interfere With Free Ingress Or Egress Of Any Person To And From Any Place Of Business Or A Private Residence; It Shall Be Unlawful For Any Union, Labor Union Or Agency Thereof To Obstruct Or Unreasonably Interfere With Free Ingress Or Egress Of Any Person To And From Any Place Of Business Or Private Residence; To Authorize Any Business Or Person Subjected To Such Unlawful Act To Seek Injunctive Relief Without The Showing Of Irreparable Harm; And For Related Purposes.

1380.title: Homeowners' associations; establish uniform law for the formation and administration of.
1380.description: An Act To Create State Uniform Law On The Formation And Legal Administration Of Homeowners' Associations; To Define Terms Used In The Provisions Of This Act; To Provide That Membership Of A Homeowners' Association Shall Consist Only Of Owners Of Real Property In The Jurisdiction Of The Association; To Provide For The Organization And Structure Of An Association; To Provide For The Termination Of Certain Contracts Entered Into By The Association's Board Of Directors; To Prescribe The Powers And Duties Of The Association And Its Board Of Directors; To Provide The Manner By Which Members Of The Board May Be Removed; To Provide A Procedure To Allow The Board Of Directors Of An Association To Amend The Governing Documents To Remove Discriminatory Provisions Contained Therein; To Allow The Judiciary To Enforce A Provision Of The Governing Documents Deemed By The Court To Be Unconscionable; To Prescribe The Information To Be Contained In The Association Bylaws; To Prohibit The Governing Documents From Prohibiting The Display Of The United States Flag; To Prohibit Unreasonable Restrictions On The Installation Or Use Of Energy Efficiency Measures; To Establish The Procedure To Be Followed In Conducting Meetings Of The Board And What Constitutes A Quorum; To Provide Disclosure Of Financial And Certain Other Information Of The Association's Status To Homeowners Within The Association; To Provide A Remedy In Law Or Equity For Violations Of This Act; To Provide For The Establishment Of Reserve Accounts With Financial Institutions To Fund Major Maintenance, Repair And Replacement Of Common Elements; To Require The Preparation Of A Reserve Study At Least Every Three Years By A Reserve Study Professional; To Prescribe The Information To Be Contained In The Reserve Study; To Authorize The Conditioned Withdrawal Of Funds From The Reserve Account For Unforeseen Or Unbudgeted Expenditures; To Place A Limitation On The Amount Of Fines Imposed Upon A Homeowner; To Exempt The Association Or Homeowner From Liability For The Acts Or Omissions Of The Developer In Connection With Any Part Of The Common Areas; And For Related Purposes.

1381.title: Community work centers; require hearing before Department of Corrections may close.
1381.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commissioner Of The Department Of Corrections To Provide Certain Notice To The House And Senate Corrections Committees Before Closing Any Community Work Center; To Require The Commissioner To Appear Before Such Committees To Provide Information To Justify The Proposed Closing Of Any Community Work Center; And For Related Purposes.

1382.title: Sheriffs and constables; revise fees charged for service of process.
1382.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-7-19 And 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees Which May Be Charged By Sheriffs And Constables For Service Of Process; And For Related Purposes.

1383.title: Appraisal Management Recovery Fund; create.
1383.description: An Act To Create Section 73-34-133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Appraisal Management Company Recovery Fund; To Create Section 73-34-135, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Administration Of The Fund By The Mississippi Real Estate Appraiser Licensing And Certification Board; To Amend Section 73-34-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 73-34-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Requirements Of Owners And Controlling Persons Of Appraisal Management Companies; And For Related Purposes.

1384.title: Guns; prohibit confiscation during natural disasters.
1384.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Weapons Shall Not Be Confiscated During Natural Disasters; And For Related Purposes.

1385.title: State Parole Board; authorize to place offenders under house arrest & to use conditional medical release.
1385.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Parole Board To Utilize The Intensive Supervision Program Also Known As "house Arrest Program"; To Authorize The Board To Place Certain Offenders On Conditional Medical Release; To Authorize The Board To Conditionally Release Certain Offenders Who Have Reached Age 65 And Have Served At Least 15 Years Of His Or Her Sentence; To Revise Certain Information On The Central Registry That Must Be Kept By The Board; And For Related Purposes.

1386.title: Parental rights; establish fundamental right of parents to direct the upbringing, education and care of their children.
1386.description: An Act To Establish The Fundamental Right Of Parents To Direct The Upbringing, Education And Care Of Their Children; And For Related Purposes.

1387.title: Law enforcement officers; sidearm issued to officer killed in line of duty may be purchased by family.
1387.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-131, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Next Of Kin To Purchase The Sidearm Of A Law Enforcement Officer Killed In The Line Of Duty If There Is No Spouse; And For Related Purposes.

1388.title: Terrorism; provide civil cause of action and forfeiture of property.
1388.description: An Act To Provide For Forfeiture Of And Claims Against Property Used To Further An Act Of Terrorism; To Provide For The Allocation Of The Proceeds; To Provide A Civil Cause Of Action By Persons Injured By An Act Of Terrorism; And For Related Purposes.

1389.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Funds; expand to include emergency management personnel & provide additional funding.
1389.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Coroners And Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Coroners And Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Combine The Death Benefits Trust Fund And The Disability Benefits Trust Fund Into A Single Fund; To Amend Section 63-16-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Funding For The Death And Disability Benefits Trust Fund; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1391.title: Tax increment financing; clarify what constitutes cost of redevelopment project under.
1391.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-45-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Cost Of A Redevelopment Project Under The Tax Increment Financing Act Includes The Cost Associated With The Operation And Maintenance Of Certain Property Rights To Real Property That May Have Been Purchased By A Municipality For The Project, As May Be Authorized In The Applicable Redevelopment Plan; To Amend Sections 21-45-11 And 21-45-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1392.title: Anti-bulling Law; create.
1392.description: An Act To Prohibit Bullying In Schools; To Require School Districts To Adopt Policies To Carry Out The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1394.title: Commercial Real Estate Broker Lien Act; create.
1394.description: An Act To Create The Commercial Real Estate Broker Lien Act; To Define Terms Used In The Act; To Provide That A Real Estate Broker Shall Have A Lien Upon Commercial Real Estate In The Amount Due Under A Written Agreement For Broker Services If Certain Conditions Are Met; To Provide The Content For A Lien Notice; To Provide For The Enforcement Of The Lien; To Prescribe Contents Of The Complaint Filed To Enforce A Lien; To Provide That The Cost Of Any Proceeding Brought To Enforce A Lien Shall Be Paid By The Nonprevailing Party; To Provide For The Discharge Of The Lien; And For Related Purposes.

1395.title: Gill nets; revise regulation of in the marine waters of Mississippi.
1395.description: An Act To Create New Section 49-15-82, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful For A Person To Possess Or Use A Gill Net, Trammel Net, Entanglement Net, Or Like Contrivances In The Marine Waters Of The State Of Mississippi With Certain Exceptions; To Bring Forward Sections 49-7-9.1, 49-7-81, 49-15-15, 49-15-78, 49-15-80, 49-15-94, 49-15-100, 49-15-100.1 And 49-15-100.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Regulate The Use Of Gill Nets; And For Related Purposes.

1396.title: Mississippi Windstorm Underwriting Association; revise certain laws regarding the nonadmitted policy fee.
1396.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-34-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Windstorm Underwriting Association May Use The Monies From The Nonadmitted Policy Fees For Certain Programs Targeted To Reduce The Number Of Policies Within The Association; To Extend The Repealer On The Section Of Law That Provides For The Nonadmitted Policy Fee; To Exempt Certain Types Of Policies From The Nonadmitted Policy Fee; To Amend Section 83-34-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

1397.title: Emergency aid to local Governments Loan and Grant Program; transfer administration of to MEMA.
1397.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-107-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer The Administration Of The Emergency Aid To Local Governments Loan And Grant Program From The Department Of Finance And Administration To The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency; To Revise The Eligibility Requirements For Loans And Grants Issued Under The Program; To Include The Use Of Loan Funds To Match Nonfederal Match Funds For Federal Emergency Management Agency Grants As A Permissible Use Of Funds Upon A Demonstration Of Need; To Amend Sections 33-15-3, 33-15-7 And 31-17-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1398.title: Salary increases for legislators; effective for term of office after term in which salary increase is given.
