1398.description: An Act To Amend Sections 5-1-41, 5-1-43, 5-1-45, And 5-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Increase Or Decrease In The Salaries And Compensation Authorized By Law For Representatives, Senators, Lieutenant Governor, President Pro Tempore And Speaker Pro Tempore Shall Be Effective The First Day Of The Next Legislative Term Immediately Following The Legislative Term In Which The Legislation Authorizing Such Increase Is Passed Into Law; And For Related Purposes.

1399.title: Abortion; prohibit performing at or after 20 weeks.
1399.description: An Act To Create New Sections 41-41-131 Through 41-41-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Performing Or Inducing Of An Abortion At Or After 20 Weeks Gestational Age; To Prohibit The Performing Or Inducing Of An Abortion Until A Physician Makes A Determination Of The Probable Gestational Age Of The Unborn Child; To Provide For Certain Exceptions; To Provide For The Protection Of Privacy In Court Proceedings Of The Identity Of The Woman On Whom An Abortion Has Been Performed Or Induced; To Amend Section 73-25-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Physician Who Performs Or Induces An Abortion In Violation Of This Act Is Subject To Disciplinary Action; And For Related Purposes.

1400.title: Gaming; disallow recovery of losses from gambling if at certain location.
1400.description: An Act To Amend Section 87-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Law Allowing A Person To Sue For The Recovery Of Money Or Property Lost As A Result Of Certain Illegal Gambling Shall Not Apply To Betting, Gaming Or Wagering On The Site Of An Abandoned Military Facility Owned By The State Which Is Located In One Of The Three Most Southern Counties In The State And Operated Or Managed By A State Port Authority; And For Related Purposes.

1401.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Fund; expand coverage to include emergency management personnel.
1401.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Combine The Death Benefits Trust Fund And The Disability Benefits Trust Fund Into A Single Fund; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1403.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of firearms, ammunition and hunting supplies during Second Amendment Weekend holiday.
1403.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Firearms, Ammunition And Hunting Supplies When Sold During The Annual Mississippi Second Amendment Weekend Holiday Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The First Friday In September And Ending At 12:00 Midnight On The Following Sunday; And For Related Purposes.

1404.title: Driver's licenses; authorize designation of certain disabilities on.
1404.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-35 And 45-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Designation Of Certain Disabilities On Driver's Licenses And Identification Cards Under Certain Circumstances; To Require Training For Law Enforcement Officers In Recognizing Certain Mental Or Medical Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

1406.title: Gale Stauffer, Jr. and Joseph Maher Law Enforcement Act of 2014; create.
1406.description: An Act To Create The "gale Stauffer, Jr. And Joseph Maher Law Enforcement Act Of 2014"; To Authorize Municipalities And Counties To Adopt Policies Under Which They Are Authorized To Continue To Pay All Or A Portion Of The Regular Compensation And Related Benefits Of Any Law Enforcement Officer, Firefighter Or Other Employee That Protects The Public Interest Of The Municipality Or County Who Is Injured In The Line Of Duty, During The Time That The Injured Employee Is Physically Unable To Perform The Duties Of His Or Her Employment; And For Related Purposes.

1407.title: Emergency communications districts; authorize municipalities to establish.
1407.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-5-305 And 19-5-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Municipality To Establish An Emergency Communications District; To Amend Section 19-5-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Municipality To Levy An Emergency Telephone Service Charge; To Amend Section 19-5-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Two Or More Municipalities To Create A Single Emergency Communications District; To Amend Sections 65-7-309, 65-7-311, And 65-7-143, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1408.title: Sheriff's fees; clarify use of and revise compensation.
1408.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Use Of Certain Fees Charged By Sheriffs; To Amend Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Compensation Of County Sheriffs; To Amend Section 45-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

1409.title: Sheriffs; increase salaries of.
1409.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Sheriffs; And For Related Purposes.

1410.title: Foreign executor or administrator; revise authority of financial institutions to turn over property or funds of a decedent to.
1410.description: An Act To Amend Section 91-7-259, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Person Or Financial Institution May Turn Over Personal Property Or Funds Of A Decedent In Its Possession To An Executor Or Administrator Who Has Qualified In Another State And May Rely Upon A Certified Copy Of The Record Of The Appointment And Qualification Of The Executor Or Administrator According To The Law Of The State Where He Is Qualified; And For Related Purposes.

1411.title: Teacher Education Alternate Route Certification Scholars Program; establish.
1411.description: An Act To Create New Section 37-106-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Teacher Education Alternate Route Certification Scholars Program Administered By The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Limit The Annual Amount Of The Scholarship A Qualifying Recipient May Receive To $5,000.00, To Establish The Criteria To Determine A Scholar Eligibility For Receipt Of A Scholarship Under The Program; To Prescribe The Responsibilities Owed To The State Upon Completion Of The Program; To Allow Certain Program Participates To Receive An Annual Supplement Of $6,000.00 Up To A Maximum Of Five Years For Teaching A School Rated As "d" Or "f"; To Prescribe The Manner By Which Scholarship Recipients Are Required To Repay The Amounts Provided Under The Program In The Event Of Failure To Perform Certain Obligations; To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Promulgate Rules Necessary To Administer The Program; And For Related Purposes.

1412.title: Public Safety Verification & Enforcement Act; revise certain provisions regarding.
1412.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 63-16-1 Through 63-16-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The Public Safety Verification And Enforcement Act; To Amend Reenacted Section 63-16-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Date Required For The Public Safety Verification System To Be Installed And Operational; To Amend Reenacted Section 63-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add The Mississippi Insurance Department To The List Of State Agencies With Regulatory And Enforcement Powers Regarding The Public Safety Verification Act; To Amend Reenacted Section 63-16-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That An Appeal Under The Act Shall Be Made To The County Or Circuit Court Where The Violation Occurred; To Amend Section 63-16-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Public Safety Verification Act; To Amend Section 63-15-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Correction; And For Related Purposes.

1413.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Funds; expand to include coroners, emergency management personnel and provide funding.
1413.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Coroners And Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Coroners And Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 63-16-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Funding For The Death Benefits Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1414.title: Adequate education program; revise method of calculating allocations to districts and adjustment for at-risk students.
1414.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Method By Which The State Department Of Education Calculates Allocations To School Districts Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program And To Revise The Adjustment To The Base Student Cost For At-risk Students; To Amend Section 37-151-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Education To Adopt Additional Rules And Regulations Relating To At-risk Funding And Establishing An Auditable And Weighted Formula For Determining At-risk Funding Allocations; And For Related Purposes.

1415.title: State teachers salary scale; clarify which licensed school employees are to be paid according to.
1415.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Which Full-time Licensed Public School Employees Are Entitled To Be Paid A Salary In Accordance With The State Teacher Salary Scale; And For Related Purposes.

1416.title: Adequate education program funds; require certain percent to be allocated to direct classroom instruction.
1416.description: An Act To Require The State Department Of Education To Annually Determine A Uniform Percentage Of Adequate Education Program Funds Which Must Be Allocated To Direct Classroom Instruction In All School Districts; To Require The Department To Calculate The Uniform Percentage Using Data From The Five Highest Performing School Districts Under The State Assessment Program; To Define The Term "direct Classroom Instruction"; And For Related Purposes.

1417.title: Elected officials, require to file report with Secretary of State on certain gifts received by.
1417.description: An Act To Require All Elected Officials To File An Annual Report On Certain Gifts With The Secretary Of State; To Exclude Gifts From Certain Relatives; To Require The Secretary Of State To Prepare And Make Available To Elected Officials A Form For The Gift Report; And For Related Purposes.

1418.title: Mississippi Electronic Protection Licensing Act; revise various provisions.
1418.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-69-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Rename The Chapter The "mississippi Electronic Protection Licensing Act"; To Amend Section 73-69-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Purpose Of The Chapter; To Amend Section 73-69-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of Terms Used In The Chapter; To Amend Section 73-69-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Administration And Enforcement Of The Chapter; To Amend Section 73-69-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Entity Desiring To Engage In Alarm Contracting Shall Hold A Class A Alarm Contracting Business License; To Amend Section 73-69-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications For Each Class Of License; To Amend Section 73-69-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Class T License; To Amend Section 73-69-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions From Licensure Requirement; To Amend Section 73-69-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Application And Licensing Fees; To Amend Section 73-69-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offenses Of The Chapter; To Amend Section 73-69-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Violations Of The Chapter; To Amend Section 73-69-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Previous Sections; To Amend Section 73-69-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Civil Penalty For Violations Of The Chapter Are Per Occurrence; To Create New Section 73-69-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appellate Review Of Actions By The State Fire Marshal; To Create New Section 73-69-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Inquisitorial And Subpoena Power Of The State Fire Marshal; And For Related Purposes.

1419.title: Vaccinations; allow exemption from requirement for school attendance with parental affidavit as being contrary to their beliefs.
1419.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-23-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Child Will Be Exempt From The Requirement To Have Any Specific Vaccination In Order To Attend A School If The Child's Parent Or Guardian Submits To The School A Letter Or Affidavit That Documents Which Required Vaccinations Have Been Given, And Which Vaccinations Have Not Been Given On The Basis That They Are Contrary To His Or Her Beliefs; To Provide That Beginning With The 2013-2014 School Year, A Form Prescribed By The State Department Of Health Shall Accompany The Letter Or Affidavit Submitted By The Parent Or Guardian, Which Includes Both A Signed Attestation From A Health Care Practitioner That The Health Care Practitioner Provided The Parent Or Guardian With Information Regarding The Benefits And Risks Of The Vaccinations And The Health Risks To The Child And To The Community Of Those Diseases Specified For Vaccination, And A Written Statement Signed By The Parent Or Guardian That Indicates That The Signer Has Received The Information Provided By The Health Care Practitioner; And For Related Purposes.

1420.title: Residential Electronic Protection License; application; require applicant to submit fingerprints with.
1420.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-69-7 And 73-69-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Applicant For A Residential Electronic Protection License To Provide Fingerprints; To Authorize The Collection Of Fees For Verification Of Such Fingerprints; And For Related Purposes.

1421.title: Elected and appointed officials; require drug test and negative result before taking office.
1421.description: An Act To Require Each Person Elected Or Appointed To A State Or Local Public Office To Submit To A Drug Test Before The Individual Assumes Office; To Define Certain Terms; To Require The Individual To File Documentation Of Negative Test Results With The State Agency Or Local Governing Authority Connected To The Public Office For Which The Person Has Been Selected; To Prohibit Any Person Receiving A Positive Drug Test Result From Assuming Office Unless The Person Submits Documentation Of A Negative Result On A Confirmation Test; And For Related Purposes.

1423.title: Gaming; repeal certain prohibitions against the advertising of a lottery.
1423.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 97-33-33, 97-33-35 And 97-33-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To Certain Prohibitions Against The Advertising Of A Lottery; And For Related Purposes.

1424.title: Crimes; prohibit installing or selling counterfeit airbags.
1424.description: An Act To Prohibit Manufacturing, Importing, Installing, Reinstalling, Selling Or Offering For Sale A Nonfunctional Or Counterfeit Airbag; To Provide Penalties For Violations; To Amend Section 75-24-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Violation Of This Act Is An Unfair Or Deceptive Trade Practice; And For Related Purposes.

1425.title: Law Enforcement Officers and Fire Fighters Death Benefits Fund; increase benefit and funding for.
1425.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Death Benefit Payable From The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Criminal Assessment For The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1426.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Fund; expand coverage to include emergency management personnel & increase benefit.
1426.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Increase The Amount Of The Death Benefit Payable From The Trust Fund; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

1427.title: Private carrier of property; provide that may haul dirt, sand, gravel, limestone and any other surface minerals intrastate.
1427.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Private Carrier Of Property May Haul Dirt, Sand, Gravel, Limestone And Any Other Surface Mineral If Hauled Within The State Of Mississippi; To Limit The Privilege To Two Vehicles Per Person; And For Related Purposes.

1428.title: Elections; define residence of candidates.
1428.description: An Act To Provide That Any Person Desiring To Be A Candidate For An Office Shall Be A Resident Of The State, State District, County, County District, Municipality, Or Municipal Ward Which Such Person Seeks To Serve By 5:00 P.m. On The Qualifying Deadline Day Provided By Statute For Such Office; To Define How The Appropriate Person, Executive Committee Or Commission Shall Determine The Residence Of Any Person Seeking To Be A Candidate; To Amend Sections 23-15-299, 23-15-309, 23-15-359 And 23-15-361, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Sections; To Bring Forward Section 23-15-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Election Of Commissioners Of Election; And For Related Purposes.

1429.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Funds; expand coverage to include emergency management personnel.
1429.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 63-16-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Funding For The Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1430.title: Law enforcement officers and firefighters; increase amount of death benefits payable for.
1430.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $65,000.00 To $100,000.00 The Death Benefit Payable From The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund For Law Enforcement Officers And Firefighters Killed In The Line Of Duty; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From Fifty Cents To One Dollar The Criminal Assessment For The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund, Imposed On Traffic Violations, Implied Consent Law Violations, Game And Fish Law Violations, And Other Misdemeanor And Felony Violations; And For Related Purposes.

1431.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Fund; expand coverage to include emergency mgt. personnel and increase benefits.
1431.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Increase The Amount Of The Death Benefit Payable From The Trust Fund; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 63-16-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Funding For The Death Benefits Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1433.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Funds; expand coverage to include emergency management personnel & increase benefit.
1433.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Increase The Amount Of The Death Benefit Payable From The Trust Fund; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Combine The Death Benefits Trust Fund And The Disability Benefits Trust Fund Into A Single Fund; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1434.title: Historic property income tax credit; authorize the transfer, sale or assignment of the credit.
1434.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes An Income Tax Credit For Costs And Expenses Incurred For The Rehabilitation Of Certain Historic Structures To Authorize The Transfer, Sale Or Assignment Of Such Income Tax Credits; To Provide That The Credit Shall Apply To Taxpayers Who Have Been Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit Before December 31, 2029, Or Who, Before December 31, 2029, Have Received A Determination In Writing From The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History, That The Rehabilitation Is Consistent With The Historic Character Of The Property And That The Property Meets The United States Secretary Of The Interior's Standards For Rehabilitation And Who Are Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit On Or After December 31, 2029; And For Related Purposes.

1435.title: Historic property income tax credit; extend time within which taxpayers may be eligible to receive.
1435.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes An Income Tax Credit For Costs And Expenses Incurred For The Rehabilitation Of Certain Historic Structures To Provide That The Credit Shall Apply To Taxpayers Who Have Been Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit Before December 31, 2029, Or Who, Before December 31, 2029, Have Received A Determination In Writing From The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History, That The Rehabilitation Is Consistent With The Historic Character Of The Property And That The Property Meets The United States Secretary Of The Interior's Standards For Rehabilitation And Who Are Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit On Or After December 31, 2029; And For Related Purposes.

1436.title: Conservator; allow appointment for a single transaction.
1436.description: An Act To Authorize The Appointment Of A Guardian Or Conservator For A Single Transaction; To Amend Sections 93-13-38 And 93-13-259, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1437.title: Public contracts for energy efficiency services; authorize entities to enter into energy performance & shared savings contracts.
1437.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Public Entities To Enter Into Energy Performance Contracts And Shared Savings Contracts For Energy Efficiency Equipment And Services Relation To The Installation, Operation And Maintenance Of Equipment; To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "energy Services" Or "energy Efficient Services" To Include Alternative Fuel Motor Vehicles; To Revise The Term Of Lease-purchase Agreements For Energy Efficiency Services Or Equipment As Well As The Terms Of Shared Savings, Energy Services Contract And Energy Performance Contracts; To Amend Sections 31-7-73, 37-7-301, 37-29-67 And 37-101-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

1438.title: Memorial highways; delete requirement of local resolution for Legislature to name.
1438.description: An Act To Repeal Section 65-3-38.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires A 10-year Period After Leaving Office Before Naming A Highway, Road, Street Or Bridge After An Elected Official And Requires A Resolution Adopted By The Local Governing Body Before The Legislature May Enact Legislation Naming Any Highway, Road, Street Or Bridge On The Designated State Highway System After Any Person; And For Related Purposes.

1439.title: Appropriation; Additional for Various State Agencies for Fiscal Year 2014.
1439.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of Capital Expense Funds And Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Years 2014 And 2015; The Wireless Communications Commission For Fiscal Years 2014 And 2015; The Office Of The Attorney General For Certain Legal Expenses, Judgments, And Settlements For Fiscal Year 2014; The Department Of Revenue For Fiscal Year 2014; The Department Of Corrections For Fiscal Years 2014 And 2015; The Forestry Commission For Fiscal Year 2014; The Office Of The Governor-division Of Medicaid For Fiscal Year 2014; The State Supreme Court Administrative Office Of Courts For Fiscal Years 2014 And 2015; The Charter School Authorizer Board Of The Administrative Offices Of Ihl For Fiscal Years 2014 And 2015; The Department Of Mental Health For Fiscal Year 2014; The Department Of Insurance For The Rural Fire Truck Acquisition Assistance Program And/or The Supplemental Rural Fire Truck Fund For Fiscal Years 2014 And 2015; And For Related Purposes.

1440.title: Monroe County; extend repealer on authority to contribute to chamber of commerce and revise contribution amount.
1440.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 916, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 908, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Monroe County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds Annually To The Monroe County Chamber Of Commerce; To Revise The Amount The Board Of Supervisors May Contribute Annually To The Chamber Of Commerce; And For Related Purposes.

1441.title: City of Brookhaven; authorize tourism and economic tax upon hotels, motels and bed and breakfast inns.
1441.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Brookhaven, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Bed And Breakfast Inns, Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals; To Provide That The Revenue From The Tax Shall Be Expended By The City Of Brookhaven For The Purpose Of Promoting Tourism And Economic Development Within The City; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City Of Brookhaven; And For Related Purposes.

1442.title: Tallahatchie County Correctional Authority; authorize to receive per diem compensation for attending meetings of.
1442.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 904, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Amended By Chapter 1023, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Chapter 901, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Authorize Board Members Of The Tallahatchie County Correctional Authority To Receive Per Diem, At The Discretion Of The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, For Attendance Of Meetings Of The Authority; And For Related Purposes.

1443.title: Town of Sardis; extend repealer on authority to impose tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
1443.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 945, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 917, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend Until July 1, 2017, The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Sardis, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And To Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Enhance Tourism, Industrial And Economic Development And For The Provision Of Parks And Recreation Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1444.title: City of McComb; extend repealer on hotel/motel tourism tax.

1445.title: Coahoma County; revise certain provisions relating to the county reserve and trust fund.
1445.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Coahoma County Reserve And Trust Fund To Delegate Certain Authority To Investment Advisors; To Provide That The Earnings Component Shall Be Composed Of A Percentage Of The Income Earned On The Corpus Component Of The Fund Instead Of A Percentage Of The Annual Interest Earned On The Corpus Component Of Such Fund; To Authorize The Trustees To Expend From The Corpus Component If The Earnings Component Is Insufficient To Pay For Certain Management Of The Trust Fund; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors, Rather Than The Clerk Of The Board Of Supervisors, To Direct The Transfer Of The Earnings Component From The Fund To The General Fund Of The County; And For Related Purposes.

1446.title: City of Indianola; extend repealer on Indianola Tourism Commission.
1446.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 931, Local And Private Laws Of 2003, As Amended By Chapter 959, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Chapter 921, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repeal Date To July 1, 2017, On The Law That Creates The Indianola Tourism Commission, Provides For The Composition Of The Commission, Prescribes The Powers And Duties Of The Commission And Authorizes The Governing Authorities To Levy A Tax To Fund The Commission; To Provide For An Indirect Referendum On The Continuation Of The Levying Of Such Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1501.description: An Act Making A Reappropriation To The Department Of Finance And Administration To Reauthorize The Expenditure Of Special Funds Previously Appropriated For Construction And/or Repair And Renovation Projects At Various State Agencies And Institutions, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1502.title: Town of Falkner; authorize to acquire Blackjack Development Association, Inc. Water System.
1502.description: An Act To Authorize The Town Of Falkner, Mississippi, To Acquire And Assume The Operation And Maintenance Of The Blackjack Development Association, Inc., Water System And To Assume All The Liabilities, Obligations, Assets, Duties And Responsibilities Of Such Association; To Authorize The Town Of Falkner To Operate Its Water Distribution System For A Distance Of More Than Five Miles From The Corporate Limits Of The Town Of Falkner In Order To Operate The Water System Within The Area Presently Served By The Blackjack Development Association; And For Related Purposes

1503.title: City of Senatobia; authorize tax levy on hotels, motels and restaurants.
1503.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Senatobia, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1504.title: City of Pascagoula; extend date of repeal on city's hotel and motel tax.
1504.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1005, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 923, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 915, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repeal Date From July 1, 2014, To July 1, 2017, On The Provision Of Law Authorizing The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel, Motel And Bed-and-breakfast Room Rentals In The City; And For Related Purposes.

1505.title: Jackson County and the City of Pascagoula; extend repealer on LaPointe-Krebs Foundation, Inc.
1505.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 904, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repealer Until July 1, 2017, On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Join With The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Create The Lapointe-krebs Foundation, Inc., For The Preservation, Maintenance, Upkeep And Operation Of The Lapointe-krebs House; And For Related Purposes.

1506.title: City of Brookhaven; authorize imposition of tax on motels, hotels and bed-and-breakfast establishments.
1506.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Brookhaven, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals From Hotels, Motels And Bed-and-breakfast Establishments Within The City; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1507.title: Lowndes County; make various revisions to its reserve and trust fund.
1507.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 910, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Include Capital Gains Within The Definition Of "income" For Purposes Of The Lowndes County Reserve And Trust Fund; To Make Clear That The Board Of Supervisors Of Lowndes County Is Not Required To Appoint An Advisory Committee For The Trust Fund; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of The Lowndes County Reserve And Trust Fund Shall Meet At Least Once Per Year; To Make Clear That The Meetings Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Trust Fund Are Governed By The Open Meetings Law; To Make It Clear That The Lowndes County Reserve And Trust Fund Is A Political Subdivision For Purposes Of The Tort Claims Law; To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Trust Fund To Delegate Investment Authority To Investment Advisors; To Provide That Every Fiscal Year After The Fund Is Established The Income Component Shall Be Considered An Amount Equal To 3% Of The Amount Of The Full Fund Balance Calculated At The End Of Each Fiscal Year, Whether Or Not The Corpus Component Has Generated Any Income In That Fiscal Year And To Provide That All Remaining Portions Of The Annual Income Earned From The Investment Of The Fund Shall Remain In The Fund As A Part Of The Corpus Component; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees May Expend From The Corpus Component Amounts Required To Pay The Amounts Required In Connection With The Management By The Trustees Of The Fund If The Income Component Is Insufficient To Pay The Amounts Required In Connection With The Management By The Trustees Of The Fund; To Revise The Amount Of The Trust Fund That May Be Transferred To The County For Special Projects; To Provide That There Shall Be No Distribution Of The Income Component If The Full Fund Balance Of The Trust Fund Falls Below An Amount Equal To The Initial Deposit To The Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1508.title: Appropriation; IHL - Alcorn State University - infrastructure upgrades.
1508.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Alcorn State University For Water, Sewer And Electrical Infrastructure Upgrades, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1509.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Alcorn State University For General Repair And Renovations To Certain Facilities, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1510.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Alcorn State University For Installation Of Safety And Security Systems Improvements, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1511.title: Appropriation; IHL - Alcorn State University - bring campus and facilities into compliance with ADA.
1511.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Alcorn State University For Purposes Of Making Modifications To Facilities And Exterior And Interior Renovations To Comply With The Americans With Disabilities Act, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1512.title: Appropriation; IHL-Alcorn State University-completion of construction of the Rudolph E. Waters Academic Technology Building.
1512.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Alcorn State University For Completion Of The Construction Of The Rudolph E. Waters Academic Technology Building, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1513.title: Appropriation; IHL-Alcorn State University-renovation and repair of aquaculture facility.
1513.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Renovation And Repair Of The Aquaculture Facility Located On The Lorman Campus Of Alcorn State University, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1514.title: Appropriation; Alcorn State University-establish of meat processing facility at DeKalb, MS.
1514.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Alcorn State University For The Establishment Of A Meat Processing Facility To Be Located At Or Near Dekalb, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1515.title: Appropriation; IHL - Alcorn State University - Agricultural Programs.
1515.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Alcorn State University Agricultural Programs For Fiscal Year 2015.

1516.title: Appropriation; DPS for 60 person Highway Patrol trooper class.
1516.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Public Safety, Division Of Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol, For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of A Sixty-member Highway Patrol Trooper Training Class, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1517.title: Appropriations; Health Dept. for MS Qualified Health Ctr. & Rural Health Clinic Capacity Bldg. Grant Program.
1517.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For The Mississippi Qualified Health Center And Rural Health Clinic Capacity Building Grant Program For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1518.title: Appropriation; Attorney General for funding the Statewide Law Enforcement Strike Team Division.
1518.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Office Of The Attorney General For The Purpose Of Funding The Statewide Law Enforcement Strike Team Division Created By House Bill No. 749, 2014 Regular Session, For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1519.title: Appropriation; Department of Wildlife for conservation officer cadet training class.
1519.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of A Twenty-five-member Conservation Officer Cadet Training Class, For Fiscal Year 2015.

1521.title: Appropriation; community colleges support at one-half mid-level funding commitment.
1521.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Aid And Support Of The Public Community And Junior Colleges Of The State Of Mississippi For Fiscal Year 2015, Reaching One-half Of The Commitment To Mid-level Funding In Accordance With Senate Bill No. 2364 Which Passed Unanimously During The 2007 Regular Session.

1522.title: Unemployment compensation; create the State Workforce Investment Fund and provide for contributions to the fund.
1522.description: An Act To Amend Sections 71-5-353 And 71-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The State Workforce Investment Fund; To Provide That Money In Such Fund Shall Be Used For Administration Of State Workforce Investment Board Business, Grants Related To Training, And Other Projects As Determined Appropriate By The State Workforce Investment Board; To Provide For A Reduction In The Newly Subject Employer Rate For Unemployment Compensation Insurance For One Year; To Provide For The Distribution Of Contributions To The Mississippi Workforce Enhancement Training Fund And The State Workforce Investment Fund; To Provide For The Allocation Of The Costs Of Collection Between Such Funds; To Provide For The Transfer Of Collections To Such Funds And The Administration Of Such Funds; To Provide That A Portion Of The Funds Collected For The Mississippi Workforce Enhancement Training Fund For The Calendar Year 2014, Shall Be Used For The Development Of Certain Performance Measures For The Use Of The Fund; To Provide For A Combined Rate For Contributions To Mississippi Workforce Enhancement Training Fund And State Workforce Investment Fund; To Provide For A General Experience Rate For Unemployment Insurance Contributions Of .2% To Which Will Be Added The Employer's Individual Experience Rate; To Provide That An Employer's Total Rate For Unemployment Insurance Contributions Shall Not Exceed 5.4%; To Amend Section 71-5-453, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Manner In Which State Workforce Investment Fund Contributions Shall Be Handled By The Department Of Employment Security And To Modify The Manner In Which Mississippi Workforce Training Enhancement Fund Contributions Are Handled By The Department Of Employment Security; And For Related Purposes.

1523.title: Appropriations; Department of Wildlife for matching funds for a county road project in Neshoba County.
1523.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For Providing Matching Funds For A Project To Pave A Section Of County Road 832 In Neshoba County, A County Access Road Into The Nanih Waiya Wildlife Management Area, For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1524.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for East Metro Corridor project in Rankin County.
1524.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Land Acquisition For And Construction And Development Of Segment 4 Of The East Metro Corridor Project In Rankin County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1525.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for certain projects at Jackson State University.
1525.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Acquiring And Improving Property For The Campus Of Jackson State University And Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping A New Building And Related Facilities For The School Of Engineering At Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

1526.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for the Marty Stuart Center and Congress of Country Music Hall.
1526.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The Marty Stuart Center And Congress Of Country Music Hall In Philadelphia, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1527.title: Bonds; increase amount that may be issued to provide funds for the Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund.
1527.description: An Act To Amend Section 45, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Section 9, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, To Increase By $5,000,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1529.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements to Jackson Zoo.
1529.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Jackson Zoo; And For Related Purposes.

1530.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Jackson in making improvements to the Woodrow Wilson Avenue bridge.
1530.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Rehabilitation Or Replacement And Reconstruction Of The Woodrow Wilson Avenue Bridge In Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1531.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for the Mississippi Watershed repair and Rehabilitation Cost-Share Program.
1531.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Watershed Repair And Rehabilitation Cost-share Program; To Amend Section 51-37-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1532.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for the Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund.
1532.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $5,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1533.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for the Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund.
1533.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $5,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Increase The Amount Of Funds That May Be Disbursed As Grant Funds To The City Of Columbus, Mississippi, To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Columbus City Hall Building And Related Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1534.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of general to repair, renovate and refurbish Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center.
1534.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center In Natchez, Mississippi, Which Is Designated A Mississippi Landmark By The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History; And For Related Purposes.

1535.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to assist in construction of Center for Manufacturing Technology Excellence.
1535.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Building And Related Facilities To House The Center For Manufacturing Technology Excellence At The East Mississippi Community College Golden Triangle Campus In Lowndes County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1536.title: Bonds; authorize to provide funds for loan to North Central MS Regional Rail Authority to acquire certain rail line.
1536.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The North Central Ms Regional Rail Authority For The Purpose Of Acquiring The Rail Line That Extends From Southaven, Mississippi, To A Point Near Canton, Mississippi; To Provide That If The Rail Authority Acquires The Rail Line, It May Enter Into Any Agreement With A Railroad Or Other Entity Providing That The Railroad Or Other Entity Will Lease The Rail Line From The Authority For Commercial Purposes; To Provide That The Principal Of And Interest On The Bonds Will Be Paid Primarily From Certain Lease Payments Deposited Into A Bond Sinking Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1537.title: Bonds; authorize additional to provide funds for improvements to portion of Mississippi Highway 25 in City of Flowood.
1537.description: An Act To Amend Section 17, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, To Increase The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds For The "2013 City Of Flowood, Mississippi Highway 25 Improvements Fund" For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Assist The City Of Flowood, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To A Portion Of Mississippi Highway 25 Located In Rankin County In The City Of Flowood; And For Related Purposes.

1539.title: Sales tax; exempt certain sales of concrete and asphalt for use in residential construction.
1539.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Concrete And Asphalt To Licensed Residential Builders And Remodelers For Use In Residential Construction And Residential Improvement; And For Related Purposes.

1540.title: Income tax; provide a credit to qualified MS cybersecurity companies for certain investments in those companies.
1540.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Qualified Mississippi Cybersecurity Companies In Which Certain Investments Are Made; To Define Certain Terms; To Require Qualified Mississippi Cybersecurity Companies To Apply To The Mississippi Development Authority To Establish The Company's Eligibility For The Tax Credit; To Prescribe The Minimum Requirements That Must Be Satisfied By Companies Seeking The Tax Credit; To Prescribe The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Provide That If The Amount Of Credit Claimed By A Qualified Mississippi Cybersecurity Company Exceeds The Amount Of Income Tax Imposed Upon The Company For The Taxable Year, Then The Company Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of The Excess; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Establish A Panel Of Experts In Cybersecurity Technology For Assistance In Determining Whether A Company Meets The Criteria To Be A Qualified Mississippi Cybersecurity Company; To Require Companies To Submit A Copy Of The Final Tax Credit Certificate Issued By The Mississippi Development Authority To The Department Of Revenue; To Establish The Mississippi Cybersecurity Investment Tax Credit Reserve Fund In The State Treasury And To Require Annual Appropriations To The Fund For The Purpose Of Offsetting The Tax Credit; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Submit An Annual Report To The Governor And The Legislature On The Tax Credit Certificates Awarded Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1541.title: Income and franchise tax; allow refundable credit for costs of purchasing/leasing & installing solar electric energy system.
1541.description: An Act To Authorize An Income And/or Franchise Tax Credit Equal To A Certain Amount Of The Cost Of Purchasing Or Leasing And Installing Solar Electric Energy Systems; To Provide That The Credit Shall Apply To All Solar Electric Energy Systems, Whether Purchased Or Leased, Installed On Or After July 1, 2012; To Provide The Manner In Which The Credit May Be Claimed; To Provide That If The Amount Of Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income And/or Franchise Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; To Provide That A Homeowners' Association Or Covenant May Not Prohibit Or Restrict The Installation Of A Solar Electric Energy System, Impose Unreasonable Fees For The Installation Or Discriminate Against A Homeowners' Member For The Installation; To Award Attorney's Fees And Costs To A Person Who Prevails In A Civil Action Against An Association Or Covenant; And For Related Purposes.

1542.title: Income tax; revise provisions regarding net income of nonresidents, revise definition of term "doing business."
1542.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Net Income Of Nonresidents Derived From Property, Activity And Other Sources Within Mississippi Is Subject To The State Income Tax; To Amend Section 27-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "doing Business" For Purposes Of The State Income Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

1543.title: Income tax; authorize a deduction for contributions to qualified tuition programs.
1543.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Individual Nonbusiness Deduction For Contributions To Qualified Tuition Programs As Defined In Section 529 Of The Internal Revenue Code; To Limit The Maximum Annual Amount Of Contributions That May Be Claimed As A Deduction; And For Related Purposes.

1544.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers that hire veterans.
1544.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Employ Persons Who Are Honorably Discharged Veterans Of The Armed Forces Of The United States; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Authorize Any Tax Credit Claimed But Not Used In Any Taxable Year To Be Carried Forward For Five Consecutive Years; And For Related Purposes.

1545.title: Income tax; exclude active duty military compensation received by a resident while stationed out of state.
1545.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "gross Income" For Purposes Of The State Income Tax Law To Exclude Compensation Received By A Resident Of This State For Active Federal Service As A Member Of The Armed Forces Of The United States In An Active Duty Status While Such Person Is Stationed Outside The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1546.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for employers who pay the cost of a qualified wellness program.
1546.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit To Employers Who Pay Costs In Connection With A Qualified Wellness Program In The Amount Of 50% Of The Costs Paid In Connection With The Qualified Wellness Program; To Provide The Components That A Wellness Program Must Have To Qualify For The Credit; To Provide That If The Amount Of The Allowable Credit Exceeds The Income Tax Liability Of The Employer, The Amount Of The Excess Shall Not Be Refundable Or Carried Forward To Any Other Taxable Year; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1547.title: Income tax; revise provisions regarding certain business deductions.
1547.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "captive Reit" For Purposes Of The State Income Tax Deduction Authorized For Dividend Distributions Made By A Real Estate Investment Trust And To Revise The Application Of The Deduction With Regard To A Captive Reit; To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "intangible Property" And "interest Expenses And Cost" And To Define The Terms "management And Administrative Fees" And "subchapter K Entity" For Purposes Of Restrictions On The Deduction Of Certain Expenses Incurred In Connection With Transactions With Related Members And To Revise Certain Provisions Regarding The Deduction; And For Related Purposes.

1548.title: Sales tax; exempt portion of sales tax on labor parts, etc., for certain truck-tractors & semitrailers used in interstate commerce.
1548.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt, Beginning July 1, 2015, Retail Sales Of Accessories, Equipment, Labor, Parts And Services For Truck-tractors And Semitrailers Used In Interstate Commerce And Registered Under The International Registration Plan (irp) Or Any Similar Reciprocity Agreement Or Compact Relating To The Proportional Registration Of Commercial Vehicles From 1/2 Of The Taxes Imposed On Such Transactions; And For Related Purposes.

1549.title: Income tax; provide for method of apportioning income for certain major medical or pharmaceutical suppliers.
1549.description: An Act To Provide For The Method Of Apportionment Of Income For Income Tax Purposes Of A Major Supplier Of Medical Or Pharmaceutical Products For A Mississippi Distribution Facility; To Amend Section 27-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1550.title: Corporation franchise tax; phase out for business enterprises classified as manufacturers by the IRS.
1550.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The Corporation Franchise Tax On Business Enterprises That Are Classified Under The Internal Revenue Service Principal Business Or Professional Activity Codes As Manufacturers And Primarily Operating As A Manufacturer In This State; And For Related Purposes.

1551.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt one motor vehicle owned by law enforcement officer wounded/injured in performance of duties.
1551.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation One Motor Vehicle Owned By A Person Who Is A Law Enforcement Officer And Who Was Wounded Or Otherwise Received Intentional Or Accidental Bodily Injury While Engaged In The Performance Of His Official Duties And Was Required To Receive Medical Treatment For The Wound Or Injury Due To The Nature And Extent Of The Wound Or Injury; And For Related Purposes.

1552.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property and services to the Mississippi Children's Museum.
1552.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property And Services To The Mississippi Children's Museum; And For Related Purposes.

1553.title: Gas severance tax; include carbon dioxide within definition of gas and remove certain exemptions.
1553.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-25-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Carbon Dioxide Within The Definition Of The Term "gas" For Purposes Of The Gas Severance Tax Laws; To Amend Section 27-25-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Gas Severance Tax Exemption Provided For Gas Lawfully Injected Into The Earth For Cycling, Repressuring, Lifting Or Enhancing The Recovery Of Oil; To Amend Section 27-25-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Credit Against The Oil Severance Tax Levied On The Value Of Oil At The Point Of Production On Oil Produced By An Enhanced Oil Recovery Method In Which Carbon Dioxide Is Used; To Provide That The Amount Of The Credit Shall Be The Amount Of Gas Severance Tax Paid On The Carbon Dioxide Used In The Enhanced Oil Recovery Method To Produce The Oil; To Bring Forward Section 27-25-501, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Defines Certain Terms Under The Oil Severance Tax Laws, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1554.title: Sale tax; exempt sales of aircraft used in oil or natural gas exploration or production.
1554.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Aircraft Used Predominately To Transport Passengers Or Property To Offshore Oil Or Natural Gas Exploration Or Production Platforms Or Vessels, And Engines, Accessories And Spare Parts For Such Aircraft, Are Exempt From Sales Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1555.title: Income tax; allow credit to grocers for part of cost of purchasing locally grown or produced agricultural products.
1555.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-7-22.38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A State Income Tax Credit To Grocers For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Purchasing Locally Grown Or Produced Agricultural Products For Sale At Retail For Human Consumption; And For Related Purposes.

1556.title: Income tax; authorize credit for taxpayer who maintain, support and care for a dependent with diagnosis of a developmental disability.
1556.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Any Taxpayer In This State Who Is Maintaining, Supporting And Caring For A Dependent With A Diagnosis Of A Developmental Disability In His Home; And For Related Purposes.

1557.title: Motor fuels tax, Certain; provide continued collection of when Groundwater Protection Trust Fund reaches $10 Million for highways & bridges.
1557.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-17-407, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Environmental Protection Tax Imposed On Bonded Distributors On Motor Fuels Shall Continue To Be Collected When The Mississippi Groundwater Protection Trust Fund Reaches Ten Million Dollars And Such Collections Shall Be Deposited In Equal Amounts Into The State Aid Road Fund And The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-435, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1558.title: Sales tax; exempt admission to and parking at certain livestock and agricultural facilities.
1558.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-65-22 And 27-65-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Any Admissions To And Parking At Livestock Facilities, Agriculture Facilities Or Other Facilities Constructed, Renovated Or Expanded With Funds From The Grant Program Authorized Under Section 18 Of Chapter 530, Laws Of 1995, When The Net Proceeds Of The Admission Are To Be Used Solely For Religious, Charitable, Educational Or Civic Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1559.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt pollution control equipment mandated by federal or state law or regulations.
1559.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Pollution Control Equipment Mandated By Federal Or State Law Or Regulation Shall Be Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1560.title: Insurance premium tax; reduce for certain insurance companies participating in health exchanges.
1560.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-15-103 And 27-15-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Rate Of The Insurance Premium Tax Levied On Premiums Collected By Certain Insurance Companies On Health Insurance Policies Or Other Health Benefit Contracts Or Plans Through Participation In An Exchange Operating In Mississippi Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act; And For Related Purposes.

1561.title: Income tax; exempt income of certain physicians, physician assistants and nurses practicing in critical physician shortage areas.
1561.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Critical Physician, Physician Assistant And Nurse Shortage Incentive Act Of 2014"; To Provide That The Gross Income Of Newly Licensed Physicians, Physician Assistants And Nurses Practicing Medicine In Critical Physician Shortage Areas Shall Not Include Any Income Derived From Providing Medical Services In Critical Physician Shortage Areas; To Provide That The Exemption From Gross Income Authorized By This Act May Be Utilized By The Qualifying Physician, Physician Assistant Or Nurse For Ten Consecutive Years If The Physician, Physician Assistant Or Nurse Practices In Such An Area For That Period Of Time; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1562.title: Income tax; exempt a portion of income of certain physicians/nurse practitioners practicing in critical physician shortage areas.
1562.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Critical Physician And Nurse Practitioner Shortage Incentive Act Of 2014"; To Provide That The Gross Income Of Newly Licensed Physicians And Nurse Practitioners Practicing Medicine And Residing In Critical Physician Shortage Areas Shall Not Include Any Income In Excess Of $100,000.00 Derived From Providing Medical Services In Critical Physician Shortage Areas; To Provide That The Exemption From Gross Income Authorized By This Section May Be Utilized By The Qualifying Physician Or Nurse Practitioner For Ten Consecutive Years If The Physician Or Nurse Practitioner Practices And Resides In Such An Area For That Period Of Time; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1563.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt certain heavy equipment from.
1563.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Certain Heavy Duty Rental Equipment; And For Related Purposes.

1564.title: Sales tax; reduce rate imposed on retail sales of boats, motorcycles and towable camping trailers.
1564.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Rate Of Sales Tax Imposed On Retail Sales Of Boats, Motorcycles And Towable Camping Trailers; And For Related Purposes.

1565.title: Citizens for Economic Development Act; create.
1565.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least Three-fifths Of The Votes Cast At A Referendum Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Authorize A Municipality To Incur Indebtedness In An Amount Not Greater Than An Amount For Which Debt Service Is Capable Of Being Funded By The Proceeds Of The Special Sales Tax; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Revenue Collected Pursuant To Such A Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The Municipality To Fund Capital Projects; To Provide For The Discontinuance Of The Special Sales Tax Upon Completion Of The Funding Of The Projects For Which The Tax Was Levied; To Amend Section 21-33-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1566.title: Jackson State University Stadium Fund; create and impose a tax on activities and events held at the stadium to fund.
1566.description: An Act To Create In The State Treasury A Special Fund To Be Designated The Jackson State University Stadium Fund; To Provide That Money In The Special Fund May Be Used By Jackson State University Upon Appropriation By The Legislature For Certain Purposes Related To The Establishment, Operation And Maintenance Of A Stadium On Or In Close Proximity To The Jackson State University Main Campus; To Amend Section 27-65-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose A Tax Of 7% Of The Gross Revenue Derived From Sales Of Admissions To Amusement Business, Activities Or Events Held Or Conducted In Or At Such Stadium That Shall Be In Lieu Of Any Other Taxes; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Revenue From The Tax Levied On Activities At Such Stadium Shall Be Deposited, Without Diversion, Into The Jackson State University Stadium Fund; To Authorize A Sales Tax Diversion In The Amount Of Eighteen And One-half Percent Of The Total Sales Tax Revenue Collected On Business Activities On Property That Is Owned By The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District And Located Outside Of The Municipalities In The County In Which The Property Is Located Shall Be Allocated For Distribution And Paid To The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District; And For Related Purposes.

1568.title: Appropriation; Archives and History for funding to Town of Summit to restore historic water tower.
1568.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To The Town Of Summit To Restore The Historic Water Tower Located In The Town For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1569.title: Hancock County Tourism Development Bureau; delete repealer on.
1569.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1019, Local And Private Laws Of 1996, As Last Amended By Chapter 901, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Remove The Repeal Date, On The Provisions Of Law That Create The Hancock County Tourism Development Bureau And Prescribe Its Powers And Duties And Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Contracts With Not-for-profit Organizations For Certain Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1570.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for certain Mississippi Development Authority programs.
1570.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $5,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $5,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Grants Or Loans To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Amend Sections 65-4-25, 65-4-29, 65-4-31 And 65-4-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $10,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Delete The Reverter On The Provisions That Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Bonds Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act And That Require Notice Of The Sale Of Such Bonds Only When The Bonds Are To Be Sold On Sealed Bids At Public Sale; And For Related Purposes.

1571.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for tourism rail line in Adams, Franklin and Lincoln Counties.
1571.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Incurred For Acquisition, Furnishing And Equipping Of Railcars And Related Equipment And Operation Of Such Cars And Equipment For Tourism Purposes On A Portion Of Rail Line Running Through Adams, Franklin And Lincoln Counties; And For Related Purposes.

1572.title: Appropriation; MDEQ to provide funding to Hines County for development of certain wastewater infrastructure facility.
1572.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To Hinds County To Assist In The Development Of A Wastewater Infrastructure Facility For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1573.title: Forrest County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
1573.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Forrest County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Association For Retarded Citizens, Big Brothers/big Sisters Of Southeast Mississippi, The Boy Scouts Of America, The Gulf Pine Girl Scout Council, The Hattiesburg Downtown Association, Inc., The Salvation Army, Pearl River Valley Opportunity, The Pinebelt Association For Community Enhancement, The Hattiesburg Little League Baseball Association, Petal Optimist Club Baseball, First Tee And The Aids Services Coalition; And For Related Purposes.

1574.title: Appropriation; MS Arts Commission to provide funding for Greenville Arts Council.
1574.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Arts Commission For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For The Greenville Arts Council For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1575.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of electricity, street lights and security equipment to homeowners' associations for security purposes.
1575.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Electricity To A Homeowners' Association If The Electricity Is Used By The Association Solely In The Operation Of Street Lights And Security Equipment For The Purpose Of Providing Or Enhancing Safety And Security Measures Within The Area Comprising The Boundaries Of The Association; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Street Lights And Security Equipment To A Homeowners' Association When Used By The Association Solely For The Purpose Of Providing Or Enhancing Safety And Security Measures Within The Area Comprising The Boundaries Of The Association; And For Related Purposes.

1576.title: Appropriation; MDOT to replace funds transferred from in past years.
1576.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Purpose Of Replacing Funds Transferred From The Mississippi Department Of Transportation In Past Years For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1577.title: Electric vehicles; impose annual tax on.
1577.description: An Act To Impose An Annual Tax On Electric Vehicles In Addition To Any Other Taxes For Which The Vehicle Is Liable; To Define "electric Vehicle"; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Paid To The County Tax Collector At The Same Time And In The Same Manner As The Annual Highway Privilege Tax Is Paid; To Provide For The Amount Of The Tax; To Provide That The Tax Collector Shall Remit The Proceeds Of The Tax To The Department Of Revenue; To Provide That The Department Shall Apportion The Proceeds Of The Tax Among The Various Purposes Specified For Gasoline And Diesel Fuel Taxes In The Same Proportion That Those Taxes Were Apportioned For Those Purposes During The Previous State Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

1578.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for construction of Mississippi Civil Rights Museum and Museum of Mississippi History.
1578.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum And The New Museum Of Mississippi History And Construction Of A Parking Garage For The Museums; And For Related Purposes.

1579.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for IHL capital improvements.
1579.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

1580.title: Lowndes County Port Authority; authorize to increase per diem compensation that is paid to board members.
1580.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1002, Local And Private Laws Of 1975, To Authorize The Lowndes County Port Authority To Increase Per Diem Compensation For Its Members; To Provide That Such Compensation Shall Be Paid From Income And Any Other Available Funds Of The Port; And For Related Purposes.

1581.title: Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Act; create to provide certain incentives for certain health care facilities.
1581.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Act; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority (mda) To Certify A Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Community If Certain Requirements Are Met; To Provide That Municipalities That Have Health Care Master Plans Meeting The Requirements Of This Act May Acquire, Own And Lease Projects For The Purpose Of Targeting The Health Care And Life Science Industry After Obtaining A Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity From The Mda; To Authorize Municipalities To Issue Bonds For The Purposes Of Defraying The Cost Of Acquiring Or Constructing Buildings For Such Projects Or Acquiring Land For Such Projects; To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Fund; To Provide That The Purpose Of The Fund Is To Assist In Maximizing Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Economic Development Opportunities Related To Any New Or Expanded Health Care Or Life Science Related Business Or Industry; To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Used By Mda To Make Grants To Local Economic Development Entities To Assist Any New Or Expanding Health Care Or Life Science Related Business Or Industry That Meets The Criteria Provided In This Section When The Assistance Aids The Consummation Of A Project Within A Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Community; To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Revolving Loan Fund; To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Disbursed By Mda As Loans To Qualified Health Care Facilities Or Businesses Located In A Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Community By The Mississippi Development Authority For Costs Associated With Architectural Services, Engineering Services, Project Management Services, And Other Pre-construction And Post-construction Expenses And Construction Costs For Public, Private, For-profit And Nonprofit Entities To Initiate New Ventures Or Expand Existing Ventures; To Provide That To Be Eligible For A Loan Under This Section, The Mda Must Certify That The Qualified Health Care Facility Or Business For Which The Loan Is Sought Will Create A Minimum Of 25 New Full-time Jobs And/or Have $10,000,000.00 Of Capital Investment; To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Job Training Grant Fund; To Provide That The Money In The Fund Shall Be Used For The Purpose Of Making Job Training Grants To Community And Junior Colleges, Public Universities And Local Workforce Investment Areas To Pay A Portion Of The Costs Of Providing Training Or Retraining For Employees Of Qualified Health Care Industry Facilities Or Businesses Locating In A Community That Has A Certified Health Care Zone Master Plan; To Provide That Mda Shall Administer The Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Funded By A Diversion Of Sales Tax Revenue; To Provide For The Amount Of The Grants; To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Advantage Jobs Fund; To Provide That The Money In The Fund Shall Be Used By Mda For The Purpose Of Making The Incentive Payments To Qualified Health Care Facilities Or Businesses; To Provide That A Qualified Health Care Facility Or Business That Provides An Average Annual Salary, Excluding Benefits Which Are Not Subject To Mississippi Income Taxes, Of At Least 100% Of The Most Recently Published State Average Annual Wage Or The Most Recently Published Average Annual Wage Of The County In Which The Qualified Health Care Facility Or Business Is Located As Determined By The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security, Whichever Is The Lesser, And Creates At Least 25 New Direct Jobs, Is Eligible For Incentive Payments; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Funded By A Diversion Of The Withholding Tax Payments Made By The Qualified Health Care Facility Or Business; To Provide The Amount Of The Incentive Payments; To Provide For An Income Tax And Insurance Premium Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Pay A Qualified Community Development Entity For Qualified Equity Investments In A Certified Health Care Zone Master Plan Community; To Provide That The Amount Of The Credit Shall Be Equal To A Certain Percentage Of The Adjusted Purchase Price Paid To The Qualified Community Development Entity For The Qualified Equity Investment; To Provide That The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of The Credits That May Be Allocated To All Taxpayers In Any One State Fiscal Year Shall Not Exceed $5,000,000.00 And That The Credits Shall Be Allocated By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide For The Recapture Of All Or A Portion Of The Credit Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 27-15-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Investments That May Reduce A Taxpayer's Insurance Premium Tax Liability Under Such Section Shall Not Include Any Investment For Which Such A Credit Is Allocated Under This Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Revolving Loan Fund; To Amend Sections 27-7-312, 21-33-303 And 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1582.title: Rankin County; authorize purchase of electronic speed detection equipment to be utilized by sheriff.
1582.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Rankin County, Mississippi, To Purchase And Utilize Electronic Speed Detection Equipment For Use By The Sheriff's Department Of The County In The Enforcement Of Speed Limits On The Roads, Streets And Highways Of The County Outside The Corporate Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; And For Related Purposes.
