1583.title: City of Oxford; require trustees of municipal reserve and trust fund to invest fund in any investments authorized for PERS.
1583.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 938, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Chapter 942, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, As Amended By Chapter 924, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Require The Board Of Trustees Of The City Of Oxford Municipal Reserve And Trust Fund To Invest The Fund In Any Of The Investments Authorized For The Public Employees' Retirement System Of Mississippi Instead Of The Mississippi Prepaid Affordable College Tuition Program; And For Related Purposes.

1584.title: Town of Tunica; authorize use of low-speed vehicles/golf carts on certain public roads and streets within.
1584.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Tunica, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The Town Of Tunica; To Require Individuals Operating A Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License; To Require Certain Registration Of Such Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart; And For Related Purposes.

1585.title: Town of Como; authorize to impose tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
1585.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Como, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Food And Beverages At Restaurants, Which Shall Be Used To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1586.title: Appropriation; Hinds County for renovation and making security improvements to Adult Detention Center.
1586.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For Renovating And Making Security Improvements To The Adult Detention Center In The City Of Raymond For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1587.title: Appropriation; Hinds County for renovating and making security improvements to Adult Detention Center.
1587.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For Renovating And Making Security Improvements To The Adult Detention Center In The City Of Raymond For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1588.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for the Mississippi Arts and Entertainment Center and the Mississippi Craft Center.
1588.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Constructing, Furnishing, Equipping, Repairs And Renovations To And The Purchase Of Land For The Mississippi Arts And Entertainment Center In Meridian, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Matching Funds For Parking And Roads At The Mississippi Craft Center And Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Renovation Of And Upgrades And Improvements At The Mississippi Craft Center In Ridgeland, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1589.title: Motor fuel tax; levy on each diesel gallon equivalent of liquefied natural gas.
1589.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-59-3 And 27-59-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "diesel Gallon Equivalent" For The Purpose Of The Tax On Liquefied Natural Gas; To Provide That The Tax Levied On Liquefied Natural Gas Shall Be Levied On Each Diesel Gallon Equivalent Of Liquefied Natural Gas; To Amend Section 27-59-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Motor Vehicles That Use Liquefied Natural Gas And No Other Compressed Gas From The Requirement Of Obtaining A Decal From The Department Of Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

1590.title: Sales tax; reduce rate on sales of equipment to contractors for use in road construction.
1590.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Sales Tax Rate On Retail Sales Of Equipment, And Parts And Labor Used To Maintain And/or Repair Such Equipment, To Contractors For Use Solely In The Construction, Reconstruction, Repair, Rehabilitation And/or Resurfacing Of Highways, Roads Or Bridges In This State; And For Related Purposes.

1591.title: Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act; revise the definition of the term "project" and authorize the issuance of bonds for a project.
1591.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-75-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "project" Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act To Include Certain Manufacturers Of Kitchen Appliances; To Amend Section 57-75-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Authority Certain Additional Powers And Duties With Regard To Such Projects; To Amend Section 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For Such Projects And To Specify The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Such Bonds May Be Used; To Extend The Reverter On The Provisions That Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Bonds Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act; And For Related Purposes.

1592.title: Surplus school buildings; establish a tax credit program for development and rehabilitation of.
1592.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-485, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Income Tax Credit For The Cost Of Development And Rehabilitation Of Surplus School Buildings For Teacher Housing And Economic Development Purposes; To Provide An Income Tax Credit To Be Used As A Subsidy For The Rent Of Public Schoolteachers Who Are Tenants In Such Property; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Establish Fees For Services Under This Redevelopment Program And To Establish A Special Fund Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

1594.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of nonperishable food items to certain charitable organizations.
1594.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Nonperishable Food Items To Certain Charitable Organizations Whose Primary Purpose Is The Operation Of A Food Pantry Or Food Bank Or Food Lines; And For Related Purposes.

1595.title: Bonds; authorize for community and junior college capital improvements.
1595.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For Community And Junior Colleges; And For Related Purposes.

1596.title: Appropriation; IHL for additions to facilities of College of Science, Engineering & Technology at JSU.
1596.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Purpose Of Making Additions To The Facilities Of The College Of Science, Engineering And Technology At Jackson State University For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1597.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for the Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund.
1597.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $4,200,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1598.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide for improvements at state parks.
1598.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For Repairs, Renovations And Capital Improvements At State Parks; And For Related Purposes.

1599.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements at the Mississippi Craft Center.
1599.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Matching Funds For Parking And Roads At The Mississippi Craft Center And Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Renovation Of And Upgrades And Improvements At The Mississippi Craft Center In Ridgeland, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1600.title: Appropriation; IHL for funding the Speech-Language Pathologists Loan Forgiveness Program.
1600.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For The Speech-language Pathologists Loan Forgiveness Program For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1601.title: City of Waveland; authorize to use Hancock County Justice Court to conduct Waveland City Court.
1601.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Waveland, Mississippi, To Utilize The Hancock County Justice Court To Conduct Waveland Municipal Court Until Such Time The City Obtains Appropriate Space To Conduct The Business Of Its Court; And For Related Purposes.

1602.title: Ad valorem taxes; authorize counties/cities to exempt true value added to commercial property by installing solar energy system from.
1602.description: An Act To Authorize County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Governing Authorities To Exempt From County Or Municipal Ad Valorem Taxes Other Than Taxes For School District Purposes, For A Period Of Not More Than Ten Years, The Amount Of True Value Added To Commercial Or Business Property Located In The County Or Municipality As A Result Of The Installation Of A Solar Energy System On Or After July 1, 2014; And For Related Purposes.

1603.title: Sales tax; exempt certain guided tour activities.
1603.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-65-22 And 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Guided Tours, Which Include Providing Accommodations, Guide Services And/or Related Equipment Operated By Or Under The Direction Of The Person Providing The Tour, For The Purposes Of Outdoor Tourism; To Bring Forward Section 27-65-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Imposes Sales Tax On Certain Business Activities, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1604.title: Appropriation; to Railroad Revitalization Fund to be used by MDOT for safety equipment at passive grade crossings.
1604.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From The State General Fund To The Railroad Revitalization Fund To Be Used By The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Purpose Of Purchasing And Installing Stop Or Yield Signs, New Surface Striping And Other Related Safety Equipment At All Public Passive Grade Crossings In The State For The Fiscal Year 2015.

1605.title: Contractor's tax; reduce for drilling oil and gas well utilizing hydraulic fracturing.
1605.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Compensation For Services Related To Hydraulic Fracturing Is Included In The Total Contract Price Or Compensation Received For Purposes Of The Tax On Upon Persons Engaging Or Continuing In The Business Of Contracting Or Performing A Contract Of Redrilling, Or Working Over, Or Of Drilling An Oil Well Or A Gas Well; And For Related Purposes.

1606.title: Amusement tax; exempt guide services on the water from.
1606.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Payments For Water Craft Guide Services On Any Waters Of This State Shall Not Be Subject To Sales Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1607.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds for repair and renovation of the MS Coliseum and construction of a new trade mart.
1607.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Repair, Renovation Of And Improvements To The Mississippi Coliseum; To Provide Funds For The Construction Of A New Trade Mart; To Provide Funds For The Demolition Of The Mississippi Trade Mart; And To Provide Funds For Improvements To Parking On The Mississippi State Fairgrounds; And For Related Purposes.

1608.title: Grocery Store Development Loan Program Act; issue bonds to help construct new grocery stores in underserved areas.
1608.description: An Act To Create The Grocery Store Development Loan Program Act; To Provide Definitions For This Act; To Create The Grocery Store Development Loan Program Fund; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Establish A Program To Make Loans To Persons, Corporations, Municipalities, Counties And Other Entities To Construct New Grocery Stores That Sell Nonprocessed Protein And Fresh Produce In Underserved Areas Of The State; To Require That Any Grocery Store Receiving A Loan From The Program Be Open For Operation Not Later Than December 31, 2017; To Require Persons, Corporations, Municipalities, Counties And Other Entities Desiring To Receive A Loan Under The Program To Submit An Application To The Mississippi Development Authority Containing Specific Information Regarding The Proposed Grocery Store Development Project; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Review The Application And Determine If It Qualifies As A Grocery Store Development Project Under This Act; To Provide That If The Proposed Project Qualifies Under This Act, The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Issue A Certificate Designating The Applicant As An Approved Participant And Authorizing The Approved Participant To Receive A Loan From The Program; To Provide That If The Approved Participant Is Not The Grocery Store Operator, The Approved Participant And The Grocery Store Operator Shall Enter Into An Agreement About The Use Of The Funds From The Loan; To Provide For The Maximum Amount Of A Loan That May Be Made To Any Approved Participant From The Program; To Provide That An Approved Participant That Receives A Loan From The Program Is Obligated For The Full Repayment Of The Loan; To Provide Assistance With The Repayment Of The Loans By Giving The Grocery Store Operators A Rebate Of 80% Of The Amount Of Sales Tax Revenue Collected From The Operation Of The Grocery Store Development Project; To Provide That The Aggregate Amount Of The Rebates That A Grocery Store Operator May Receive Shall Not Exceed 30% Of The Approved Project Costs Incurred By The Approved Participant For The Grocery Store Development Project; To Provide That The Rebates Will End On The Earlier Of The Date That An Aggregate Amount Of 30% Of The Approved Project Costs Incurred By The Approved Participant For The Grocery Store Development Project Has Been Paid To The Grocery Store Operator, Or 10 Years After The Date The Grocery Store Opens For Commercial Operation; To Authorize Grocery Store Operators To Enter Into Agreements With The Municipality Or County In Which The Grocery Store Development Project Will Be Located To Allocate Up To Five Percent Of The Amount Of Sales Tax Revenue Collected From The Operation Of The Grocery Store Development Project That The Grocery Store Operator Receives, To Reimburse The Municipality Or County For All Or A Portion Of The Cost Incurred By The Municipality Or County In Providing Necessary Infrastructure And Off-site Improvements For The Grocery Store Development Project; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That 80% Of The Sales Tax Revenue Collected From The Operation Of A Grocery Store Development Project Under The Provisions Of This Act Shall Be Deposited, After Certain Diversions, Into The Grocery Store Development Loan Program Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $500,000.00 And Provide That The Proceeds Of Those Bonds Shall Be Deposited Into The Grocery Store Development Loan Program Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1609.title: Income tax; allow credit to venison processers for part of costs of processing venison donated by hunters for MS Hunter's Harvest Program.
1609.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-7-22.38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A State Income Tax Credit To Venison Processers For A Percentage Of The Production Cost Of Processing Venison Donated By Hunters For The Mississippi Hunter's Harvest Program Of The Mississippi Wildlife Federation For Which The Processer Has Not Been Paid Or Otherwise Received Reimbursement; And For Related Purposes.

1610.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for certain tourism purposes.
1610.description: An Act To Provide That Programs And Projects Promoting The Heritage, History And Culture Of The State And Demonstrating The State's Attractiveness As A Tourism Destination Are A Priority For The Division Of Tourism Development Of The Mississippi Development Authority; To Establish The Statewide Tourism Projects Fund Into Which The Proceeds Of The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds Shall Be Deposited For The Purpose Of Funding Certain Tourism Projects; To Specify That Those Tourism Projects Receiving Monies From Such Fund Shall Be The Mississippi Arts And Entertainment Center; The Tunica Gateway To The Blues Museum; The Elvis Presley Birthplace, Museum And Chapel; The Jimmie Rodgers Museum; The Curlee House; The Cottonlandia Museum; The Gulf Coast Winter Classics Project; Mississippi Civil Rights Historical Sites; And The Natchez-brookhaven Rail Line Tourism Project; To Establish The Mississippi Heritage, History And Culture Tourism Fund Into Which The Proceeds Of The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds Shall Be Deposited For The Purpose Of Providing Monies For Various Tourism Projects And Programs In The State Addressing The State's Heritage, History And Culture; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Statewide Tourism Projects Fund And The Mississippi Heritage, History And Culture Tourism Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1611.title: Bonds; increase amount that may be issued for the Local Governments and Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund.
1611.description: An Act To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 35, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, To Increase From $29,843,000.00 To $33,343,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1612.title: Excise tax on gasoline and diesel; revise rate.
1612.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of The Gasoline Excise Tax; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-12, 27-55-19 And 27-55-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Certain Exemptions And Refunds Under The Gasoline Excise Tax Law, For The Purposes Of Amendment; To Amend Section 27-55-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of The Special Fuel Excise Tax Imposed On Undyed Diesel Fuel; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-521, 27-55-523 And 27-55-533, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Mississippi Special Fuel Tax Law, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Distribution Of Fuel Taxes, For The Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1613.title: Contractor's tax; exempt portion of the contract performed by a professional engineer who is the prime contractor.
1613.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Contractor's Tax The Portion Of The Total Contract Price Attributable To Engineering Services If The Engineering Services Are Performed By A Professional Engineer Who Is The General Or Prime Contractor; And For Related Purposes.

1614.title: Alternative fuel revolving loan fund; authorize counties to borrow money from.
1614.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-421, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties To Enter Into Loans Under A Revolving Loan Program Established By The Mississippi Development Authority To Assist Counties With Paying The Cost Of Qualified Alternative Fuel Motor Vehicle Fuel Property; And For Related Purposes.

1615.title: Sales tax; delete provision that excludes ornamental plants from agricultural exemption.
1615.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision That Provides That The Agricultural Sales Tax Exemption Does Not Apply To Ornamental Plants Which Bear No Fruit Of Commercial Value; And For Related Purposes.

1616.title: Ad valorem taxes; authorize certain counties/municipalities to exempt new hotels/motels.
1616.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County And The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality In Which There Is Located A Major Musical Heritage Museum As Designated By The Mississippi Development Authority To Exempt From County Or Municipal Ad Valorem Taxation, As The Case May Be, All Tangible Property, Except Motor Vehicles, Used In Or Necessary To The Operation Of New Enterprises That Are Commonly Or Usually Designated As Hotels Or Motels And Completed And Opened For Initial Commercial Operations After July 1, 2014; To Provide That An Exemption Granted Under This Act May Not Exceed Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

1618.title: City of Greenwood; extend the repeal date on the Greenwood Tourism Commission.
1618.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 813, Local And Private Laws Of 1989, As Last Amended By Chapter 956, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend From September 30, 2014, To September 30, 2017, The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Establishes The Greenwood Tourism Commission And Authorizes The City Of Greenwood To Impose A Tax On Hotels, Motels And Restaurants; To Provide For An Indirect Referendum On The Continuation Of The Levying Of Such Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1619.title: Chickasawhay Natural Gas District; authorize to obtain compressed natural gas auto refueling station and to sell gas to public.
1619.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Directors Of The Chickasawhay Natural Gas District To Construct, Expand, Operate, Obtain And Maintain Compressed Natural Gas Automobile Refueling Stations; To Authorize The Board Of Directors To Sell Compressed Natural Gas At Such Stations For Use In Vehicles To Both Public And Private Consumers; And For Related Purposes.

1620.title: Chickasawhay Natural Gas District; authorize to obtain compressed natural gas auto refueling stations and to sell gas to public.
1620.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Directors Of The Chickasawhay Natural Gas District To Construct, Expand, Operate, Obtain And Maintain Compressed Natural Gas Automoile Refueling Stations; To Authorize The Board Of Directors To Sell Compressed Natural Gas At Such Stations For Use In Vehicles To Both Public And Private Consumers; And For Related Purposes.

1622.title: Town of Crowder; authorize to levy a tax upon sale of beer in the town.
1622.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Crowder, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds From The Sale Of Beer Within The Town; To Provide That Such Tax Shall Not Exceed Two Percent; To Require The Tax, Before Its Imposition, To Be Approved By Sixty Percent Of Qualified Electors Voting In A Referendum On The Question Of Levying The Tax; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The Town Of Crowder; And For Related Purposes.

1623.title: City of Starkville; extend repeal date on economic development, tourism/convention tax.
1623.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 950, Local And Private Laws Of 1994, As Amended By Chapter 1014, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Extend The Repeal Date Until June 30, 2025, On The City Of Starkville's Economic Development, Tourism And Convention Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1624.title: City of Waynesboro and Wayne County; extend repealer on recreational facilities tax.
1624.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 938, Local And Private Laws Of 2005, As Amended By Chapter 967, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Chapter 918, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal To July 1, 2017, On The Recreational Facilities Tax For The City Of Waynesboro And Wayne County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1625.title: City of Poplarville; authorize rent free use of certain surplus office space by Poplarville Historical Preservation Society.
1625.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of Poplarville, Mississippi, To Allow Rent Free Use Of Certain Surplus City-owned Office Space By The Poplarville Historical Preservation Society, A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation; And For Related Purposes.

1626.title: City of Southaven; extend date of repeal on restaurant tax.
1626.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 955, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2014, To July 1, 2017, On The Law That Authorizes The City Of Southaven, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of The Sales Of Beverages And Prepared Food At Restaurants Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

1627.title: City of Flowood; authorize to levy tax on hotels and motels for conference center.
1627.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of Flowood, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Hotel And Motel Rooms And Lodging For The Purpose Of Financing And/or Refinancing The Acquisition, Construction, Reconstruction, Expanding, Improving, Furnishing, Equipping And Repairing Of A Conference Center In The City And For The Payment Of Any Debt Incurred In Connection Therewith; To Authorize The Governing Authority Of The City Of Flowood, Mississippi, To Incur Debt For The Purpose Of Financing And/or Refinancing The Acquisition, Construction, Reconstruction, Expanding, Improving, Furnishing, Equipping And Repairing Of The Conference Center In An Amount Not To Exceed $20,000,000; And For Related Purposes.

1628.title: City of Collins; authorize to enter into certain long term power supply agreement.
1628.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Collins, Mississippi, To Enter Into A Long Term Power Supply Agreement With Any Public Utility For Up To Twenty Years; And For Related Purposes.

1629.title: Lauderdale County; extend repeal date on the Lauderdale County Tourism Commission.
1629.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 991, Local And Private Laws Of 1997, As Last Amended By Chapter 924, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal To October 1, 2017, On The Law That Establishes The Lauderdale County Tourism Commission; To Require An Election On The Continuation Of The Tax If A Certain Number Of Electors File A Written Protest Against The Continuation Of The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1630.title: City of Southaven; extend date of repeal on restaurant tax, revise use of tax revenue and authorize to issue bonds for certain purposes.
1630.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 955, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Law That Authorizes The City Of Southaven, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of The Sales Of Beverages And Prepared Food At Restaurants Within The City; To Revise The Purposes For Which Revenue From The Tax May Be Expended; To Authorize The City Of Southaven To Issue General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Pay Costs Associated With Construction, Acquisition, Development, Additions To And Expansion Of Buildings, Facilities And Property For Tourism And Parks And Recreation Related Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1632.title: North Central Mississippi Regional Railroad Authority; authorize to enter into lease purchase agreement and/or transfer assets.
1632.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Directors Of The North Central Mississppi Regional Railroad Authority To Enter Into A Certain Lease-purchase Agreement And To Transfer Title To Assets Of The Authority; And For Related Purposes.

1633.title: Jefferson County Hospital; authorize contributions to Jefferson County.
1633.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Jefferson County Hospital To Contribute To The General Fund Of Jefferson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1634.title: City of Charleston; authorize to lease for up to ten years city owned farmland.
1634.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Charleston, Mississippi, To Lease For A Period Of Up To Ten Years Farmland That Is Owned By The City; And For Related Purposes.

1635.title: Jackson County; authorize supervisors to maintain satellite offices in respective districts without regard to county seat.
1635.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Purchase, Construct And Maintain Satellite Offices Within The Supervisors' Respective Districts, Without Regard To The County Seat, For The Convenience Of The County And Its Citizens So Long As The Primary Office Of The Board Of Supervisors Remains In The County Seat; And For Related Purposes.

1636.title: Attala County; authorize contribution to Holmes Community College for renovation of certain building for educational purposes.
1636.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Attala County, Mississippi, To Contribute Up To One Million Dollars In Cash Or In Kind Work To Holmes Community College For The Renovation Of The Old Milwaukee Electric Tool Building Which Shall Be Utilized For Educational Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1637.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize to contribute funds and in-kind maintenance services to Beulah Cemetery.
1637.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To And Provide In-kind Services For Maintenance To The Beulah Cemetery; To Provide That Community Service Or Inmate Labor May Be Used For Such Maintenance; And For Related Purposes.

1638.title: Tunica County; revise distribution of gaming revenue tax.
1638.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 866, Local And Private Laws Of 1992, As Last Amended By Chapter 920, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Revise The Distribution Of The Gaming Revenue Tax Imposed By The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County; And For Related Purposes.

1639.title: City of Greenwood; authorize donations of Katrina Cottages to Greenwood-Leflore Fuller Center for Housing, Inc.
1639.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenwood, Mississippi, To Donate The Katrina Cottages Conveyed To The City In 2011 By The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency To The Greenwood-leflore Fuller Center For Housing, Inc., A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation Which Is Engaged In Providing Housing To Low-income, Disabled And Elderly Residents In Greenwood; And For Related Purposes.

1640.title: Kemper County; authorize creation of the Kemper County Natural Gas District.
1640.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Kemper County, Mississippi, To Create And Participate In The Kemper County Natural Gas District; To Establish A Board Of Commissioners Of The District; To Provide For The Membership And Terms Of Office For The Commission's Board Of Directors; To Authorize The Commission To Construct And Operate A Natural Gas Transmission And Distribution System And To Prescribe Other Powers And Duties Of The Commission; To Authorize The Issuance Of Revenue Bonds To Construct The Natural Gas Transmission And Distribution System; And For Related Purposes.

1641.title: City of Hattiesburg; extend repealer on Hattiesburg Tourism Commission and hotel/motel tax.
1641.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 878, Local And Private Laws Of 1990, As Last Amended By Chapter 920, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend Until July 1, 2017, The Date Upon Which The Hattiesburg Tourism Commission Is Repealed; To Provide For An Indirect Referendum On The Continuation Of The Levying Of Such Tax; To Require Certain Auditing Of Funds Received As They Relate To The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1643.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
1643.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Mississippi Food Network; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Warren, Washington, Issaquena, Sharkey Community Action Agency, Inc.; We Care Community Services, Inc.; And Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And For Related Purposes.

1644.title: City of Hattiesburg; authorize to impose local sales tax.
1644.description: An Act To Provide For A Tax On Gross Sales Of All Taxable Items Except Hotels, Motels, Beverages, Packaged Liquor, Motor Vehicles, Restaurants, Groceries And Prescription Drugs In The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, To Be Expended By The City Of Hattiesburg To Defray The Costs Of Certain Public Projects In The City; To Provide That Such Tax Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City; To Authorize The City To Use The Proceeds Of The Tax For The Purposes Of Funding Public Projects Of The City; And For Related Purposes.

1645.title: City of Oxford; authorize contributions to Oxford-Lafayette County Economic Development Foundation.
1645.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Oxford-lafayette County Economic Development Foundation For The Next Three Municipal Fiscal Years; And For Related Purposes.

1646.title: Tishomingo County; authorize to make certain contribution to Fellowship Christian Retreat, Inc.
1646.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 918, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tishomingo County, Mississippi, To Make An Annual Allocation To The Fellowship Christian Retreat, Inc., Which Is Formerly Known As The Crow's Neck Environmental Education Center; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Seek Allocations From Certain Counties To Assist In The Operation Of The Retreat; And For Related Purposes.

1647.title: Washington County; extend repealer on Washington County Convention and Visitors Committee and the tourism tax.
1647.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 816, Local And Private Laws Of 1991, As Last Amended By Chapter 944, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend Until July 1, 2017, The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Establishes The Washington County Convention And Visitors Committee And Authorizes A Tax On Hotels, Motels And Restaurants; And For Related Purposes.

1648.title: Suffrage; restore to Donald Jones of Harrison County.
1648.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Donald F. Jones Of Harrison County, Mississippi.

1649.title: City of Madison; establish alternate procedure for municipal code enforcement.
1649.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Madison, Mississippi, To Adopt An Ordinance Establishing A System By Which City Uniformed Law Enforcement Officers And Employees And Other Municipal Employees May By Issuance Of Citation, Summon An Alleged Violator Of Certain Municipal Codes To Appear In Municipal Court; To Provide For A Procedure If An Alleged Violator Does Not Appear In Response To Such Summons; And For Related Purposes.

1650.title: Marshall County; authorize contributions to certain charitable organizations.
1650.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To Charitable Organizations Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1651.title: Mississippi businesses; urge to implement ergonomic practices to protect the health of the state's workforce.
1651.description: A Resolution Urging Mississippi's Businesses And Industries To Help Protect The Health, Well-being And Investment Made In The State's Workforce By Implementing Ergonomic Practices And Programs Proven To Prevent And Relieve Musculoskeletal Disorders.

1652.title: Mr. Calvin C. Cunning; commend and congratulate upon superb public service career for his retirement.
1652.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. Calvin C. Cunning Upon The Special Occasion Of His Retirement After 34 Years Of Outstanding Public Service.

1653.title: Steven R. White; commend upon being named recipient of NCGE's Distinguished Teaching Award.
1653.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. Steven R. White Of The Branch Community Of Morton, Mississippi, And Educator At Rosa Scott School In Madison, Mississippi, Upon Being Named One Of Two Mississippi Recipients Of The National Council For Geographic Education K-12 Distinguished Teaching Award For Excellence In Geography Teaching.

1654.title: Mississippi Home Education Week; designate week of May 12-16,2014, as for observance in Mississippi.
1654.description: A Resolution Recognizing Mississippi's Unwavering Commitment To Education In The Designation Of The Week Of May 12-16, 2014, As Mississippi Home Education Week In The State Of Mississippi.

1763.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2016, The Legislature Shall Meet In Regular Session Once Every Two Years Rather Than Annually; And For Related Purposes.

1764.title: Mississippi Assoc. of Independent Colleges and Universities; declare week of Jan 20-24, 2014 as MAICU Week.
1764.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The Week Of January 20 Through January 24, 2014, As Maicu Week In Honor Of The Member Institutions Of The Mississippi Association Of Independent Colleges And Universities.

1765.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1765.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Sections 140 And 142 And Repealing Section 141 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1766.title: Slavery; issue apology for state's role in.
1766.description: A Concurrent Resolution Apologizing For The Wrongs Of Slavery, And Expressing Regret For Mississippi's Role In Slavery, And Urging Reconciliation.

1767.title: Constitution; amend to require Governor to give Legislature advance notice of extraordinary session.
1767.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 121, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require A Proclamation Which Calls The Legislature Into Extraordinary Session To Be Issued At Least Five Calendar Days Before The Convening Of The Legislature In Extraordinary Session; And For Related Purposes.

1768.title: Constitution; amend to provide for gubernatorial appointment of the State Superintendent of Public Education.
1768.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Gubernatorial Appointment Of The State Superintendent Of Public Education Beginning With The Election Of The Governor At The General Election In 2015.

1769.title: Constitution; amend to authorize metropolitan government.
1769.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Enact General Law And To Permit The Legislature To Enact Local And Private Law Prescribing The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1771.title: Honorable Tobey Bartee; commend and congratulate upon being named President of National Judges Association.
1771.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Honorable Judge Tobey Bartee Upon Being Named President Of The National Judges Association For The 2014 Term.

1772.title: Camille Scales Young; commend upon selection as the first female African-American President of the MSU Nat'l Alumni Association.
1772.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mrs. Camille Scales Young Upon Being Selected The First African-american Female President Of The Mississippi State University National Alumni Association.

1774.title: Constitution; amend to change day of November election for statewide officers from Tuesday to Saturday.
1774.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 102, Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Change The Day On Which The Election Of Statewide Officers Occurs From The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November, Beginning In 2015.

1775.title: Constitution; amend to require actual cause or physical evidence before a search warrant is issued.
1775.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 23, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Search Warrant Shall Only Be Issued For Actual Cause Or Physical Evidence Instead Of Probable Cause; And For Related Purposes.

1776.title: Joint session; call to hear State of the State address of Governor Phil Bryant.
1776.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1777.title: Constitution; amend to change day of general election for state and county officers from Tuesday to Saturday.
1777.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 102, Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Change The Day Of The General Election For State And County Elected Officers From The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November, Beginning In 2015.

1778.title: Mississippi Chapter of the American Academy of Pediatrics; congratulate on occasion of its 80th anniversary.
1778.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Recognizing The Accomplishments Of The Mississippi Chapter Of The American Academy Of Pediatrics And Congratulating The Academy On The Most Auspicious Occasion Of Its 80th Anniversary Of Serving As The State's Professional Organization Of Pediatricians To Be Acknowledged On March 25, 2014.

1779.title: Constitution; revise voter initiative procedure to conform signature requirements to number of exiting congressional districts.
1779.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 273, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Relates To The Power Of The People To Enact Constitutional Amendments By Initiative, To Conform The Maximum Percentage Of The Number Of Signatures Of Qualified Electors Allowed From Any Single Congressional District To The Percentage That The District Represents In Relation To The Total Number Of Congressional Districts; And For Related Purposes.

1780.title: Jeff Bates; acknowledge and commend success of as a country music artist.
1780.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Country Music Artist Extraordinaire Jeffery Wayne "jeff" Bates Of Bunker Hill, Mississippi, Upon His Achievements And Success In The Music Industry.

1781.title: Memorial Hospital; commend and congratulate on receiving Nations Best Hospital Ranking by U.S. News & World Report.
1781.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Memorial Hospital At Gulfport, Mississippi, Upon Receiving National Ranking As Best Hospital In The State Of Mississippi By U.s. News & World Report.

1782.title: Parental rights; State of Mississippi recognizes.
1782.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Parental Rights.

1783.title: Constitution; establish legal holidays of African American Day and of Women's Day.
1783.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Establish Two Legal Holidays In The Constitution, In Addition To Those Which May Be Provided By The Legislature In General Law; To Designate The Last Day Of February As "african American Day" And August 26 As "women's Day"; And For Related Purposes.

1784.title: State sovereignty; affirm sovereignty of the State of Mississippi under the 10th Amendment of U.S. Constitution.
1784.description: A Concurrent Resolution Affirming The Sovereignty Of The People Of The State Of Mississippi Under The Tenth Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Over All Powers Not Otherwise Delegated To The Federal Government By The Constitution Of The United States.

1785.title: Constitution; corporation shall not have any right or privilege not granted to the people or an individual person.
1785.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 32, 181, 182 And 199, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Corporation Shall Not Have Any Right Or Privilege Granted To The People Or To An Individual Person; To Provide That A Corporation Shall Not Receive A Property Or Income Tax Credit, Deduction Or Exemption That Is Not Allowed To An Individual Person; And For Related Purposes.

1786.title: Constitution; amend to provide that minimum age to serve in the Mississippi House of Representatives is 18 years.
1786.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 41, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives From 21 Years To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1787.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the minimum age to serve in Mississippi State Senate is 18 years.
1787.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 42, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi State Senate From 25 To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1788.title: U.S. Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend 5th Amendment relative to double jeopardy.
1788.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To The Double Jeopardy Clause Of The Fifth Amendment And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1789.title: Congress; urge to amend U.S. Constitution to prohibit corporations from having certain rights.
1789.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States To Abolish The Concept Of Corporate Personhood And Urging The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1790.title: Constitution; amend to revise disposition of criminal fines and forfeitures.
1790.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 261, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Legislature May By General Law Designate The Use Of Criminal Fines And Forfeitures; And For Related Purposes.

1791.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit state or local government from compelling a person to purchase certain health insurance products.
1791.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Creating A New Section To Prohibit State Or Local Government From Compelling A Person To Purchase A Health Insurance Product That Contains A Part That The Person Can Never Use Because Of His Permanent Condition Or Circumstance, Or That Includes Mandatory Coverage For A Specific Condition Or Disease If The Person Is Not Anatomically Capable Of Being In That Condition Or Having That Disease; And For Related Purposes.

1792.title: Constitution; provide that defense of double jeopardy shall not be available to person accused of killing unarmed person.
1792.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 22, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Defense Of Double Jeopardy, Which Protects A Person Against A Second Prosecution For The Same Offense After Acquittal Or Conviction And Against Multiple Punishments For The Same Offense, Shall Not Be An Available Defense To Any Person Who Is Accused Of Killing An Unarmed Person; And For Related Purposes.

1793.title: Constitution; amend to provide for a state university system state board of governors and local board of trustees.
1793.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Clarify That The Legislature Shall Make Adequate Provision By Law For The Establishment, Maintenance And Operation Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For A State University System Comprised Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Establish A System Of Governance For The State University System Of Mississippi; To Provide For A Board Of Governors For The Management Of The State University System Comprised Of The Membership Of The Present Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Board Of Governors Of The State University System; To Provide For Local Boards Of Trustees For The Administration Of Each University In The State University System; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Local Boards Of Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

1794.title: Constitution; amend to extend searches and seizures protection to electronic communications and data.
1794.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 23, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Clarify That The Right Against Unreasonable Searches And Seizures Extends To Electronic Communications And Data; And For Related Purposes.

1795.title: Mississippi Children's Home Services Recognition Day; designate January 29, 2014, as.
1795.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing January 29, 2014, As Mississippi Children's Home Services Recognition Day.

1796.title: Rev. John Taylor, Jr.; commend on service to the community.
1796.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Reverend John Taylor, Jr., Upon His Outstanding Community Service.

1797.title: MS Association of Parliamentarians; congratulate on 5th anniversary as a chartered division of NAP.
1797.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mississippi Association Of Parliamentarians On The Occasion Of Its Fifth Anniversary As A Chartered Division Of The National Association Of Parliamentarians, And To Designate The Month Of April 2014 As National Parliamentary Law Month In The State Of Mississippi.

1798.title: Clara School; commend resilience and community involvement in rebuilding efforts.
1798.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Resilience Of The Administration, Faculty, Staff And Students Of Clara School And The Concerted Efforts Of The Citizens Of Wayne County To Rebuild The School In The Wake Of Destruction By An Act Of Arson.

1799.title: Tennessee Valley Authority; commend and congratulate on the occasion of its 80th anniversary.
1799.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Reputable Service And Community Engagement Of The Tennessee Valley Authority And Congratulating Its Enduring History Of Professionalism On The Occasion Of Celebrating Its 80th Anniversary.

1800.title: Paige Nicholson; commend and congratulate upon being crowned Miss Rodeo America 2014.
1800.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Miss Rodeo Mississippi 2013, Paige Nicholson, Upon Receiving The Distinct Honor And Privilege Of Being Crowned With The Prestigious Title Of Miss Rodeo America 2014.

1801.title: French Camp Academy Football Team; commend and congratulate upon winning MHSAA Class 1A State Championship.
1801.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The French Camp Academy Panthers Football Team And Coach Nathan Wright For Their First-ever Mhsaa Class 1a State Championship.

1802.title: East Mississippi Community College Football Team; commend and congratulate upon winning NJCAA National Championship.
1802.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The East Mississippi Community College Lions Football Team And Coach Of The Year Buddy Stephens For Winning Their Second Njcaa National Championship In Three Years And Number One Ranking In The Final National Junior College Athletic Association Poll.

1803.title: Dr. Garland "Bo" Holloman; acknowledge and commend contribution to the advancement of medicine in the state.
1803.description: A Concurrent Resolution Saluting And Congratulating University Of Mississippi Medical Center's Dr. Garland "bo" Holloman For His Contributions To The Advancement Of Medicine And The Preservation Of The Lives Of Mississippians.

1804.title: "Wereth Eleven"; commend soldiers who were massacred during the Battle of the Bulge.
1804.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing Official Recognition Of The Massacre And Posthumous Honor Of The 11 African-american Soldiers Of The 333rd Field Artillery Battalion Of The United States Army, Three Of Whom Were Mississippians, Historically Known As The "wereth 11," Who Had Been Captured In Wereth, Belgium, During The Battle Of The Bulge On December 17, 1944.

1805.title: U.S. Constitution; urge Congress to propose "Regulation Freedom" amendment to.
1805.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Congress Of The United States To Propose An Amendment Known As The "regulation Freedom Amendment" To The Constitution Of The United States.

1808.title: Biggert-Waters Act of 2012; request Congress to repeal certain provisions and declare certain effects of as a taking.
1808.description: A Concurrent Resolution Opposing The Biggert-waters Flood Insurance Reform Act Of 2012 And Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Repeal Provisions Of The Act That Result In An Increase Of Flood Insurance Rates And Request That Dramatic Increases In Flood Insurance Rates Due To The Act Be Considered A Regulatory Or Constructive Taking Requiring Just Compensation To The Property Owner.

1809.title: Deloris Christina Brown Orey; commemorate life, legacy and distinguished service of as an unsung heroine of civil rights upon her passing.
1809.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss, Commemorating The Life, Legacy And Esteemed And Distinguished Service Of Unsung Mississippi Civil Rights Heroine And Icon, Mrs. Delores Christina Brown Orey, And Expressing Sincere Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1811.title: Dexter Allen; commend musical artistry and success as Blues Musician.
1811.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Blues Artist Extraordinaire Dexter Allen Of Crystal Springs, Mississippi, Upon His Achievements And Success In The Music Industry.

1812.title: Greene County High School Cheerleading Squad; commend upon winning state championship.
1812.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Greene County High School Wildcats Cheerleading Team And Coach Misti Rounsaville For Winning The 2013 Mississippi High School Activities Association Small/non-tumbling Division Ii State Cheerleading Championship.

1814.title: Simpson County Academy Cougars Football Team; commend on winning MAIS Class 2A State Championship.
1814.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2013 Simpson County Academy Cougars Football Team And Head Coach Winston Mullins For Winning The Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools Class 2a State Championship.

1815.title: Dr. Gerry Cadenhead Fletcher; commend life and contributions to nursing and health care of.
1815.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Contributions To Nursing And Health Care Of Dr. Gerry Cadenhead Fletcher.

1816.title: Chelsea Kaitlin Rick; commend and congratulate upon being crowned Miss Mississippi 2013.
1816.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Chelsea Kaitlin Rick Of Fulton, Mississippi, Upon Being Crowned Miss Mississippi 2013.

1817.title: U.S. Constitution; application to Congress for calling a convention to propose federal balanced budget amendment.
1817.description: A Concurrent Resolution Making Renewed Application To The Congress Of The United States To Call For A Convention For The Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Requiring A Balanced Budget And Other Fiscal Restraints And Urging The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress For The Calling Of A Convention For Such Purpose.

1818.title: Ray Guy; commend and congratulate upon his election to the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2014.
1818.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To Celebrated University Of Southern Mississippi Golden Eagles Punter Ray Guy Upon His Election To The Pro Football Hall Of Fame Class Of 2014.

1819.title: Mr. Shawn Randolph "Randy" Houser; commend for many achievements as an award-winning country singer and songwriter.
1819.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Acclaimed Country Music Artist And Native Mississippian, Shawn Randolph "randy" Houser, For His Many Achievements As A Singer And Songwriter, And Extend Best Wishes For Many More Years Of Success.

1821.title: Bay Creek Baptist Church; commend historical legacy upon the occasion of its 118th anniversary.
1821.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Bay Creek Baptist Church Upon The Occasion Of Its Historic Anniversary, Acknowledging The Celebration Of 118 Years Of Devout Faith And Spiritual Excellence.

1822.title: Mr. Douglas Harrington, Sr.; commend life and service upon his passing.
1822.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Douglas F. Harrington, Sr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1823.title: Marc Poole; commend on being selected Instructor of the Year at Jackson Co. Campus on MS Gulf Coast Community College.
1823.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Marc Poole On Being Named Instructor Of The Year At The Jackson County Campus Of Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1825.title: Robin Lyons; commend on being selected Instructor of the Year at the Perkinston Campus of MS Gulf Coast Community College.
1825.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ms. Robin Lyons On Being Named Instructor Of The Year At The Perkinston Campus Of Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1826.title: Dr. Kelly Rouse, commend on being selected Instructor of the Year at the Jefferson Davis Campus of MS Gulf Coast Community College.
1826.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. Kelly Rouse On Being Named Instructor Of The Year At The Jefferson Davis Campus Of Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1827.title: Ms. Taylor Beverly; commend upon breaking NCAA Division II Career scoring record for the Univ. of Montevallo Falcons Women's Basketball Team.
1827.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Athleticism And Spirit Of Sportsmanship Of Brandon, Mississippi Native, Ms. Taylor Beverly, And Congratulating Her Upon The Iconic Accomplishment Of Breaking The Ncaa Division Ii Career Scoring Record For The University Of Montevallo Falcons Women's Basketball Team.

1829.title: Mr. Irwin F. Edenzon; commend and congratulate upon the occasion of his retirement from Ingalls Shipbuilding.
1829.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Exemplary Leadership And Service Mr. Irwin F. Edenzon Provided As Corporate Vice President Of Huntington Ingalls Industries And President Of Ingalls Shipbuilding Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1830.title: Wilton Jackson; congratulate upon selection as USA Today Collegiate Correspondent.
1830.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating And Commending Mr. Wilton Charles Jackson, Ii, Upon Being Selected As A Usa Today Collegiate Correspondent.

1832.title: Dollhouse Dance Factory & Dianna Williams; commend on landing reality TV show Bring It!.
1832.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Jackson's Dollhouse Dance Factory And Owner Dianna Williams On Landing The Reality Tv Series Bring It! On The Lifetime Television Network.

1833.title: John Furniss Bondurant; commend life and legacy of.
1833.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of John Furniss Bondurant Of Forest, Mississippi, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1834.title: Dean Jim Rosenblatt; commend on retirement as Dean of Mississipppi College School of Law.
1834.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mississippi College School Of Law Dean Jim Rosenblatt On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1835.title: Sgt. Kevin Gale Stauffer, Jr.; commend the life, service and legacy of upon his passing.
1835.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Distinguished Legacy Of Public Service Of Sergeant Kevin Gale Stauffer, Jr., Of The Tupelo Police Department And Expressing The Deepest And Most Solemn Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1836.title: Blackwood Brothers Quartet; commend musical accomplishments of in observance of Choctaw County Homecoming.
1836.description: A Concurrent Resolution Celebrating The Musical Accomplishments And The Homecoming Of Nationally Acclaimed Gospel Quartet, The Blackwood Brothers, Upon Their Performance For The Choctaw County Homecoming Concert At Ackerman Baptist Church On Saturday, March 29, 2014.

1837.title: Mr. Tom Kovar; commend and congratulate upon retirement from Chevron Corp.
1837.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Exemplary Leadership And Service Mr. Tom Kovar Provided As General Manager Of Chevron Pascagoula Refinery Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1839.title: Victoria Vivians; commend on stellar high school basketball career.
1839.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Victoria Vivians Upon Her Record-breaking And Stellar High School Basketball Career At Scott Central High School.

1840.title: Simpson County Cougars Basketball Team; commend upon winning MAIS Class AA State Championship.
1840.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Simpson County Academy "cougars" High School Boys Basketball Team And Coach James Crain For Winning The 2013-2014 Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools Class Aa State Championship.

1841.title: Legislature; extend 2014 Regular Session, suspend deadlines for appropriation bills, set date of sine die adjournment.
1841.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The 2014 Regular Session Of The Legislature; Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Permitting The Further Consideration, Filing And Adoption Of Conference Reports On Certain Appropriation Bills; And Setting The Date Of Sine Die Adjournment Of The 2014 Regular Session Of The Legislature.

1842.title: First Baptist Church of Meridian; commend and congratulate on the occasion of its 175th Church Anniversary.
1842.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The First Baptist Church Of Meridian On The Impressive Occasion Of Its 175th Church Anniversary, And Wishing The Church And Its Members Many More Years Of A Rich And Storied Presence In Meridian.

1846.title: Nuclear waste storage; reaffirm Legislature's opposition to within the borders of the State of Mississippi.
1846.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Oppose The Siting Of A High-level Radioactive Waste Repository Within The Borders Of The State Of Mississippi.

1847.title: Alcoholic beverage; revise the definition of qualified resort areas.
1847.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Lower To 200 The Number Of Adjacent Residential Units That Are Necessary For A Clubhouse And The Associated Golf Course To Fall Within The Definition Of "qualified Resort Area" Under The Local Option Law; To Include Certain Bed And Breakfast Inns Within The Definition Of The Term "qualified Resort Area" Under The Local Option Law; And For Related Purposes.

1848.title: Trusty status; offenders convicted of murder or any other crime of violence shall not work at Governor's Mansion.
1848.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-138.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Offender In Trusty Status Who Was Convicted Of Murder Or Any Other Crime Of Violence Shall Not Be Allowed To Participate In Any Program At The Governor's Mansion; And For Related Purposed.

1849.title: Gaming; create statewide lottery to fund Hope College Scholarship Program.
1849.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Create A Trust Fund Into Which A Portion Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited; To Amend Sections 37-106-5, 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

1850.title: Texting; prohibit while driving.
1850.description: An Act To Create Section 63-3-1217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Texting While Driving; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Exemptions; To Repeal Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Texting While Driving By The Holders Of Temporary And Intermediate Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

1851.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act; revise Schedules I and IV.
1851.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add 9 Hallucinogenic Substances To Schedule I Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 41-29-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Lorcaserin To Schedule Iv Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Act; And For Related Purposes.

1853.title: Income tax; public and private hospitals may collect certain debts by a set off against the debtor's refund.
1853.description: An Act To Authorize A Procedure To Allow Public And Private Hospitals To Collect Certain Debts Through A Setoff Against Income Tax Refunds Owed The Debtor; To Provide For Hearing And Appeals In Contested Cases; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Transfer The Income Tax Refunds Of A Debtor To Claimant Hospital For The Purpose Of Satisfying Such Debts; To Amend Section 27-7-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1854.title: Burn bans; allow board of supervisors to provide an exemption for certain persons.
1854.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-19-351, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Boards Of Supervisors To Provide An Exemption To Outdoor Burning Bans For Persons Who Are Certified To Perform Controlled Burns; And For Related Purposes.

1855.title: County supervisors; require adoption of resolution before notifying tax collector of any unpaid garbage fees.
1855.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Adoption Of A Resolution By The Board Of Supervisors Before Notifying The Tax Collector Of Any Unpaid Garbage Fees; And For Related Purposes.

1856.title: Elections; authorize election day voter registration, Internet voter registration and early voting.
1856.description: An Act To Authorize A Person Who Is Not Registered To Vote Or Did Not Register To Vote By The Deadline Otherwise Specified By Law And Who Is Otherwise A Qualified Elector, To Go To The Polling Place For The Precinct In Which Such Person's Residence Is Located On The Day Of A Primary Or Election Or The Registrar's Office And Register To Vote By Completing An Application For Registration As An Elector In This State And By Providing The Poll Manager Or Registrar With One Of The Forms Of Identification A Person Is Required To Present In Order To Vote In Person; To Provide That A Person Who Registers To Vote In Such A Manner Shall Vote By Affidavit Ballot; To Amend Sections 23-15-11, 23-15-39 And 23-15-573, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize Persons Eligible To Vote In This State To Submit Voter Registration Applications Through A Secure Internet Website Established By The Secretary Of State; To Allow Persons Who Are Registered To Vote To Update Their Voter Registration Information Using Such Website; To Provide That The Secretary Of State Shall Forward The Application And Any Additional Information Received To The Registrar Of The County In Which The Applicant Currently Resides; To Provide Procedures By Which The County Registrar Shall Process Such Applications; To Authorize A Qualified Elector To Vote Early Not More Than 21 Days Nor Less Than 5 Days Before The Date Of An Election; To Provide That Early Voting May Be Conducted In The Registrar's Office Or At A Location Designated By The Board Of Supervisors; To Require A Person Who Desires To Vote Early To Appear At The Registrar's Office Or Location Designated By The Board Of Supervisors And To Provide That After Signing The Receipt Book Such Person Shall Be Entitled To Vote At The Registrar's Office Or At The Location Designated By The Registrar During The Early Voting Period In The Same Manner As He Would At His Voting Precinct On The Day Of The Election; To Provide That The Election Laws That Govern Procedures For A Person Who Appears To Vote On The Day Of Election Shall Apply When A Person Appears To Vote During The Early Voting Period; To Provide That All Votes Cast During The Early Voting Period Shall Be Final; To Provide That The Votes Cast During Early Voting Shall Be Announced Simultaneously With The Vote Cast On Election Day; To Provide That Each Candidate Shall Have The Right To Be Present At The Registrar's Office And To Challenge The Qualifications Of Any Person Offering To Vote Early In The Same Manner As Provided By Law At The Polling Place On The Day Of The Election; To Require The Secretary Of State To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Necessary To Effectuate Early Voting; To Amend Sections 23-15-195, 23-15-353 And 23-15-653, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Sections 23-15-627, 23-15-637, 23-15-641, 23-15-713 And 23-15-715, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Voters May Not Cast Absentee Ballots At The Office Of The Registrar During The Early Voting Period; And For Related Purposes.

1857.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tags; extend time for requirements to be met to issue for supporters of Boys and Girls Clubs.
1857.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend Until July 1, 2017, The Period Of Time That The Requirements For The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The Boys And Girls Club Must Be Met; And For Related Purposes.

1858.title: Juvenile justice; centralized control of housing of juvenile offenders.
1858.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-323, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Over Monitoring Of Juvenile Offenders Housing By Recreating The Monitoring Unit As A Function Of The Division Of Youth Services Of The Department Of Human Services; And For Related Purposes.

1859.title: Assault; revise list of victims triggering enhanced penalty.
1859.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Personnel Triggering An Enhanced Penalty Under The Offenses Of Simple And Aggravated Assault; And For Related Purposes.

1860.title: Delinquency; revise disposition alternatives.
1860.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Disposition Alternatives Under The Youth Court Act And To Allow For Reduction In The Time Of Notice To The Committing Court Of A Child's Release If The Release Is To Manage The Facility Population; And For Related Purposes.

1861.title: State Department of Health; extend repealers.
1861.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 41-3-1.1, 41-3-3, 41-3-4, 41-3-5.1, 41-3-6, 41-3-16, 41-3-17, 41-3-18 And 41-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The State Board Of Health, Establish The Position Of Executive Officer Of The State Department Of Health And Establish The State Department Of Health And Prescribe Its Powers And Duties; To Amend Section 41-3-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Fee For Reviewing Applications For Certificates Of Need; To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On Certain Requirements For The Operation And Licensure Of Personal Care Homes In The State Of Mississippi; To Amend Section 41-3-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On Those Statutes Which Create The State Board Of Health, Establish The Position Of Executive Officer Of The State Department Of Health And Establish The State Department Of Health And Prescribe Its Powers And Duties; To Provide For Annual Health Action Plans Prepared By The State Department Of Health; To Provide For A Diabetes Annual Action Plan; To Provide For An Obesity Annual Action Plan; To Provide For The Preparation And Submission Requirements; To Provide For The Required Content Of The Action Plans To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Accept Grants To Implement This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1862.title: Generation and transmission electric power associations; authorize to undertake economic development activities.
1862.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-5-231, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Any Generation And Transmission Electric Power Association To Undertake Economic Development Activities Whether Directly, Indirectly, Alone Or In Conjunction With Other Entities; And For Related Purposes.

1863.title: Electric power associations; revise procedure to amend the certificate of incorporation.
1863.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-5-215, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedure By Which Any Electric Power Association May Amend Its Certificate Of Incorporation; And For Related Purposes.

1864.title: Electric power associations; allow corporate name to include words "electric cooperative."
1864.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-5-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Name Of A Corporation Under The Electric Power Association Law Shall Include The Words "electric Power Association" Or "electric Cooperative"; To Amend Section 77-5-209, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of The Words "electric Cooperative" In The Corporate Name Of Any Corporation Other Than Those Formed Pursuant To The Provisions Of This Article; And For Related Purposes.

1865.title: Habitual offenders; revise offenses triggering sentencing as.
1865.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Offenses That Trigger Imposition Of Sentence Under The Habitual Offenders Law; And For Related Purposes.

1866.title: Indictment; when becomes public record.
1866.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify At What Point An Indictment Becomes Public Record; And For Related Purposes.

1867.title: Electric power associations; bylaws may allow members to vote electronically.
1867.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-5-227, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Bylaws Of Electric Power Associations May Allow Members To Vote Electronically; And For Related Purposes.

1869.title: Job tax credit; authorize for entities that conduct certain warehousing activities.
1869.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Entities That Perform Certain Warehousing Activities Within The Business Enterprises That Are Eligible For The Job Tax Credit; To Provide That Credits Generated For Such Entities Shall Offset The Income Of The Entity Based On An Apportioned Ratio Of Payroll For Warehouse Employees Of The Entity To Total Mississippi Payroll Of The Entity That Includes The Payroll Of Retail Employees Of The Entity; And For Related Purposes.

1873.title: Mississippi Civic Literacy Act; enact.
1873.description: An Act To Enact The Mississippi Civic Literacy Act; To Require The Teaching Of The Nation's Founding And Related Documents During The High School Years; To Require The State Department Of Education To Submit An Annual Report To The Governor And Legislature On The Effectiveness Of The Curriculum On Civic Literacy; And For Related Purposes.

1874.title: Mandatory student physical education requirements; provide teacher and administrator licensure suspension if not followed.
1874.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-134, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Teacher And School Administrator Licensure Suspension In Any School Wherein Mandatory Student Physical Activity Requirements Are Not Being Followed; And For Related Purposes.

1875.title: Veterans Treatment Courts; authorize formation.
1875.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Veterans Treatment Court Act; To Make A Statement Of Legislative Intent And Purpose; To Authorize Creation Of A Veterans Treatment Court Program By The Circuit Courts; To Provide Conditions For Eligibility For Participation In A Program; To Task The Administrative Office Of Courts With Supervisory Responsibility Under The Act; To Require The State Drug Court Advisory Committee With The Responsibility To Develop Statewide Rules And Policies For Veterans Treatment Courts; To Create The Veterans Treatment Courts Funds; To Provide For Immunity Of The Staff Members Of Veterans Treatment Courts For Their Good-faith Acts; And For Related Purposes.

1876.title: Keyaurdra's Law; require unique identifying mark on bullet casings.
1876.description: An Act To Be Known As Keyaurdra's Law; To Create New Section 97-37-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That All Center-fire Pistol And Rifle Cartridges Sold In Mississippi Bear A Unique Identifying Mark; To Require Sellers Of Ammunition To Keep Records As To The Purchaser Of Such Ammunition By Serial Number Or Other Unique Identifying Mark; And For Related Purposes.

1877.title: Absentee ballot; require to be placed in an unmarked envelope inside the envelope containing affidavits to ensure ballot secrecy.
1877.description: An Act To Amend Sections 23-15-631, 23-15-635, 23-15-639, 23-15-719 And 23-15-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Absentee Ballots Be Placed In An Unmarked Envelope Inside The Envelope Upon Which The Required Affidavits Are Printed In Order To Ensure Secrecy Of The Ballot; To Revise The Procedures For Handling Absentee Ballots To Conform To This Requirement; And For Related Purposes.
