1878.title: Local governments; authorize to reimburse an insured's deductible for automobile insurance coverage claim if protected by immunity.
1878.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-3-41 And 21-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties And Municipalities To Reimburse The Cost Of An Insured's Deductible For An Automobile Insurance Coverage Claim, If The Claim Has Been Paid For Damages To The Insured's Property Arising From The Negligence Of A Duly Authorized Officer, Agent, Servant, Attorney Or Employee Of The County Or Municipality In The Performance Of His Or Her Official Duties, And The Officer, Agent, Servant, Attorney Or Employee Owning Or Operating The Motor Vehicle Is Protected By Immunity Under The Mississippi Tort Claims Act; And For Related Purposes.

1879.title: MDOC; may incarcerate additional offenders in county and regional correctional facilities.
1879.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Incarcerate Additional Offenders At County And Regional Correctional Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1880.title: Employment First Act; require state agencies to give priority to persons with disabilities.
1880.description: An Act To Create The "employment First Act"; To Require That State Agencies That Provide Services And Support To Persons With Disabilities Shall Consider, As Their First Option, Competitive Employment In An Integrated Setting For Persons With Disabilities; To Require All State Agencies To Follow This Policy For Employment By Coordinating All Collaborating Efforts Among Agencies; To Authorize State Agencies To Adopt Rules And Regulations To Implement The Act; To Establish An Employment First Oversight Commission Which Shall Review Measurable Goals And Objectives As Submitted To It By Each Relevant State Agency To Ensure Implementation Of The Act; To Provide Reporting Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

1881.title: Suffrage; restore to Michael Todd Manual of Rankin County, Mississippi.
1881.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Michael Todd Manual Of Rankin County, Mississippi.

1882.title: Slow Down To Get Around Law; revise to include sanitation vehicles.
1882.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-809, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Motor Vehicle Operators To Perform Certain Traffic Safety Maneuvers When Approaching A Stationary Sanitation Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

1883.title: Elections; Secretary of State shall conduct a study on the feasibility of allowing students to vote via the Internet.
1883.description: An Act To Require The Secretary Of State To Conduct A Study On The Feasibility Of Allowing Students Who Are Registered Voters Who Are Attending School Outside The County In Which They Are Registered, To Vote In Any Election Held In This State From The Location Where They Are Attending School Through The Use Of The Internet; And For Related Purposes.

1884.title: Legislative Internship Program; authorize IHL to administer under certain conditions.
1884.description: An Act To Establish A Legislative Internship Program To Allow Third-year Students At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning To Work For Members Of The Senate Or House Of Representatives And Receive Academic Credit; To Provide Certain Conditions On This Program; And For Related Purposes.

1885.title: Child support; arrearage not pursued absent proof of nonpayment.
1885.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-19-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow An Absent Parent The Opportunity To Prove That Child Support Is Current Before The Department Of Human Services Can Open A Case Against The Absent Parent For An Alleged Arrearage; And For Related Purposes.

1886.title: SREB contract program at out-of-state college of optometry; students not required to practice in Mississippi.
1886.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-135-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Participating In The Southern Regional Education Board (sreb) Contract Program At Any College Of Optometry Outside Of The State Shall Not Be Required To Return To The State Of Mississippi To Practice After Graduation; And For Related Purposes.

1887.title: MS Eminent Scholars Grant Program; add eligibility requirements for students who earn college credits at out-of-state schools.
1887.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Eligibility Requirements Under The Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant Program For Students Who Earn Postsecondary Credits At An Out-of-state Institution Of Higher Learning; To Require Those Students To Maintain A 3.5 Gpa On All Credit Hours Earned At The Out-of-state Institution Of Higher Learning; To Require Those Students To Earn No More Than 30 Credit Hours At The Out-of-state Institution To Maintain Their Eligibility For Assistance Under The Program; And For Related Purposes.

1888.title: Youth court records; revise confidentiality.
1888.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-261, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Persons And Entities To Whom Youth Court Records Can Be Disclosed By Order Of The Youth Court; And For Related Purposes.

1889.title: Legislature; reduce size beginning with 2015 statewide general election.
1889.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2015 Statewide General Election The Mississippi House Of Representatives Shall Consist Of 70 Members; To Amend Section 5-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2015 Statewide General Election The Mississippi Senate Shall Consist Of 30 Members; And For Related Purposes.

1890.title: Unlawful absences from school; no promotion or graduation if student has accumulated 21 or more absences in preceding school year.
1890.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-16-7 And 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No School District Shall Promote A Compulsory-school-age Student To The Next Grade Level Or Allow Such Student To Graduate If That Student Has Accumulated 21 Or More Unlawful Absences In The Immediately Preceding School Year; To Provide That No School Shall Allow A High School Student To Earn Credit If He Has Accumulated 11 Unlawful Absences; And For Related Purposes.

1891.title: Local school district budgets; require at least 75% to be expended for instructional purposes.
1891.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2014-2015 School Year The State Board Of Education Shall Require Each School District To Comply With The Financial Accountability And Reporting System Requirement That Not Less Than 75% Of School District Funds Shall Be Expended For Direct Classroom Instructional Cost Purposes; To Amend Sections 37-61-9 And 37-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local School District Budgets To Contain A Detailed Statement Of The Estimated Amounts To Be Expended For Instruction And Other Program Budget Categories, And To Require School District Expenditures To Be Limited By The Said 75% Requirement And To Provide Personal Liability Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

1892.title: Sales taxation; exempt retail sales of school supplies during the last weekend in July.
1892.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Retail Sales Of Certain School Supplies During A Period Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The Last Friday In July And Ending At 12:00 Midnight The Following Saturday; And For Related Purposes.

1893.title: Wildlife; require Commission on Wildlife to issue depredation permits to farmers to use dogs during turkey season to control wild hogs.
1893.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Issue Depredation Permits For Farmers To Use Dogs During Turkey Season For The Control Of Wild Hogs; To Authorize The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Establish The Term Of The Permits; And For Related Purposes.

1894.title: Sex offenders; require lie detector test if victim under 16.
1894.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Sex Offenders Whose Victim Was Under The Age Of 16 Submit To A Polygraph Exam For The Purpose Of Determining If Other Minor Children May Have Been Victims; To Amend Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Definition Of Polygraph Examination; To Amend Section 45-33-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Sex Offender Registrants Whose Victim Was Under The Age Of 16 Submit To A Polygraph Exam Upon Sentencing Or Release On Supervision; To Amend Section 45-33-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Sex Offender Registrants Whose Victim Was Under The Age Of 16 Submit To An Annual Polygraph Exam As Part Of The Reregistration Process; To Amend Section 45-33-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Punishment For Violation Of The Sex Offender Registration Chapter; And For Related Purposes.

1895.title: Assistant DAs; revise number authorized.
1895.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 25-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Number Of Assistant District Attorneys Authorized As Legal Assistants To The District Attorneys For The Various Circuit Court Districts; And For Related Purposes.

1898.title: Tuition-free attendance at any state IHL or community college; authorize for students with at least 3.0 GPA.
1898.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Who Have At Least A 3.0 Grade Point Average In High School And Maintain That Average Shall Be Eligible For A Scholarship Equal To The Full Cost Of Tuition At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College; And For Related Purposes.

1899.title: Retired teachers; may draw retirement benefits and be reemployed as teachers if they have 30 years of creditable service.
1899.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-11-126, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Persons Receiving A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Are Employed As Teachers In The Public School System After Their Retirement, And Certain Persons Employed As Teachers In The Public School System Who Are Eligible To Receive A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System, May Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers In Addition To Receiving A Teacher's Salary; To Provide That Those Persons Shall Not Be Contributing Members Of The Retirement System Nor Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period During Which They Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1900.title: Bonds; authorize for Phase II of construction of a new headquarters building for the Department of Public Safety.
1900.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Phase Ii Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Headquarters Building For The Department Of Public Safety; And For Related Purposes.

1901.title: Driver's license suspension; revise course requirements for alternative sentencing of minor offenders.
1901.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require At Least 4 Hours Of Physical, In-person, Classroom Instruction, Student Workbooks, An Instructor Manual And Qualified Instructors For A Traffic Safety Violator Course Approved By The Court As An Alternative To Conviction For Certain Offenders Who Are Minors In The Control Of A Parent Or Guardian; And For Related Purposes.

1902.title: Adult care facilities; define adult day care facilities for licensure purposes.
1902.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "adult Day Care Facility" For Purposes Of Institutional Licensure By The State Department Of Health; To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Rules, Regulations And Standards Regarding The Operation Of Adult Day Care Facilities Which Incorporate The Most Current Ranges And Levels Of Care Developed By The National Adult Day Services Association (nadsa); To Codify Section 43-11-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees For Adult Day Care Facility Licensure; And For Related Purposes.

1903.title: Home health services; authorize advanced practice nurses and physician assistants to provide to Medicare/Medicaid beneficiaries.
1903.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5, 73-15-20 And 73-26-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Clinical Nurse Specialists, Nurse Practitioners And Physician Assistants May Provide Home Health Services For Medicare Or Medicaid Beneficiaries Consistent With Federal Law; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1904.title: Indecent exposure; revise penalty.
1904.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-29-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty For Indecent Exposure Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

1905.title: Public assistance benefits; require applicants to submit to drug screening and testing to qualify.
1905.description: An Act To Require Adult Applicants For Public Benefits In Mississippi To Submit To Drug-screening And Testing In Order To Be Eligible; To Provide That Any Such Person Whose Test Results Are Positive Regarding The Presence Of Any Unlawful Drug In The Person's System Shall Be Ineligible To Receive Public Assistance For A Period Of Time Based On The Number Of Positive Drug Tests; To Provide Procedures And Exceptions For Such Drug-screening Or Testing; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Willful Violations Of Drug-screening And Testing Requirements; To Make It Unlawful For Any State Agency To Provide Any Public Benefit In Violation Of Drug-screening And Testing Requirements; To Amend Sections 43-13-115, 43-17-1, 71-5-511 And 43-33-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Require The Division Of Medicaid, The Department Of Human Services, The Office Of Employment Security And The Mississippi Housing Authorities To Require Applicants Of Public Assistance Programs To Submit To Drug-screening And Testing As Required Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1906.title: Health care certificate of need; additional services subject to CON review.
1906.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Additional Services Subject To Health Care Certificate Of Need Review; And For Related Purposes.

1910.title: Verification of student attendance; define responsibility of teachers and parents.
1910.description: An Act To Establish State Standards For The Responsibility Of Parents And Schoolteachers To Verify Student Attendance; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Develop School Attendance Plans To Be Implemented By Teachers; And For Related Purposes.

1911.title: Corporation franchise tax law; exclude deferred gains and deferred income from certain computations under.
1911.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-13-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Deferred Gains And Deferred Income From The Computation Of Capital, Paid-in Capital, Surplus And Retained Earnings For Purposes Of The Corporation Franchise Tax Law; To Provide That For Purposes Of The Corporation Franchise Tax Law Capital Shall Be Reduced By The Cost Of Treasury Stock Of The Corporation Regardless Of Whether Such Stock Is Purchased With The Earnings Of The Corporation; And For Related Purposes.

1912.title: Municipalities; extend repeal date on authority to enter agreements to provide extra police protection to housing authorities.
1912.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authority Of A Municipality To Enter Into An Agreement With A Housing Authority To Provide Extra Police Protection To The Housing Authority In Exchange For The Payment Of Compensation Or A Fee To The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

1913.title: Counties and municipalities; extend repeal date on authority to accept credit card payments for judgements, fines and costs.
1913.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-25-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Authority Of Counties And Municipalities To Accept Credit Cards, Charge Cards, Debit Cards And Other Electronic Fund Transfers For Payment Of Government Fees, Costs And Debts; And For Related Purposes.

1914.title: Marine finfish; allow restaurants to serve recreationally caught marine finfish to the persons who caught the fish.
1914.description: An Act To Allow Restaurants To Prepare And Serve Recreationally Caught Marine Finfish To The Person Who Caught The Finfish; And For Related Purposes.

1916.title: Alcoholic beverages; authorize the issuance of permits to sell alcoholic beverage at events held at venues that meet certain criteria.
1916.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Issue Permits That Allow The Holder To Purchase And Resell Alcoholic Beverages During Legal Hours On The License Premises If Food Is Being Served At An Event Held On The Licensed Premises By A Caterer Who Is Not Affiliated With The Permittee; To Provide That Such Permits May Only Be Issued For Venues That Can Accommodate 200 Persons Or More; And For Related Purposes.

1917.title: Freestanding Emergency Center; authorize CON in Lamar County and require licensure.
1917.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define "freestanding Emergency Center" As Being Included In Those Health Care Facilities Requiring A Health Care Certificate Of Need; To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Health Care Certificate Of Need For The Construction Of A Freestanding Emergency Center In Lumberton, Lamar County, Mississippi; To Amend Sections 41-75-1, 41-75-5, 41-75-13 And 41-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A License Issued By The State Department Of Health For The Operation Of A Freestanding Emergency Center; And For Related Purposes.

1918.title: Employment First Act; require state agencies to consider persons with disabilities.
1918.description: An Act To Create The "employment First Act"; To Require That State Agencies That Provide Services And Support To Persons With Disabilities Shall Consider, As Their First Option, Competitive Employment In An Integrated Setting For Persons With Disabilities; To Require All State Agencies To Follow This Policy For Employment By Coordinating All Collaborating Efforts Among Agencies; To Authorize State Agencies To Adopt Rules And Regulations To Implement The Act; To Direct The Disability Resource Commission To Review Measurable Goals And Objectives As Submitted To It By Each Relevant State Agency To Ensure Implementation Of The Act; To Provide Reporting Requirements; To Amend 43-30-1 To Prescribe Specific Responsibilities Of The Mississippi Resource Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1919.title: Sales taxation; sales of aircraft used in oil exploration or production are exempt.
1919.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Aircraft Used Predominately To Transport Passengers Or Property To Offshore Oil Exploration Or Production Platforms Or Vessels, And Engines, Accessories And Spare Parts For Such Aircraft, Are Exempt From Sales Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1921.title: Retirement; limit authority of PERS to interpret personnel polices of a municipality or other political subdivision of the state.
1921.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The Authority Of The Public Employees' Retirement System To Interpret, Limit Or Otherwise Restrict The Power Of The Governing Authority Of A Municipality Or Other Political Subdivision Of The State To Interpret Its Own Personnel Policies Or To Have The Policies Interpreted By A Court Of Competent Jurisdiction; And For Related Purposes.

1922.title: Motor vehicle privilege tax; increase the period of time within which a newly acquired motor vehicle must be registered.
1922.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From 7 Working Days To 14 Business Days The Period Of Time Within Which A Newly Acquired Motor Vehicle Must Be Registered; To Amend Sections 27-19-40, 27-19-141 And Section 63-21-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1923.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of Beauvior.
1923.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Beauvoir, The Last Home Of Jefferson Davis And Presidential Library; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1924.title: Public Procurement Review Board approve parking leases; delete repealers.
1924.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-104-7, 29-5-2 And 31-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Automatic Repealers On Provisions Relating To The Authority Of The Public Procurement Review Board To Approve State Agency Parking Leases; To Further Amend Section 29-5-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Enter Into Contracts Or Rental Agreements For The Use Of A Limited Amount Of Space In The Robert G. Clark, Jr. Building To Certain Private Vendors; And For Related Purposes.

1925.title: Distinctive license tags; reduce number of Rotary International tags required to be presold in order to be issued.
1925.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce To 200 The Number Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of Rotary International Required To Be Sold Prior To The Preparation And Issuance Of Such Tags By The Department Of Revenue; To Amend Section 27-19-56.108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend Until July 1, 2015, The Deadline For Selling The Number Of Tags Required For The Preparation And Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of Rotary International; And For Related Purposes.

1926.title: Distinguished Flying Cross, Air Medal and the Bronze Star motor vehicle tags; exempt from vehicle registration fees and taxes.
1926.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-19-56.13 And 27-19-56.62, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Authorized To Be Issued To Recipients Of The Distinguished Flying Cross, The Air Medal And The Bronze Star Shall Be Exempt From All Motor Vehicle Registration Fees And Privilege Taxes; To Provide That The Surviving Spouse Of A Deceased Person Who Was Issued Such A License Plate Or Tag Shall Be Entitled To Apply For Or Retain Such A License Plate Or Tag Issued Under This Section And May Continue Annually To Renew Registration For One Such Motor Vehicle License Plate Or Tag For As Long As The Spouse Remains Unremarried; To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Certain Motor Vehicles Owned By; And For Related Purposes.

1927.title: Ad valorem tax; authorize a credit for homeowners required to purchase flood insurance.
1927.description: An Act To Authorize An Ad Valorem Tax Credit For Homeowners Who Are Required To Purchase Flood Insurance On Their Homes Pursuant To Federal Law Or As A Condition Of Securing A Loan; And For Related Purposes.

1928.title: Municipal special sales tax; remove requirement that cities appoint a commission to establish a master plan for expenditures.
1928.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-241, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Levy Of A Municipal Special Sales Tax In Certain Municipalities, To Remove The Provisions That Require A Municipality To Appoint A Commission To, With Input From The Municipality, Establish A Master Plan For Road And Street Repair, Reconstruction And Resurfacing Projects And Water, Sewer And Drainage Projects, That Require Expenditures Of The Revenue From The Special Tax To Comply With The Master Plan, And That Require The Commission To Monitor The Compliance Of The Municipality With The Master Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1929.title: Charitable solicitation; revise reporting period.
1929.description: An Act To Amend Sections 79-11-507, 79-11-513, 79-11-515 And 79-11-517, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Reporting Period Applying To The Filing Of Financial Statements By Charitable Organizations That Solicit Donations; And For Related Purposes.

1930.title: State employees; authorize use of earned medical leave for adoption and foster care placement.
1930.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize State Employees To Use Earned Major Medical Leave For Adoption Or Foster Care Placement; And For Related Purposes.

1931.title: Antlered deer; all of bag limit for hunters 75 or older may be any antlered deer.
1931.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Hunters 75 Years Of Age Or Older, All Of The Three Antlered Deer Bag Limit May Be Any Antlered Deer; And For Related Purposes.

1932.title: Community colleges; county tax collectors shall transmit certain tax revenue directly to community college districts.
1932.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-29-143, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Tax Collector Of Each County Belonging To A Junior College District And Collecting Taxes For The Support And Maintenance Thereof Shall Transmit The Tax Revenues Directly To The Community College District; And For Related Purposes.

1934.title: Payment of teacher salaries; standard contract shall fix monthly installments.
1934.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Standard Teacher Contract Prescribed By The State Board Of Education Shall Provide That Licensed Employees Shall Earn A Salary Payable In Equal Installments Beginning In The First Month Of Employment And To Clarify The Daily Rate Of Pay Earned By A Licensed Employee; And For Related Purposes.

1935.title: State textbook funds; authorize local school board to petition for purchase of trade books.
1935.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-43-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "trade Book" For Purposes Of The State Textbook Purchasing Law; To Amend Section 37-43-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Local School Boards To Petition The State Board Of Education For Permission To Purchase Trade Books With State Textbook Funds In Order To Provide Students With Vocabulary Development, Literacy Development And Motivation; And For Related Purposes.

1936.title: Payroll date for school district employees; authorize semimonthly payroll in discretion of local school board.
1936.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-151-103 And 37-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 71, 2014 Regular Session, To Authorize School Districts To Process A Semimonthly Or A Monthly Payroll For Nonlicensed Employees, In The Discretion Of The Local School Board; And For Related Purposes.

1937.title: Mississippi Adequate Education Program; phase out hold harmless provision.
1937.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The Hold Harmless Provision In The Mississippi Adequate Education Program Over A Four-year Period; And For Related Purposes.

1938.title: Dyslexia therapy scholarship program for students with dyslexia; revise definitions.
1938.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-173-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definitions Of "dyslexia Therapy" And "dyslexia Therapist" For Purposes Of The Scholarship Program For Students With Dyslexia; To Amend Section 37-173-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Screening For The Program In Either Spring Of The Student's Kindergarten Year Or In The Fall Of The Student's First Grade Year, And To Prescribe The Credentials Of Speech-language Pathologists Who May Conduct Dyslexia Evaluations In The Program; And For Related Purposes.

1939.title: CPR training; require instruction in high school physical education class.
1939.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education, With The Assistance Of The State Board Of Health, To Promulgate Regulations To Require Training In Cpr And The Use Of The Automated External Defibrillator For High School Students In Physical Education Class; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Require School Districts And Private Schools To Comply With Cpr Requirements Beginning With The 2014-2015 School Year; And For Related Purposes.

1940.title: Student athletes; require automated external defibrillators on high school grounds, cardiac screening and AED training.
1940.description: An Act Relating To Automated External Defibrillators; To Require Public And Private High Schools To Have A Defibrillator On The School Grounds; To Encourage Public And Private Partnerships To Cover Certain Costs Associated With Defibrillators; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Regulations To Require Preventative Cardiac Screening Of Student Athletes And To Mandate That Coaches Receive Training In Cpr And The Use Of An Automated External Defibrillator; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Require School Districts And Private Schools To Comply With Cardiac Screening Requirements Beginning With The 2014-2015 School Year; And For Related Purposes.

1941.title: School board members elected in all districts; superintendents appointed after January 1, 2016.
1941.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected From Special Trustee Election Districts By The Qualified Electors Of Such District Beginning With The Municipal Elections In The Year 2017; To Provide That Such Election Shall Be Held Every Four Years In The Same Manner As Elections Are Held For Other Municipal Officers; To Provide That The Local School Board Shall Apportion The New Trustee Election Districts; To Amend Section 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected In The Same Manner As Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts; To Amend Sections 37-5-9, 37-7-211 And 37-7-711, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Uniform Number Of Signatures On Petitions Of Nomination To Run For The Office Of Elected School Board And To Require Petitions To Be Filed At Least 60 Days Prior To The Election; To Repeal Sections 37-7-209 Through 37-7-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Electing Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts From Added Territory; To Repeal Sections 37-7-705 Through 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Selecting Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts; To Amend Section 37-9-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of All Superintendents Of Schools From And After January 1, 2016, Unless The Incumbent County Superintendent Of Education Chooses To Seek Reelection; To Amend Sections 37-5-61, 37-5-71 And 37-9-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 37-9-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Elective Method Of Choosing The County Superintendent Of Education; To Repeal Sections 37-5-63 Through 37-5-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Election Of County Superintendents Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

1942.title: Child Witness Bill of Rights; create.
1942.description: An Act To Create New Section 99-43-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Child Witness Bill Of Rights In Order To Grant Appropriate Accommodations To Children Testifying In Court; And For Related Purposes.

1943.title: Off-road vehicles; prohibit on public streets.
1943.description: An Act To Create New Section 63-3-1217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Operation Of Off-road Vehicles On The Public Streets, Roads, Highways And Alleys Of This State; And For Related Purposes.

1944.title: Criminal convictions; revise certain fees and assessments.
1944.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Correction To The Filing Fee Charged By The Circuit Clerk For An Expunction; To Bring Forward Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1945.title: Motorcycles; children under 16 not allowed as passengers.
1945.description: An Act To Create New Section 63-3-1217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Passengers Under The Age Of 16 On Motorcycles; And For Related Purposes.

1946.title: Concealed weapon; permits; revise certain training requirements.
1946.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Honorably Discharged Members Of The Military From Certain Training Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

1947.title: Motor vehicle license plates; persons issued antique motor vehicle plates may be issued a refund in certain cases.
1947.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Taxpayer Who Sells, Trades Or Otherwise Disposes Of A Motor Vehicle, Surrenders The License Plate For Such Vehicle And Is Issued An Antique Automobile Plate Or An Antique Pickup Truck Plate At The Time Of Surrender, May Elect To Receive A Refund Of The Taxes Paid For The Remaining Tax Year On The Vehicle Sold, Traded Or Otherwise Disposed Of; To Provide That If The Seller Or Transferor Of A Motor Vehicle Is Eligible For A Credit At The Time He Surrenders A License Plate, Elects To Be Issued A Certificate Of Credit For The Taxes Paid For The Remaining Tax Year On The Vehicle Sold, Traded Or Otherwise Disposed Of, And Is Later Issued An Antique Automobile Plate Or An Antique Pickup Truck Plate, The Seller Or Transferor May Elect To Receive A Refund In The Amount Of The Certificate Of Credit At The Time The Antique Automobile Plate Or Antique Pickup Truck Plate Is Issued; And For Related Purposes.

1948.title: Official Mississippi state song; authorize two state songs.
1948.description: An Act Authorizing Mississippi To Have Two Official State Songs Consisting Of The Present Official State Song "go Mississippi" And "my Home Mississippi"; And For Related Purposes.

1949.title: Third Circuit District; revise residency requirement.
1949.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Subdistrict Residency Requirements In The Third Circuit District; And For Related Purposes.

1950.title: Sales tax; remove requirement that certain taxpayers pay June liability for the tax on or before June 25.
1950.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Requires A Taxpayer Who Is Required To Collect Sales Taxes And Who Has An Average Monthly Sales Tax Liability Of At Least $20,000.00 To Pay A Portion Of His Sales Tax Liability For The Month Of June On Or Before June 25; And For Related Purposes.

1952.title: Sales tax; make it clear that failure to pay taxes and any penalties and interest is unlawful.
1952.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Failure To Pay The Sales Tax And Failure To Pay The Assessment Of Sales Taxes, Damages And Interest Are Subject To Criminal Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

1953.title: Income tax; authorize certain employees to pass tax credits through to employees.
1953.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Permanent Business Enterprise That Qualifies For Certain Income Tax Credits May Elect To Pass Through All Or A Portion Of Such Credits To Its Employees; To Provide That A Business Enterprise Desiring To Pass Tax Credits Through To Its Employees Must Notify The Department Of Revenue Of Such Intent And Provide The Department With Certain Information; To Amend Sections 57-87-3, 57-87-5, 57-87-7, 27-111-1 And 27-7-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1954.title: K-4 school assistant teachers and prekindergarten programs; earmark funding from gaming winnings tax.
1954.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Elementary School Assistant Teachers In Fourth Grade Beginning In The 2016-2017 School Year; To Amend Section 37-21-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Funding For Prekindergarten Programs Under The "early Learning Collaborative Act Of 2013" May Be Made From The Income Tax On Certain Winnings Paid To Patrons Of Gaming Establishments From The Early Childhood Education Fund Created Under This Act; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "early Childhood Education Fund" And To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Utilized By The Department Of Education To Assist In Funding The Prekindergarten Program And Elementary School Assistant Teachers In Grades K Through 4; To Amend Section 27-7-901, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose An Additional Tax Upon Certain Amounts That Are Paid Or Credited By Gaming Establishments Licensed Under The Provisions Of The Mississippi Gaming Control Act To Their Patrons And Provide That The Revenue From Such Tax Shall Be Deposited Into The Early Childhood Education Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1955.title: TANF assistance benefits; require applicants to submit to drug testing to qualify.
1955.description: An Act Relating To Drug Screening Of Potential And Existing Beneficiaries Of Temporary Assistance For Needy Families; To Require The Department Of Human Services To Perform A Drug Test On An Applicant For Temporary Assistance For Needy Families Benefits; To Require Such Individual To Bear The Cost Of The Drug Test; To Require The Department To Provide, And The Applicant To Acknowledge Receipt Of, Notice Of The Drug-screening Policy; To Require The Department To Increase The Amount Of The Initial Tanf Benefit By The Amount Paid By The Individual For The Drug Testing; To Provide Procedures For Testing And Retesting; To Require The Department To Provide Information Concerning Local Substance Abuse Treatment Programs To An Individual Who Tests Positive; To Provide Conditions For An Individual To Reapply For Temporary Assistance For Needy Families Benefits; To Provide That, If A Parent Is Ineligible As A Result Of Failing A Drug Test, The Eligibility Of The Children Is Not Affected; To Provide Conditions For Designating Another Protective Payee; To Provide Rulemaking Authority To The Department; And To Amend Section 43-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformanity; And For Related Purposes.

1956.title: DUI; increase penalty for 4th and 5th offenses.
1956.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create An Increased Penalty For A Fourth Or Fifth Conviction Of Driving Under The Influence; And For Related Purposes.

1958.title: Professional association dues deduction by teachers; authorize.
1958.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Deduction Of Professional Association Dues By Local School District Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

1959.title: Municipally owned waterworks; prohibit from charging higher rates to certain customers in another municipality.
1959.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-27-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Certain Municipalities From Charging Greater Rates For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Outside Of And Within One Mile Of The Corporate Limits Of The Municipality Than For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Within The Municipality; To Amend Section 77-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Previous Section; And For Related Purposes.

1960.title: Highways; designate certain section of U.S. Highway 82 in Washington County as the "Roy B. Fulton Highway."
1960.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Section Of U.s. Highway 82 In Washington County As The "roy B. Fulton Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

1961.title: Ethics Commission; provide whistleblower protection for complainants.
1961.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-4-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Whistleblower Protection For Those Who, In Good Faith, File A Complaint With The Mississippi Ethics Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1962.title: MS Dept. of Mental Health; may sell to Clarke College Alumni Assn. certain real property in Newton County.
1962.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Board Of Mental Health, Acting Through The Mississippi Department Of Mental Health, To Sell To The Clarke College Alumni Association Certain Real Property Located In Newton County, Mississippi, For Use As A Clarke College Alumni House; To Name The Basketball Court Within The Davey L. Whitney Complex Located On The Campus Of Alcorn State University In Lorman, Mississippi, The Shirley A. Walker Basketball Court; And For Related Purposes.

1963.title: Mississippi Qualified Health Center/Rural Health Clinic Incubator Grant Program; establish in the State Department of Health.
1963.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Qualified Health Center/rural Health Clinic Incubator Grant Program In The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Making Competitive Grants To Such Centers To Increase Access To Care To Uninsured Or Medically Indigent Patients In Mississippi; To Prescribe Requirements For Participation In The Program And Restrictions On The Use Of Such Grants; To Create The Mississippi Qualified Health Center/rural Health Clinic Incubator Grant Program Fund In The State Treasury; And For Related Purposes.

1964.title: Medical examiner and pathologist fees for investigation of death and autopsies; extend repealer.
1964.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-61-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Statute Prescribing Medical Examiner And Pathologist Fees For Investigation Of Death And Autopsies; And For Related Purposes.

1965.title: Mississippi Qualified Health Center Grant Program; extend repealer.
1965.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-99-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Qualified Health Center Grant Program In The State Department Of Health; And For Related Purposes.

1966.title: Flu vaccinations; require hospital to offer to patients prior to discharge.
1966.description: An Act To Create Section 41-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Flu Vaccinations To Be Offered By Hospitals To Certain Patients Prior To Discharge; To Amend Section 41-9-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1967.title: Distinctive license plate; authorize for supporters of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians.
1967.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag To Supporters Of The Mississippi Band Of Choctaw Indians; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1968.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; revise distribution of fees from tags displaying the emblem of the University of Memphis.
1968.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags That Display The Emblems Of Universities Located In Other States, To Revise The Distribution Of Fees Collected From The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of The University Of Memphis; And For Related Purposes.

1969.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for members of the Grand Chapter of the Mississippi Order of the Eastern Star.
1969.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Members Of The Grand Chapter Of The Mississippi Order Of The Eastern Star Or The Spouse And Children Of Deceased Members; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1970.title: Distinctive license plate; authorize for supporters of Hispaniola Mountain Ministries.
1970.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag To Supporters Of Hispaniola Mountain Ministries; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1971.title: Authority of chancery court to revise birth certificates; Tribal Court of MS Band of Choctaw Indians has same authority.
1971.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-57-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Tribal Court Of The Mississippi Band Of Choctaw Indians Shall Have The Same Authority As Chancery Courts To Make Changes Or Corrections In The Birth Certificates Of Persons Of Mississippi Choctaw Descent; And For Related Purposes.

1972.title: ABC Capital Fund; create to maintain state liquor distribution operation and deposit alcoholic beverage permit fees into it.
1972.description: An Act To Create The Abc Capital Fund In The State Treasury; To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Utilized By The Department Of Revenue For The Purpose Of Defraying The Costs Incurred In Maintaining The Department's Liquor Distribution Operation; To Amend Section 27-71-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Annual Privilege License Tax Paid By Each Person Approved For A Permit Under The Alcoholic Beverage Control Law Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of Such Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1973.title: Motor vehicles; jointly owned and one owner claims homestead in a city may be registered outside city under certain circumstances.
1973.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Private Passenger Vehicles Jointly Titled To A Person Who Claims Homestead Exemption In A Municipality And A Person Who Does Not, To Be Registered Outside The Municipality Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

1974.title: Insurance; prohibit civil liability against a person or entity for reporting insurance fraud.
1974.description: An Act To Prohibit Civil Liability Against A Person Or Entity For Furnishing Information Concerning Insurance Fraud To Any Law Enforcement, Investigatory, Prosecutorial Or Regulatory Agent Or Agency; To Amend Section 83-13-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1975.title: PERS; require trustees to conduct a study to determine the advisability of investing excess funds in income-producing property.
1975.description: An Act To Require The Board Of Trustees Of The Public Employees' Retirement System To Conduct A Study To Determine The Advisability Of Utilizing A Portion Of The Funds In Excess Of The Cash Working Balance Required To Be Maintained By The Public Employees' Retirement System To Invest In Income-producing Property; And For Related Purposes.

1976.title: Death penalty; eliminate for persons with mentally retardation.
1976.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Eliminate The Death Penalty For Individuals With Mental Retardation; And For Related Purposes.

1977.title: School district expenditures; require school boards to adopt an annual balanced budget.
1977.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-61-9 And 37-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Adopt An Annual Balanced Budget To Be Submitted To The Levying Authority And To The State Board Of Education And To Clarify That School District Budgets Shall Limit Fund Expenditures To The Revenue Resources Available To That Fund Which Shall Not Include Transfers From Other Fund Balances; To Amend Section 37-61-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No School District Fund Shall Have A Negative Balance At The End Of The School Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

1979.title: Justice court; revise service of process.
1979.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Form Of A Summons In A Civil Proceeding Commenced In Justice Court; To Amend Section 11-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Service Of Process In Justice Court; To Amend Section 11-9-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide What Constitutes Prima Facie Evidence Of Service Of Process; To Amend Section 11-9-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Taxing Of Certain Court Costs And 13-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Service Of Process In Justice Court; And For Related Purposes.

1980.title: Mississippi Youth Concussion Law; create.
1980.description: An Act To Require Public And Private Schools That Provide Youth Athletic Activities To Adopt And Implement A Concussion Management And Return To Play Policy That Includes Certain Components And To Provide Parents With The Concussion Policy Before The Start Of The Regular School Athletic Season; To Provide That The State Department Of Health Shall Endorse A Concussion Recognition Education Course To Provide Information To Mississippians Of The Nature And Risk Of Concussions In Youth Athletics, Which Shall Be Available Online; To Provide That This Act Does Not Create Any Liability For Any Person Or Entity Who Has Complied With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1981.title: Income tax; authorize a business deduction for certain income attributable to domestic production activities.
1981.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Business Deduction For Income Related To Domestic Production Activities As Defined And Determined Under Section 199 Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

1982.title: Qualified equity investment tax credit; include municipal airport authorities in the definition of "public entity."
1982.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-105-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Municipal Airport Authorities Within The Definition Of The Term "public Entity" For Purposes Of The Qualified Equity Investment Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1983.title: Airport authorities; remove requirement that notice Internet sales of airport property be published in a newspaper.
1983.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Information That Is Contained In Public Newspaper Notices When An Airport Authority Sells Personal Property By Use Of An Internet Web Service; To Authorize The Authority To Relist And Sell The Property On The Same Internet Web Service Without Public Notice If An Internet Sale Is Not Concluded For Any Reason; And For Related Purposes.

1984.title: Supplemental Law Enforcement Officers Training Fund; create and fund with tag fee on vehicles that are exempt from inspection law.
1984.description: An Act To Create The Supplemental Law Enforcement Officers Training Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Utilized By The Board On Law Enforcement Officers Standards And Training To Assist In Paying The Costs Of Training Conservation Officers And State Law Enforcement Officers; Amend Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Additional License Tag Fee On Private Carriers Of Passengers And Light Carriers Of Property; To Provide That From And After July 1, 2015, A Portion Of The Fee Shall Be Deposited Into The Supplemental Law Enforcement Officers Training Fund And A Portion Shall Be Deposited In The State General Fund; To Amend Section 63-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Private Carriers Of Passengers And Light Carriers Of Property From The Requirement That Vehicles Be Inspected And Display A Certificate Of Inspection; To Amend Sections 63-13-11 And 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1985.title: Giving away merchandise without authority of merchant; revise punishment for offense.
1985.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-23-99, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Punishment For The Offense Of Giving Away Of Merchandise By An Employee Without The Authority Of The Merchant; And For Related Purposes.

1986.title: PERS; provide that members who retire after July 1, 2014, may receive the COLA only after they reach age 65.
1986.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-112, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Begin Receiving A Retirement Allowance On Or After July 1, 2014, Must Be 65 Years Of Age Or Older To Be Eligible To Receive The Additional Annual Payment; And For Related Purposes.

1987.title: Child support cases; court may enter visitation order sua sponte.
1987.description: An Act To Create New Section 93-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Inherent Authority Of The Chancery Court To Enter Orders Of Visitation In Child Support Cases; To Provide A Statutory Scheme Of Visitation To Be Implemented By The Chancellor On A Case-by-case Basis In The Discretion Of The Court; To Amend Sections 93-11-65 And 43-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1988.title: Circuit clerks; increase marriage license fee and post-judgment proceedings fee.
1988.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Marriage License Fee And Post-judgment Proceedings Fee Charged By Circuit Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

1989.title: Open season on fur-bearing animals and for hunting opossums, raccoons and bobcats with dogs and guns; revise.
1989.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-31.4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Open Season On Fur-bearing Animals And For Hunting Opossums, Raccoons And Bobcats With Dogs And Guns; And For Related Purposes.

1990.title: Deer enclosures; remove repeal provisions on the laws that authorize the regulation of deer enclosures by the DWFP.
1990.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-58.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2014, Repeal Date Of The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Regulate The Hunting Of Nonnative Cervids In Noncommercial Wildlife Enclosures; To Amend Section 49-7-58.4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2014, Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Grants The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks And The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Plenary Power To Regulate All Commercial And Noncommercial Wild Animal Enclosures And Authorizes The Commission To Regulate Any Facility That Prevents The Free Ingress And Egress Of Native Or Nonnative Cervids; And For Related Purposes.

1991.title: Wild hog; prohibit transportation of.
1991.description: An Act To Amend Sections 49-7-31.5 And 49-7-140, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Transportation And Relocation Of Live Wild Hogs; And For Related Purposes.

1992.title: Deer bag limit; grant the Commission on Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks plenary power to set.
1992.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Plenary Authority To Set The Bag Limits For White-tailed Deer And Promulgate Any Regulations Necessary Therefor, Consistent With Best Management Practices, Scientific Data And Subject To Applicable Existing Law, Rules And Regulations Of This State Or The United States Of America; And For Related Purposes.

1993.title: Capital Expense Fund; increase certain limitations on expenditures.
1993.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-103-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Individual Project Cap On Expenditures From The Capital Expense Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1995.title: Sales tax; authorize cities to impose a 1% sales tax.
1995.description: An Act To Create The Citizens For Economic Development Act; To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of Certain Municipalities To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Special Sales Tax Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 3/5 Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax May Be Used And Expended; And For Related Purposes.

1996.title: Early release programs; revise eligibility and authorize release for certain juvenile offenders.
1996.description: An Act To Create Section 47-5-142.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Eligibility Of Persons Convicted Of Certain Offenses To Receive Early Release For Earned Time, Trusty Time And Meritorious Earned Time; To Authorize Circuit Courts To Determine Whether An Offender Who Committed A Felony When He Was Under The Age Of 18 May Be Released After The Offender Has Served A Certain Portion Of The Sentence Imposed By The Trial Court; And For Related Purposes.

1997.title: Cosmetology licensure law; make technical amendments to.
1997.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-7-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Certain Restrictions On Membership Appointment To The State Board Of Cosmetology; To Amend Section 73-7-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Proof That Education Levels Of Cosmetology Programs Being Taught Are Secondary Or Post-secondary; To Amend 73-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Requirement Of Photo Head Shot Licenses Issued By The State Board Of Cosmetology; To Amend 73-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Number Of Credit Hours Required For Barbers To Receive Their Cosmetology License; To Amend Section 73-7-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Minimum Qualifications For Enrollment In Schools Of Cosmetology; And For Related Purposes.

1998.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for costs paid by company in relocating national or regional headquarters to this state.
1998.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Any Company That Transfers Or Relocates Its National Or Regional Headquarters To The State Of Mississippi From Outside The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That A Minimum Of 20 Jobs Must Be Created By The Relocation In Order For A Company To Qualify For The Credit Authorized Under This Act; To Provide That The Maximum Cumulative Amount Of Tax Credits That May Be Claimed By All Taxpayers Claiming A Credit Under This Act In Any One State Fiscal Year Shall Not Exceed $1,000,000.00, Exclusive Of Credits That Might Be Carried Forward From Previous Taxable Years; To Provide That A Tax Credit Claimed Under This Act But Not Used In A Taxable Year May Be Carried Forward For Five Years From The Close Of The Tax Year In Which The Relocation Costs Were Paid; To Amend Sections 57-87-3, 57-87-5, 57-87-7 And 27-111-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2001.title: Mississippi State University; may enter into long-term leases with IHL's approval.
2001.description: An Act To Authorize Mississippi State University To Enter Into A Long-term Parking Garage License Agreement With Cooley Center Hotel, Llc; To Authorize Mississippi State University To Enter Into A Long-term Agreement To Lease The Property Known As The "cooley Building" To Cooley Center, Llc; To Authorize Mississippi State University To Enter Into An Agreement To Sublease A Portion Of The Cooley Building From Cooley Center, Llc; To Authorize Mississippi State University To Enter Into A Ground Lease With The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Starkville, Mississippi; To Authorize Mississippi State University To Enter Into A Parking Garage Use And Operation Agreement With The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Starkville, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2002.title: Requirements for enrollment of children in public schools in MS border counties; include proof of purchase of car tag in proper county.
2002.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Proof Of Purchase Of A Car Tag In The Proper County Or An Affidavit By The Parent Or Guardian Is A Requirement For Enrollment Of Children In Public Schools Located In Counties On The Mississippi Border; And For Related Purposes.

2003.title: Court reporters; increase annual salary of.
2003.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-13-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Salary Of Court Reporters For Circuit And Chancery Courts; And For Related Purposes.

2004.title: Civil actions; property and casualty insurers have burden of proof for exclusions in all perils coverage policy.
2004.description: An Act To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against A Property And Casualty Insurer Under An All Perils Coverage Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy; And For Related Purposes.

2005.title: Agricultural high schools; discontinue Hinds Agricultural High School and transfer property.
2005.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-27-80, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From And After July 1, 2014, The Hinds Agricultural High School Shall Be Discontinued With The Real Property To Become The Property Of The Hinds County Community College District And The Personal Property To Be Distributed As Determined By The Appropriate Boards Of Trustees; To Provide For Student Diplomas; And For Related Purposes.

2006.title: Wills; revise calculation when spouse seeks to renounce.
2006.description: An Act To Amend Section 91-5-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Calculation Of A Person's Separate Estate Who Seeks To Renounce The Will Of A Deceased Spouse; And For Related Purposes.

2007.title: Mississippi Compulsory School Attendance Law; applies to students through age 18 and increase penalties for parents.
2007.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Provisions Of The Mississippi Compulsory School Attendance Law Are Applicable To Students Through Age 18; To Provide That Every Day A Compulsory-school-age Child Accumulates An Unlawful Absence Constitutes A Separate Criminal Violation Relative To The Parents Or Legal Guardians Of Such Students And To Amend Sections 97-5-39 And 37-13-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2008.title: Youth court; clarify original jurisdiction of certain serious crimes.
2008.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Original Jurisdiction Of The Youth And Circuit Courts Over Certain Serious Crimes Committed By Minors; And For Related Purposes.

2009.title: Official state song; adopt "My Home Mississippi."
2009.description: An Act Adopting "my Home Mississippi" By Delma Furniss As The Official State Song; And For Related Purposes.

2010.title: School district consolidation incentive grants; establish program in the State Department of Education.
2010.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Education To Distribute School District Consolidation Incentive Grants To North Bolivar Consolidated School District, West Bolivar Consolidated School District, Sunflower County School District, And To Any School District Which Consolidates After July 1, 2014, To Defray Certain Transitional Costs Relating To The Administrative Consolidation; To Provide Standards For Calculating The Amount Of The Grants; To Provide That Such Grant Funds Shall Be Distributed At The Same Time And In The Same Manner As Adequate Education Program Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2011.title: Medicaid program; allow pharmacies and home health to deliver diabetic testing supplies to Medicaid and dually eligible recipients.
2011.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Division Of Medicaid To Seek Necessary Waivers To Allow Retail Community Pharmacies And Home Health Agencies To Deliver Diabetic Testing Supplies To Medicaid And Dually Eligible Medicare/medicaid Recipients Without Using A Medicare National Mail-order Contract Supplier Located Out Of State; And For Related Purposes.

2012.title: Local school superintendents; all appointed after January 1, 2016, except pursuant to referendum.
2012.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-9-13, 37-9-25 And 37-5-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of All Superintendents Of Schools From And After January 1, 2016; To Authorize A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Office Of Elected County Superintendent Of Education In Counties Pursuant To Petition Prior To January 1, 2015; To Repeal Effective January 1, 2016, Sections 37-5-61, 37-5-63, 37-5-65, 37-5-67, 37-5-69, 37-5-71 And 37-5-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Changing The Position Of County Superintendent Of Education To An Appointed Office Pursuant To Petition And Referendum, Provide For The Reestablishment Of The Office As An Elective Office, Authorize The Appointment Of The County Superintendent Of Education In Certain Counties, Provide For The Selection And Qualifications Of Elected Superintendents In Certain Counties, Provide For The Filling Of Vacancies In The Office Of Elected County Superintendent Of Education, And Section 37-9-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Elective Method Of Choosing The County Superintendent Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

2013.title: Oil storage tanks; require safety measures at location of.
2013.description: An Act To Be Known As The "devon And Wade Bill"; To Require Specific Safety Measures For Certain Oil And Gas Well Sites Under Certain Circumstances; To Create A Violation For Breach Of The Safety Standards; To Enact Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2014.title: Expunction of record; allow filing fee in municipal court.
2014.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Filing Fee To Be Charged In Municipal Court For A Petition For Expunction; To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Correct An Error In The Cross-reference To Section 99-19-71 Concerning The Fee To Be Charged By The Circuit Clerk For Expunction Of Records; And For Related Purposes.

2015.title: At-risk youth; authorize Community-Based Placement Pilot Program.
2015.description: An Act To Create The Community-based Placement For At-risk Children Pilot Program In Order To Plan For Early Intervention With At-risk Children In The County In Which The Pilot Program Is Located; To Enact Standards For Community-based Homes; To Provide Standards For Determination Of Eligibility Of Children For Placement Under The Pilot Program; To Authorize Reasonable Reimbursement For Expenses Of Placements To The Community-based Homes; To Authorize Funding For The Pilot Program; To Provide For Supervision Of And Reporting By The Pilot Program; And For Related Purposes.

2016.title: Board of supervisors; may assess homeowners based on pro rata platted lot area after taking ownership of a private street.
2016.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors, Upon Taking Ownership Of A Private Street Or Roadway, To Assess Each Homeowner Fronting That Street Based On The Homeowner's Pro Rata Platted Lot Area; And For Related Purposes.

2017.title: Smoking in all public places; prohibit.
2017.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Uniform Smoke-free Public Place Act Of 2014"; To Prohibit Smoking In Public Places; To Provide For Definitions; To Prohibit Smoking In Certain Public Places And Areas; To Prohibit Smoking In Any Indoor Or Outdoor Public Facility In Mississippi During Any Time That Persons Under 18 Years Of Age Are Engaged In An Organized Athletic Event In The Facility; To Provide For Exceptions; To Provide For Posting Of Signs And Removal Of Ashtrays; To Provide For An Informational Program; To Provide For Enforcement By The State Department Of Health; To Provide That Violations Of Smoking Prohibition Are Punishable By Civil Penalty; To Provide That This Prohibition Supersedes Local Ordinances; To Amend Sections 29-5-160, 29-5-161 And 29-5-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Enforcement And Penalty Provisions Of This Act Shall Be Applicable To The Statutes Prohibiting Smoking In Government Buildings, To Provide That Prohibitions On Smoking In Government Buildings Are Applicable To Government-owned Vehicles And To Provide That Prohibitions On Smoking In University Or College Buildings Are Applicable To Private Universities And Colleges; To Amend Section 97-32-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Smoking In All Private School Buildings And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2018.title: Tax assessors and collectors; increase salaries.
2018.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Tax Assessors And Collectors; And For Related Purposes.

2019.title: Memorial highway; designate portion of Highway 82 bridge in Washington County as the "Jesse Brent Memorial Bridge."
2019.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Bridge On Highway 82 In Washington County As The "jesse Brent Memorial Bridge"; And For Related Purposes.

2020.title: Appropriations FY2015; State Department of Health, Taborian Urgent Care Center medical services.
2020.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of State General Funds To The State Department Of Health, For The Purpose Of Implementing A Healthcare Network And Related Medical Emergency Services For The Taborian Urgent Care Center In Mount Bayou, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2021.title: State agencies; require to accept payment by personal check upon certain conditions.
2021.description: An Act To Require All State Agencies, Departments, Boards Or Commissions To Accept Personal Checks For Payment Of Any License, Permit, Fee Or Any Obligation Owing To The Agency Or Trust Deposit; And For Related Purposes.

2022.title: Public school student high school graduation ceremony requirements; clarify.
2022.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Public School Student Shall Be Allowed To Participate In High School Graduation Ceremonies Even If He Has Not Passed An End-of-course Subject Area Test If The Student Has Earned The Carnegie Unit Credits Required For Graduation And Has Met Any Other Requirements Of The School Or School District; To Provide That Such Student Shall Not Be Awarded A Diploma Until Satisfactory Completion Of The End-of-course Subject Area Test; And For Related Purposes.

2023.title: State Board of Pharmacy computerized program to track prescriptions; extend repealer.
2023.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Statute Authorizing The State Board Of Pharmacy To Operate A Computerized Program To Track Prescriptions; To Clarify The Reporting Requirements For Dispensers Of Controlled Substances By Veterinarians; To Clarify The Lawful Access To Prescription Monitoring Information; And For Related Purposes.

2024.title: Alcoholic beverages; allow direct shipment of certain wines, authorize a wine only package retailer's permit and allow wine tasting.
2024.description: An Act To Authorize Certain Persons Domiciled Outside This State To Lawfully Ship Directly To Package Retailers Those Manufactured Wines That Are Not Listed By The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division As A Part Of Its Inventory And Distribution Operation; To Provide That Such Manufactured Wine Must Be Purchased Through The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue; To Require Package Retailers To Pay The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division For The Manufactured Wine And Pay All Taxes, Fees And Markups Imposed On The Manufactured Wine Prior To Any Such Shipment; To Require A Person 21 Years Of Age Or Older To Sign For Manufactured Wine Shipped To A Package Retailer Under This Act; To Require Shipments Of Manufactured Wine Into This State Under This Act To Be Made By A Duly Licensed Carrier; To Make It Clear That All Taxes, Fees And Surcharges That Are Imposed Upon The Sale Of Wine Shipped By The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue Apply To Wine Shipped Under This Act; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Issuance Of A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; To Authorize The Holder Of A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit To Offer Wine Samples To Customers Pursuant To Regulations Established By The Department Of Revenue; To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Fee For A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit; To Amend Sections 27-71-15 And 67-1-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2025.title: Public university real property; authorize IHL to acquire and dispose of with DFA's approval.
2025.description: An Act To Create Section 37-101-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Acquire Or Dispose Of Real Property On Behalf Of All State Universities After Obtaining The Approval Of The Department Of Finance And Administration; To Amend Sections 37-113-3, 37-113-7, 37-115-1, 37-117-1, 37-119-1, 37-123-1, 37-125-1 And 37-127-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2026.title: Adoption; expedited for readoptions of foreign-born adoptees.
2026.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-17-3 And 93-17-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Expedited Pro Se Proceedings For Registration Of Foreign Adoptions And Issuance Of A Mississippi Birth Certificate Under Certain Circumstances; To Bring Forward Section 93-17-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Create Sections 97-17-301, 97-17-303, 97-17-305 And 97-17-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Title 97, Chapter 17, Article 9, To Constitute The Mississippi Registration Of Foreign Adoption Act; And For Related Purposes.

2028.title: Headlights; require use during precipitation.
2028.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Headlights Of Vehicles Shall Be Operated Whenever Precipitation Necessitates The Use Of Windshield Wipers; To Prohibit The Use Of Only The Parking Lights Of Vehicles During Times When The Use Of Headlights Is Required; To Provide That State Assessments Under Section 99-19-73 Shall Not Impose On Such Violation; And For Related Purposes.

2029.title: School Start Date Act of 2012; repeal.
2029.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-13-62, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That All Public Schools Shall Begin The School Year On Or After The Third Monday In August; To Bring Forward Section 37-13-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That Local School Boards Have The Authority To Set The School Start Date; And For Related Purposes.

2031.title: "School Start Date Act"; repeal.
2031.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-13-62, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The "school Start Date Act" Effective With The 2014-2015 School Year; And For Related Purposes.

2032.title: School district financial procedures; clarify distribution of funds and time of payment of school employee salaries.
2032.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-9-39 And 37-151-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Time Of The Monthly Distribution Of Adequate Education Funds To School Districts And To Provide For The Time Of Payment Of Salaries Or Wages To School District Employees; And For Related Purposes.

2034.title: Payroll date for school district employees; revise.
2034.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-151-103 And 37-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Payroll Date For School District Employees; And For Related Purposes.

2035.title: Public Records Act; cost for records shall be at pay scale of lowest level employee.
2035.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Staff Time Or Contractual Services Included In Actual Cost Of Providing Records Shall Be At The Pay Scale Of The Lowest Level Employee Or Contractor Competent To Respond To The Request; To Amend Section 25-61-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Denial Of Access To A Public Record Or Overcharging For A Copy Of A Public Record Resulting In A Civil Fine Is The Individual Responsibility Of The Person; And For Related Purposes.

2036.title: Mississippi Qualified Health Center Capacity Building Grant Program; establish in the State Department of Health.
2036.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Qualified Health Center Capacity Building Grant Program In The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Making Competitive Grants To Such Centers To Increase Access To Care To Uninsured Or Medically Indigent Patients In Mississippi; To Prescribe Requirements For Participation In The Program And Restrictions On The Use Of Such Grants; To Create The Mississippi Qualified Health Center Capacity Building Grant Program Fund In The State Treasury; And For Related Purposes.

2037.title: Penalty for withdrawal of accreditation of school or school district; shall not include suspension of extracurricular events.
2037.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Penalty For The Withdrawal Of Accreditation Of A School Or School District Shall Not Result In Suspension Of Participation In Extracurricular Or Interscholastic Activities, Including Regular And Post Season Games And Contests; And For Related Purposes.

2038.title: Expunction of felony; revise.
2038.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Expunction Of A Felony Record Under Certain Limited Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2039.title: Expunction of felony; revise by adding receipt of stolen property.
2039.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Expunction Of A Felony Record Under Certain Limited Circumstances; To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Correction; And For Related Purposes.

2040.title: Physician Order for Scope of Treatment Act (POST); enact.
