2040.description: An Act To Be Known As The Physician Order For Sustaining Treatment (post) Act; To Create New Sections 41-41-301 Through 41-41-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Execution Of And Specify The Content Of Physician Orders For Sustaining Treatment; To Direct The State Board Of Medical Licensure To Promulgate A Standardized Physician Order For Sustaining Treatment Form; To Provide Immunity From Civil And Criminal Liability For Physicians Acting In Good Faith Under The Provisions Of This Act; To Provide For Civil Liability For Persons And Entities That Violate This Act; To Authorize Equitable Relief Relating To Physician Orders For Sustaining Treatment; And For Related Purposes.

2041.title: School nurses; authorize to administer auto-injectable epinephrine to students.
2041.description: An Act To Create New Section 41-79-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Public School Districts And Private And Parochial Schools Or School Districts To Adopt A Policy Authorizing A School Nurse Or Trained School Employee To Administer Auto-injectable Epinephrine To A Student Who Is Having An Anaphylactic Reaction; To Require That At Least One Employee At Each School Receive Training From A Registered Nurse Or A Licensed Medical Physician In The Administration Of Auto-injectable Epinephrine; To Authorize Schools To Maintain A Supply Of Auto-injectable Epinephrine At The School In A Secure Location; To Authorize Physicians To Prescribe Epinephrine Auto-injectors In The Name Of The School System Or The Individual School To Be Maintained For Use As Provided In This Act; To Amend Section 41-79-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2042.title: Habitual offender; revise felonies triggering sentencing as.
2042.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Felonies Triggering Sentencing As A Habitual Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2043.title: Visitation; allow to third party under certain limited circumstances.
2043.description: An Act To Create New Section 93-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Means For A Court To Grant Third-party Visitation To A Person Standing In Loco Parentis To A Child Or To Another Person With A Significant Relationship With The Child Under Certain Limited Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2044.title: Wills and estates; fast-track administration available for certain small estates.
2044.description: An Act To Create New Section 91-7-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Summary Administration For Certain Small Estates Whether The Decedent Died Testate Or Intestate; And For Related Purposes.

2045.title: Parental Rights Act; create.
2045.description: An Act To Establish The Fundamental Right Of Parents To Direct The Upbringing, Education And Care Of Their Children; And For Related Purposes.

2046.title: Health Information Technology Act (MS-HIN); extend repealer.
2046.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 41-119-1 Through 41-119-17 And To Amend Section 41-119-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Health Information Technology Act (ms-hin); To Amend Section 41-119-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Peer Committee To Develop A Report Regarding The Implementation Of The Electronic Health Records System In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2047.title: Regulation of marriage and family therapists; extend repealer.
2047.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-54-1, 73-54-3, 73-54-5, 73-54-7, 73-54-9, 73-54-11, 73-54-13, 73-54-17, 73-54-19, 73-54-23, 73-54-27, 73-54-29, 73-54-31, 73-54-33, 73-54-35, 73-54-37 And 73-54-39, And Sections 73-53-3, 73-53-8, 73-53-10, 73-53-11 And 73-53-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Enact The Marriage And Family Therapist Licensure Law And Which Create And Empower The Board Of Examiners For Social Workers And Marriage And Family Therapists; To Amend Section 73-54-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The "practice Of Marriage And Family Therapy"; To Amend Section 73-54-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Marriage And Family Therapist Licensure Law And Those Statutes Which Create And Empower The Board Of Examiners For Social Workers And Marriage And Family Therapists; And For Related Purposes.

2048.title: Medicaid; expand eligibility to include individuals entitled to benefits under federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
2048.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Medicaid Eligibility To Include Those Individuals Who Are Entitled To Benefits Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca) Beginning July 1, 2014; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Essential Health Benefits For Individuals Eligible For Medicaid Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca); And For Related Purposes.

2049.title: Crime of violence; define.
2049.description: An Act To Create New Section 1-3-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term Crime Of Violence; To Amend Sections 47-5-401, 47-5-451 And 99-15-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2050.title: Assault; add youth court personnel to the list of victims triggering enhanced penalty.
2050.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Youth Court Personnel To The List Of Personnel Triggering An Enhanced Penalty Under The Offenses Of Simple And Aggravated Assault; And For Related Purposes.

2051.title: Youth court custody orders; authorize electronic monitoring.
2051.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-21-301 And 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Youth Court To Utilize An Electronic Monitoring Custody Order As An Alternative To Detention; And For Related Purposes.

2052.title: Court reporters; increase annual salaries of.
2052.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-13-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Annual Salary Which May Be Paid To Court Reporters For Circuit And Chancery Courts; And For Related Purposes.

2053.title: State takeover of school districts; provide timeline and exit criteria for school district conservators.
2053.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Provide Specific Findings Of Accreditation Violations, Financial Mismanagement Or Academic Deficiencies In Order For The Governor To Declare An Emergency Resulting In A State Takeover Of The District, To Define The Authority Of A State Conservator Appointed By The State Board Of Education To Administer A School District In State Takeover Status, And To Provide A Time Limitation For The Authority Of Such School District Conservator And Specific Exit Criteria Unless The Governor Continues The State Takeover; And For Related Purposes.

2055.title: Transfer of students between school districts; automatic transfer of students attending a school rated "D" or "F."
2055.description: An Act To Create An Opportunity Scholarship Program For Low-income Students To Attend An Approved Nonpublic School; To Provide An Income Tax Credit For Contributors To The Program; To Amend Sections 37-15-29 And 37-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Transfer Of Students Attending Failing Schools To A School Of Choice Upon The Petition Of The Parent Or Guardian Of Such Student; To Provide That Transportation Of Such Student To The Transferee School Shall Be The Responsibility Of The Parent Or Guardian Unless The School District Agrees To Provide Transportation; To Amend Section 37-151-93, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No School District Accepting Any Transfer Student Shall Charge The Student Any Tuition Fees; To Amend Sections 37-15-13 And 37-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2056.title: Workers' compensation; increase maximum total recovery and remove cap on permanent total disability compensation.
2056.description: An Act To Amend Sections 71-3-13, 71-3-17, 71-3-21 And 71-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Total Compensation That An Employee May Recover Under The Workers' Compensation Law, And To Provide That Compensation For Permanent Total Disability Shall Be Paid To The Employee Until His Death; And For Related Purposes.

2057.title: Bolivar County School District consolidation; repeal mandated school district consolidation law.
2057.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-7-104.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Mandated An Administrative Consolidation Of Bolivar County School Districts Into Two New Districts To Be Designated As North Bolivar Consolidated School District And West Bolivar Consolidated School District And Provided For New School Boards In The New Districts; And For Related Purposes.

2058.title: Teacher salaries funded under the MAEP; provide for 5% across-the-board increase.
2058.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-19-7 And 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A 5% Across The Board Salary Increase For Teachers And Assistant Teachers Under The Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

2059.title: Creation of innovation schools and innovation zones in school districts; authorize.
2059.description: An Act Relating To Authorizing Creation Of Innovation Schools And Innovation Zones Focused On Science, Technology, Engineering And Mathematics In School Districts; To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Develop An Application Process And Standards To Be Administered By The Local School Boards; To Amend Section 37-17-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2060.title: Court administrators; revise continuing education requirements.
2060.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise And Clarify The Number Of Hours Of Annual Continuing Education Required Of A Court Administrator; And For Related Purposes.

2061.title: Mississippi Mineral Rights Reform Act of 2014; create.
2061.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Mineral Rights Reform Act Of 2014; To Require Registration Of Severed Mineral Interests In The Office Of The Chancery Clerk Of The County In Which The Mineral Interest Is Located; To Provide For Forfeiture To The State Of Any Severed Mineral Interest Not So Registered; And For Related Purposes.

2062.title: Suspended driver's license violations; second-time DUI offender ineligible for driver's license for 5 years.
2062.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Second-time Dui Offender Who Operates A Vehicle While Under License Suspension Is Ineligible To Obtain An Operator's License For A Period Of Five Years; And For Related Purposes.

2063.title: Anatomical Gift Act, Revised Mississippi Uniform; delete repealer on.
2063.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 41-39-101 Through 41-39-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Revised Mississippi Uniform Anatomical Gift Act; To Amend Section 41-39-149, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Revised Mississippi Uniform Anatomical Gift Act; And For Related Purposes.

2064.title: "Mississippi Asthma and Anaphylaxis Child Safety Act"; enact.
2064.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-11-71 And 73-25-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Recodify And Revise Provisions Requiring School Districts To Take Certain Actions Relating To Children With Asthma And Anaphylaxis, To Be Referred To As The "mississippi Asthma And Anaphylaxis Child Safety Act"; To Repeal Section 41-79-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Self-administration Of Asthma Medication At School; And For Related Purposes.

2065.title: Divorce; create bona fide separation as the 13th ground.
2065.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create As A Thirteenth Ground For Divorce The Bona Fide, Complete Separation Of The Parties For A Certain Period Of Time; To Enact Certain Restrictions; And For Related Purposes.

2066.title: Law enforcement training expenses; revise time for reimbursement of formerly employing entity.
2066.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time During Which A Governmental Entity Must Reimburse The Formerly Employing Governmental Entity For The Costs Incurred By That Entity For The Officer's Law Enforcement Training; And For Related Purposes.

2067.title: Elections; increase fee paid by legislative candidates upon entering the race for party nominations.
2067.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-297, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee Paid By Candidates For State Senator Or State Representative Upon Entering The Race For Party Nomination For Such Offices; To Amend Section 23-15-299, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2068.title: Statutory rape; must be knowing and willful.
2068.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Knowledge And Willfulness In Order To Convict For Statutory Rape; And For Related Purposes.

2069.title: Alcohol-free motor fuels; ensure the availability of.
2069.description: An Act To Require Retail Dealers And Distributors Of Gasoline To Offer For Sale Or Use Nonethanol-blended Unleaded Regular Grade Gasoline; And For Related Purposes.

2070.title: Carbon monoxide detectors in all public and nonpublic schools; require.
2070.description: An Act To Require Carbon Monoxide Detectors In All Public And Nonpublic Schools In Mississippi; To Authorize And Direct The State Fire Marshall To Provide Requirements For Testing And Inspecting Carbon Monoxide Detection And Warning Equipment Installed In Public Or Nonpublic School Buildings; And For Related Purposes.

2071.title: Assistant teachers; increase salaries for.
2071.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Salaries For Assistant Teachers; And For Related Purposes.

2073.title: Adoption; revise fine for illegal placement of children.
2073.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-15-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fine Imposed For Illegal Placement Of Children; And For Related Purposes.

2074.title: Sanitation trucks; require drivers to exercise caution in passing when stationary.
2074.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-809, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Duty Of Care When Driving Past A Stationary Sanitation Vehicle; To Amend Section 63-7-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize But Not Require Flashing Lights On Sanitation Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

2075.title: Public records; booking information of certain mentally ill patients exempt.
2075.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Booking Information From The Public Records Act If The Person Being Booked Is Held In Custody Solely On The Basis Of The Person's Mental Health Status; To Amend Section 25-61-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "booking Information" For Purposes Of The Exemption; And For Related Purposes.

2077.title: Cooperatives; provide for the incorporation of.
2077.description: An Act To Provide For The Incorporation Of Cooperative Associations; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Requisites For The Articles Of Association Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Adoptions Of Bylaws By Cooperatives; To Specify The Membership Of Cooperatives And The Requisites For Voting By Members; To Provide For The Organization Of Meetings And The Notification Of Members Of Meetings; To Provide For The Authorization Of, Control And Use Of Stock By Cooperatives; To Provide For The Number, Election And Removal Of Directors; To Provide For The Meetings Of Directors; To Authorize Executive Committees; To Provide For The Officers Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Compensation And Benefits To Directors, Officers And Employees Of A Cooperative; To Provide For The Liability Of Directors, Members, Stockholders And Patrons Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Dispose Of Assets; To Provide Rules That Govern Contracts By Cooperatives; To Provide That The Directors Shall Determine And Distribute Net Assets At Least Once Annually; To Provide For Annual Reports; To Provide The Manner In Which Articles Of Association May Be Amended; To Provide The Manner In Which Cooperatives May Merge And Consolidate; To Provide The Manner In Which A Corporation May Convert Itself Into A Cooperative; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Voluntarily Dissolve Itself; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Be Involuntarily Dissolved; To Provide For The Liquidation Of The Assets And Business Of A Cooperative Under Court Supervision; To Provide For Derivative Actions By Members And Stockholders; To Limit The Use Of The Term "cooperative" To Associations Organized Under This Act And To Provide Penalties For Improper Use Of Such Term; To Provide For Administrative Dissolution; To Amend Section 79-35-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2078.title: Pearl River Valley Water Supply District; add two board members from the City of Jackson.
2078.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Governor Shall Appoint Two Members From The City Of Jackson To Serve On The Board Of Directors Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District; And For Related Purposes.

2079.title: CON for nursing facility in any underserved minority zip code area in the state; authorize.
2079.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need For The Construction Of A 60-bed Nursing Facility In Any Underserved Minority Zip Code Area In The State; And For Related Purposes.

2080.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to purchase real estate for the University Medical Center.
2080.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Acquire Certain Real Estate In The City Of Jackson For The Use And Benefit Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Purchase Such Property; And For Related Purposes.

2081.title: Federal Workforce Investment Act; Hinds County is separate workforce investment area.
2081.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Hinds County Shall Be A Separate Workforce Investment Area Under The Federal Workforce Investment Act; And For Related Purposes.

2082.title: Gaming; authorize aboard cruise vessels on the Pearl River within a city with a population of 150,000 or more.
2082.description: An Act To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 87-1-5, 97-33-1, 97-33-7, 97-33-17, 97-33-25 And 97-33-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Gaming To Be Conducted On Vessels As Defined In Section 27-109-1 Whenever Such Vessel Is On The Pearl River Within The Corporate Limits Of A Municipality With A Population Of 150,000 Or More According To The Most Recent Federal Decennial Census; And For Related Purposes.

2083.title: Cultural product districts; authorize creation of and exempt sales of original, one-of-a-kind works of art in from sales taxation.
2083.description: An Act To Authorize Boards Of Supervisors Of Counties And Governing Authorities Of Municipalities To Designate And Establish Pursuant To Criteria Established By The Mississippi Development Authority, Cultural Product Districts For The Purpose Of Revitalizing A Community By Creating Hub For Cultural Activity, Including Affordable Artist Housing And Work Space; To Provide That The Sale Of Original, One-of-a-kind Works Of Art From An Established Location Within The Boundaries Of A Cultural Product District Shall Be Exempt From Sales Taxation; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2084.title: Public School Districts of Innovation; authorize State Board of Education to approve creation of in local school districts.
2084.description: An Act To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Approve The Creation Of Public School Districts Of Innovation; To Define Certain Terms Related To "public School Districts Of Innovation"; To Provide That The Number Of Districts Of Innovation Approved Shall Not Exceed Five Districts Per Year; To Limit The Initial Approval And Subsequent Renewals Of Districts Of Innovation To Five-year Periods; To Direct The Board To Promulgate Administrative Rules And Regulations To Prescribe The Conditions And Procedures To Be Used By Local School Boards To Be Approved As A District Of Innovation; To Specify The Criteria To Be Addressed By The Administrative Regulations; To Prescribe The Requirements For A District To Be A District Of Innovation Applicant; To Prescribe The Statutory Requirements With Which Schools Of Innovation Within Districts Of Innovation Must Comply; To Identify Areas In Which Districts Of Innovation May Request Approval Of Practices That Are Different Than Current Statutory Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

2085.title: Education Employment Procedures Law; increase probationary period for newly hired certified employees on phased-in basis.
2085.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Probationary Period Under The Education Employment Procedures Law (eepl) For Certified School District Employees On A Phased-in Basis; And For Related Purposes.

2087.title: MS Affordable Housing Trust Fund; create to assist in the development, rehabilitation and preservation of affordable housing.
2087.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; To Provide That Money In The Trust Fund Shall Be Made Available For Assisting The Development, Rehabilitation And Preservation Of Affordable Housing; To Provide That The Trust Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund Oversight Board To Approve Rules And Regulations Proposed By The Mississippi Development Authority, To Oversee The Management Of Monies In The Trust Fund And To Approve Awards Of Trust Fund Monies To Applicants; To Provide For The Membership Of The Oversight Board; To Amend Section 75-76-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of All Taxes, Fees, Interest, Penalties, Damages, Fines Or Other Monies Collected By The Department Of Revenue Under The Gaming Control Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2088.title: Election managers; municipalities may increase discretionary pay and may compensate those who attend training sessions.
2088.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-229, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Governing Authority Of A Municipality To Approve Discretionary Pay Of Up To $50.00 For Election Managers; To Amend Section 23-15-239, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Governing Authority Of A Municipality To Compensate Election Managers Who Attend Training Sessions; And For Related Purposes.

2089.title: Public works construction; performance bond is not required if contract is less than $50,000.00 and paid in two equal installments.
2089.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-5-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Performance Bond Is Not Required When A Contract With A Public Entity For The Construction, Alteration, Or Repair Of Any Public Building Or Public Work Is Less Than $50,000.00 And The Owners Elect To Make Two Payments Valued At 50% Of The Contract Amount; And For Related Purposes.

2090.title: Disparity study; require MDA to file copies with the Legislature by not later than December 31, 2014.
2090.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To File With The Secretary Of The Senate And The Clerk Of The House Of Representatives By Not Later Than December 31, 2014, A Copy Of Its Study To Determine If There Is A Significant Statistical Disparity In The Total Number Of Qualified Minority Contractors Of Goods And Services Doing Business In The State Of Mississippi And The Actual Number Of Such Minority Contractors With Whom The State Of Mississippi, Or With Whom A Prime Contractor With The State Of Mississippi, Has Contracted To Provide Goods And Services; And For Related Purposes.

2091.title: City of Jackson; require payments in lieu of taxes on state-owned property located in the city.
2091.description: An Act To Require The State Of Mississippi To Provide Funds To The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, As Payment In Lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes For The Purpose Of Assisting The City To Defray The Ad Valorem Tax Loss The City Sustains As A Result Of State Ownership Of Property In The City And To Defray Certain Costs The City Incurs As A Result Of Being The Seat Of Government; To Provide That The Amount Of The Annual Payment Shall Be Equal To 50% Of The Ad Valorem Tax Revenue That Would Be Due Each Calendar Year On All State-owned Property Within The City Limits Of Jackson If The Property Were Not Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Funds May Be Used; And For Related Purposes.

2092.title: State Truth Commission; establish.
2092.description: An Act To Create The State Truth Commission; To Prescribe Powers And Duties Of The Commission; To Provide For The Establishment Of Procedures To Investigate Grievances Registered With The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2093.title: Domestic abuse courts; authorize implementation.
2093.description: An Act To Create New Sections 9-23-101, 9-23-103, 9-23-105, 9-23-107, 9-23-109, 9-23-111, 9-23-113 And 9-23-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Authority For A Chancery Or County Court To Establish A Domestic Abuse Court And To Provide Authority For Justice And Municipal Courts To Participate In Such A Court; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide For The Enactment Of Standards Of Operation To Govern The Operation Of Domestic Abuse Courts By The Administrative Office Of Courts; To Create The Domestic Abuse Court Special Fund; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Assessments And To Fund The Domestic Abuse Court Special Fund; To Amend Sections 9-5-81 And 9-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2094.title: Expunction; revise list of felonies that a first-time offender is allowed to expunge.
2094.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Type Of Felony Offenses That A First-time Offender Is Allowed To Expunge; To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Correction; And For Related Purposes.

2095.title: Habitual criminal; revise computation of prior convictions.
2095.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Sentencing Of Repeat Felons Under The Habitual Criminal Statute; And For Related Purposes.

2096.title: Digital privacy; labor and employment protections.
2096.description: An Act To Prohibit An Employer From Requesting Or Requiring That An Employee Or Applicant Disclose Any User Name, Password Or Other Means Accessing A Personal Account Or Service Through Certain Electronic Communications Devices; To Prohibit An Employer From Taking, Or Threatening To Take, Certain Disciplinary Actions For An Employee's Refusal To Disclose Certain Password And Related Information; To Prohibit An Employer From Failing Or Refusing To Hire An Applicant As A Result Of The Applicant's Refusal To Disclose Certain Password And Related Information; To Prohibit An Employee From Downloading Certain Unauthorized Information Or Data To Certain Websites Of Web-based Accounts; To Provide That An Employer, Based On The Receipt Of Certain Information Regarding The Use Of Certain Websites Or Certain Web-based Accounts, Is Not Prevented From Conducting Certain Investigations For Certain Purposes; To Define Certain Terms; And For Related Purposes.

2097.title: Domestic violence special funds; DFA monitor expenditure of.
2097.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Carry Out Certain Duties With Respect To The Establishment Of Agency Special Funds; To Amend Section 93-21-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The State Department Of Health To Charging For Administration Of Domestic Violence Funds An Amount Not To Exceed 10% Of The Direct And Indirect Costs Of Administering Grants Made To Domestic Violence Shelters Annually; And For Related Purposes.

2100.title: MS Department of Transportation; terminate local HELP agreements and clarify capacity enhancement project authority.
2100.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-1-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Terminate The Transportation Commission's Authority To Enter Into Certain Local Governmental Agreements Effective July 1, 2014; To Amend Section 65-3-97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Transportation Commission Spread In Its Minutes The Criteria It Uses In Any Case Where It Re-prioritizes A New Capacity Project And Further Requires The Commission To Display Any Departmental Analysis Regarding The New Capacity Project In An Exhibit To The Minutes; And For Related Purposes.

2101.title: State ports; revise membership of board.
2101.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-5-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reconstitute And Revise The Qualifications Of The Board Of The State Port Authority; To Transfer Certain Duties From The Mississippi Development Authority To The Board; To Amend Sections 59-5-1, 59-5-9, 59-5-35 And 59-5-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2102.title: Offshore mineral leases of state-owned land; distribute portion of revenue from to school districts in coastal counties.
2102.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Money From Mineral Leases Of Offshore State-owned Property Shall Be Distributed To Public School Districts In The Six Most Southern Counties Of The State; And For Related Purposes.

2103.title: State agency program budgeting; provide specific requirements.
2103.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section, Section 27-103-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Legislative Budget Office, The Peer Committee Staff, The Department Of Corrections, The Department Of Education, The Department Of Health, And The Department Of Transportation To Develop And Recommend To The Legislative Budget Committee An Inventory Of Programs And Activities For The Departments Set Out Herein; To Require The Legislative Budget Office To Recommend To The Legislative Budget Committee Methods For Incorporating These Catalogues Of Programs Into The Legislative Budget Recommendations And Appropriations Process For Fy2017; To Require That The Legislative Budget Committee Recommend To The Legislature By The 2019 Regular Session A Plan For Requiring All State Agencies To Comply With The Requirements Of This Act; To Amend Sections 27-103-153 And 27-103-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That The Department Of Corrections, The Department Of Education, The Department Of Health And The Department Of Transportation Comply With Certain Requirements Of The Mississippi Performance Budget And Strategic Planning Act Of 1994; And For Related Purposes.

2104.title: Medicaid program coverage; authorize for home/therapeutic leave days for supervised living waiver program.
2104.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Medicaid Coverage For Home/therapeutic Leave Days For The Supervised Living Waiver Program; And For Related Purposes.

2105.title: State agency procurement contracts; Mississippi Department of Information Technology Services (MDITS) develop website link.
2105.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services (mdits) To Develop A State Portal To Provide Potential Vendors Of Goods And Services And Necessary Information To Assist Them In Procuring Contracts With The State Of Mississippi; To Create New Code Section 27-104-165, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Portal Be Incorporated Into The Current Transparency Mississippi Website; And For Related Purposes.

2106.title: Emergency communications districts; require regular audits, etc.
2106.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Auditor To Ensure That When Conducting County Audits, That The Funds And Transactions Of Emergency Communications Districts Be Included In Such Audit; To Require That Emergency Communications Districts, Which Maintain Their Funds In A Fund Or Funds Separate From The County General Fund, Employ The Services Of A Certified Public Accountant To Conduct An Audit Of The Emergency Communications District; To Amend Section 19-5-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Purposes For Which Emergency Communications Districts May Purchase And Procure Equipment, Commodities And Services, And Empower The Commercial Mobile Radio Services Board To Establish Regulations Governing Such Purposes; To Amend Section 19-5-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Empower The Commercial Mobile Radio Services Board To Carry Out Certain Additional Functions; And For Related Purposes.

2107.title: Pat Harrison Waterway District local funds; use DOR tax rolls.
2107.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-15-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Pat Harrison Waterway District To Use State Approved Tax Rolls Available On November 1 Of Each Year As A Basis For Determining The Proper Share That Each Member County Will Pay To The District In Ad Valorem Funding; To Require That Each Member County Remit Its Share Of Ad Valorem Taxes To The District By March 1 Of Each Year; And For Related Purposes.

2108.title: Paternity proceedings; revise determination of child's surname.
2108.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-9-9 And 41-57-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Surname Of A Child Born To Parents Who Are Not Married Shall Be Either As Agreed Upon By The Natural Parents Or As Determined By A Court According To The Best Interests Of The Child; And For Related Purposes.

2109.title: Homestead exemption; provide for certain owners of manufactured homes or mobile homes.
2109.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-53-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes For An Owner Of A Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Who Occupies Such Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home As His Primary Home And Has Done So At The Same Physical Location For At Least Two Consecutive Years, Regardless Of Whether Such Person Owns The Land On Which The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Is Located Or How The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home And Land Are Assessed; To Provide That A Person May Not Claim The Exemption Provided In This Act If The Person Claims An Exemption Under The Homestead Exemption Law; And For Related Purposes.

2110.title: Headlights; require use of when windshield wipers necessary.
2110.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Use Of Headlights Whenever Driving Conditions Necessitate The Use Of Windshield Wipers; And For Related Purposes.

2111.title: Bonds; authorize for the Tammy Wynette Legacy Park Center.
2111.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Building, Equipping And Furnishing Facilities At The Tammy Wynette Legacy Park Center In Tremont, Mississippi, And To Provide Funds For The Purchase Of Additional Land For The Center; And For Related Purposes.

2112.title: Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; repeal.
2112.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 63-13-1 Through 63-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Additional Tag Fee And To Provide For The Distribution Of The Fee; To Amend Section 37-41-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2113.title: Children at risk; establish the Motivating Parents and Children (MPAC) pilot program for school districts.
2113.description: An Act To Establish A Motivating Parents And Children (mpac) Pilot Program Within The State Department Of Education For The Purpose Of Making Grants To School Districts That Provide Parental Involvement Services To Families Of Compulsory-school-age Children Residing In Such School District; To Set Forth The Purposes Of The Mpac Pilot Program; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Develop And Implement The Mpac Pilot Program; To Prescribe The Basic Components Of Services To Be Offered By School Districts Under The Mpac Pilot Program; To Provide An Application And Selection Procedure For School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program; To Amend Section 37-11-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Parents To Attend Conferences And Other Functions Of School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program; To Amend Section 63-1-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Children Under 18 Residing In School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program Who Withdraw From School May Have Their Driver's License Suspended; To Amend Section 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Such Minors From License Reinstatement Fees; To Amend Section 63-1-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2114.title: School districts; pilot program requiring pupils to read a minimum of four books per school year.
2114.description: An Act To Establish A Pilot Program Authorizing Local School Boards In The State To Require All Pupils In Grades 1 Through 12 To Read A Minimum Of Four Books Per School Year And Make Reports Thereon; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Develop And Issue Guidelines Under Which School Districts May Apply For Participation In This Pilot Program; And For Related Purposes.

2117.title: Civil actions against health care providers; provide for inadmissibility of certain statements of fault or apology.
2117.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Statements By Health Care Providers Or Employees Regarding The Unanticipated Outcome Of Medical Care Are Inadmissible In Any Civil Action By A Patient Or A Relative Or Representative Of The Patient; To Provide Definitions; And For Related Purposes.

2118.title: Military officers and employees; grant leave of absence from civil occupations in public or private business.
2118.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Officers And Employees Of Any Public Or Private Business Or Industry Who Are Active Members Of The Military Shall Be Entitled To Military Leave Of Absence From Their Respective Civil Duties And Occupations; And For Related Purposes.

2119.title: Tuition-free attendance at any state IHL or community college; authorize for Mississippi residents age 65 or older.
2119.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Mississippi Resident Age 65 Or Older Shall Be Eligible For A Scholarship Equal To The Full Cost Of Tuition At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College; To Provide That Such Waiver Shall Be Administered Under The Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Program (mtag); And For Related Purposes.

2120.title: Hunting; require tree stands to be tagged with name and address of owner.
2120.description: An Act To Require A Person To Tag Any Tree Stand Placed On Public Lands Or Lands Of Another Person; And For Related Purposes.

2121.title: Individual wastewater disposal system; health department to reimburse for diminished value of land if fails to approve system.
2121.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-67-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Health To Reimburse Landowner For Diminished Value Of Land Adjacent To A Lake If The Department Fails To Approve An Individual On-site Wastewater Disposal System For Property Purchased Prior To July 1, 2008; And For Related Purposes.

2122.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize to commemorate the City of Marks as home of "The Mule Train."
2122.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Commemorating The City Of Marks As The Home Of "the Mule Train"; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2124.title: Parental access to online curriculum programs in which child is enrolled; State Board of Education to provide for.
2124.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Require Local School Districts To Provide Parental Access To Online Curriculum Programs; To Provide That Local School Districts Shall Allow Parents To Register Online In Order To Request Access To The Curriculum Programs In Which Their Children Are Enrolled And To Offer Assistance For This Purpose; And For Related Purposes.

2125.title: Eminent domain; require disclosure of comparative appraisals to property owner whose property is taken by eminent domain.
2125.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-1-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Disclosure Comparative Appraisals Used By A Public Body To The Property Owner Whose Property Is Taken By Eminent Domain; And For Related Purposes.

2126.title: State income tax deduction; provide for parents who send children to private school or homeschool.
2126.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A State Income Tax Deduction For Parents Who Send Their Children Or Dependents To A Private School Or A Homeschool Program; And For Related Purposes.

2127.title: Elections; prohibit candidates from appearing in publicly funded ads during statewide general election years.
2127.description: An Act To Create Section 23-15-299.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Any Person Who Is A Candidate For Any Public Office From Appearing In Publicly Funded Advertisements During The Year Of The Statewide General Election; To Provide That Those Candidates Who Violate The Prohibition Shall Be Disqualified From Holding Any Public Office Until The Next Statewide General Election; To Amend Sections 23-15-297, 23-15-299, 23-15-359 And 23-15-976, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2128.title: Marine Resources; exempt certain rules of the Commission on Marine Resources from economic impact statements.
2128.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Certain Rules And Regulations Of The Commission On Marine Resources From The Economic Impact Statements Required By The Mississippi Administrative Procedures Act; And For Related Purposes.

2129.title: Agritourism; extend repealer on section regulating agritourism.
2129.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-53-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Statutes Regulating Agritourism; And For Related Purposes.

2130.title: Mississippi Fair Commission; revise and clarify powers and duties related to the State Fairgrounds.
2130.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise And Clarify The Duties Of The Mississippi Fair Commission Related To The State Fairgrounds; To Authorize The Mississippi Fair Commission To Enter Into Leases Or Right-of-ways; To Delete The Requirement That Certain Funds Be Used For Premiums Or Awards In Livestock Shows; To Authorize The Creation Of A Nonprofit Foundation And A Special Fund For The Use Of Funds Received From Activities Related To The State Fairgrounds; To Provide Purposes For Which The Funds May Be Used; And For Related Purposes.

2131.title: Agriculture; allow courts to impose assessments for felony convictions investigated by Agricultural and Livestock Theft Bureau.
2131.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Courts To Impose Assessment Against Persons Convicted Of A Felony Violation Investigated By The Mississippi Agricultural And Livestock Theft Bureau; To Amend Section 69-29-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Special Fund For Those Assessments; And For Related Purposes.

2132.title: City of Starkville; authorize a long-term ground lease of certain property belonging to Mississippi State University.
2132.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Starkville, Mississippi, To Enter Into A Long-term Ground Lease Of Certain Property Belonging To Mississippi State University Of Agriculture And Applied Science; To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Starkville, Mississippi, To Enter Into A Long-term Operating Agreement Regarding The Improvements Constructed Upon Such Property; And For Related Purposes.

2133.title: Public records requests; create administrative procedure for Ethics Commission to enforce.
2133.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Nonexclusive Administrative Procedure Before The Ethics Commission For The Enforcement Of Public Records Requests; To Provide For Appeal De Novo From The Orders Of The Commission; To Authorize The Commission To Impose The Penalties Otherwise Provided By Law; And For Related Purposes.

2134.title: School board elections in certain municipal school districts; provide uniform procedure for nominating petition.
2134.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-7-211 And 37-7-711, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Uniform Procedure For Nominating Petitions And A Uniform Number Of Signatures On Said Petitions Of Nomination To Run For The Elected Office Of Board Of Trustees Of Certain Municipal School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

2135.title: Emergency management; include MS Band of Choctaw Indians as a participant under the Statewide Mutual Aid Compact.
2135.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-15-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "political Subdivisions" As Used In The Emergency Management Law; To Amend Section 33-15-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Mississippi Band Of Choctaw Indians As An Authorized Participant Under The Statewide Mutual Aid Compact; To Amend Section 33-15-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency To Sponsor And Develop Mutual Aid Plans And Agreements Between The Political Subdivisions Of The State And The Mississippi Band Of Choctaw Indians; And For Related Purposes.

2136.title: Public Utilities Staff; conduct survey of state universal service funds/report with recommendations.
2136.description: An Act To State The Public Policy Of The State Of Mississippi Regarding Universal Availability Of Local Exchange Telephone Service At Affordable Rates And Universal Access To Broadband Services; To Direct The Public Utilities Staff To Survey And Analyze State Universal Service Funds And To Make A Report With Recommendations To The Governor And The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2137.title: State Auditor; authorize to audit agencies as deemed necessary/revise charges for performing audits.
2137.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Auditor To Perform Audits Of State Agencies As Deemed Necessary By The State Auditor; To Amend Section 7-7-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Charges For Performing Audits And Other Services; And For Related Purposes.

2138.title: Green fleet vehicles; require state vehicles to use natural gas for fuel by 2016.
2138.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require State-owned Vehicles To Use Natural Gas For Fuel By 2016; And For Related Purposes.

2139.title: State Board of Pharmacy building; authorize sale of.
2139.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Sell And Convey Certain State-owned Real Property Under The Possession Of The Mississippi Board Of Pharmacy; To Require Monies Derived From The Sale Of That Property To Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury For The Use And Benefit Of The Mississippi Board Of Pharmacy; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Correct Discrepancies In The Legal Descriptions Of The Real Properties In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2140.title: Oil and gas severance tax;revise distribution between state and counties.
2140.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-25-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Manner In Which Oil Severance Taxes Are Distributed To The State And The County In Which The Oil Was Produced; And For Related Purposes.

2141.title: Commercial motor vehicle registration; remove repeal & reverter on provisions relating to enforcement of unlawful operation of.
2141.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-60, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2014 Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Department Of Revenue To Deny Registration And Licensing Or Revoke Or Suspend Licensing Of Commercial Motor Vehicles Operated By Certain Persons, And That Authorizes The Removal Of License Plates From Commercial Motor Vehicles Of Persons Who Have Been Prohibited From Operating By A Federal Or State Agency Responsible For Motor Carrier Safety; To Amend Section 27-19-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2014, Reverter On The Provision Of Law That Makes It Unlawful To Willfully And Knowingly Make Any False Statement Or Representation On The Registration Application For A Commercial Motor Vehicle In Order To Circumvent The Federal Prohibition From Operating In Interstate Commerce Or The Laws Of The State Of Mississippi, Or To Attempt To Register A Commercial Motor Vehicle On Behalf Of Another Person In Order To Circumvent The Federal Prohibition From Operating In Interstate Commerce Or The Laws Of The State Of Mississippi; To Amend Section 27-19-90, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2014, Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Provides Criminal Penalties For Any Person Who Willfully And Knowingly Alters, Forges Or Counterfeits Any License Plate, Decal, Permit Or Other Document Required For A Commercial Motor Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

2143.title: Agriculture; clarify terms used in the Mississippi Agricultural Promotions Program Act.
2143.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-45-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Terms Of The Singular Number Shall Include The Plural Number As Used In The Mississippi Agricultural Promotions Program Act; And For Related Purposes.

2144.title: Regional mental health/intellectual disability commissions; define services which may be provided.
2144.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-19-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Services Which Are Authorized To Be Provided By Regional Mental Illness And Intellectual Disability Commissions; And For Related Purposes.

2145.title: Public Trust Tidelands; auth. leases for residential purposes on Lowry Island and auth. SOS to share sublease income with city.
2145.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-1-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Residential Leases On Lowry Island; To Delete References To Multiunit Residential Structures; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Share Sublease Income With The City; And For Related Purposes.

2146.title: Pawnshop transactions; require electronic transmission if law enforcement supplies software.
2146.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Pawnshop Transactions To Be Made Available By Means Of Electronic Transmission To The Appropriate Law Enforcement Agency If The Law Enforcement Agency Supplies The Computer Software; And For Related Purposes.

2147.title: Property insurance; prohibit hurricane deductible unless damages arose from a named storm.
2147.description: An Act To Prohibit The Application Of A Hurricane Deductible For Property Damage In Insurance Policies Unless The Damage Arose From A Named Hurricane Or Tropical Storm; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2148.title: Official dating standard to be used by public museums and publications; require "A.D." and "B.C."
2148.description: An Act To Designate An Official Dating Standard To Be Used By Any Public Museum Or Publication Funded By The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2149.title: Breathalyzer; Crime Lab to calibrate instrument with each breath test.
2149.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Crime Laboratory To Calibrate The Breathalyzer With Each Breath Test; And For Related Purposes.

2150.title: Disabilities; authorize designation of certain on driver's licenses or I.D. cards.
2150.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-35 And 45-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Designation Of Certain Disabilities On Driver's Licenses And Identification Cards Under Certain Circumstances; To Require Training For Law Enforcement Officers In Recognizing Certain Mental Or Medical Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2151.title: Licensed professional counselors; make technical amendments to licensure law.
2151.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-30-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Criminal History Records Check On Applicants For Licensure As Licensed Professional Counselors And On Applicants For License Renewal As Licensed Professional Counselors; To Amend Section 73-30-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Filing Of An Appeal Of An Adverse Ruling Of The Licensed Professional Counselors Board To The Circuit Court Of The First Judicial District Of Hinds County; To Amend Section 73-30-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Filing Of An Appeal Of A Decision Of The Licensed Professional Counselors Board To The Circuit Court Of The First Judicial District Of Hinds County, And An Appeal Of The Circuit Court To The Mississippi Supreme Court, To Establish The Chancery Court Of The First Judicial District Of Hinds County As The Venue For Applying For Orders Enjoining The Unlawful Practice Of Counseling And/or False Representation As A Licensed Professional Counselor; To Amend Section 73-30-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Biennial License Renewal Fee Shall Be $200.00 Not To Exceed $400.00 If The Licensed Professional Counselors Board Finds It Necessary For The Enforcement And Regulation Of Chapter 30, Title 73 Of The Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Criminal History Records Check On Applicants For License Renewal As Licensed Professional Counselors, To Establish Fees For Various Services Provided By The Licensed Professional Counselors Board And To Authorize The Licensed Professional Counselors Board To Establish Additional Fees For Services As The Board Deems Necessary For The Regulation And Enforcement Of Chapter 30, Title 73 Of The Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

2152.title: School Resource Officer qualifications; require standard training program.
2152.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The School Resource Officer Qualifications To Require That All School Resource Officers Complete A Uniform Statewide Training Prior To Being Permitted To Serve In A School; And For Related Purposes.

2153.title: Distinctive tags for supporters of the Boys and Girls Clubs; extend time for meeting issuance requirements.
2153.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Time To Meet The Requirements For Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of The Boys And Girls Clubs; And For Related Purposes.

2154.title: MDOC early-release programs; increase the monthly fee paid by offenders being supervised by the Community Corrections Division.
2154.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Monthly Fee Paid By Offenders On Probation, Parole, Earned-release Supervision, Post-release Supervision, Or Earned Probation From $55.00 To $60.00; And For Related Purposes.

2155.title: Deer feeding; Commission on Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks may not specify type of feed on private lands.
2155.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-4-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Shall Not Have The Authority To Specify The Type Of Feed That Is Utilized To Feed White-tailed Deer On Private Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2156.title: Field trials; Commission on Wildlife, Fisheries & Parks may not impose fees for field trials held on private lands.
2156.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-1-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Shall Not Impose Fees For Field Trials Conducted On Private Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2157.title: State-owned vehicles; MDOC Commissioner may request unmarked vehicle for use in official investigations.
2157.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of The Department Of Corrections To Request Unmarked Vehicles Where The Presence Of Identifying Marks Would Hinder Official Investigations; And For Related Purposes.

2158.title: MDOC; may house additional offenders in county or regional correctional facilities.
2158.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Incarcerate Additional Offenders In County Or Regional Correctional Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2159.title: Tidelands; exempt municipal small water craft harbors from obtaining a tidelands lease from the Secretary of State.
2159.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Municipal Small Water Craft Harbors Are Exempt From Leasing Requirements Of The Secretary Of State; And For Related Purposes.

2160.title: MS Gulf Coast Region Utility Act; revise powers and duties of the county utility authorities.
2160.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-17-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To State Legislative Intent And Findings; To Amend Section 49-17-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms; To Amend Section 49-17-715, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The George County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The Pearl River County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-723, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The Stone County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-727, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The Harrison County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-731, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The Jackson County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-735, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The Hancock County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-743, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The General Powers And Duties Of The County Utility Authorities And The Power Of Eminent Domain; To Amend Section 49-17-745, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A County Utility Authority May Operate Systems Within Its Service Area; To Amend Section 49-17-751, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certificates Of Public Convenience And Necessity Of Other Utilities May Be Transferred To A County Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2161.title: Health Care Freedom Of Choice Act; enact.
2161.description: An Act To Provide That Every Person In This State Has The Right To Pay Directly For Health Care Services And Purchase Insurance From The Provider Of Their Choice; To Provide That No Public Official Shall Impose Any Penalty Or Tax In Derogation Of The Right Set Forth Under This Act; To Provide Exemptions; And For Related Purposes.

2162.title: MS Wireless Communication Commission; revise authority regarding local government entities.
2162.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Authority Of The Mississippi Wireless Communication Commission To Approve All Wireless Communications Systems Owned Or Operated By Any Local Government Entity; And For Related Purposes.

2163.title: Justice courts; revise fees.
2163.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Justice Court Fee Allowable For Certain Traffic Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2164.title: Cursive writing; direct State Board of Education to require in elementary education curriculum.
2164.description: An Act To Require The State Board Of Education To Ensure Instruction In Cursive Writing As A Part Of The Basic Elementary Education Curriculum; And For Related Purposes.

2165.title: Littering; revise offense of.
2165.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97-15-30, 97-15-29, 97-15-31 And 97-27-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fines Imposed For The Offense Of Littering; And For Related Purposes.

2166.title: Window tint violations; enforceable by sheriffs.
2166.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The County Sheriff To Enforce Window Tint Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2167.title: Transportation; allow use of road equipment by other county departments without reimbursement to road and bridge funds.
2167.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Board Of Supervisors Of A County To Allow The Use Or Transfer Of County Road Equipment To Other Departments Of The County Without Reimbursement To Road And Bridge Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2168.title: Mississippi Entity Conversion and Domestication Act; create.
2168.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Entity Conversion And Domestication Act; To Create New Section 79-37-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth A Short Title; To Create New Section 79-37-102, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 79-37-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Relationship Of The Act To Other Laws; To Create New Section 79-37-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify When Notice Or Approval Is Required; To Create New Section 79-37-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Filing Status; To Create New Section 79-37-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Act Is Not Exclusive; To Create New Section 79-37-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Plan May Refer To Ascertainable Outside Facts; To Create New Section 79-37-108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Alternative Means Of Approval Of Transactions; To Create New Section 79-37-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Outline Appraisal Rights; To Create New Section 79-37-110, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Be Reserved For Future Enactment; To Create New Section 79-37-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth Requirements For Documents; To Create New Section 79-37-112, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Fees; To Create New Section 79-37-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Effective Date Of Documents; To Create New Section 79-37-114, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow For Corrections To A Filed Document; To Create New Section 79-37-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth The Filing Duty Of The Secretary Of State; To Create New Section 79-37-116, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appeal Of The Secretary's Refusal To File A Document; To Create New Section 79-37-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Evidentiary Effect Of A Filed Copy; To Create New Section 79-37-118, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Penalty For Signing A False Document; To Create New Section 79-37-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant To The Secretary Of State Powers Reasonably Necessary To Enforce The Act; To Create New Section 79-37-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Conversion Of Entities To A Different Form; To Create New Section 79-37-402, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth Requirements For A Plan Of Conversion; To Create New Section 79-37-403, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Approval Of A Plan Of Conversion; To Create New Section 79-37-404, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Amendment Or Abandonment Of A Plan Of Conversion; To Create New Section 79-37-405, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth The Requirements For A Valid Statement Of Conversion; To Create New Section 79-37-406, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Effect Of A Conversion; To Create New Section 79-37-501, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Domestication Of A Foreign Entity; To Create New Section 79-37-502, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth Requirements For A Plan Of Domestication; To Create New Section 79-37-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Approval Of A Plan Of Domestication; To Create New Section 79-37-504, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Amendment Or Abandonment Of A Plan Of Domestication; To Create New Section 79-37-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth The Requirements For A Valid Statement Of Domestication; To Create New Section 79-37-506, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Effect Of A Domestication; To Create New Section 79-37-601, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Promote Consistency Of The Law With Regard To Other States Enacting Such An Act; To Create New Section 79-37-602, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Relationship Of This Act To The Electronic Signatures In Global And National Commerce Act; To Create New Section 79-37-603, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Savings Clause; To Create Section 79-37-604, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Separate Severability Clause; To Amend Section 79-4-13.02, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Business Corporation Act; To Amend Sections 79-13-101, 79-13-401, 79-13-502 And 79-13-908, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Uniform Partnership Act; To Amend Sections 79-14-101, 79-14-105, 79-14-201, 79-14-202, 79-14-204 And 79-14-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Uniform Limited Partnership Act; To Amend Section 79-29-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Limited Liability Company Act; To Repeal Section 79-13-902, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Conversion Of A Partnership To A Limited Partnership; To Repeal Section 79-13-903, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is Reserved For Future Enactment; To Repeal Section 79-13-904, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Effect Of A Conversion; And For Related Purposes.

2169.title: Controlled Substance Act; revise Schedules.
2169.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Certain Hallucinogenic Substances To Schedule I Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 41-29-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Lorcaserin To Schedule Iv Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Act; And For Related Purposes.

2170.title: Human trafficking; create offense of advertising for sexual servitude of a minor.
2170.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-54.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Offense Of Advertising For Sexual Servitude Of A Minor; And For Related Purposes.

2172.title: Establishment of graduation standards for high school students; authorize early graduation ("seat time waiver") program.
2172.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Implement A "seat Time Waiver" Program Or Early Graduation Policy For Students Who Complete Accelerated Coursework; And For Related Purposes.

2173.title: Memorial highways; designate a certain segment of MS Highway 364 in Prentiss County as the "Oliver Wendell Pinson Memorial Highway."
2173.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 364 In Prentiss County As The "oliver Wendell Pinson Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2174.title: Highways; allow the placement of memorials on the right-of-ways of state and U.S. highways subject to certain restrictions.
2174.description: An Act To Provide For The Placement Of Memorials On The Right-of-ways Of State And U.s. Highways; To Authorize The Commission To Specify Material Of Which The Memorials May Be Made And The Distance From The Highway That They May Be Placed On The Right-of-ways; And For Related Purposes.

2175.title: Auto insurance; extend repealer on law requiring repair business and lienholder on check paying claim.
2175.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-11-551, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Provision Of Law Requiring An Insurer Paying An Auto Insurance Claim To Add As A Payee On The Check The Business Repairing The Automobile And The Lienholder; And For Related Purposes.

2176.title: MS Windstorm Underwriting Association; revise certain laws regarding the nonadmitted policy fee.
2176.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-34-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Windstorm Underwriting Association May Use The Monies From The Nonadmitted Policy Fees For Certain Programs Targeted To Reduce The Number Of Policies Within The Association; To Extend The Repealer On The Section Of Law That Provides For The Nonadmitted Policy Fee; To Exempt Certain Types Of Policies From The Nonadmitted Policy Fee; To Amend Section 83-34-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

2177.title: Health insurance policies; clarify when policies must include coverage for mental illness.
2177.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify When Health Insurance Policies Must Include Coverage For Mental Illness; To Amend Section 83-9-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Provision Of Outpatient Mental Illness Coverage On Parity With Inpatient And Partial Hospitalization Mental Illness Coverage; To Repeal Section 83-9-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides The Formula For Determining Which Health Insurance Policies Are Required To Provide Covered Benefits For The Treatment Of Mental Illness; And For Related Purposes.

2178.title: Eligibility of children in certain licensed residential facilities to receive federal education funds; provide.
2178.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Children Residing In Licensed Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facilities To Be Eligible For Federally Funded Education Services And To Require That Such Children Shall Be Placed In The Education Setting Based On The Recommendation Of The Iep Committee; And For Related Purposes.

2179.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of to assist Yazoo City in the construction of the Willie Morris Parkway.
2179.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Yazoo City, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Cost Of Constructing The Willie Morris Parkway To Connect Mississippi Highway 3 With Grand Avenue; And For Related Purposes.

2180.title: Universities and community colleges; to enact policies that increase rate of CJC students transferring to IHLs.
2180.description: An Act To Provide For Greater Collaboration Between State Universities And Community Colleges On Increasing The Percentage Of Community College Transfer Students Who Obtain Baccalaureate Or Similar Degrees; To Authorize And Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning And The Mississippi Community College Board To Develop And Implement Articulation Agreements And Policies That Improve The Process Of Students Transferring Between Programs And Institutions; And For Related Purposes.

2181.title: Memorial highway; designate a segment of Mississippi Highway 51 in Madison County as the William T. "Bill" Martin Memorial Highway.
2181.description: An Act To Designate A Segment Of Mississippi Highway 51 Within Madison County, Mississippi As The Deputy Chief W.t. "bill" Martin Memorial Highway; And For Related Purposes.

2182.title: Students with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASDs); State Dept. of Education to implement program in the public schools.
2182.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Department Of Education To Develop Standards And Implement Autism Spectrum Disorders (asds) Classrooms In The School Districts Statewide To More Fully Meet The Needs Of Students With Autism In The Public School Setting; And For Related Purposes.

2183.title: Elections; amend training requirements for resolution board members.
2183.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-523, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement For Resolution Board Members To Attend Election Manager Training; To Require Resolution Board Members To Complete Training Of Up To Three Hours On Their Duties To Review, Handle And Count Damaged Or Defective Ballots; And For Related Purposes.

2184.title: Election commissioners; chairman may receive per diem for up to 5 additional days.
2184.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A County Board Of Supervisors To Approve The Payment Of Per Diem For Up To Five Additional Days To The Chairman Of The Commissioners Of Election For The Performance Of His Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2186.title: Elections; change the length of training course required for managers/pollworkers.
2186.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-239, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The County Executive Committee And The Commissioners Of Election To Offer An Annual Training Course Of Up To Eight Hours To Managers Of Election; And For Related Purposes.

2187.title: Vicksburg Auditorium; authorize DFA to transfer without cost to the Mayor and Board of Aldermen of the City of Vicksburg.
2187.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Transfer And Convey Certain Real Property Located In The City Of Vicksburg, County Of Warren, State Of Mississippi To The Mayor And Aldermen Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2190.title: Board of Bar Commissioners and The Mississippi Bar; delete repeal clause.
2190.description: An Act To Repeal Section 73-3-403, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Repeal Of The Sections Of Law Which Create The Mississippi Bar And The State Board Of Bar Commissioners And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; And For Related Purposes.

2192.title: Qualifications for local school board; require at least 2 years of postsecondary education.
2192.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-5-1 And 37-7-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Members Of Local School Boards To Have At Least Two Years Of Postsecondary Education As A Qualification For Office; And For Related Purposes.

2193.title: School Employment Procedures Law; reduce probationary period for certified employees.
2193.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Probationary Period For Certified School District Employees Under The School Employment Procedures Law To One Year And To Eliminate The Probationary Period For Certified Employees Transferring From Another School District; And For Related Purposes.

2196.title: Appropriation FY2015; MS Gulf Coast Community College Motion Picture Industry Workforce Training.
2196.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College For The Purpose Of Providing Motion Picture Industry Workforce Training In Coordination With The Mississippi Film Office For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2197.title: Assistant teachers; require school districts to provide notice of nonreemployment at least 5 days before the school year ends.
2197.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Give Assistant Teachers Notification Of Nonreemployment No Later Than Five Days Before The End Of The Academic School Year; And For Related Purposes.

2199.title: Municipalities; revise method of calculating maximum amount that may be assessed for cleaning dilapidated private property.
2199.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Governing Authority Of A Municipality To Assess The Cost And Any Penalty Against Menaced Property As A Civil Debt Against The Property Owner And/or, At The Option Of The Governing Authority, A Lien Against The Property; To Provide That Such Lien Against The Property Shall Be An Encumbrance Upon The Property And Shall Follow Title Of The Property; To Add "abandoned" Buildings To The List Of Property That Can Be Cleaned By A Municipality; To Remove The Cost Limitation For Removal Of Hazardous Substances From Property Determined By The Governing Authority To Be A "menace"; And For Related Purposes.

2200.title: MDOC Early Release Programs; prohibit participation by offenders convicted of house burglary.
2200.description: An Act To Prohibit Any Offender Who Was Convicted Of Burglary Under Section 97-17-23 From Participating In Any Early Release Program Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections; To Amend Sections 47-5-138.1, 47-5-139 And 47-5-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2201.title: Veterans' Home Purchase Law; revise requirements for refinancing of mortgage loans.
2201.description: An Act To Amend Section 35-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Conditions Under Which The Veterans' Home Purchase Board May Provide For The Refinancing Of Permanent Mortgage Loans; And For Related Purposes.

2202.title: Health Action Plans by State Department of Health; provide for diabetes and obesity annual plans.
2202.description: An Act To Provide For Annual Health Action Plans Prepared By The State Department Of Health; To Provide For A Diabetes Annual Action Plan; To Provide For An Obesity Annual Action Plan; To Provide For The Preparation And Submission Requirements; To Provide For The Required Content Of The Action Plans; And For Related Purposes.

2203.title: Veterans' Home Purchase Board; authorize to designate employee to sign closing documents during absence of the director.
2203.description: An Act To Amend Section 35-7-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Veterans' Home Purchase Board To Designate One Of Its Employees To Be Authorized To Sign The Deed Of Conveyance Or Other Closing Documents Necessary As To Not Delay The Closing Or Settlement Of A Home Purchase During The Absence Or Unavailability Of The Director; And For Related Purposes.

2205.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for Hancock High School.
