2205.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Hancock High School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2206.title: State Department of Audit; require an annual audit of each state agency with the cost to be charged to the agency.
2206.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Audit To Post Audit Each State Audit Annually With The Cost To Be Charged To The Individual Agency's Budget; And For Related Purposes.

2208.title: School accreditation; include financial accountability rating system and student achievement in performance-based accreditation.
2208.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-17-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Performance-based Accreditation System For Schools And School Districts Shall Include The Development And Implementation Of A Financial Accountability Rating System To Identify High Academic Achievement And Cost-effective School Operations; To Direct The State Department Of Education To Review School And School District Resource Allocation Practices; To Prescribe A Procedure For Projecting A Deficit In The Operation Of Schools And School Districts; To Provide For Reports; To Codify Section 37-17-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Board Of Education To Adopt Performance Indicators For Student Achievement And To Provide That The Performance-based Accreditation System For Schools And School Districts Shall Include Student Achievement Performance Indicators; To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2209.title: Charter schools for special needs students; may be approved with approval of local school board.
2209.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-28-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Charter School Authorizer Board May Approve Public Charter Schools For Special Needs Students Without Approval Of The Local School Board; And For Related Purposes.

2210.title: Health care insurance; no person, employer or health care provider shall be required to participate in any health care plan.
2210.description: An Act To Provide That No Person, Employer Or Health Care Provider Shall Be Required To Participate In Any Health Care Services Payment System; To Permit A Person Or Employer To Pay Directly For Lawful Health Care Services And To Permit A Health Care Provider To Accept Direct Payment From A Person Or Employer For Lawful Health Care Services; To Provide That The Purchase Or Sale Of Health Insurance Shall Not Be Prohibited By Law Or Rule; And For Related Purposes.

2211.title: Chemical endangerment of a child or fetus; create crime of.
2211.description: An Act To Create The Offense Of Chemical Endangerment Of A Child Or Fetus And To Prescribe Punishment Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2212.title: Taxation; limit prosecution's authority to plea-bargain.
2212.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The Discretion Of The Prosecutor In Any Prosecution For Tax Evasion; And For Related Purposes.

2213.title: Controlled substances; enhance penalty for illegal sale in proximity to drug rehab facility.
2213.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Enhancement Of Penalties For The Sale Of Drugs Within 1500 Feet Of A Drug Or Alcohol Treatment Or Rehabilitation Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2214.title: Health care certificate of need; exempt relocation of certain nursing facilities within same long-term care planning district.
2214.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Relocation Of Certain Existing Nursing Home Facilities To A New Facility Located Within The Same Long-term Care Planning District Without The Requirement Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need; And For Related Purposes.

2215.title: Hunting; revise squirrel season.
2215.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-31.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Squirrel Season Shall Open On October 1 And Run Through February 28 Next Following Throughout The State; To Provide That The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks May Set An Additional Squirrel Season That Shall Open Not Earlier Than May 15 And Run Not Later Than June 1 Next Following; And For Related Purposes.

2216.title: General education development (GED); change references to "high-school equivalency diploma."
2216.description: An Act To Change References To "general Education Development," "general Educational Development" And "ged" To "high-school Equivalency Diploma"; To Provide That A High-school Equivalency Diploma Is A High-school Diploma Approved By The Mississippi Community College Board; To Amend Sections 37-13-92, 37-21-7, 37-29-1, 37-35-3, 37-35-9, 37-35-13, 37-106-29, 37-153-9, 43-17-5, 43-21-605, 43-27-201, 43-27-203, 45-3-9 And 47-5-949, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2217.title: Public Employee Whistleblower Act; bring forward sections.
2217.description: An Act To Amend The Whistleblower Protection Act; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-172, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-175, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-177, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2218.title: Retired teachers; may draw retirement benefits and be reemployed as teachers if they have 25 years of creditable service.
2218.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-11-126, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Persons Receiving A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Are Employed As Teachers In The Public School System After Their Retirement, And Certain Persons Employed As Teachers In The Public School System Who Are Eligible To Receive A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System, May Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers In Addition To Receiving A Teacher's Salary; To Provide That Those Persons Shall Not Be Contributing Members Of The Retirement System Nor Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period During Which They Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Limitations On The Salaries Of Persons Who Are Employed As Teachers After Retirement And Choose To Continue Receiving A Retirement Allowance; And For Related Purposes.

2219.title: Qualified equity investment credits; increase amount that may be allocated by MDA in a fiscal year increase time period for issuance.
2219.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-105-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Credit Allowance Date For The Income Tax And Insurance Premium Tax Credits For Taxpayers Holding Certain Qualified Investments; To Increase From 60 To 120 Days The Period Of Time After The Mississippi Development Authority Has Allocated Such Credits To A Qualified Community Development Entity That The Corresponding Qualified Low-income Community Investment Must Be Issued; To Extend Until January 1, 2018, The Date After Which The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Not Allocate Such Credits; To Make It Clear That Municipal Airport Authorities Are Included Within The Definition Of The Term "public Entity" Or "public Entities" For Purposes Of The Provision That Authorizes The Creation Of Public Benefit Corporations Under This Section; And For Related Purposes.

2221.title: Distinctive license plate; authorize for supporters of the Mississippi Vision Foundation.
2221.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag To Supporters Of The Mississippi Vision Foundation; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2222.title: Mississippi Business Finance Corporation; revise definition of "economic development project" for bonds issued prior to 7/1/94.
2222.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-10-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Within The Definition Of The Term "economic Development Project" Under The Law Which Provides For The Issuance Of Bonds By The Mississippi Business Finance Corporation To Finance Economic Development Projects In Order To Induce The Location Or Expansion Of Certain Businesses Within This State, The Economic Development Project Of A Related Approved Company That Is Merged Into Or Consolidated With Another Approved Company Where The Approved Companies Are Engaged In A Vertically Integrated Manufacturing Or Warehouse Operation; And For Related Purposes.

2223.title: Severance tax; change date that returns & payments are due for timber, oil and gas; repeal salt severance tax.
2223.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-25-23, 27-25-519 And 27-25-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Date On Which Timber, Oil And Natural Gas Severance Tax Returns And Payments Are Due To The Twentieth Day Of The Second Month Succeeding The Month In Which The Tax Accrues; To Repeal Sections 27-25-301 Through 27-25-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Mississippi Salt Severance Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

2225.title: Commissioner of Insurance; authorize to employ persons with specialized skills.
2225.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Employ Persons With Specialized Skills; To Allow The State Personnel Board To Pay Those Persons Based On Prevailing Wages, But Not In Excess Of The Salary Of The Deputy Commissioner; And For Related Purposes.

2226.title: Fire insurance policies; increase tax to on gross premium receipts for Fire Marshal and academy expenses.
2226.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-11-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Tax On Gross Premium Receipts Of Fire Policies To Defray Expenses Of The Office Of State Chief Deputy Fire Marshal And State Fire Academy; And For Related Purposes.

2228.title: Prekindergarten programs; increase funding for second and third phase.
2228.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Second And Third Phase Of Prekindergarten Funding Commitment For The "early Learning Collaborative Act Of 2013"; And For Related Purposes.

2229.title: Certain school/community college districts; offer employees a selection regarding group term life insurance coverage.
2229.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-104.1, To Authorize Certain School And Community College Districts To Offer Employees A Selection Regarding Group Term Life Insurance Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

2230.title: Intercept gaming winnings of parents with a child support arrearage; provide procedures for.
2230.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare As Public Policy That Children Are Adversely Affected When A Parent Who Has An Outstanding Child Support Arrearage Diverts Child Support To Gaming; To Codify Section 75-76-58, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Procedures For The Mississippi Gaming Commission, The Department Of Human Services And Licensees Under Chapter 76 Of Title 75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Carry Out The Intercept And Seizure Of Game Winnings Of Parents With A Child Support Arrearage; And For Related Purposes.

2231.title: Motor Vehicle Sales Finance Law; buyer must sign credit insurance disclosure.
2231.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-19-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, Prior To The Execution Of A Motor Vehicle Retail Installment Contract, The Seller Shall Provide A Written Disclosure To Be Signed By The Buyer Regarding Credit Insurance Products; And For Related Purposes.

2232.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds to repair, renovate & refurbish Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center.
2232.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center In Natchez, Mississippi, Which Is Designated A Mississippi Landmark By The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History; And For Related Purposes.

2233.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for epilepsy awareness.
2233.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Epilepsy Awareness Motor Vehicle License Tag; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2235.title: Health care industry zones; may be countywide under certain circumstances.
2235.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-117-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority May Certify An Area As A Health Care Industry Zone If The Facility Is Located In A County In Which Is Located A Facility With A Certificate Of Need For Hospital Beds Or In Which Certain Universities Or Colleges Are Located; And For Related Purposes.

2237.title: Mississippi Acupuncture Practice Act; exempt doctor referral requirement for certain acupuncturists.
2237.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-71-7 And 73-71-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Acupuncturist That Has Been Licensed And Remains In Good Standing In Mississippi For Five Consecutive Years Is Exempt From The Medical Doctor Referral Requirement; And For Related Purposes.

2238.title: Physician/pharmacist drug protocol; authorize single agreement.
2238.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Physicians To Delegate Drug Prescribing Functions To A Pharmacist With A Single Protocol Agreement; And For Related Purposes.

2239.title: Wild deer feeding; allow the use of corn year-round.
2239.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-4-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Allow The Use Of Corn To Feed Wild Deer Throughout The Year; And For Related Purposes.

2240.title: Public lands; allow corporations to purchase lands sold or forfeited to the state for delinquent taxes.
2240.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-1-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Purchase Lands Sold Or Forfeited To The State For Delinquent Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

2241.title: State Employee Wellness Program; make technical amendments to.
2241.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-97-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Amendments To The State Employee Wellness Program To Allow Proper Monitoring And Evaluation Of The Impact And To Require Agencies To Allow Employees To Perform Wellness Activities During Work Hours; And For Related Purposes.

2242.title: Local government capital improvements revolving loan program; include municipal natural gas facilities.
2242.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "capital Improvements" For Purposes Of The Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Program To Include Repair, Renovation And Improvement Of Municipal Natural Gas Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2243.title: Privilege license tax; local governments may reduce or waive.
2243.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-17-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties And Municipalities To Reduce Or Waive The Amount Imposed As A Tax To Secure A Privilege License; And For Related Purposes.

2244.title: Revenue bonds for toll roads and bridges; extend the maximum period of time that they may mature.
2244.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-43-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend From 30 To 40 Years The Maximum Period Of Time That Revenue Bonds Issued By Counties Or Municipalities For Toll Roads And Toll Bridges May Mature; To Amend Section 65-43-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2245.title: Transportation; make placement of guides or warning posts on culverts a discretionary duty of MS Transportation Commission.
2245.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-21-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make The Placement Of Guides Or Warning Posts On Culverts A Discretionary Duty Of The Mississippi Transportation Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2246.title: Red light; motorcycle may proceed with due caution under certain circumstances.
2246.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Motorcycle To Proceed Through A Red Light Using Due Caution Under Certain Limited Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2247.title: Trespassers; codify duty of care to.
2247.description: An Act To Codify The Duty Of Care Of A Possessor Of Real Property To A Licensee Or Trespasser; And For Related Purposes.

2248.title: Contract employees working for state agencies; Personal Service Contract Review Board issue standards in conformity with IRS rules.
2248.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Personal Service Contract Review Board To Develop And Issue Regulations To Define Standards For Contract Employees That Are In Conformity With Federal Internal Revenue Service Regulations; And For Related Purposes.

2249.title: Law Enforcement Officers and Firefighters Scholarship; change requirements related to GPA and proof of disability.
2249.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-107-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Persons Who Apply For The Law Enforcement Officers And Firefighters Scholarship To Have Graduated From High School With A Minimum Grade Point Average Of 2.0; To Require Scholarship Recipients To Maintain A Grade Point Average Of 2.5 As A Condition For Renewal; To Amend Section 37-107-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Documentation That Must Be Submitted To Prove Permanent And Total Disability; And For Related Purposes.

2250.title: Open Meetings Act; remove exemption for public hospitals.
2250.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "public Body" To Remove The Exemption For Public Hospitals In The Open Meetings Act; And For Related Purposes.

2251.title: Levee structures; increase penalty for hunting or target practice upon.
2251.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Penalty For Hunting Or Engaging In Target Practice Upon Or Near A Levee Structure Erected By Any Board Of Levee Commissioners; And For Related Purposes.

2252.title: MS Tuition Assistance Grant; students who score below 20 on the ACT test must attend community college to receive MTAG.
2252.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Students Who Score Below 20 On The Act Test To Attend A Community Or Junior College In Order To Receive An Award Under The Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Program; To Amend Section 37-106-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2253.title: Riding bailiffs; revise per diem.
2253.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-25-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Pay To Be Paid To A Riding Bailiff Per Day Of Service; To Amend Section 19-19-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2254.title: Health care certificate of need law; define "radiation therapy services."
2254.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define "radiation Therapy Services" For Purposes Of The Health Care Certificate Of Need Law; And For Related Purposes.

2255.title: School board members; all elected beginning with the November 2016 general election; appoint all local school superintendents.
2255.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-6-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact The "nonpartisan School Board Election Act"; To Provide That Beginning With The November 2016 General Election, The Members Of The County Boards Of Education, Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts, The Trustees Of Consolidated School Districts And The Trustees From The Special Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected In A Nonpartisan Election Concurrent With The Federal Election For The President Of The United States; To Provide That The Terms Of Office Of All School Board Members Shall Be Four Years; To Provide For Nominating Petitions To Run For The Office Of Elected School Board Members And A Uniform Number Of Signatures On Said Petitions Of Nomination; To Provide The Procedure For Filling Vacancies In The Office Of Elected School Board Members; To Amend Sections 37-5-1, 37-5-3, 37-5-7, 37-5-9, 37-5-18, 37-5-19, 37-7-203, 37-7-207, 37-7-221, 37-7-223, 37-7-225, 37-7-227, 37-7-229 And 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Sections 37-7-204, 37-7-209, 37-7-211, 37-7-213, 37-7-215, 37-7-217 And 37-7-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Electing Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts From Added Territory; To Repeal Sections 37-7-705, 37-7-707, 37-7-709, 37-7-711, 37-7-713, 37-7-715 And 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Selecting Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts; To Amend Sections 37-9-13, 37-9-25 And 37-5-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of All Superintendents Of Schools From And After January 1, 2016; To Authorize A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Office Of Elected County Superintendent Of Education In Counties Pursuant To Petition Prior To January 1, 2015; To Repeal Effective January 1, 2016, Sections 37-5-61, 37-5-63, 37-5-65, 37-5-67, 37-5-69, 37-5-71 And 37-5-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Changing The Position Of County Superintendent Of Education To An Appointed Office Pursuant To Petition And Referendum, Provide For The Reestablishment Of The Office As An Elective Office, Authorize The Appointment Of The County Superintendent Of Education In Certain Counties, Provide For The Selection And Qualifications Of Elected Superintendents In Certain Counties, Provide For The Filling Of Vacancies In The Office Of Elected County Superintendent Of Education, And Section 37-9-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Elective Method Of Choosing The County Superintendent Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

2256.title: Cemeteries, for-profit; authorize reversion of title to space after 99 years.
2256.description: An Act To Create New Section 41-43-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Procedure For For-profit Cemeteries With Burial Spaces And Entombment Rights That Have Been Abandoned For A Certain Period Of Time To Terminate The Owner's Rights To The Burial Space Or Entombment Right; To Provide That If A Burial Space Or Entombment Right Issued By A Cemetery Has Remained Unused For A Period Of At Least 99 Years From The Date Of Sale Or Last Recorded Designation Or Transfer And Has No Improvements On The Burial Space Or Entombment Right, The Current Owner Of The Cemetery May Terminate The Rights And Interests Of The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right; To Provide That If The Cemetery Owner Desires To Terminate The Rights And Interests Of The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right And Determines That The Required Conditions Have Been Met, The Cemetery Owner Must First Send The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right A Notice Of The Intent To Terminate And Declare Abandoned The Owner's Rights To The Burial Space Or Entombment Right By Certified Mail With Return Receipt Requested; To Provide That A Person Who Has Received A Termination Notice May Inform The Cemetery Owner Of The Continued Intent To Claim The Burial Space Or Entombment Right; To Provide That If The Cemetery Owner Has Been Informed Of That Intent, The Cemetery Owner Shall Not Terminate The Rights And Interests Of The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right; To Provide That If The Cemetery Owner Has Not Received A Response From The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Within 90 Days After Sending The Required Notice, The Cemetery Owner Shall Advertise In A Newspaper Of General Circulation In The County Of The Owner's Last-known Address Seeking The Owner's Current Address; To Provide That If The Cemetery Owner Has Not Received A Response Regarding The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Within 90 Days After Placing The Required Advertisement, The Owner's Rights And Interests In The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Are Terminated, And The Cemetery Owner May Sell The Burial Space Or Entombment Right To A New Owner; To Provide That If The Owner Of A Burial Space Or Entombment Right Contacts The Cemetery Owner After The Rights And Interests In The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Are Terminated, The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Is Entitled To Certain Remedies; To Provide That Persons Who Violate The Provisions Of This Act Are Subject To Certain Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2257.title: Marine Resources; prohibit commercial fishing with nets near designated fishing keys.
2257.description: An Act To Prohibit Any Type Of Commercial Fishing Involving A Net Within A Certain Distance Of Designated Fishing Keys; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2258.title: Municipal judges; remove maximum limit on number of in certain cities.
2258.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-23-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Limit On The Maximum Number Of Municipal Judges In Cites Of A Certain Size; To Amend Section 21-23-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2259.title: Teacher salary scale; provide new salary scale for beginning teachers.
2259.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A New Salary Scale For Beginning Teachers Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

2260.title: Law Enforcement Officers and Fire Fighters Death Benefit Trust Fund; increase funding for.
2260.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The State Assessment Upon Persons Convicted Of Certain Criminal Violations For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funding For The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund; To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Payment From The Fund When A Firefighter Is Killed Or Injured During The Performance Of His Official Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2264.title: Agricultural Marketing Cooperative; revise procedures for amendments to articles and election of officers.
2264.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-19-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Agricultural Marketing Cooperatives To Deal In Agricultural Products With Nonmembers Under Certain Restrictions; To Amend Section 79-19-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duration Of An Association; To Amend Section 79-19-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure For Less Than A Majority Of All Members Of The Association To Adopt Proposed Amendments To The Articles Of An Association; To Amend Section 79-19-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Election Of A Chief Operating Officer Of The Association; To Amend Section 79-19-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Membership Fee; To Amend Section 79-19-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Fees For Filing Articles Of An Association And Amendments To The Articles; To Create New Section 79-19-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The General Nonprofit Corporation Laws And All Powers And Rights Under Those Laws Shall Apply To Agricultural Marketing Associations Unless Those Laws Are In Conflict With The Express Provisions Of The Agricultural Marketing Cooperative Act; And For Related Purposes.

2265.title: Task Force to Study Strategies for Solving the Current Teacher Shortage; extend.
2265.description: An Act To Amend Section 1 Of Chapter 484, Laws Of 2010, As Amended By Section 2 Of Chapter 512, Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Task Force To Study Strategies For Solving The Current Teacher Shortage In Mississippi Until The Filing Of Its Legislative Report In 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2266.title: Bicycle safety; require helmets when riding on public streets.
2266.description: An Act To Provide That All Operators Of Bicycles, Tricycles And Skateboards Wear A Helmet When Riding On Any Public Road, Highway Or Bike Path; And For Related Purposes.

2267.title: Agritourism; remove repealer on sections regulating agritourism.
2267.description: An Act To Repeal Section 69-53-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Repeal Of The Statues Regulating Agritourism; And For Related Purposes.

2269.title: Professional school counselors; provide for assignment and responsibilities.
2269.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Assignment And Responsibilities Of Professional School Counselors Employed By Public School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

2270.title: Salary supplement for certain school educators; clarify eligibility for single supplement.
2270.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Licensed Educator Is Only Eligible For A Single Salary Supplement For Receiving Certain Certificate Endorsements; And For Related Purposes.

2271.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of firearms, ammunition and hunting supplies during Mississippi Sportsman Weekend.
2271.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Firearms, Ammunition And Hunting Supplies When Sold During The Annual Mississippi Second Amendment Weekend Holiday Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The First Friday In September And Ending At 12:00 Midnight On The Following Sunday; And For Related Purposes.

2273.title: "Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act"; enact.
2273.description: An Act To Prohibit Abortions If The Probable Post-fertilization Age Of The Unborn Child Is 20 Weeks Or Greater; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Provide Certain Exceptions; To Amend Section 97-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2274.title: Municipal annexation; require approval by majority of electors in area to be annexed and in certain adjoining areas.
2274.description: An Act To Create Section 21-1-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Election On The Question Of Municipal Annexation In The Territory Proposed To Be Annexed And In Certain Adjoining Territory; To Require The Governing Authorities Of The Municipality To Annex The Proposed Territory And The Unincorporated Areas Of Both The Census Block Where The Territory Is Located And Any Census Block Adjoining That Territory If Approved By A Majority Vote Of Qualified Electors; To Amend Sections 21-1-27, 21-1-29, 21-1-31, 21-1-33, 21-1-35, 21-1-37 And 21-1-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Question Of Municipal Annexation From The Chancery Court; And For Related Purposes.

2275.title: Pharmacy benefit manager; extend effective date on the revised definition of.
2275.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Effective Date On The Revised Definition Of "pharmacy Benefit Manager" For Purposes Of The Pharmacy Benefit Prompt Pay Act; And For Related Purposes.

2276.title: Katie's Law; require DNA sample from certain arrestees.
2276.description: An Act To Create Katie's Law; To Provide For Dna Collection From Persons Arrested For Crimes Of Violence; And For Related Purposes.

2278.title: Recreational vehicles; regulate relationship between manufacturers and dealers of.
2278.description: An Act To Prohibit Manufacturers Or Distributors Of Recreational Vehicles From Selling Recreational Vehicles In This State Without First Entering Into A Manufacturer-dealer Agreement With A Dealer; To Provide For The Designation Of The Area Of Sales Responsibility Exclusively Assigned To A Dealer; To Provide For The Termination, Cancellation, Nonrenewal And Alteration Of A Dealership By A Manufacturer Or Distributor; To Provide For Repurchase Of Inventory By A Manufacturer Upon Termination Of A Manufacturer-dealer Agreement Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For Transfer Of Ownership Of Dealerships; To Specify Warranty Obligations; To Provide For Indemnification Of The Parties To The Agreement Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For The Repair Of Recreational Vehicles Damaged In Transit To The Dealer And Rejection By A Dealer Of Recreational Vehicles Damaged In Transit Under Certain Circumstances; To Prohibit Coercion Of A Dealer To Purchase Products The Dealer Did Not Order And To Prohibit Coercion Of A Dealer To Enter Into Certain Agreements; To Provide For Mediation Of Disputes; To Regulate The Selling Of Recreational Vehicles At Shows; To Amend Sections 63-17-73, 63-17-111 And 63-17-131, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2279.title: Texting; prohibit while driving for all ages.
2279.description: An Act To Create Section 63-3-1217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Texting While Driving; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Exemptions; To Repeal Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Texting While Driving By The Holders Of Temporary And Intermediate Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

2280.title: Texting while driving; constitutes careless driving.
2280.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-1213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Rebuttable Presumption That Manually Texting While Driving Constitutes Careless Driving; And For Related Purposes.

2281.title: Income tax; reduce the rate of tax.
2281.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Rate Of The State Income Tax By Providing That All Taxable Income In Excess Of $5,000.00 Shall Be Taxed At The Rate Of 4%; And For Related Purposes.

2282.title: State Longitudinal Data System (SLDS); allow parents of public school students to opt-out of mandatory electronic tracking system.
2282.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-154-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Longitudinal Data System (slds) Governing Board Shall Allow The Parents Or Legal Guardians Of Public School Students To Opt-out Of The Mandatory Electronic Data Educational Tracking System; And For Related Purposes.

2283.title: Income tax; exclude from gross income certain amounts spent by teachers for classroom supplies.
2283.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income Under The Income Tax Law, Certain Amounts Expended By A Teacher From His Or Her Personal Funds For Classroom Supplies, Instructional Materials Or Equipment To Be Used By Students In A School Classroom; To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2284.title: "4th Amendment Protection Act"; prohibit any state action which implements the federal NSA program.
2284.description: An Act Entitled The "4th Amendment Protection Act"; To Prohibit Any State Action Which Implements Any Federal Nsa Program; To Provide Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2285.title: "Mississippi Recall Act of 2014"; enact.
2285.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Recall Act Of 2014" To Provide A Procedure For The Recall Of State And Local Elected Officials; To Provide Definitions; To Prescribe Those Officers Subject To Recall; To Prescribe The Number Of Electors Needed To Demand A Recall; To Prescribe Grounds For Recall; To Provide For The Application For And Time Of Filing A Recall Petition By Sponsors; To Provide For The Review Of The Grounds Stated In The Application; To Provide A Form For The Recall Petition; To Prescribe Those Electors Eligible To Sign A Recall Petition And A Procedure For The Verification Of Signatures; To Prohibit Certain Persons From Circulating A Petition Or Application; To Provide For The Determination Of Legal Sufficiency Of A Petition By The Circuit Court; To Provide For The Manner Of Conducting A Recall Election; To Provide For The Filing Of Subsequent Recall Petitions Following A Recall Election Or Denial Of Recall Petition; To Authorize The State Board Of Election Commissioners To Promulgate Regulations To Implement This Act; To Authorize An Application To The Circuit Court To Compel Compliance With Recall Procedures; To Prohibit Giving Or Receiving Money To Sign Petitions Or Affidavits For Recall And Other Recall Infractions, And To Provide Criminal Penalties Therefor; To Repeal Sections 25-5-3 Through 25-5-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide A Recall Procedure For Local Officials Pursuant To Petition And Election; And For Related Purposes.

2286.title: Vexatious Litigant Law; enact.
2286.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Vexatious Litigant Law; To Enact Definitions; To Provide Relief For Defendants Subjected To Suit By Persons Determined By A Court To Be Vexatious Litigants; To Require Posting Of Security For Costs And Fees Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2287.title: Public funds; prohibit investment in countries sponsoring terrorism.
2287.description: An Act To Require That No Public Funds Shall Be Invested In Any Financial Investment That Has Relationships With Terrorist-sponsoring Nations; And For Related Purposes.

2288.title: Inventory; phase in an ad valorem tax exemption for.
2288.description: An Act To Phase In An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes On Commodities, Raw Materials, Works-in-process, Products, Goods, Wares And Merchandise Held For Resale By Any Manufacturer, Distributor, Wholesale Or Retail Merchant; To Repeal Section 27-7-22.5, Which Authorizes An Income Tax Credit In Certain Amounts For Manufacturers, Distributors, Wholesale Or Retail Merchants For Ad Valorem Taxes Paid On Commodities, Raw Materials, Works-in-process, Products, Goods, Wares And Merchandise Held For Resale By Any Manufacturer, Distributor, Wholesale Or Retail Merchant; And For Related Purposes.

2289.title: Homestead exemption; extend to unremarried surviving spouses of totally disabled veterans.
2289.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Homestead Exemption Granted To A Person Who Has A Service-connected Total Disability As An American Veteran And Has Been Honorably Discharged From Military Service Shall Extend To The Unremarried Surviving Spouse Of Such A Person; And For Related Purposes.

2290.title: Department of Revenue; require to conduct a feasibility regarding the elimination of ad valorem taxation.
2290.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Revenue To Study The Feasibility Of Phasing Out And Eliminating The Imposition Of Ad Valorem Taxes On All Property In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2294.title: School district consolidation; require in Leflore County and Greenwood.
2294.description: An Act To Provide That In The Leflore County And Greenwood Municipal Separate School Districts There Shall Be An Administrative Consolidation Into One School District To Be Designated As The Greenwood Leflore School District, Which Shall Be A Countywide School District Effective July 1, 2016; To Provide For The Composition Of The Board Of Education Of The New Greenwood Leflore School District; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Administratively Consolidate Any School District Which Does Not Voluntarily Follow The Consolidation Order; To Abolish The Former School Districts Following The Administrative Consolidation And Provide For The Transfer Of School District Assets And Liabilities; To Provide For Execution Of Teacher And School District Employee Contracts And The Preparation Of A School District Budget In The New School District; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Promulgate Regulations To Implement Such Administrative Consolidation; To Provide A Two-year Waiver From Certain Accountability And State Assessment Requirements For The New Student Population; To Amend Sections 37-5-7 And 37-7-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2295.title: Legislature; reduce the size of the Legislature after the 2023 election.
2295.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2023 Statewide General Election The Mississippi House Of Representatives Shall Consist Of 110 Members; To Amend Section 5-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2023 Statewide General Election The Mississippi Senate Shall Consist Of 47 Members; And For Related Purposes.

2296.title: Cockfighting; offense to conduct, train or attend.
2296.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Cockfighting And The Punishment Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2297.title: Vulnerable senior citizens; Mississippi Leadership Council on Aging may establish investigation/legal unit.
2297.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-53-5 And 43-53-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Leadership Council On Aging To Establish A Senior Crimes Network System To Provide Investigative And Legal Services For Vulnerable Senior Citizens; And For Related Purposes.

2298.title: Entrepreneur in Residence Pilot Program; establish under authority of the Small Business Regulatory Review Committee.
2298.description: An Act To Create The Entrepreneur In Residence Pilot Program Committee To Provide For Better Outreach By State Government To Small Businesses; To Provide That The Small Business Regulatory Review Committee Shall Select State Agencies That Have Functions Affecting Small Businesses To Participate In The Pilot Program; To Provide That The Small Business Regulatory Review Committee Shall Assign Entrepreneurs In Residence From Among Individuals Who Are Representative Of Small Businesses And Who Are Successful In Their Fields; To Provide That Upon Conclusion Of The Pilot Program, The Small Business Regulatory Review Committee Shall Submit A Report To The Mississippi Development Authority With Its Recommendations On The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2299.title: Public Records Act; provide exemption for unpublished research records of community colleges and universities.
2299.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Exemption From The Mississippi Public Records Act For Certain Records Created Or Collected In The Course Of Academic Research; And For Related Purposes.

2301.title: D'Iberville property; authorize DFA to sell on behalf of USM.
2301.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Sell And Convey Certain State-owned Real Property And Any Improvements Thereon Under The Possession And Control Of The University Of Southern Mississippi, Located In D'iberville, Harrison County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Sell And Convey Parcels Of Certain State-owned Real Property And Any Improvements Thereon Under The Possession And Control Of The University Of Southern Mississippi, Located In The City Of Hattiesburg, Forrest County, Mississippi; To Stipulate The Conditions Under Which The Property May Be Sold To Promote The Highest And Best Use For The University Of Southern Mississippi And The State; To Provide That The Selling Entity Shall Entertain Requests For Proposals For The Sale And Purchase Of The Property And Improvements And Accept The Proposal That Provides The Highest And Best Value For The University Of Southern Mississippi And The State Which Shall Include, But Not Be Limited To The Price, Use And Other Proposal Conditions As Required By The University And The State; To Provide That The State Shall Retain All Mineral Rights To The Real Property Sold Or Leased Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2302.title: School district consolidation; require in Kemper County and Noxubee County.
2302.description: An Act To Provide That In The Kemper County And Noxubee County School Districts There Shall Be An Administrative Consolidation Into One School District To Be Designated As The Kemper-noxubee Consolidated School District, Which Shall Be A Line Consolidated School District Effective July 1, 2015; To Provide For The Composition Of The Board Of Trustees Of The New Kemper-noxubee Consolidated School District; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Administratively Consolidate Any School District Which Does Not Voluntarily Follow The Consolidation Order; To Abolish The Former School Districts Following The Administrative Consolidation And Provide For The Transfer Of School District Assets And Liabilities; To Provide For Execution Of Teacher And School District Employee Contracts And The Preparation Of A School District Budget In The New School District; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Promulgate Regulations To Implement Such Administrative Consolidation; To Provide A Two-year Waiver From Accountability And State Assessment Requirements For The New Student Population; To Amend Sections 37-7-103 And 37-7-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2303.title: Driver's education; require for drivers under age 17.
2303.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Drivers Under The Age Of 17 To Have Completed A Driver's Education Course In Order To Hold An Intermediate License; And For Related Purposes.

2306.title: PERS; require to study SLRP to determine the feasibility of closing or allowing members to opt out.
2306.description: An Act To Require The Public Employees' Retirement System To Conduct A Study Of The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan (slrp) To Determine The Feasibility And Cost Of Closing Slrp To New Members And/or Offering Members The Ability To Opt Out Of Slrp; To Require Pers To File A Report With The Legislature By Not Later Than December 1, 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2307.title: Transportation; make certain duties of the MS Transportation Commission and Department discretionary.
2307.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-1-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Exercise Discretionary Duties With Regard To The Maintenance Of The State Highway System; And For Related Purposes.

2308.title: West Nile Virus Mosquito Management Grant Program; establish in the State Department of Health.
2308.description: An Act To Establish A West Nile Virus Mosquito Management Grant Program In The State Department Of Health To Assist Municipalities And Counties In Providing Matching Funds For Pesticide And Larvicide Spray Programs, The Elimination Of Breeding Sites On Public Land, And Public Awareness Efforts; To Create The West Nile Virus Mosquito Management Grant Fund To Be Administered By The State Department Of Health; To Amend Sections 41-27-5, 41-27-13 And 41-27-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2309.title: SLURP; authorize current members to opt out and give persons elected in the future the option of not becoming members.
2309.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant All Persons Who Are Contributing Members Of The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan On July 1, 2014, A One-time Option To Withdraw From Membership In The Plan; To Provide That Upon Exercising This Option The Contributions To The Plan By The Member Shall Cease And The Person's Accumulated Contributions To The Plan Shall Be Paid To Him Or Her; To Provide That This Option Must Be Exercised Before September 1, 2014; To Provide That Persons Who Are Elected As Members Of The State Legislature Or President Of The Senate After July 1, 2014, And Who Previously Served As Members Of The Legislature Or President Of The Senate But Were Not A Member Of The State Legislature On July 1, 2014, Shall Have The Option Of Withdrawing From Membership In The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan; To Provide That The Person's Accumulated Contributions To The Plan Shall Be Paid To Him Or Her; To Provide That Once Exercised, This Option Shall Be Permanent; To Provide That Persons Who Become Members Of The State Legislature For The First Time After July 1, 2014, And The Persons Who Become The President Of The Senate For The First Time After July 1, 2014, Shall Have The Option Of Not Being A Member Of The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan; To Provide That Once Exercised, This Option Shall Be Permanent; And For Related Purposes.

2310.title: Health insurance exchange; prohibit State of Mississippi from establishing.
2310.description: An Act To Prohibit Any State Agency, Department Or Political Subdivision From Planning, Creating, Participating In Or Enabling An Exchange For Health Insurance Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act; To Provide That Any Such Exchange Established Before The Effective Date Of This Act Shall Be Invalid And Must Be Discontinued; And For Related Purposes.

2311.title: Firearms; prohibit state cooperation with federal effort to ban.
2311.description: An Act To Prohibit State Or Local Enabling Of Federal Gun Ban Enforcement; And For Related Purposes.

2313.title: Corporation franchise tax; phase out effective January 1, 2019.
2313.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The Corporation Franchise Tax Effective January 1, 2019; To Repeal, Effective January 1, 2019, Sections 27-13-1 Through 27-13-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Corporation Franchise Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

2315.title: USM Hattiesburg property; DFA may sell/lease portion of without accepting competitive bids.
2315.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Sell And Convey Or Lease Parcels Of Certain State-owned Real Property And Any Improvements Thereon Under The Possession And Control Of The University Of Southern Mississippi, Located In The City Of Hattiesburg, Forrest County, Mississippi; To Stipulate The Condition Under Which The Property May Be Sold To Promote The Highest And Best Use For The University Of Southern Mississippi, The City Of Hattiesburg And The State; To Exempt The Selling Entity From The Advertising Requirement For Acceptance Of Competitive Bids On The Property; To Provide That The State Shall Retain The Right To Repurchase The Real Property Or Terminate The Lease If Certain Conditions Occur; To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Review And Consider All Proposals For The Purchase Or Lease Of The Property Using Certain Reviewing Factors; To Provide That The State Shall Retain All Mineral Rights To The Real Property Sold Or Leased Under This Act; To Amend Sections 27-33-17 And 27-33-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2317.title: Cyberbullying; revise and clarify electronic communication offenses.
2317.description: An Act To Revise And Clarify Electronic Communication Offenses; To Amend Section 97-29-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Obscene Electronic Communication; To Amend Section 97-45-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Cyberstalking; To Amend Section 97-45-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Cyberbullying; And For Related Purposes.

2318.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tags; authorize for various organizations.
2318.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of Stringer Attendance Center, Beauvoir (the Last Home Of Jefferson Davis And Presidential Library), Hispaniola Mountain Ministries, Hancock High School, Jim Hill High School, Friends Of Jackson County Animal Shelter Pets, The National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund, The Lawrence County School District, The Pass Christian School District, The Mississippi Vision Foundation, The Mississippi Band Of Choctaw Indians, The State Board Of Cosmetology, Meridian High School, The Pontotoc City School District, Moss Point High School, Forest High School, Mississippi Motosteps Motorcycle Safety Training, The Choctaw County Chargers, The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund, The Mississippi Wildlife Enforcement Officers' Association, Inc., West Lauderdale High School, Mississippi Fca, The Catfish Industry, Preservation Of The Kemp's Ridley Sea Turtle, And Mississippi's Toughest Kids Foundation; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of The Dallas Cowboys Professional Football Team; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Members Of The Grand Chapter Of The Mississippi Order Of The Eastern Star Or The Spouse And Children Of Deceased Members; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Commemorating The City Of Marks As The Home Of "the Mule Train"; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Epilepsy Awareness Motor Vehicle License Tag; To Prescribe Additional Fees For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Amend Section 27-19-56.7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of A Public Junior College Or Community College In This State; To Amend Section 27-19-56.14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Persons To Whom The Grand Lodge Of Mississippi, Free And Accepted Masons, Distinctive License Tag May Be Issued; To Amend Section 27-19-56.15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags That Display The Emblems Of Universities Located In Other States; To Revise The Distribution Of Fees Collected From The Issuance Of Distinctive License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of The University Of Memphis; To Amend Section 27-19-56.108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of Rotary International; To Amend Section 27-19-56.133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Boys And Girls Clubs; To Amend Section 27-19-56.307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of Phi Kappa Tau Fraternity; To Amend Section 27-19-56.22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Optional Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Design For Members Of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity; To Amend Section 27-19-56.27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags That Bear Either Of The Emblems Authorized For Supporters Of The Mississippi Seafood Industry Must Meet The Requirements Of Section 27-19-44; To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce To 200 The Number Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of Rotary International Required To Be Sold Prior To The Preparation And Issuance Of Such Tags By The Department Of Revenue And To Exempt The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Authorized To Be Issued For Supporters Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund From The Provisions Of This Section; To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation One Motor Vehicle Owned By A Person Who Is A Law Enforcement Officer And Who Was Wounded Or Otherwise Received Intentional Or Accidental Bodily Injury While Engaged In The Performance Of His Official Duties And Was Required To Receive Medical Treatment For The Wound Or Injury Due To The Nature And Extent Of The Wound Or Injury; And For Related Purposes.

And For Related Purposes.

2321.title: Real estate appraiser licensees; require criminal background checks and revise prerequisites for examination.
2321.description: An Act To Create New Section 73-34-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Background Investigations Of Prospective Real Estate Appraiser Licensees; To Amend Section 73-34-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Prerequisites To Taking Examinations For Licensing; To Amend Section 73-34-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Licensees To Undergo A Criminal History Records Check For Renewal Of License; And For Related Purposes.

2322.title: Domestic violence; clarify sentencing status of multiple offender, revise protection order.
2322.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Sentencing Status Of A Multiple Domestic Violence Offender; To Amend Section 93-21-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Term Of A Domestic Violence Protection Order; And For Related Purposes.

2323.title: Child care facility licensure by the State Department of Health; provide certain standards and restrictions.
2323.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-20-9, 43-20-11, 43-20-14 And 43-20-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose Certain Standards Relative To The Licensure Of Child Care Facilities, To Provide Certain Complaint Procedures, To Provide Certain Notice Requirements Prior To License Disciplinary Action; And For Related Purposes.

2324.title: Concealed weapons law; decrease certain fees for licensees.
2324.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Decrease Certain Fees For Licensees Under The Concealed Weapons Law; To Exempt Active Duty Members Of The Armed Forces Of The United States From Payment Of The License Fee; And For Related Purposes.

2325.title: Assistant to the Attorney General; revise salary provisions.
2325.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-3-39.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Compensation Of Special Assistant, Assistant And Deputy Attorneys General Shall Be Fixed By The Attorney General; And For Related Purposes.

2326.title: Adoption records, confidentiality of; provide for contempt and misdemeanor proceedings.
2326.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-17-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Confidentiality Of Adoption Records And To Provide For Criminal Prosecution And A Finding Of Civil Contempt Against A Person Who Discloses Adoption Records Or Other Confidential Adoption Information Without Leave Of Court; And For Related Purposes.

2327.title: Structured settlement payments; revise disclosures required in petition for transfer of.
2327.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-57-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Disclosure To Be Made In An Application For Approval Of A Transfer Of Structured Settlement Payment Rights; And For Related Purposes.

2328.title: Federal subject matter jurisdiction; correlate with plenary state court subject matter jurisdiction.
2328.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-17-35 And 11-17-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Jurisdiction That May Be Exercised By The State Courts In Certain Title Disputes Pending The Settlement Of A Claim Of Title In The United States Of America And To Recognize The Function And Application Of Federal Law; And For Related Purposes.

2329.title: Mental commitment cases; revise screening process.
2329.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-21-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Prescreening Process In Mental Commitment Cases; And For Related Purposes.

2330.title: Statewide Grand Jury Act; extend repeal clause.
2330.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 13-7-1, 13-7-3, 13-7-5, 13-7-7, 13-7-9, 13-7-11, 13-7-13, 13-7-15, 13-7-17, 13-7-19, 13-7-21, 13-7-23, 13-7-25, 13-7-27, 13-7-29, 13-7-31, 13-7-33, 13-7-35, 13-7-37, 13-7-39, 13-7-41, 13-7-43, 13-7-45, 13-7-47 And 13-7-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The State Grand Jury Act And Provide For The Operation Of A State Grand Jury; To Amend Section 99-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On Venue For Indictments By The State Grand Jury; To Amend Section 27, Chapter 553, Laws Of 1993, As Amended By Chapter 382, Laws Of 1998, As Amended By Chapter 480, Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Chapter 471, Laws Of 2002, As Amended By Chapter 506, Laws Of 2005, As Amended By Chapter 337, Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repealer On The State Grand Jury Act; And For Related Purposes.

2331.title: Mississippi Gulf Coast Advanced Technology Corridor; create.
2331.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Gulf Coast Advanced Technology Corridor For The Purpose Of Growing, Retaining And Attracting High-technology Enterprises To Counties In Mississippi Traversed By Interstate Highway 10; To Create The Board Of Directors Of The Mississippi Gulf Coast Advanced Technology Corridor And Provide For Its Powers And Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2332.title: MS Dept. of Archives and History property; DFA may transfer certain lands to U.S. Dept. of the Interior, Vicksburg National Military Park.
2332.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History, To Donate To The U.s. Department Of The Interior, National Park Service, Vicksburg National Military Park Certain Real Property Under The Possession And Control Of The Department Of Archives And History, Located In Hinds And Claiborne Counties, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2333.title: Taxation; authorize alternate method of apportioning for income tax, revise appellate procedure for the appeals.
2333.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-7-23 And 27-7-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Use Of Certain Alternative Methods To Apportion, For Income Tax Purposes, The Income Of Corporations Or Organizations Having Business Income From Activity That Is Taxable Within And Without This State; To Provide That In Cases Involving Such Corporations And Organizations And In Cases Involving Financial Institutions, The Party Requesting Or Requiring The Alternative Method Shall Bear The Burden Of Proving By Clear And Convincing Evidence In Any Administrative Or Judicial Proceeding That The Standard Methods Of Apportionment Do Not Fairly Represent The Taxpayer's Activity; To Amend Sections 27-7-37, 27-7-51, 27-7-53, 27-7-315, 25-7-327 And 27-7-345, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Commissioner Of Revenue May Not Require A Corporation That Is Affiliated With One Or More Corporations That Are Not Taxable Under The Income Tax Law To File A Combined Return Until Regulations Have Been Enacted Specifying The Criteria And Circumstances That Form The Basis For Meeting The Clear And Convincing Evidence Standard Required To Support A Conclusion That Intercompany Transactions Of Such Corporation Have Resulted In The Shifting Of Taxable Income From A Taxpayer To Another Member Or Members Of Its Affiliated Group Not Subject To Tax Under This Article, Or That The Intercompany Transactions Of Such Corporations Have Resulted In The Shifting Of Taxable Income Between Members Of The Included Affiliated Group; To Prohibit The Commissioner Of Revenue From Assessing Certain Penalties Arising From Requiring A Combined Return Except Upon Clear And Convincing Evidence That The Taxpayer's Method Was Without Reasonable Basis, Or That It Is Beyond A Reasonable Doubt The Taxpayer Filed A False Or Fraudulent Return With Intent To Evade The Income Tax; To Provide That One Of The Options For Delivering Certain Notices To The Taxpayer Under The Income Tax Law Shall Be Certified Mail, Return Receipt Requested, Rather Than Regular Mail, And To Provide That The Period Of Time To Respond To Such Notices Shall Begin From The Date Of Mailing Or Hand Delivering The Notice; To Reduce Certain Interest Penalties That May Be Imposed By The Commissioner Of Revenue Under The Income Tax Law From 1% To 1/2% Per Month; To Make The Imposition Of Such Penalties Discretionary; To Apply Certain Penalties To The Tax Deficiency Or Delinquency Rather Than The Amount Of The Tax; To Provide That A Taxpayers Failure To File An Appeal For Denial Or Refund Of Overpayment Based On The Failure Of The Overpayment To Be Paid The Taxpayer Within 6 Months, Does Not Prejudice The Taxpayer's Right To File An Appeal Upon A Subsequent Formal Denial; To Amend Section 27-13-23 And 27-13-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That One Of The Options For Delivering Certain Notices To The Taxpayer Under The Franchise Tax Law Shall Be Certified Mail, Return Receipt Requested, Rather Than Regular Mail, And To Provide That The Period Of Time To Respond To Such Notices Shall Begin From The Date Of Mailing Or Hand Delivering The Notice; To Reduce Certain Interest Penalties That May Be Imposed By The Commissioner Of Revenue Under The Franchise Tax Law From 1% To 1/2% Of 1% Per Month; To Make The Imposition Of Such Penalties Discretionary; To Apply Certain Penalties To The Tax Deficiency Or Delinquency Rather Than The Amount Of The Tax; To Amend Sections 27-65-3, 27-65-31, 27-65-35, 27-65-37 And 27-65-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Within The Definition Of The Term "taxpayer" Under The Sales Tax Law, In The Case Of A Claim For A Refund Of Overpaid Taxes, Any Person Who Paid A Tax To A Seller Or Other Party And Bore The Economic Burden Of The Tax; To Provide That Penalties For Failure To Remit Funds Collected By A Seller Under The Sales Tax Law Shall Not Be Levied Unless The Commissioner Proves By Clear And Convincing Evidence That The Taxpayer Actually Collected The Funds From The Purchaser And Knowingly And Intentionally Failed To Remit Them; To Provide That One Of The Options For Delivering Certain Notices To The Taxpayer Under The Sales Tax Law Shall Be Certified Mail, Return Receipt Requested, Rather Than Regular Mail, And To Provide That The Period Of Time To Respond To Such Notices Shall Begin From The Date Of Mailing Or Hand Delivering The Notice; To Reduce Certain Interest Penalties That May Be Imposed By The Commissioner Of Revenue Under The Sales Tax Law From 1% To 1/2% Of 1% Per Month; To Make The Imposition Of Such Penalties Discretionary; To Apply Certain Penalties To The Tax Deficiency Or Delinquency Rather Than The Amount Of The Tax; To Provide That In Regard To The Penalty For Deficient Or Delinquent Sales Tax That Is Intentional, A Taxpayer's Purported Disregard Of Instructions Given Through An Audit Shall Not Be A Basis For The Imposition Of The Penalty, And A Taxpayer's Good-faith Challenge To The Constitutionality Or Legality Of A Law Or Regulation Shall Preclude The Imposition Of The Penalty; To Amend Sections 27-77-1, 27-77-5 And 27-77-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That "mail," "mailed" Or "mailing" Under The Laws Governing The Board Of Tax Appeals Shall Mean Certified Mail, Return Receipt Requested, Rather Than First-class Mail; To Expand The Actions That May Be Appealed To The Board Of Tax Appeals; To Provide That If The Department Of Revenue's Board Of Review Does Not Issue An Order Within 6 Months Of A Hearing, The Taxpayer May Treat The Failure To Issue An Order As A Denial Of The Relief Requested In The Hearing And Appeal To The Board Of Tax Appeals; To Provide That At Hearings Before The Board Of Tax Appeals, The Board Shall Give No Deference To The Decision Of The Department Of Revenue Or Board Of Review Or Its Interpretation Of Any Law That Is Not Contained Within Official Regulations Of The Department Of Revenue, But It Shall Try The Case De Novo; To Provide That If The Board Of Tax Appeals Does Not Issue An Order Within 9 Months Of A Hearing, The Taxpayer May Treat The Failure To Issue An Order As A Denial Of The Relief Requested In The Hearing And Appeal To The Chancery Court; To Provide That Any Appeal Or Other Filing With The Board Of Review Or Board Of Tax Appeals Shall Be Considered Timely If It Is Hand Delivered, Mailed, Postmarked, Shipped, Or Electronically Transmitted Via Electronic Mail, Electronic Filing Or Facsimile By Midnight Of The Due Date For The Filing; To Remove The Requirement That A Taxpayer Must Post A Bond To Appeal Decisions Of The Board Of Tax Appeals; And For Related Purposes.

2335.title: High-school graduation and grade promotion requirements; replace PARCC with ACT Test.
2335.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department To Replace Satp And Parcc Student Assessments With The Act Test; To Provide That Beginning With The 2014-2015 School Year Students Shall Be Required To Pass The Act Test With A Satisfactory Score Determined By The State Board Of Education For Promotion To Grade Levels And High-school Graduation; And For Related Purposes.

2338.title: Dental hygienists; provide for general supervision of licensed dental hygienists by licensed dentists.
2338.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-9-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For General Supervision Of Licensed Dental Hygienists By Licensed Dentists; To Provide Definitions; And For Related Purposes.

2339.title: Paternity; clarify circumstances under which putative father cannot contest.
2339.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Circumstances Under Which A Putative Father Cannot Further Contest Paternity; And For Related Purposes.

2341.title: State aid roads; remove restriction on use of local bridge replacement and rehabilitation program funds on state aid roads.
2341.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-37-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Restriction On Use Of Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program Funds On State Aid Roads; And For Related Purposes.

2344.title: Mississippi State Seal; insert "IN GOD WE TRUST."
2344.description: An Act To Provide That The Seal Of The State Of Mississippi Shall Include The Phrase "in God We Trust"; And For Related Purposes.

2346.title: Money transmission; require licensees to collect a fee for each international transaction.
2346.description: An Act To Require Licensees Under The Mississippi Money Transmitters Act To Collect A Fee For Each International Transaction To Be Remitted Quarterly To The Department Of Revenue; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury For The Deposit Of Such Fees; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Suspend The License Of Any Licensee Who Fails To File Reports Or Fails To Remit The Fee; And For Related Purposes.

2348.title: Tourism project sales tax incentive program; include certain hotel projects in.
2348.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-26-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Certain Hotels Within The Definition Of The Term "tourism Project" For Purposes Of Tourism Project Sales Tax Incentive Program; To Amend Section 57-26-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Prohibits, From And After July 1, 2014, The Mississippi Development Authority From Issuing Certificates Designating An Entity As An Approved Participant And Authorizing The Approved Participant To Participate In The Incentive Program; And For Related Purposes.

2349.title: State vehicles; extend moratorium on acquisition of.
2349.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-78, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Moratorium On The Acquisition Of Motor Vehicles By State Agencies; To Allow Any Agency With A Fleet Of Not More Than 50 Vehicles To Replace Certain Vehicles After Submitting Documentation To The Bureau Of Fleet Management; To Amend Section 43-13-407, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Total Amount Of The Tobacco Settlement Installment Payment In Calendar Year 2014 Shall Be Deposited Into The Health Care Expendable Fund; To Provide That A Certain Sum Shall Be Transferred From The Health Care Trust Fund To The Health Care Expendable Fund During Fiscal Year 2014; To Amend Section 65-37-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delay The Requirement For Appropriations To The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program; To Amend Section 27-103-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Distributions Into The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund For Fiscal Year 2014; To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer Certain Sums To The Capital Expense Fund From The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund During Fiscal Year 2015; To Amend House Bill No. 901 (2013 Regular Session) To Delete The Requirements That Certain Funds Transferred From The Capital Expense Fund Shall Be Repaid; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 69, Laws Of 2013, To Amend The Appropriation Amount To The Contingent Fund For The House Of Representatives; To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer Certain Sums To The Capital Expense Fund From The State General Fund; To Amend Section 27-103-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Percentage Limitation On Legislative Appropriations From The State General Fund For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2350.title: Tax assessors and collectors; bring forward provisions regarding salaries of.
2350.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 25-3-3 And 27-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Regarding The Salaries Of County Tax Assessors And Collectors For The Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2351.title: Tax collectors; provide salary supplement for attaining educational benchmark.
2351.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Salary Supplement To Tax Collectors Who Have Completed A Valid Certificate Of Educational Recognition From The Education And Certification Board; To Amend Section 27-19-99, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Certain Proceeds From Vehicle Registration Fees To Be Used For Education And Training; And For Related Purposes.

2352.title: State agency property; authorize DFA as central leasing agent for all state agencies.
2352.description: An Act To Create Section 29-5-2.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Act As The Central Leasing Agent For All State Agencies That Need Space In Any State Or Nonstate-owned Building; To Define And Describe The Area To Be Known As The "capitol Complex"; To Amend Sections 29-5-2, 37-3-5, 41-4-7, 41-73-27, 43-13-116, 43-33-717, 45-11-7, 49-17-713, 49-19-5, 51-8-29, 51-8-31, 51-9-121, 51-11-11, 51-11-13, 51-13-111, 51-15-119, 55-24-9, 57-1-23, 59-5-35, 59-5-37, 59-5-39, 59-7-211, 59-17-13, 65-1-8, 65-1-17, 69-7-109, 69-27-35, 71-3-85, 73-7-3, 73-17-7, 73-39-57, 99-18-13 And 99-39-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2353.title: Mississippi Public Records Act; authorize Ethics Commission to enforce.
2353.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Nonexclusive Administrative Procedure Before The Ethics Commission For The Enforcement Of Public Records Requests; To Provide For Appeal De Novo From The Orders Of The Commission; To Authorize The Commission To Impose The Penalties Otherwise Provided By Law; And For Related Purposes.

2354.title: Posting of bond as a condition of parole or early release by a defendant; authorize.
2354.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Posting Of Bond As A Condition Of Parole Or Early Release To Secure The Appearance Of A Defendant For A Subsequent Parole Or Court Proceeding; To Amend Section 47-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2355.title: Bail bond; clarify when discharged or cleared.
2355.description: An Act To Clarify When A Bail Bond Is Discharged Or Cleared; And For Related Purposes.

2359.title: Critical Needs Teacher Scholarship Program; earmark minimum number of awards for teachers of advanced placement courses.
2359.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-159-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2014-2015 School Year At Least Two Critical Needs Teacher Scholarship Program Awards Shall Be Made In Each Mississippi Congressional District For Teacher Education Students Who Agree To Teach Advanced Placement Courses; And For Related Purposes.

2360.title: Statewide monetary assessments; revise.
2360.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Revision; And For Related Purposes.

2361.title: Homeschool students; authorize participation in extracurricular activities in public school.
2361.description: An Act Entitled The "homeschool Students Equal Access Act"; To Provide Definitions; To Authorize And Direct Local School Boards To Register A Homeschool Student Residing In The School District For Participation In Any Extracurricular Activities Available To Students In The Homeschool Student's Grade; To Provide Certain Conditions For Participation By The Homeschool Student; To Provide For Insurance Coverage For Such Extracurricular Activities; To Provide That Schools Enrolling Such Homeschool Students May Not Be Impeded From Competing Against Other Schools; And For Related Purposes.

2362.title: Texting; prohibit while driving for those under 18.
2362.description: An Act To Create Section 63-3-1217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Texting While Driving; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Exemptions; To Repeal Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Texting While Driving By The Holders Of Temporary And Intermediate Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

2363.title: Natchez Trace Parkway; exempt buildings that are not visible from the parkway from height restrictions.
2363.description: An Act To Amend Section 55-13-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Height Restrictions On Buildings And Other Structures Adjacent To The Natchez Trace Parkway Shall Not Apply To A Certain Senior Living Facility Subject To The Approval Of The Superintendent Of The Natchez Trace Parkway; And For Related Purposes.

2364.title: Emerging Crops Fund; increase amount that may be loaned to assist in financing minority economic development.
2364.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-2-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount That May Be Loaned Or Granted From The Emerging Crops Fund To Assist In Providing Financing For Minority Economic Development; And For Related Purposes.

2365.title: Socially and economically disadvantaged small business concerns; establish program to encourage participation in state contracts by.
