2651.title: Homeowners' associations; create regulation of.
2651.description: An Act To Create Consistent Law Regarding The Formation And Legal Administration Of Homeowners' Associations; To Enact Definitions; To Provide Guidelines For Membership And Organization Of Associations; To Provide Guidelines For Developers' Retaining An Interest; To Specify The Association Formation And Powers; To Provide For A Board Of Directors; To Invalidate Unconstitutional Restrictions In Governing Documents; To Provide For Bylaws; To Create Developer Liability For Misappropriation Of Association Funds; To Create A Lien For Unpaid Assessments; And For Related Purposes.

2652.title: Multijurisdictional Capital City Crime Prevention Program; create.
2652.description: An Act To Create The Capital City Crime Prevention Program; To Require The Office Of The Attorney General To Contract With A Nongovernmental Organization To Assess Public Safety And Functioning Of The Criminal Justice System In The Capital City To Create A Long-term, Comprehensive Plan; To Create A Multijurisdictional Capital City Crime Prevention Task Force; To Provide That The Purpose Of The Task Force Is To Assist Municipal, County And State Law Enforcement In The Apprehension Of Criminals, The Seizure Of Evidence, The Execution Of Warrants And Other Actions Upon Request By Such Law Enforcement Agency; To Implement The Pilot Program; To Create A Mississippi Backlog Initiative Program To Fund Special Prosecutors And Special Judges To Improve The Criminal Justice System In The Pilot Program County; To Establish A Two-year Pilot Program To Provide Matching Funds For Employers Who Hire Ex-offenders And Provide Part-time And Summer Employment For Youth; To Create A Jail Overcrowding Pilot Program To Provide For Placement Of Alleged Offenders In Surrounding Counties Pending Trial; And For Related Purposes.

2653.title: Abortion; prohibit where unborn human individual's heartbeat is detected and is 12 weeks or greater gestation.
2653.description: An Act To Prohibit A Physician From Performing An Abortion On A Pregnant Woman Where The Unborn Human Individual's Heartbeat Has Been Detected And The Unborn Human Individual Is Twelve Weeks Or Greater Gestation And To Provide That A Violation Of This Prohibition Shall Result In The Revocation Of The Medical License Of The Physician; To Amend Section 73-25-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Inconformity; And For Related Purposes.

2654.title: Computer and electronic waste; require management plan for recycling and disposal.
2654.description: An Act To Provide A Program For The Recycling And Disposal Of Computer And Electronic Solid Waste; To Require Each State Agency To Implement Such Program; To Provide For The Sale Or Donation Of Such Equipment; To Create A Computer And Electronic Recycling Fund; To Provide For The Disbursement Of Fund Proceeds; And For Related Purposes.

2656.title: Mississippi Minimum Wage Act; establish.
2656.description: An Act To Enact A Minimum Wage Law For The State Of Mississippi, With Annual Incremental Increases Over A Three-year Period; To Define Employers And Employees Subject To The Minimum Wage Law; To Empower The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security, Office Of The Governor, To Enforce And Administer The Provisions Of The Minimum Wage Law; To Provide Criminal Penalties And A Civil Cause Of Action Against Employers For Violations Of The Minimum Wage Law; To Amend Section 17-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Municipal And County Governing Authorities, In Their Discretion, To Mandate A Wage That Is More Than The State Minimum Wage; To Amend Section 25-3-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2657.title: Interstate Mining Compact; provide for the adoption of.
2657.description: An Act To Codify Sections 53-10-1, 53-10-2, 53-10-3, 53-10-4 And 53-10-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Adoption Of The Interstate Mining Compact; To Authorize The Governor To Enter The State Into The Interstate Mining Compact; To Provide For The Funding Of The Membership Fee For The Compact; And For Related Purposes.

2658.title: Alcoholic beverages; impose a handling fee.
2658.description: An Act To Impose A Handling Fee On Each Manufacturer Or Wholesaler Of Alcoholic Beverages Whose Product Is Placed In The Department Of Revenue's Liquor Distribution Center; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury Designated As The Abc Capital Expenditure Fund And To Provide That Revenue Derived From The Handling Fee Shall Be Placed In Such Fund; To Provide That Money In The Fund May Be Utilized By The Department Of Revenue For Any Expenditure Necessary For The Operations Of The Department's Liquor Distribution Center And Grounds; To Provide That When Money In The Abc Capital Expenditure Fund Is Insufficient To Cover The Expenditures Necessary For The Operations Of The Liquor Distribution Center, The Department Of Revenue May Borrow Additional Funds And Repayment Of The Loans Shall Be Made From The Fund; To Amend Section 27-71-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2659.title: E911 service charge; authorize increase of.
2659.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Service Charge For Residential, Voice Over Internet Protocol And Commercial Telephone Subscriber Accounts For The Purpose Of Funding E911 Services; To Amend Section 19-5-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Commercial Mobile Radio Service (cmrs) Emergency Telephone Service Charge For The Purpose Of Funding E911 Services; To Amend Section 19-5-343, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Service Charge On Prepaid Wireless Services For The Purpose Of Funding E911 Services; And For Related Purposes.

2660.title: Sixteenth section land; clarify provisions related to leases of.
2660.description: An Act To Clarify That A Lease Of Sixteenth Section Lands That Is Duly Executed By The Applicable School Board Of The School District Is Presumed To Be Valid; To Clarify That The Approval Of The Secretary Of State Is Not Necessary Before The Board May Enter Into Any Such Lease; To Provide That The Secretary Of State May Object To The Validity Of Such A Lease By Filing An Action In The Appropriate Chancery Court And Demonstrating That The Lease Is Unconscionable Or Otherwise Not Valid; To Provide That Board Members Acting In Good Faith Are Immune From Individual Liability Associated With Entering Into The Lease; To Amend Section 29-3-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Certain Standards Regarding The Classification And Reclassification Of Sixteenth Section Land; To Amend Section 29-3-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Appraisal Every 5 Years And To Provide For A Certain 16th Section Land Complaint Tribunal For Leaseholders; To Authorize The Local School Board In Its Discretion To Charge The Leaseholder For The Cost Of The First Appraisal Of Sixteenth Section Land; To Amend Section 29-3-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority Of The Secretary Of State To Reclassify Any Sixteenth Section Land On His Own Motion And Leave That Authority With The Local School Board; To Amend Section 29-3-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibility Of Sixteenth Section Land Managers; To Amend Section 29-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize 16th Section Land Leaseholders To Assign Or Sublease Their Lease In Their Discretion; To Amend Sections 29-3-63 And 29-3-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2662.title: Residential property foreclosures; prohibit unless 90-day written notice is given.
2662.description: An Act To Prohibit Foreclosure On Residential Property Unless The Mortgagee Or Holder Of The Mortgage Gives The Mortgagor 90 Days' Written Notice; To Prescribe The Contents Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Mortgagee To Notify The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance Of The Date Of The Foreclosure Sale, The Purchase Price Obtained At The Sale, And A Copy Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Maintain A Database Of Certain Foreclosure Activity Information; And For Related Purposes.

2663.title: Railroad grade crossings; prohibit obstruction of vehicular traffic for more than 20 consecutive minutes at grade crossings.
2663.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-9-235, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Any Train, Railroad Car Or Equipment, Or Engine From Obstructing Vehicular Traffic At A Railroad Grade Crossing Upon A Public Street, Road Or Highway For A Period In Excess Of 20 Consecutive Minutes; To Provide Exceptions To Such Prohibition; To Provide Fines For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2664.title: Starkville Consolidated School District; technical amendments to consolidation timetable.
2664.description: An Act To Amend Section 1, Chapter 572, Laws Of 2013, And Section 37-7-104.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To The Establishment Of The Starkville-oktibbeha Consolidated School District, To Prescribe The Powers And Responsibilities Of The Conservator Of The Oktibbeha County School District, To Clarify The Procedure For The Selection Of The New Starkville-oktibbeha Consolidated School District Board Of Trustees, To Authorize And Direct The Conservator Of The Oktibbeha County School District To Issue Short-term Notes To Fund Initial Repairs And Improvements To Certain Elementary Schools And Increase Capacity For The Consolidation, To Authorize And Direct The Conservator Of The Oktibbeha County School District To Issue School Bonds To Upgrade Certain County School Facilities Subject To A Reverse Referendum On The Bond Issue, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Starkville-oktibbeha Consolidated School District To Issue School Bonds In The New District On A Reverse Referendum Basis And To Increase The Debt Limit Cap On Assessed Valuation For Such Bonds, To Clarify That The County Board Of Supervisors Shall Provide Administrative Offices For The New Starkville-oktibbeha Consolidated School District; To Amend Sections 37-59-7, 37-59-23 And 37-59-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2665.title: State Board of Pharmacy; prescribe new nominating process.
2665.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Nominating Process For Appointments To The State Board Of Pharmacy; And For Related Purposes.

2667.title: Voter assistance; must be given only by certain persons & require those persons to complete a form after providing such assistance.
2667.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-549, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Managers Of An Election Shall Require Any Person Providing Assistance To A Voter Sign A Declaration To Provide Voter Assistance; To Provide That No Person, Other Than An Election Official, May Assist More Than 10 Voters In A Federal Election Or A State Election That Is Held Concurrently With A Federal Election; To Provide That No Candidate In Such An Election, Or A Family Member Of Such Candidate Or Poll Watcher Of Such Candidate, May Assist A Voter Unless The Voter Is A Member Of The Candidate's Family; To Amend Section 23-15-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Penalty For Vote Fraud; And For Related Purposes.

2668.title: Small Loan Regulatory Law; revise disclosures to borrowers/establish reporting requirements.
2668.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Disclosure To Borrowers Under The Small Loan Regulatory Law For Loans With Optional Products; To Require Small Loan Licensees To Report Each Loan To A Repository Of Consumer Credit Data Within A Certain Period Of Time; And For Related Purposes.

2669.title: Environmental Quality; require commission to adopt rules on radon control.
2669.description: An Act Requiring The Commission On Environmental Quality To Adopt Rules For Radon Control; And For Related Purposes.

2670.title: Prescription Monitoring Program; require dispensers and prescribers to check database.
2670.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Dispensers And Prescribers To Check The Prescription Monitoring Program Database Before Dispensing Or Prescribing Certain Drugs; To Delete The Sunset Provision; And For Related Purposes.

2672.title: Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant Program; increase annual award from $2,500.00 to $3,500.00.
2672.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Award Amount Under The Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant Program From $2,500.00 To $3,500.00; And For Related Purposes.

2675.title: Regional mental illness and intellectual disability commissions; define services.
2675.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-19-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Services That Are Authorized To Be Provided By Regional Mental Illness And Intellectual Disability Commissions To Include The Creation And Operation Of Primary Care Health Clinics; And For Related Purposes.

2677.title: Taking; prohibit state cooperation with federal effort to ban firearms or seize property.
2677.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Second Amendment And Property Rights Preservation Act; To Prohibit State Or Local Enabling Of Federal Gun Ban And Other Property Rights Violations Enforcement; And For Related Purposes.

2678.title: Capitol Police; expand jurisdiction.
2678.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-5-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Jurisdiction Of The Capitol Police To Enforce Laws; And For Related Purposes.

2679.title: Voter rolls; clarify that revising and purging of should be conducted through the Statewide Elections Management System.
2679.description: An Act To Clarify That The Registrar And The Commissioners Of Election Shall Revise And Purge The Voter Roll Through The Statewide Elections Management System; To Authorize The Removal Of The Names Of All Persons From The Voter Roll Who Have Requested In Writing To Be Removed; To Amend Sections 23-15-153 And 23-15-161, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2681.title: Appropriation; University of Mississippi School of Education grant funds for AP teachers on the Mississippi Gulf Coast.
2681.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Grant Funds Available To The University Of Mississippi School Of Education To Defray The Expenses Of Enrolling And Educating Teachers For Advanced Placement Courses And Principals In School Districts Located In The Counties Bordering The Mississippi Gulf Coast, For Fiscal Year 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2682.title: Mississippi Patient Protection Act of 2014; create.
2682.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Patient Protection Act Of 2014"; To Declare Legislative Intent; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Provide That A Health Insurer Shall Not Discriminate Against Any Provider Who Is Located Within The Geographic Coverage Area Of A Health Benefit Plan And Who Is Willing To Meet The Terms And Conditions For Participation Established By The Health Insurer; To Prohibit A Health Insurer From Imposing A Monetary Advantage Or Penalty That Would Affect A Beneficiary's Choice Among Those Health Care Providers Who Participate In The Health Benefit Plan; To Require The Commissioner Of Insurance To Enforce The State's Any Willing Provider Laws; To Provide Injunctive Relief For Violations Of This Act; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Adopt Regulations To Implement The Act; To Amend Section 83-41-409, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2683.title: Domestic Violence Protection Order Registry; require arresting officer to perform check.
2683.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Arresting Law Enforcement Officer To Check The Protection Order Registry Status Of The Suspect In A Domestic Violence Case; And For Related Purposes.

2684.title: Underground storage of gases; clarify that certain Oil and Gas Board statute shall be applicable for the issuance of a permit for.
2684.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-57-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Provisions Of Section 53-3-155 Shall Be Applicable For The Issuance Of A Permit For The Creation And Use Of Underground Storage Spaces For Gases; And For Related Purposes.

2685.title: Natural Gas Marketing Act; revise the rate of interest on payments required under the act.
2685.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-58-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of Interest Paid Should Any Person Fail To Make Any Payment Required Under The Natural Gas Marketing Act; And For Related Purposes.

2687.title: Mississippi Mineral Rights Reform Act of 2015; create.
2687.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Mineral Rights Reform Act Of 2015; To Require Registration Of Severed Mineral Interests In The Office Of The Chancery Clerk Of The County In Which The Mineral Interest Is Located; To Provide For Forfeiture To The State Of Any Severed Mineral Interest Not So Registered; And For Related Purposes.

2690.title: State Agency Accountability and Transparency website; to include 5 oldest Public Records Act requests for each agency.
2690.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Department Of Finance And Administration To Include On The State Agency Accountability And Transparency Website A Description Of The Five Oldest Public Records Act Or Freedom Of Information Act (foia) Requests; And For Related Purposes.

2691.title: Banks; shall post owner information of ATM if owned by another bank or entity.
2691.description: An Act To Require Any Bank That Has An Automated Teller Machine Located On Its Premises That Is Owned By Another Financial Institution Or Other Entity To Affix On The Front Of The Machine The Name, Address And Contact Information Of The Owner; And For Related Purposes.

2692.title: Insurance; prohibit use of credit information in underwriting and rating.
2692.description: An Act To Prohibit Insurers From Using Information Regarding A Consumer's Creditworthiness, Credit Standing Or Credit Capacity For The Purpose Of Determining Rates For Insurance Or Eligibility For Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

2693.title: Payday lending; prohibit activities of/declare public nuisance.
2693.description: An Act To Declare Legislative Intent To Prohibit Activities Commonly Referred To As Payday Lending, Deferred Presentment Services, Advance Cash Services And Other Similar Activities; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Engage In The Business Of Making Certain Small Loans; To Provide Criminal Penalties Therefor; To Provide For Collection Of Civil Penalties In Actions By The State Or By Private Parties On Behalf Of The State; To Declare The Site Or Location Of A Place Of Business Where Payday Lending Takes Place In The State Of Mississippi As A Public Nuisance; To Repeal Sections 75-67-401 Through 75-67-449, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Title Pledge Act; To Repeal Sections 75-67-501 Through 75-67-539, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Check Cashers Act; And For Related Purposes.

2694.title: State land mammal; designate black bear as.
2694.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The American Black Bear As One Of The State Land Mammals; And For Related Purposes.

2695.title: Environmental fees; authorize Commission on Environmental Quality to set to cover costs of permitting programs.
2695.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Environmental Quality To Establish Fees Necessary To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; To Create The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Amend Sections 51-3-31, 51-5-1, 53-7-21, 53-7-25, 53-7-69 And 49-31-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Commission To Set Program Fees And To Direct Fees To The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Bring Forward Section 53-7-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Applications For The Modification, Transfer Or Reissuance Of Any Surface Mining Permit, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2696.title: Appointments to state agency boards and commissions; shall give due regard to race and gender.
2696.description: An Act To Provide That The Governor, Lieutenant Governor And Any Other Appointing Authority Shall Give Due Regard To Race And Gender In Making Appointments To State Agency Boards And Commissions; To Provide That Members Of State Agency Boards And Commission Shall Give Due Regard To Race And Gender In Sending Designees To Meetings; To Specify The State Agency Boards And Commissions To Which This Act Applies; And For Related Purposes.

2697.title: Public utilities; charitable or civic contributions shall not be allowed as costs or expenses for rate-making purposes.
2697.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charitable Or Civic Contributions Made By Public Utilities Shall Not Be Allowed In Any Amount As Costs Or Expenses For Rate-making Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2698.title: Appeal bond; set the maximum amount for appeals from decisions of local governments as to taxes.
2698.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-51-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Amount Of The Appeal Bond Required For An Appeal From A Decision By A Board Of Supervisors Or Municipal Authorities As To The Assessment Of Taxes Shall Be Not Less Than $100.00 Nor More Than $10,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

2699.title: Marine Resources fees; authorize Commission on Marine Resources to adjust fees to cover costs of permitting programs.
2699.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Marine Resources To Adjust Fees To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Marine Resources; To Create The Department Of Marine Resources Program Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2700.title: Driver's license; commissioner able to decline suspension.
2700.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Decline To Suspend An Operator's License If The Court Clerk Does Not Timely Submit The Abstract Of The Court Record; And For Related Purposes.

2701.title: Parole; authorize for offenders who were juveniles when they committed the felonies for which they are incarcerated.
2701.description: An Act To Provide For The Parole Of Certain Offenders Who Were Under The Age Of 18 When They Committed The Felonies For Which They Are Sentenced; To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2702.title: Pat Harrison Waterway District; provide for the renewal of property leases in the district.
2702.description: An Act To Provide For The Renewal Of Residential Property Leases In The Pat Harrison Waterway District; To Provide For The Renewal Of Commercial Property Leases In The Pat Harrison Waterway District; And For Related Purposes.

2703.title: Appropriation; IHL - General support.
2703.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2704.title: Appropriation; IHL - Subsidiary programs.
2704.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities' Designated Institutes, Laboratories And Programs For Which They Are Responsible And The Executive Office Of The Board Of Trustees For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2705.title: Appropriation; IHL - Student Financial Aid.
2705.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Support And Maintenance Of Financial Aid Scholarship, Loan And Grant Programs And The Mississippi Office Of Student Financial Aid, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2706.title: Appropriation; IHL - University of Mississippi Medical Center.
2706.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center For Fiscal Year 2015.

2707.title: Appropriation; IHL - Alcorn State - Agricultural programs.
2707.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Alcorn State University Agricultural Programs For Fiscal Year 2015.

2708.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Agricultural and Forestry Experiment Station.
2708.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Agricultural And Forestry Experiment Station For Fiscal Year 2015.

2709.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Cooperative Extension Service.
2709.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service For Fiscal Year 2015.

2710.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Forest and Wildlife Research Center.
2710.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Incurred In The Maintenance And Operation Of The Forest And Wildlife Research Center For Fiscal Year 2015.

2711.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Veterinary Medicine, College of.
2711.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The College Of Veterinary Medicine At Mississippi State University, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2712.title: Appropriation; Community and Junior Colleges Board - Administrative expenses.
2712.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Administrative Expenses Of The Mississippi Community College Board For Fiscal Year 2015.

2713.title: Appropriation; Community and Junior Colleges Board - Support for community and junior colleges.
2713.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Aid And Support Of The Public Community And Junior Colleges Of The State Of Mississippi For Fiscal Year 2015.

2714.title: Appropriation; Corrections, Department of.
2714.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections For Fiscal Year 2015.

2715.title: Appropriation; Emergency Management Agency.
2715.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency, And For The Purpose Of Establishing A Disaster Relief Reserve Fund And Defraying The Costs Related To Certain Disaster Assistance Programs, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2716.title: Appropriation; Military Department.
2716.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi National Guard For Fiscal Year 2015.

2717.title: Appropriation; Public Safety, Department of.
2717.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Public Safety For Fiscal Year 2015.

2718.title: Appropriation; Veterans Affairs Board.
2718.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Veterans Affairs Board For Fiscal Year 2015.

2719.title: Appropriation; Judicial Performance Commission.
2719.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Commission On Judicial Performance Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2015.

2720.title: Appropriation; Ethics Commission.
2720.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Ethics Commission For The Fiscal Year 2015.

2721.title: Appropriation; Banking and Consumer Finance, Department of.
2721.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Support Of The State Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance For Fiscal Year 2015.

2722.title: Appropriation; Employment Security, Department of.
2722.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security For Fiscal Year 2015.

2723.title: Appropriation; Revenue, Department of.
2723.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Revenue, Including The Homestead Exemption Division, The Motor Vehicle Comptroller Functions, The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division, And The Bureau Of Telecommunications; For The Purpose Of Reimbursing The Counties, County Districts And Municipal Separate School Districts For Tax Losses Incurred By Reason Of The Exemption Of Homes From Certain Ad Valorem Taxes; And For The Purpose Of Purchasing Motor Vehicle License Tags, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2724.title: Appropriation; Tax Appeals Board.
2724.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Board Of Tax Appeals For The Fiscal Year 2015.

2725.title: Appropriation; Workers' Compensation Commission.
2725.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Workers' Compensation Commission For Fiscal Year 2015.

2726.title: Appropriation; Mental Health, Department of.
2726.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Mental Health And Certain Programs Of The Division Of Alcohol And Drug Abuse, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2727.title: Appropriation; Development Authority, Mississippi.
2727.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Development Authority For Fiscal Year 2015.

2728.title: Appropriation; Gaming Commission.
2728.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2729.title: Appropriation; Transportation, Department of - State Aid Road Construction, Office of.
2729.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Office Of State Aid Road Construction Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For Fiscal Year 2015.

2730.title: Appropriation; Chiropractic Examiners, Board of.
2730.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners For Fiscal Year 2015.

2731.title: Appropriation; Dental Examiners, Board of.
2731.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To The Mississippi State Board Of Dental Examiners For Fiscal Year 2015.

2732.title: Appropriation; Funeral Services Board.
2732.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Funeral Services For Fiscal Year 2015.

2733.title: Appropriation; Massage Therapy, Board of.
2733.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Massage Therapy, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2734.title: Appropriation; Pharmacy, Board of.
2734.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Pharmacy For Fiscal Year 2015.

2735.title: Appropriation; Counselors, Board of Examiners for Licensed Professional.
2735.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Examiners For Licensed Professional Counselors For Fiscal Year 2015.

2736.title: Appropriation; Veterinary Examiners, Board of.
2736.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Veterinary Examiners For Fiscal Year 2015.

2737.title: Appropriation; Architecture, Board of.
2737.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Architecture And Landscape Architecture Advisory Committee For Fiscal Year 2015.

2738.title: Appropriation; Geologists, Board of Registered Professional.
2738.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Board Of Registered Professional Geologists For Fiscal Year 2015.

2739.title: Appropriation; Motor Vehicle Commission.
2739.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Commission For Fiscal Year 2015.

2740.title: Appropriation; Accountancy, Board of Public.
2740.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Accountancy For Fiscal Year 2015.

2741.title: Appropriation; Contractors, Board of.
2741.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Contractors For Fiscal Year 2015.

2742.title: Appropriation; Agriculture and Commerce, Department of.
2742.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Agriculture And Commerce, For The Fiscal Year 2015.

2743.title: Appropriation; Egg Marketing Board.
2743.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Egg Marketing Board, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2744.title: Appropriation; Animal Health, Board of.
2744.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Board Of Animal Health For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Board For Fiscal Year 2015.

2745.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission.
2745.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Fair Commission, The Mississippi Livestock Coliseum, And The Industrial Showcase And Trade Mart Building For Fiscal Year 2015.

2746.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission - Livestock shows.
2746.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Fair Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Dixie National Livestock Show; A Roundup For Junior Exhibitors Of Livestock And Goats; Supplemental Funds For Livestock Premiums; County Livestock Shows In Offering And Paying Prizes Or Awards To Competitors In Approved County Livestock Shows; The Five District Livestock Shows; The Five State Dairy Shows; The Mississippi High School Rodeo; And To Provide How Said Money Shall Be Paid Out Of The State Treasury For Fiscal Year 2015.

2747.title: Appropriation; Tennessee-Tombigbee Waterway Development Authority.
2747.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Tennessee-tombigbee Waterway Development Authority For The Purposes Enumerated In Section 51-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2748.title: Appropriation; Finance and Administration, Department of.
2748.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Year 2015.

2749.title: Appropriation; Governor's Office and Mansion.
2749.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For Expenses Of The Executive Department, Being The Governor's Office And Staff, And For Expenses Incidental To The Proper Operation Of The Governor's Mansion And Residence Of The Governor, For Fiscal Year 2015.

2750.title: Appropriation; Audit, Department of.
2750.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Audit For Fiscal Year 2015.

2751.title: Appropriation; Information Technology Services, Department of.
2751.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services For Fiscal Year 2015.

2752.title: Appropriation; Personnel Board.
2752.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Personnel Board For Fiscal Year 2015.

2753.title: Appropriation; Secretary of State.
2753.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Office Of The Secretary Of State For Fiscal Year 2015.

2754.title: Appropriation; Treasurer's Office.
2754.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Treasurer's Office For Fiscal Year 2015.

2755.title: Appropriation; Debt Service-Gen. Obli.
2755.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Payment Of Service Charges To Banks For Acting As Agents Of The State In Paying Full Faith And Credit Bonds And Interest Of The State Of Mississippi, From The Effective Date Of This Act Until Such Bonds Shall Be Paid Or Until June 30, 2015, Whichever Shall First Occur; And For The Payment Of Maturing Bonds And Interest On The Full Faith And Credit Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi Falling Due During Fiscal Year 2015.

2756.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers that employ veterans.
2756.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Employ Persons Who Are Honorably Discharged Veterans Who Served On Active Duty In The Armed Forces Of The United States On Or After September 11, 2001, And Who Have Been Unemployed For Six Consecutive Months Immediately Prior To Being Employed By Such Taxpayers; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Authorize Any Tax Credit Claimed But Not Used In Any Taxable Year To Be Carried Forward For Five Consecutive Years; And For Related Purposes.

2757.title: Hancock County Tourism Development Bureau; extend date of repeal.
2757.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1019, Local And Private Laws Of 1996, As Last Amended By Chapter 901, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law That Create The Hancock County Tourism Development Bureau And Prescribe Its Powers And Duties And Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Contracts With Not-for-profit Organizations For Certain Purposes And Authorize The Levy Of A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Derived From Room Rentals By Hotels And Motels; To Require An Election On The Continuation Of The Tax If A Certain Number Of Electors File A Written Protest Against The Imposition Of The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

2758.title: Appropriation FY2015; Mississippi Development Authority for Small Farm and Agribusiness Center.
2758.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Development Authority For The Mississippi Small Farm And Agribusiness Center And Mississippi Natural Products Association, For The Purpose Of Expanding Shitake Mushroom Research And Production For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2759.title: Appropriation FY2015; Alcorn State University meat processing facility.
2759.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Alcorn State University For The Establishment Of A Meat Processing Facility Located At Or Near Dekalb, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2760.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for cost of installing a solar electric or solar thermal system in a residence.
2760.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit In An Amount Equal To A Portion The Cost Of Purchasing And Installing A Solar Electric Or Solar Thermal System, Or Any Combination Of Components Thereof, At A Residence Located In This State; To Provide That Any Tax Credit Claimed Under This Section But Not Used In Any Taxable Year Shall Constitute An Overpayment Of Income Taxes, And The Commissioner Of Revenue Shall Make A Refund Of The Overpayment From Current Income Tax Collections; And For Related Purposes.

2761.title: Expand the Health Care Industry Zone Act to include the Port Bienville.
2761.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-117-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority May Certify An Area As A Health Care Industry Zone If The Facility Is Located In A County In Which Is Located A Facility With A Certificate Of Need For Hospital Beds Or In Which Certain Universities Or Colleges Are Located; And For Related Purposes.

2762.title: City of Bay Springs; extend repeal date on city's authority to fund the Annual Bayfest Celebration.
2762.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 936, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend Until July 1, 2017, The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Bay Springs, Mississippi, To Expend Certain Funds Annually For Promotion And Effectuation Of The City's Annual Bayfest Celebration; And For Related Purposes.

2763.title: Natchez Regional Medical Center; authorize to petition for debt relief under Chapter 9, Title 11, United States Code.
2763.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Natchez Regional Medical Center To Petition For Relief From Debts And Financial Obligations Of The Hospital Under Chapter 9 Of Title 11, United States Code; And For Related Purposes.

2764.title: City of Greenwood; authorize donations of Katrina cottages to Greenwood-Leflore Fuller Center for Housing, Inc.
2764.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenwood, Mississippi, To Donate The Katrina Cottages Conveyed To The City In 2011 By The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency To The Greenwood-leflore Fuller Center For Housing, Inc., A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation Which Is Engaged In Providing Housing To Low-income, Disabled And Elderly Residents In Greenwood; And For Related Purposes.

2765.title: City of Amory; authorize a tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
2765.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Amory, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

2766.title: Jackson State University Stadium Fund; create and impose a tax on activities and events held at the stadium to fund it.
2766.description: An Act To Create In The State Treasury A Special Fund To Be Designated The Jackson State University Stadium Fund; To Provide That Money In The Special Fund May Be Used By Jackson State University Upon Appropriation By The Legislature For Certain Purposes Related To The Establishment, Operation And Maintenance Of A Stadium On Or In Close Proximity To The Jackson State University Main Campus; To Amend Section 27-65-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose A Tax Of 7% Of The Gross Revenue Derived From Sales Of Admissions To Amusement Business, Activities Or Events Held Or Conducted In Or At Such Stadium That Shall Be In Lieu Of Any Other Taxes; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Revenue From The Tax Levied On Activities At Such Stadium Shall Be Deposited, Without Diversion, Into The Jackson State University Stadium Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2767.title: Sales taxation; exempt sales to the Mississippi Children's Museum.
2767.description: An Act To Create The Jessica Sibley Upshaw Food Bank And Food Pantry Sales Tax Relief Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By Senate Bill No. 2425, 2014 Regular Session, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Nonperishable Food Items To Certain Charitable Organizations That Operate A Food Bank Or Food Pantry Or Food Lines; To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services To National Association Of Junior Auxiliaries, Inc.; To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Tangible Personal Property And Services To The United Way Of The Pine Belt Region, Inc.; To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property And Services To The Mississippi Children's Museum; To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services To The Jackson Zoological Park; To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales To Tangible Personal Property Or Services To The Hattiesburg Zoo; To Exempt From Sales Taxation Gross Proceeds From Sales Of Food, Merchandise Or Other Concessions At An Event Held Solely For Religious Or Charitable Purposes At Livestock Facilities, Agriculture Facilities Or Other Facilities Constructed, Renovated Or Expanded With Funds For The Grant Program Authorized Under Section 18, Chapter 530, Laws Of 1995; And For Related Purposes.

2768.title: Income tax; credit for contributions to organizations that grant scholarships to schools that provide dyslexia therapy.
2768.description: An Act To Create The Dyslexia Therapy Tax Credit; To Authorize An Income Tax Credit To Taxpayers In An Amount Equal To The Total Contributions Made During The Taxable Year To Certain Organizations That Provide Scholarships To Students Attending Accredited, Nonprofit, Nonpublic Schools That Provide Dyslexia Therapy Instruction; To Provide That The Credit Shall Not Exceed 50% Of The Taxpayer's Income Tax Liability; To Provide That Scholarship-granting Organizations Must Meet Certain Requirements In Order For A Contribution To Them To Be Eligible For The Credit; To Provide That Schools That Accept Scholarships From A Scholarship-granting Organization Must Meet Certain Requirements; To Require Certain Reports To Be Made By Scholarship-granting Organizations To The Department Of Revenue; To Give The Department Of Revenue Certain Powers And Duties With Regard To The Administration Of The Credit Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2769.title: Appropriation FY2015; Supreme Court fund MS Civil Legal Assistance program.
2769.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Civil Legal Assistance Fund To Be Administered By The Mississippi Supreme Court Administrative Office Of Courts, For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2770.title: City of Ripley; remove the repeal date on hotel, motel and restaurant tax.
2770.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 956, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Remove The Repeal Provision On The Act That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ripley, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Certain Restaurants; And For Related Purposes.

2771.title: City of Southaven; extend the repeal date on restaurant tax.
2771.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 955, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The City Of Southaven, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Beverages And Prepared Food At Restaurants Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

2772.title: City of Poplarville; may allow the Poplarville Historical Society to use certain city office space rent free.
2772.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Poplarville, Mississippi, In Their Discretion, To Allow The Poplarville Historical Preservation Society To Use Certain Office Space Rent Free; And For Related Purposes.

2774.title: Appropriation FY2015; MSU Early Childhood Institute research early education programs.
2774.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi State University Early Childhood Institute For The Purpose Of Researching Early Education Programs, For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2775.title: Town of Abbeville; authorize borrowing of money to purchase the Abbeville Water Association.
2775.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Abbeville, Mississippi, To Borrow Money In An Amount Not To Exceed $200,000.00 For The Purpose Of Purchasing The Abbeville Water Association; And For Related Purposes.

2776.title: Coahoma County Reserve & Trust Fund; trustees may delegate investment of assets to investment advisors.
2776.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, Which Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Establish The Coahoma County Reserve And Trust Fund, To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of The Fund May Delegate To Investment Advisors The Power To Assign, Transfer And Dispose Of Any Of The Securities And Investments Of The Fund; To Make It Clear That The Earnings Component Of The Fund Shall Be Composed Of All Income Earned On The Corpus Component Of The Fund; To Provide That If The Earnings Component Is Insufficient To Pay The Amounts Required In Connection With The Management By The Trustees Of The Fund, The Corpus Component May Be Utilized To Pay Such Amounts; To Provide That The Earnings Component Shall Be Transferred From The Fund To The General Fund Of The County At The Direction Of The Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

2777.title: Appropriation FY2015; continued implementation of the Early Learning Collaborative Act.
2777.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Department Of Education For The Continued Implementation Of The Early Learning Collaborative Act And For The Purpose Of Funding Additional Early Childhood Education Programs, For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2778.title: Appropriation FY2015; Mississippi Department of Transportation for unified ship-tracking system at ports.
2778.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Intermodal Program To Establish A Unified Ship-tracking System Among All The Ports, For Fiscal Year 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2779.title: Income tax; provide for method of apportioning income for certain major pharmaceutical suppliers.
2779.description: An Act To Provide For The Method Of Apportionment Of Income For Income Tax Purposes Of A Major Supplier Of Medical Or Pharmaceutical Products For A Mississippi Distribution Facility; To Amend Section 27-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2780.title: Exempt from sales taxation sales of certain truck-tractors.
2780.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 1555, 2014 Regular Session, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Truck-tractors And Semitrailers Used In Interstate Commerce And Registered Under The International Registration Plan (irp) Or Any Similar Reciprocity Agreement Or Compact Relating To The Proportional Registration Of Commercial Vehicles; To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2781.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds for the E.E. Bass Cultural Arts Center.
2781.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The E.e. Bass Cultural Arts Center In Greenville, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2782.title: Sales taxation; sales of aircraft used in oil or natural gas exploration or production are exempt.
2782.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Aircraft Used Predominately To Transport Passengers Or Property To Offshore Oil Or Natural Gas Exploration Or Production Platforms Or Vessels, And Engines, Accessories And Spare Parts For Such Aircraft, Are Exempt From Sales Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

2784.title: Surplus school buildings; establish a tax credit program for development and rehabilitation for teacher housing purposes.
2784.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-485, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Income Tax Credit For The Cost Of Development And Rehabilitation Of Surplus School Buildings For Teacher Housing And Economic Development Purposes; To Provide An Income Tax Credit To Be Used As A Subsidy For The Rent Of Public Schoolteachers Who Are Tenants In Such Property; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Establish Fees For Services Under This Redevelopment Program And To Establish A Special Fund Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2786.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt hunting and/or fishing leases on sixteenth section lands.
2786.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Leases That Grant Hunting And/or Fishing Privileges On Sixteenth Section School Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2787.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers who serve as volunteer firefighters.
2787.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Serve As Volunteer Firefighters; To Define The Term "volunteer Firefighter"; And For Related Purposes.

2789.title: Ad valorem taxes; exempt certain heavy equipment from.
2789.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Certain Heavy Duty Rental Equipment; And For Related Purposes.

2790.title: Ad Valorem taxes; counties and municipalities may exempt certain residential rental structures.
2790.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of A Municipality To Exempt From Municipal Ad Valorem Taxes, Excluding Ad Valorem Taxes For School District Purposes, For A Period Of Not More Than 7 Years, Any Privately Owned Residential Rental Structures That Are Renovated Or Improved, But Only If The Residential Rental Structures Are Renovated Or Improved Pursuant To The Requirements Of The Municipality For The Development Of The Area In Which The Residential Structure Is Located; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of A County To Exempt From County Ad Valorem Taxes For A Period Of Not More Than 7 Years, Privately Owned Residential Rental Property That Has Been Granted An Exemption By A Municipality Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2791.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers that employ certain supervised offenders.
2791.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Employ Persons Who Is An Offender Who Is Being Supervised By The Community Corrections Division Of The Department Of Corrections Or Who Has Been Discharged From The Custody Of The Department Of Corrections; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; And For Related Purposes.

2792.title: Income taxation; allow a deduction for amounts contributed to accounts established to pay for uninsured wind damage to homesteads.
2792.description: An Act To Authorize Owners Of Homesteads To Establish Catastrophe Savings Accounts And To Utilize Money In Such Accounts To Provide Reimbursement For Deductible Amounts And Other Uninsured Portions Of Damage To Homesteads From Certain Events; To Authorize An Income Tax Deduction For Amounts Contributed To Catastrophe Savings Accounts; To Exclude Interest On Such Accounts From Gross Income For Income Tax Purposes; To Provide Limits On The Amount That May Be Contributed To Catastrophe Savings Accounts; To Provide That A Distribution From A Catastrophe Savings Account Must Be Included In The Income Of The Taxpayer Unless The Distribution Is Used To Cover Qualified Catastrophe Expenses; To Provide That The Income Tax Shall Be Increased On Taxable Distributions From A Catastrophe Savings Account; To Amend Sections 27-7-15 And 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2793.title: Appropriation FY2015; Elvis Presley Memorial Foundation.
2793.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Elvis Presley Memorial Foundation For The Purpose Of Completing Phase Iii Of "master Plan 2000"; And For Related Purposes.

2795.title: General obligation bonds; authorize issuance for a wastewater facility in the Byram-Clinton corridor area.
2795.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Hinds County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Construction And Development Of A Centralized Wastewater Treatment Facility For The Byram-clinton Corridor Area; And For Related Purposes.

2796.title: City of Senatobia; authorize the imposition of a tax on restaurants, hotels and motels.
2796.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Senatobia, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote Parks And Recreation And Economic Development Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

2797.title: Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds for in the amount of $10,000,000.00.
2797.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2801.title: Monroe County; extend the repeal date on the authority to contribute to the Monroe County Chamber of Commerce.
2801.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 916, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 908, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Monroe County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds Annually To The Monroe County Chamber Of Commerce; To Revise The Amount The Board Of Supervisors May Contribute Annually To The Chamber Of Commerce; And For Related Purposes.

2802.title: City of McComb; extend repeal date on tourism tax.
2802.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 916, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, To Impose A Tourism Tax Within The City, And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

2803.title: Washington County; extend the repeal date on the Washington County Convention and Visitors Committee and the tourism tax.
2803.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 816, Local And Private Laws Of 1991, As Last Amended By Chapter 944, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Establishes The Washington County Convention And Visitors Committee And Authorizes A Tax On Hotels, Motels And Restaurants; To Require An Election On The Continuation Of The Tax If A Certain Number Of Electors File A Written Protest Against The Continuation Of The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

2805.title: Bond; authorize general obligation bonds for the Mississippi Arts and Entertainment Center.
2805.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Constructing, Furnishing, Equipping, Repairs And Renovations To And The Purchase Of Land For The Mississippi Arts And Entertainment Center In Meridian, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2806.title: Bonds; authorize g.o. bonds for the construction of the William Faulkner Library at the Union County Heritage Museum.
2806.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The William Faulkner Library At The Union County Heritage Museum In New Albany, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2807.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds for repair and renovation of the MS Coliseum and construction of a new trade mart.
2807.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Repair, Renovation Of And Improvements To The Mississippi Coliseum; To Provide Funds For The Construction Of A New Trade Mart; To Provide Funds For The Demolition Of The Mississippi Trade Mart; And To Provide Funds For Improvements To Parking On The Mississippi State Fairgrounds; And For Related Purposes.

2809.title: City of Pascagoula; extend the repeal date on the city's hotel and motel tax.
2809.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1005, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Last Amended By Chapter 915, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law Authorizing The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel, Motel And Bed-and-breakfast Room Rentals In The City; And For Related Purposes.

2810.title: City of Hernando; authorize the imposition of a tax on restaurants, hotels, and motels.
2810.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Hernando, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

2811.title: Motor fuel tax; levy on each diesel gallon on liquefied natural gas.
2811.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-59-3 And 27-59-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "diesel Gallon" For The Purpose Of The Tax On Liquefied Natural Gas; To Provide That The Tax Levied On Liquefied Natural Gas Shall Be Levied On Each Diesel Gallon Of Liquefied Natural Gas; To Amend Section 27-59-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Motor Vehicles That Use Liquefied Natural Gas And No Other Compressed Gas From The Requirement Of Obtaining A Decal From The Department Of Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

2813.title: Bonds, authorize issuance for certain Mississippi Development Authority programs.
2813.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $5,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $5,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Grants Or Loans To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Amend Sections 65-4-25, 65-4-29, 65-4-31 And 65-4-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $10,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Delete The Reverter On The Provisions That Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Bonds Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act And That Require Notice Of The Sale Of Such Bonds Only When The Bonds Are To Be Sold On Sealed Bids At Public Sale; And For Related Purposes.

2815.title: City of Waveland; authorize municipal court to be conducted outside the city.
2815.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of Waveland, Mississippi, To Hold Municipal Court At A Location Outside The Municipality In A Public Building Within A Twenty-mile Radius Of The Boundaries Of The City Until Such Time As The Governing Authorities Of The City Determine That The City Has Obtained More Appropriate Space Within The City For Its Municipal Court To Conduct Business; And For Related Purposes.

2817.title: Washington County; authorize long-term lease for the establishment, operation and maintenance of a youth sports complex.
2817.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of Washington County, Mississippi, To Enter Into A Long-term Lease For The Establishment, Operation And Maintenance Of A Youth Sports Complex On Real Property Owned By Washington County At The Washington County Convention Center; And For Related Purposes.

2818.title: Sales tax; exempt certain guided tour activities and certain livestock admissions and parking.
2818.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Amusement Tax Guided Tours On Navigable Waters Of This State, Which Include Providing Accommodations, Guide Services And/or Related Equipment Operated By Or Under The Direction Of The Person Providing The Tour, For The Purposes Of Outdoor Tourism And Admissions To Events Held Solely For Religious Or Charitable Purposes At Livestock Facilities, Agriculture Facilities Or Other Facilities Constructed, Renovated Or Expanded With Funds For The Grant Program Authorized Under Section 18, Chapter 530, Laws Of 1995; To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 1555, 2014 Regular Session, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Gross Collections Derived From Guided Tours On Navigable Waters Of This State, Which Include Providing Accommodations, Guide Services And/or Related Equipment Operated By Or Under The Direction Of The Person Providing The Tour, For The Purposes Of Outdoor Tourism; To Amend Section 27-65-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Parking At Events Held Solely For Religious Or Charitable Purposes At Livestock Facilities, Agriculture Facilities Or Other Facilities Constructed, Renovated Or Expanded With Funds For The Grant Program Authorized Under Section 18, Chapter 530, Laws Of 1995; And For Related Purposes.

2821.title: Bonds; authorize for various purposes and revise distribution of severance tax revenue.
2821.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The North Central Ms Regional Rail Authority For The Purpose Of Acquiring The Rail Line That Extends From Southaven, Mississippi, To A Point Near Canton, Mississippi; To Provide That If The Rail Authority Acquires The Rail Line, It May Enter Into Any Agreement With A Railroad Or Other Entity Providing That The Railroad Or Other Entity Will Lease The Rail Line From The Authority For Commercial Purposes; To Provide That The Principal Of And Interest On The Bonds Will Be Paid Primarily From Certain Lease Payments Deposited Into A Bond Sinking Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Make Grants To Local Units Of Government To Assist The Local Unit Of Government In Purchasing Real Property For The Benefit Of Certain Existing Industries; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $20,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Limit The Amount Of Bonds That May Be Issued In Any One Fiscal Year; To Amend Section 27-25-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Manner In Which Oil Severance Taxes Are Distributed To The State And The County In Which The Oil Was Produced; And For Related Purposes.

2823.title: Critical Physician Shortage Incentive Act; exclude a portion of physician income from taxation.
2823.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Critical Physician Shortage Incentive Act Of 2014"; To Provide That The Gross Income Of Newly Licensed Physicians Practicing Medicine And Residing In Critical Physician Shortage Areas Shall Not Include Any Income In Excess Of $100,000.00 Derived From Providing Medical Services In Critical Physician Shortage Areas; To Provide That The Exemption From Gross Income Authorized By This Section May Be Utilized By The Qualifying Physician For Ten Consecutive Years If The Physician Practices And Resides In Such An Area For That Period Of Time; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2825.title: Bonds; authorize to assist the Rail Authority of East Mississippi to pay the cost of environmental impact study.
2825.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Assist The Rail Authority Of East Mississippi In Paying Costs Incurred By The Authority For An Environmental Impact Study; And For Related Purposes.

2826.title: Bonds; authorize for phase II of the Civil Rights Museum and Mississippi Museum of History.
2826.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of Phase Ii Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum And The New Museum Of Mississippi History And Construction Of A Parking Garage For The Museums; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Enter Into Contracts For Such Projects On The Basis Of Negotiation Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2828.title: City of Newton; authorize a long-term agreement regarding the lease of space on the city's water tower.
2828.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Newton, Mississippi, To Enter Into A Long-term Agreement With A Company To Purchase The Existing Lease Of Space On The City's Water Tower, To Collect Rent For Space Leased On The Tower, To Find Future Tenants For The Available Space On The Tower; And For Related Purposes.

2830.title: Lauderdale County; extend the repeal date on the Lauderdale County Tourism Commission.
2830.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 991, Local And Private Laws Of 1997, As Last Amended By Chapter 924, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Establishes The Lauderdale County Tourism Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2831.title: Indianola Tourism Commission and hotel, motel and restaurant tax; extend repeal date.
2831.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 931, Local And Private Laws Of 2003, As Last Amended By Chapter 921, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend Until July 1, 2017, The Repeal Date On The Law That Creates The Indianola Tourism Commission, Provides For The Composition Of The Commission, Prescribes The Powers And Duties Of The Commission And Authorizes The Governing Authorities To Levy A Tax To Fund The Commission; To Require An Election On The Continuation Of The Tax If A Certain Number Of Electors File A Written Protest Against The Continuation Of The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

2832.title: Sebastopol Natural Gas District; increase the amount of revenue bonds that may be issued by.
2832.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 998, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Last Amended By Chapter 948, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Increase The Amount Of Revenue Bonds That Are Authorized To Be Issued By The Sebastopol Natural Gas District From $10,000,000.00 To $15,000,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

2833.title: Tunica County; revise the distribution of gaming tax revenue.
2833.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 866, Local And Private Laws Of 1992, As Last Amended By Chapter 920, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Revise The Distribution Of The Gaming Revenue Tax Imposed By The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County; And For Related Purposes.

2834.title: Jackson County; may establish satellite office in each supervisors district of the county.
2834.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Purchase, Construct And Maintain Satellite Offices In Each Supervisors District Of The County So Long As The Primary Office Of The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County Remains In The County Seat; And For Related Purposes.

2835.title: Chickasawhay Natural Gas District; authorize to construct and operate natural gas fueling stations for motor vehicles.
2835.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Directors Of The Chickasawhay Natural Gas District To Construct, Expand, Operate, Obtain And Maintain Compressed Natural Gas Automobile Refueling Stations; To Authorize The Board Of Directors To Sell Compressed Natural Gas At Such Stations For Use In Vehicles To Both Public And Private Consumers; And For Related Purposes.

2836.title: City of Flowood; authorize a tax on hotels & motels; authorize the issuance of bonds for a conference center.
2836.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of Flowood, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Room Rentals Of Hotel And Motel Rooms In The City; To Authorize The City To Issue Bonds In An Amount Not To Exceed $20,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Financing A Conference Center And Related And Ancillary Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2837.title: Town of Falkner; authorize to acquire Blackjack Development Water Association, Inc. Water System.
2837.description: An Act To Authorize The Town Of Falkner, Mississippi, To Acquire And Assume The Operation And Maintenance Of The Blackjack Development Association, Inc., Water System And To Assume All The Liabilities, Obligations, Assets, Duties And Responsibilities Of Such Association; To Authorize The Town Of Falkner To Operate Its Water Distribution System For A Distance Of More Than Five Miles From The Corporate Limits Of The Town Of Falkner In Order To Operate The Water System Within The Area Presently Served By The Blackjack Development Association; And For Related Purposes

2838.title: Lafayette County Reserve and Trust Fund; authorize fund to be invested in any investments authorized for PERS.
2838.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 953, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, As Amended By Chapter 936, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Lafayette County Reserve And Trust Fund To Invest The Fund In Any Of The Investments Authorized For The Public Employees' Retirement System; And For Related Purposes.

2840.title: City of Byram; authorize a tax on the gross proceeds of sales for room rentals of hotels and motels.
2840.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Byram, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals For Hotels Or Motels Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

2842.title: City of Hattiesburg; authorize the city to impose a special sales tax.
2842.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, To Levy A Special Sales Tax If The Levy Of The Tax Is Approved By 3/5 Of The Qualified Electors Of The City Voting At An Election Called For Such Purpose; To Exempt Certain Sales From The Special Sales Tax; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Utilized For Certain Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2843.title: City of Greenville; authorize to levy a 1% sales tax.
2843.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenville, Mississippi, To Levy A Special Sales Tax On All Items Taxed At 7% Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law If 3/5 Of The Qualified Electors Of The City Voting At An Election Called For Such Purpose Vote In Favor Of The Imposition Of The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

2844.title: City of Greenville, authorize the city to make contributions to the Greenville Public School District.
2844.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenville, Mississippi, To Annually Contribute A Portion Of The Revenue That The City Receives From The Fees Imposed On The Gross Revenue Of Gaming Vessels, To The Greenville Public School District For The Promotion Of Educational Programs Of The District; And For Related Purposes.

2846.title: Monroe County; extend repealer on authority to create and contribute to beautification commission.
2846.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 913, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 931, Laws Of 2011; To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Creates The Monroe County Beautification Commission And Prescribes Its Membership And Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Monroe County, Mississippi, To Make A Certain Appropriation To The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2847.title: Marshall County; authorize contributions to charitable nonprofit organizations exempt from federal income taxation.
2847.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute To Charitable Nonprofit Organizations Exempt From Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code, Including, But Not Limited To, The Marshall County Food Pantry; And For Related Purposes.

2848.title: Harrison County Motor Vehicle for Hire Commission; revise memebership and eliminate oversight by Harrison County.
2848.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 936, Local And Private Laws Of 2010, As Amended By Chapter 959, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, As Amended By Chapter 901, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Revise The Membership Of The Harrison County Motor Vehicle For Hire Commission; To Eliminate Responsibilities For Oversight Of The Commission By Harrison County; To Clarify The Powers And Duties Of The Commission; To Provide For Appeals From Certain Decisions Of The Commission; To Provide That Violations Of Rules And Regulations Established By The Commission Shall Be Misdemeanors; And For Related Purposes.

2849.title: Coast Coliseum Commission; authorize expenditure of money in its trust fund for certain purposes.
2849.description: An Act To Amend Section 55-24-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Coast Coliseum Commission To Expend An Amount Not To Exceed $7,000,000.00 From Its Trust Fund For Capital Expenses Of The Mississippi Coast Coliseum Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2850.title: A resolution mourning the loss and commending the life of civil rights legend Delores Orey.
2850.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life Of Civil Rights Legend Delores Orey.

2851.title: Commend Pearl "Pirates" Boys Soccer Team and Head Coach Chris Rash for winning 9th State Championship.
2851.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pearl High School "pirates" Boys Soccer Team And Head Coach Chris Rash For Winning Their 9th State Championship.

2852.title: Recognize and congratulate Seattle Seahawks Linebacker K.J. Wright.
2852.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Olive Branch And Msu Linebacker K.j. Wright For His Exceptional Play In The Seattle Seahawks Super Bowl Victory On February 2, 2014, On The Occasion Of "k.j. Wright Day."

2853.title: Urge President and United States Congress to assist the Republic of Azerbaijan.
2853.description: A Resolution Urging The President Of The United States And The United States Congress To Assist The Republic Of Azerbaijan In Asserting Its Territorial Integrity.

2854.title: Recognize work of Dr. Yvonne Maddox, Deputy Director of NICHD-National Institute of Health.
2854.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Outstanding Mississippi Contributions Of Dr. Yvonne Maddox On The Occasion Of Her Retirement From The National Institute Of Child Health And Human Development-nih.

2855.title: Recognize Columbus Fire and Rescue (CFR) for receiving International Accreditation Status.
2855.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Columbus, Mississippi, Fire And Rescue (cfr) As The First Unit In The State To Receive International Accreditation Status.

2856.title: Recognize Cotton Baronich, Grand Marshal of the 2014 Mal's St. Paddy's Parade.
2856.description: A Resolution Recognizing Iconic Jackson Mixologist Cotton Baronich, Grand Marshal Of The 2014 Mal's St. Paddy's Parade.

2857.title: Commend the life and civic contributions of Biloxi seafood patriarch Emile "Junior" Desporte.
