2857.description: A Resolution To Pay Tribute And Commend The Life And Civic Contributions Of Biloxi Seafood Patriarch Emile "junior" Desporte And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Mississippi Senate.

2858.title: Mourn the loss and commend the historic public service of former Governor and Attorney General William A. "Bill" Allain.
2858.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Historic Public Service Of Former Governor And Attorney General William A. "bill" Allain, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2859.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and public service of former Senator Jim Bean.
2859.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator James L. "jim" Bean And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

2860.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and public service of former Senator Billy Thames.
2860.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator Billy Howard Thames And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

2861.title: Mourn the loss and commend public service of former State Senator Charles Ray Nix.
2861.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Public Service Of Senator Charles Ray Nix Of Panola County, Mississippi, A "sportsman's Sportsman," And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2862.title: Pay tribute to the memory of former Mississippi Representative John Hampton Stennis.
2862.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Memory Of Former Mississippi Representative John Hampton Stennis.

2863.title: Honor the life and legacy of former South African President Nelson Mandela.
2863.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Honoring The Life And Legacy Of Former South African President Nelson Mandela; And For Related Purposes.

2864.title: Mourn the loss and commend the public service of Dr. Don Cabana, former Warden of the Mississippi State Penitentiary.
2864.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Public Service Of Dr. Donald A. Cabana, Former Warden And Superintendent Of The Mississippi State Penitentiary.

2865.title: Pay tribute to the memory of Mississippi civic leader Gene Triggs, Sr.
2865.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Memory Of Gene Triggs, Sr., Of Clinton, A Business, Civic, University, Political And Church Leader In Mississippi For Four Decades.

2866.title: Mourn the loss of former Pittsburgh Steelers' star defensive end L.C. Greenwood of Canton, Mississippi.
2866.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Former Pittsburgh Steelers' Star Defensive End L.c. Greenwood Of Canton, Mississippi.

2867.title: Pay tribute to JPD veteran officer Bruce Daniel Jacob.
2867.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Paying Tribute To Jackson Police Department Veteran Bruce Daniel Jacob Who Was Lost In The Line Of Duty.

2868.title: Pay tribute to the memory of Dr. Chester L. Quarles, former Director of MBN and State Crime Lab and longtime Ole Miss Professor.
2868.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Memory Of Dr. Chester L. Quarles, Former Director Of The Mississippi Bureau Of Narcotics, First Director Of The Mississippi State Crime Lab And Longtime Ole Miss Professor.

2869.title: Honor legacy of Dr. Susan G. Dillard on award of MSU and Louisville School District at-risk student program "DREAMS."
2869.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Legacy Of Dr. Susan G. Dillard, Outstanding Educator From Louisville, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of The Award Of The "dillard's Reading, Enrichment, Arts, Mathematics And Science After-school And Summer Tutorial Enrichment Program (dreams)" At Mississippi State University College Of Education And The Louisville Municipal School District.

2870.title: Congratulate Pascagoula Red AA Coach Pitch Baseball Team for State and Regional World Series Championship.
2870.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating The Pascagoula Red All-star Aa Coach Pitch Baseball Team For Winning The Dixie Youth State Tournament And The Region Iii World Series.

2871.title: Designate Mississippi as "A Purple Heart State."
2871.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The State Of Mississippi As "a Purple Heart State" To Honor And Encourage Citizens To Show Appreciation To Mississippians Who Received The Purple Heart Medal For Wounds Suffered In Combat.

2872.title: Recognizing the 50th Anniversary of the Mississippi Bar Foundation.
2872.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The 50th Anniversary Of The Mississippi Bar Foundation.

2873.title: Commend Southaven High School "Lady Chargers" Volleyball Team for 5th State Championship.
2873.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Southaven High School "lady Chargers" Volleyball Team And Coach Allison Burchyett For Winning Their 5th State Championship.

2874.title: Recognize North Jackson Boy Scout Troop 302 for rescuing a man from a freezing river in the Alabama Sipsey Wilderness.
2874.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Paying Tribute To North Jackson Boy Scout Troop 302 For Risking Their Lives To Rescue A Man In The Alabama Sipsey Wilderness On January 20, 2013.

2875.title: Recognize Mississippi State Senior Donald "Field" Brown as first Rhodes Scholar since 1911.
2875.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Extending The Congratulations Of The Legislature To Mississippi State University Senior Donald "field" Brown As The University's First Rhodes Scholar Since 1911.

2876.title: Congratulate Hailey Thomas for 2013 Mississippi Miss Hospitality.
2876.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Hailey Thomas Upon Being Crowned 2013 Mississippi Miss Hospitality.

2877.title: Commend EMCC "Lions" Football Team for 2nd NJCAA National Championship in 3 years.
2877.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The East Mississippi Community College "lions" Football Team And Coach Of The Year Buddy Stephens For Winning Their Second Njcaa National Championship In Three Years And Number One Ranking In The Final National Junior College Athletic Association Poll.

2878.title: Recognize Forrest County Agricultural High School "Aggies" Football Team for first-ever State Championship.
2878.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The Forrest County Agricultural High School "aggies" Football Team And Coach Larry Dolan For Winning Their First-ever Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 4a State Championship.

2879.title: Commend Louisville High School "Wildcats" Football Team and Coach M.C. Miller for winning the Class 3A State Championship.
2879.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Louisville High School "wildcats" Football Team And Coach M.c. Miller For Winning The Mhsaa Class 3a State Championship.

2880.title: Amendment to the United States Constitution relating to parental rights; urge Congress to propose.
2880.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Propose An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To Parental Rights And Urging The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Call On The Congress To Propose Such An Amendment.

2881.title: Commend Lamar High School "Raiders" Football Team for winning MAIS Class AAA Division II State Championship.
2881.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Lamar High School "raiders" Football Team And Head Coach Mac Barnes For Winning The Mais Class Aaa Division Ii State Championship.

2882.title: Congratulate Mississippi State University "Bulldogs" Football Team and Coach Dan Mullen for 2013 Liberty Bowl Victory.
2882.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating The Mississippi State University "bulldogs" Football Team And Head Coach Dan Mullen For Its Record-setting Victory In The 2013 Autozone Liberty Bowl.

2883.title: Recognize Ridgeland Mayor Gene McGee upon his election to National League of Cities (NLC) Board of Directors.
2883.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Ridgeland Mayor Gene Mcgee Upon His Election To The National League Of Cities (nlc) Board Of Directors.

2884.title: Mourn the loss of Afghanistan casualty U.S. Army Specialist Terry Kishaun Dantez Gordon of Shubuta, Mississippi.
2884.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Army Specialist Terry Kishaun Dantez Gordon Of Shubuta, Mississippi, From Injuries Sustained In Action In Southern Afghanistan On December 17, 2013.

2885.title: Designate "Mississippi Association of Independent Colleges and Universities (MAICU) Week."
2885.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The Week Of January 20-24, 2014, As "mississippi Association Of Independent Colleges And Universities (maicu)" Week.

2886.title: Commend Germantown High School Marching Band for winning the 2013 Class 5A State Championship.
2886.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Germantown High School Band And Band Director Justin Harvison For Winning The Mhsaa/mba 2013 Class 5a State Marching Band Championship With The Highest Score In The History Of The Competition.

2887.title: Post-ratify amendment to U.S. Constitution providing for direct election of United States Senators.
2887.description: A Concurrent Resolution Post-ratifying Amendment Xvii To The Constitution Of The United States Providing For The Popular Election Of United States Senators; And For Related Purposes.

2888.title: Post-ratify federal voting age 18 amendment to the United States Constitution.
2888.description: A Concurrent Resolution Post-ratifying Amendment Xxvi To The Constitution Of The United States Establishing The Federal Voting Age At Age 18; And For Related Purposes.

2889.title: Commemorate 35 years of the USA/IBC Competition and congratulate Sue Lobrano for 34 years of leadership.
2889.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating 35 Years Of The Usa International Ballet Competition And Congratulating Sue Lobrano For 34 Years Of Faithful Service And Dedication In Spearheading This Event In Jackson, Mississippi.

2890.title: Joint Rules; amend to require a fiscal note on any bill increasing or decreasing the revenue of the state unless 2/3 vote to dispense.
2890.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Joint Rule 20 To Require A Fiscal Note On Any Bill Increasing Or Decreasing The Revenue Of The State Upon The Request Of Any Member And To Provide That Consideration Of The Bill Cannot Proceed Without Such Fiscal Note Unless 2/3 Of That House Vote To Dispense.

2891.title: Unfunded state mandates; amend Constitution to prohibit.
2891.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Provide That No Bill Imposing An Unfunded State Mandate On Municipalities, Counties, School Districts Or Other Political Subdivisions Shall Be Enacted; To Provide That No Bill Imposing Such A State Mandate Shall Be Enacted Without Statements Of The Estimated Cost Of Such Mandate And The Source Of State Revenue Identified To Defray The Cost; And For Related Purposes.

2892.title: Recognize and commend students and staff of Clara School in Wayne County which was destroyed by fire in 2011.
2892.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Recognize And Commend The Determination And The Example Set By The Students, Teachers And Administration Of Clara School In Wayne County, Mississippi, Which Was Destroyed By Fire In 2011.

2893.title: Urge U.S. Congress not to approve federal acquisition of 48,000 acres of private property in Yazoo County, Mississippi.
2893.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing The Opposition Of The Mississippi Legislature To A Plan Being Considered By The United States Congress Authorizing Federal Acquisition Of Privately Held Land In Yazoo County, Mississippi, Near The Panther Swamp National Wildlife Refuge.

2894.title: Commend JSU "Lady Tigers" Soccer Team and Coach of the Year Dean Joseph for winning SWAC.
2894.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Jackson State University "lady Tigers" Soccer Team And Coach Of The Year Dean Joseph For Winning The 2013 Swac Championship.

2895.title: Commend legacy of leadership of Marshall L. Fisher upon retirement as Director of MBN.
2895.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Paying Tribute To The Legacy Of Leadership Of Marshall L. Fisher Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As Director Of The Mississippi Bureau Of Narcotics.

2896.title: Commend Oak Grove "Warriors" Football Team, Coach Nevil Barr for first-ever State Championship.
2896.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Oak Grove High School "warriors" Football Team And Head Coach Nevil Barr For Winning Their First-ever Mississippi High School Athletic Association Class 6a Championship.

2897.title: Mourn the loss of Major General Catherine Smith Lutz, Mississippi's first female Air National Guard leader.
2897.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Service Of Major General Catherine Smith Lutz Of Flora, Mississippi's First Female Air National Guard Leader.

2898.title: Express opposition of State of Mississippi of National Defense Authorization Act provisions on indefinite detention.
2898.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing The Opposition Of The State Of Mississippi To The National Defense Authorization Act Of 2012 (ndaa) Provision That Authorizes Indefinite Detention; And For Related Purposes.

2899.title: United States Constitutional Convention under Article V; apply for federal debt consideration.
2899.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A United States Constitution Article V Amendments Convention Specifically Relating To The Federal Debt.

2900.title: Constitution; amend section 36 to require the Legislature to meet every two years and limit the length of the biennial sessions.
2900.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Legislature Will Meet Every Two Years; To Limit The Length Of The Biennial Sessions; To Allow The Legislature To Extend A Biennial Session; And For Related Purposes.

2901.title: Constitution; change terms of office of members of State Board of Education from nine to four years.
2901.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 203 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Change The Terms Of Office Of The Members Of The State Board Of Education From 9 To 4 Years; And For Related Purposes.

2902.title: Constitution; mineral estate to revert to surface.
2902.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Create New Section 112a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For An Annual Assessment On Certain Nonproducing Mineral Estates; To Provide That Failure To Pay The Assessment Shall Result In The Reversion Of The Title And Interest In The Mineral Estate To The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For The Redemption Of The Mineral Estate; And For Related Purposes.

2903.title: Commend the life of Dr. B. Rowe Byers, Professor of Microbiology at UMMC.
2903.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Memory And Commending The Life Of Dr. B. Rowe Byers, Longtime Professor Of Microbiology At The University Of Mississippi School Of Medicine.

2904.title: Joint Rules of Mississippi Legislature; amend to provide that Legislature shall not convene on Easter Sunday.
2904.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Joint Rule No. 40 To Provide That The Legislature Shall Not Convene On Easter Sunday.

2905.title: Commend French Camp Academy "Panthers" Football Team for first-ever Class 1A State Championship.
2905.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The French Camp Academy "panthers" Football Team And Coach Nathan Wright For Their First-ever Mhsaa Class 1a State Championship.

2906.title: United States Constitution; urge Congress to propose amendment to restrict federal/regulatory authority.
2906.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging Congress To Propose The "regulation Freedom" Amendment To The U.s. Constitution.

2907.title: Constitution; prohibit pardon of certain violent crimes and revise notice requirements for other crimes.
2907.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Governor Cannot Grant Pardons For Certain Violent Crimes And To Require Publication Of Notice Before The Governor Pardons Certain Other Felony Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

2908.title: Designate March 2014 as "Women's History Month in Mississippi."
2908.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating March 2014 As "women's History Month In Mississippi" With Its Theme "celebrating Women Of Character, Courage And Commitment."

2909.title: Recognize and salute the military and public service of Mississippi Air National Guard Chief Master Sergeant Jerome Jackson.
2909.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The Military And Public Service Of Mississippi Air National Guard Chief Master Sergeant Jerome Jackson Of Preston, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

2910.title: Commend the Hickory Flat Cross Country Team for winning MHSAA Class 1A State Championship.
2910.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Hickory Flat "rebels" Boys Cross Country Team And Coach Michael Seger For Winning The Mhsaa Class 1a State Championship, The School's First Championship In 27 Years.

2911.title: Recognize Ole Miss Tennis Coach Billy Chadwick.
2911.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Ole Miss Tennis Coach Billy Chadwick, Who Took The Team To 20 Consecutive Ncaa Tournaments, On The Occasion Of His Retirement After 34 Successful Years.

2912.title: Commend Johnny Atherton of Mississippi Power Company as 2013-2014 Chairman of Mississippi Manufacturers Association.
2912.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Johnny Atherton, Vice President Of Mississippi Power Company In Gulfport, Mississippi, As 2013-2014 Chairman Of The Mississippi Manufacturers Association.

2913.title: Commend Picayune High School "Maroon Tide" Football Team for Class 5A State Championship.
2913.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2013 Picayune High School "maroon Tide" Football Team And Veteran Head Coach Dodd Lee For Winning The Mhsaa Class 5a State Championship.

2914.title: Commend the life and public service of Eupora Police Officer Keith Crenshaw who was lost in the line of duty.
